entries.title: ayylmao
entries.content: Ayylmao Level 3 Small Aberration Defense Traits AC 15\ HP 44\ Poise 21\ Fort +3, Refl +5, Will +5 Flyby Attack - An ayylmao's movement is \[elusive] against targets it has attacked this round. Offense Traits (DC 15) Probe (Zap) +5\ 3d6+2 (12) (+discomfort) Innate Techniques - Detect Thoughts\ 1/day - Malleable Memory Discomfort - Ayylmao like sticking their probes in unusual places. Creatures are sent reeling and are made clumsy 1 on hit. Against a DD or grappled target, this increases to clumsy 2. Tractor Beam (Su) \[concentration] - Unleash a ray at a creature within 30 ft. It is entangled (reflex negates). A DC 20 athletics check as a standard action frees the creature. While entangled, the creature maintains the exact distance away from the ayylmao, even if it moves. This allows the ayylmao to slam it into the ground, drag it along walls etc. Every turn it moves at least 10 feet deals 4d6 (14) crush damage. If the ayylmao chooses, it can spend its own movement to beam the creature closer, or push it away, but no farther than 30 feet away. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Milkers - There's only one thing an ayylmao likes more than anal probing, and that's cows. If any cows or cow-like creatures are present, an ayylmao will always focus on kidnapping them with their tractor beams over anything else. A substantial quantity of cow milk gives creatures advantage on checks in social situations with ayylmao.  Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +2, Lucc +0, Int +3, Wis +0, Cha +0 Telepathy Cloaking Device - Ayylmao can take 10 on stealth (resulting in 22 for the average ayylmao). They are always considered to have partial concealment while the cloaking device is active. The cloaking device is deactivated when an ayylmao does anything other than movement, or it takes damage. The only exception is if the action has the \[subtle] tag. Speed - 40 hover, 10 land. An ayylmao can use its hover speed to fly, but only during its turn. Takeoff - An ayylmao can return to the mother ship by spending 3 consecutive standard actions activating turbo thrusters. It also leaves with any creature caught in its tractor beam. Feats - Skill Focus (Stealth), Signature Skill (Stealth) Skills - +5 perception, 22 stealth, +8 arcana, +12 engineering, +8 cryptozoology, +8 nature Ayylmao, clovermon

entries.title: beholder
entries.content: Beholder Level 11 Large Aberration \[boss] Defense Traits AC 26\ HP 130\ Poise 34\ Fort +12, Refl +12, Will +12 All Around Vision - Cannot be flanked Recovery - Beholders get news saves to end effects they suffered from last turn, unless they are permanent. They make these saves with advantage. Offense Traits (DC 24) Bite (P) +12 (5 ft range)\ 3d6+1 (11) Innate Techniques - Dispel Magic Gaze (Su) - A beholder has many eyes, but one particularly large one it uses to cancel out magical effects. At the start of the beholder's turn, it decides to focus it's gaze on a single creature it can see (free action). The creature is siphoned for 1 round (will negates). It cannot use its eye stalks ability against this target for 1 round. Eyestalks (Su) - The beholder's extra eyes have the ability to unleash devastating laser beams at creatures within 100 ft. As a standard action it can shoot three of these laser beams at three different creatures. The effect is rolled randomly (reroll duplicates), more details below.\ \ Outside of combat, the beholders are able to exert more fine control over its eye stalks, allowing it to telekinetically move objects and disintegrate holes into things with ease. Feel free to change up a few eye beams to make your beholders extra special. Roll D10\ 1 - \[charm] - Creature is dominated and spends its turns attacking its allies (will negates). It cannot use Su or Sp abilities.\ 2 - stun - Creature is stunned (fort negates).\ 3 - \[fear] - Creature is frightened (will negates).\ 4 - slow - Creature is staggered (fort negates).\ 5 - drain - Creature is drained 2 (fort reduces to drain 1). This effect is permanent\ 6 - telekinesis - Briefly take hold of a creature's body (will negates) and throw them across the battlefield. You move them 30 ft and they take 10d6 (35) bludgeoning damage.\ 7 - sleep - Creature falls asleep (will negates). Creature does not get a new save against sleep each turn and must be manually woken up.\ 8 - petrify - Targeted is entangled as its flesh turns to stone (fort negates). A creature entangled by this becomes permanently entombed at the end of its next turn (fort negates).\ 9 - decay - Target takes 10d8 (45) necrotic damage (fort halves).\ 10 - death ray - Target takes 10d10 (55) force damage (reflex halves). If this defeats the creature, they are turned into a fine dust. Boss Actions - The beholder can perform 2 of the following actions each turn. Eyebeam - Fire a random eyestalk beam at an enemy after they end their turn.\ Exploit - Bite a creature suffering a debilitating status from your eyestalks with a +8 bonus. \ Inferior Magic \[recharge] - Roll dispel magic to counter spell as though you had prepared the action. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Boss Mechanics - Whenever a beholder is staggered, instead of its usual effects, it can can only shoot 2 eyestalks on its turn. When it is dazed, instead it can only shoot 1 eyestalk. When it is stunned, its eyestalk ability is disabled, but it can otherwise act normally. When a beholder is siphoned, instead of its usual effects, its primary eye closes and it cannot use its gaze. Whenever a beholder is blinded, instead of gaining the blinded condition, its eyestalk DC decreases by 2. Blurred vision is instead converted into -1 to its eyestalk DC. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +1, Dex +1, Lucc +0, Int +4, Wis -1, Cha -1 Speed - Hover 30, can be used to fly on its turn. Grounded reduces hover speed to 10. Feats - Skill Focus (arcana), Signature Skill (knowledge), Speak for the Dead, Defensive Training, \ Ghostbuster Skills - +16 perception, +17 knowledge (all, adv arcana)

entries.title: besmolder
entries.content: Besmolder Level 12 Smol Aberration \[boss] Defense Traits AC 27\ HP 150\ Poise 35\ Fort +12, Refl +14, Will +13 All Around Vision - Cannot be flanked Recovery - Besmolders get news saves to end effects they suffered from last turn, unless they are permanent. They make these saves with advantage. Offense Traits (DC 25) Boop +13\ ??? Innate Techniques - Dispel Magic Charming Gaze \[charm] - A besmolder has many eyes, but one particularly large one it uses to cancel make new friends. At the start of the besmolder's turn, it decides to focus it's gaze on a single creature it can see (free action). The creature is charmed for 1 round (will negates). It cannot use its eye stalks ability against targets it charms. Eyestalks - The besmolder's extra eyes have the ability to unleash devastating laser beams at creatures within 100 ft. As a standard action it can shoot three of these laser beams at three different creatures. The effect is rolled randomly (reroll duplicates), more details below.\ \ Outside of combat, the besmolder is able to exert more fine control over its eye stalks, allowing it to summon friends, build little villages, telekinetically move objects and disintegrate holes into things with ease. Feel free to change up a few eye beams to make your besmolder's extra special. Roll D12\ 1 - Candy Beam \[poly, baleful] \[healing] - Creature is turned into inanimate candy, effectively stunning them (fort negates). The besmolder can lick an adjacent piece of unattended candy as a swift action, dealing 10 damage and healing 10 hp.\ 2 - Sunshine and Rainbows \[light] - Creature is blinded (reflex negates).\ 3 - Kung Fu Grip - Telekinetically take control of a creature (will negates). You get to decide what they do on their next turn. You cannot activate Su or Sp abilities. Against a defeated creature, turns into a toy.\ 4 - Shrink Ray - Creatures reduced to the size of a mouse. -15 speed and deal half damage (fort negates).\ 5 - Fun House - Creature is trapped inside of a tiny building (reflex negates). Instead of making additional saves, it requires an athletics or sleight of hand to check (standard action) to free the creature.\ 6 - Banana Split \[persistent] - A 20 ft radius around the creature gets covered in incredibly slippery banana peels. A creature that starts its turn or walks into the area is knocked down and takes 4d6 (14) crush damage (reflex or acro negates).\ 7 - Bed Time - Creature falls asleep (will negates). Creature does not get a new save against sleep each turn and must be manually woken up.\ 8 - Bubblebeam - Creature is trapped inside of a bubble (reflex negates). Otherwise functions as per \ bubblebreath.\ 9 - Story Time! \[companion] - Summon a level 4 or lower creature adjacent to target. It acts immediately. (note, you may want to select the besmolder's friends beforehand to make things like tokens more seamless). {% hint style="info" %} A besmolder can only have 2 creatures created at a time out of combat using "Story Time" but during combat, they can have up to 4. If they already have 4 and roll storytime again, reroll that result.\ When defeated, the creatures fade away. {% endhint %} 10 - Oopsie! \[force] - Target takes 10d10 (55) force damage (reflex halves). If this defeats the creature, they are turned into a fine dust.\ 11 - Tea Party \[mind-affecting] - Target creature is forced to drink from a small teacup until it is empty. They are pacified on their next turn (will negates). \ 12 - The Floor is Lava \[persistent] - A 40 ft radius around the creature gets covered in liquid lava 3 ft deep. Creatures in the area, or that move into it, are immediately partially submerged.\ If the target is flying/hovering, the lava effects the ground directly beneath them. Friend Magic - A besmolder can use its MM Caster Minion feat with its eyestalks. Boss Actions - The besmolder can perform 2 of the following actions each turn. Eyebeam - Fire a random eyestalk beam at an enemy after they end their turn.\ Inferior Magic \[recharge] - Roll dispel magic to counter spell as though you had prepared the action. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Boss Mechanics - Whenever a besmolder is staggered, instead of its usual effects, it can can only shoot 2 eyestalks on its turn. When it is dazed, instead it can only shoot 1 eyestalk. When it is stunned, its eyestalk ability is disabled, but it can otherwise act normally. When a besmolder is siphoned, instead of its usual effects, its primary eye closes and it cannot use its gaze. Whenever a besmolder is blinded, instead of gaining the blinded condition, its eyestalk DC decreases by 2. Blurred vision is instead converted into -1 to its eyestalk DC. Story Time! - A besmolder knows much more than even it knows. If prompted to tell stories, its knowledge of history is unmatched and it can practically "remember" anything with vivid detail, though it often exaggerates details to make the story more interesting. When it does so, its history bonus is effectively +30. By making a DC 30 history check, you can parse what parts of the story are facts and which are fiction. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +2, Lucc +2, Int -1, Wis -1, Cha +4 Speed - Hover 30, can be used to fly on its turn. Grounded reduces hover speed to 10. Band Practice - When not under duress, a besmolder can summon an instrument and play it. Feats - Defensive Training, Ghostbuster, MM Caster Minion Skills - +16 perception, +17 persuasion, +17 deception, +27 perform (any instrument), +13 history

entries.title: grandma
entries.content: Grandma Level 10 Medium Aberration Defense Traits AC 22\ HP 80\ Poise 27\ Fort +12, Refl +10, Will +12 No Breath - A grandma does not need to breathe and can survive in the vacuum of space. Resistance - Cold Offense Traits (DC 21) Bite (P) +12 (+4 vs cookie)\ 2d6+2 (9) 2h Ritual Rolling Pin (C) +12 (+4 vs cookie)\ 2d6+2 (9)  Innate Techniques - Wandering Stars, Unseen Form, Cosmic Cage, Hellscape, Silence\ 1/day - Drain Soul Cookification \[curse] - With a touch, turn a creature into a sweet treat version of themselves (fort negates). Creatures with bite attacks gain a +4 bonus to attack against cookie creatures. A grandma can make a bite attack as an instant action against a creature that gets cookiefied. Bite^2 - If a xenomorph starts its turn grappling a creature, it can use its second mouth to blast a hole in the creature as its maintain option. The creature takes 8d6 (28) pierce damage and is drained 1 (fort halves dmg and negates drain). Weaknesses/Deep Lore Hibernation - A xenomorph can willingly enter stasis permanently. It only leaves hibernation if it smells a creature. Stabilizing Compound - A xenomorphs blood reacts explosively when exposed to open air, but an informed alchemist can negate that. With a DC 21 alchemy check, an alchemist can create a compound that can disable a xenomorphs caustic blood feature for 1 minute as a FRA.  You can apply it as a thrown attack, but it only functions for 1 round if you graze, and is consumed with no effect if you miss. If you poise break the xenomorph, you can apply it instead of the usual effects. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +2, Dex +0, Lucc +0, Int +3, Wis +0, Cha +3 Telepathy One Mind - A grandma forms a family with up to 3 other grandmas. They can telepathically communicate with their family over any distance. Shape Change: Grandma \[poly, true] - One humanoid grandma Feats - Maneuver Initiate, Body Block, Maneuver Master, Combat Reflexes Skills - +10 (+8) perception, +13 acrobatics, +13 stealth, +13 athletics

entries.title: illumatrix
entries.content: Illumatrix Level 4 Medium Aberration Defense Traits AC 16\ HP 60\ Poise 27 (DRA 3)\ Fort +7, Refl +8, Will +4 KYS (Su) \[healing] \[overheal] - Kopy yourself. While a creature you are copying is defeated and within reach, you can absorb data to repair damage as a swift action, healing 20 hp. Offense Traits (DC 16) Unarmed (C) +7 (+2 real deal)\ d8+3 (7) Innate Techniques - Kidnap, Fake Out, Nice Catch\ 1/day - Toe Smasher, Feign Defeat Real Deal - While copying a creature, gain +2 attack against it. Copy: I'll have what she's having (Su) - As a swift action, a shadow can use it's copy ability to create a fully functional handheld object it can see within 30 ft. If the object is magical, it loses its magical properties. If the copied object gets more than 100 ft from the original, it disappears. Using copy in this way does not stun the shadow. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Don't Tread on Me - Shadows are just that, shadows. Anything it copies is merely a projection. As such, it does not like it when objects interact with the shadow of its projection. It avoids people stepping on it, creatures walking over it etc. If the shadow's shadow is targeted directly, or included in an AoE effect, its DRA is ignored.  If you target a shadow with a piercing melee weapon, you can embed it in the surface and entangle the shadow on hit or with a successful poise break, replacing all other effects and losing access to the weapon. Projectiles like arrows require 3 hits. Shadows cannot remove the entangling items on their own. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +3, Dex +2, Lucc +0, Int +0, Wis +0, Cha +0 Copy (Su) \[poly, true] - As a FRA, a shadow can emit a very bright flash of light while gazing upon a specific creature within 30 ft. When it does so It adds this creature to its memory. It can choose to immediately transform into this creature as part of this action. The replication process is almost perfect, giving the shadow access to the creatures memories, skill proficiencies, personality traits, current clothing, appearance, size etc.  The shadow gains all of the racial features of the creature it copies (assuming a player character) or all of the natural attacks (including multi attack options)/movement abilities if it is not. A shadow can "memorize" copies of 4 different creatures/objects (see offense traits). It can transform into one as a standard action, or revert to its true form as a free action. When copying a creature, treat its disguise roll as 26. Speed - Speed(s) of copied creature. It can choose to enter a hybrid form, foiling its disguise, in order to move at a speed of 40, or climb 40. Feats - Unarmed Combatant, Bonded Mind, Feint Partner Skills - +6 perception, +6 deception, +8 stealth Shide, from the anime "Summertime Rendering"

entries.title: mind-flayer
entries.content: Mind Flayer Level 8 Medium Aberration Defense Traits AC 23\ HP 84\ Poise 30\ Fort +9, Refl +10, Will +11 Resistance - Psychic Break Will \[charm] - As an immediate action when hit by an attack, a mind flayer can attempt to charm the attacking creature (will negates). Once a creature has passed its save against this effect, it becomes immune until rest.  Offense Traits (DC 20) Tentacles (C) +10 (+4 grapple, +4 MI)\ d8+2 (6) Innate Techniques - Mind Crush (U4), Detect Thoughts, Telekinetic Maneuver\ 1/day - Telekinetic Thrust\ Constant - Telekinetic Lift Brain Blast (Su) \[psychic] \[recharge] - Creatures in a 30 ft cone take 6d6 (21) psychic damage and are stunned (will halves damage and reduces stun to stagger). At the end of the creatures turn, they can roll an additional save to end the stun.  A mind flayer must devour intellect, wait 1 minute or concentrate as a FRA to gain use of this ability again. Displacer (Su) \[psychic] - Creatures that take fall damage from your actions take an additional 5 psychic damage. Devour Intellect \[recharge] - Special: Can only be used against the creature that is stunned, grappled or defeated.\ Spend a standard action to chomp on a creatures brain. Creature takes 10d8 (45) pierce dmg (fort halves). A mind flayer must digest for at least an hour before it can devour intellect again. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Psychic Casting - A mind flayer requires a higher degree of concentration to use many of its psionic abilities. It cannot use its supernatural abilities or its innate techniques while it is frightened, dominated or confused. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +1, Dex +2, Lucc +0, Int +3, Wis +1, Cha +1 Telepathy - A mind flayer cannot verbally communicate and must rely on telepathy. Blindsense - Thought Sense 30 ft Speed - Hover 30. During its turn, a mind flayer can use this speed to fly. Feats - MM Coax, Combat Step, Maneuver Initiate,  Skills - +11 (+4) perception, +11 deception, +11 persuasion, +13 cryptozoology, +13 arcana, +13 planes Illithid, Baldur's Gate 3

entries.title: README
entries.content: Aberrations Terrors born from the unknowable and the otherworldly. They cannot be reasoned with or rationalized and are utterly insurmountable nightmare that humanity has no hope of escaping. From the darkest depths of space, the ocean and other mysterious realms, aberrations are often alien creatures uninterested in the conventions of traditional life. Others are strange mixes of the organic and inorganic in unfamiliar animalistic shapes.

entries.title: shadowling-scout
entries.content: Shadowling Scout Level 3 Small Aberration Defense Traits AC 17\ HP 44\ Poise 23\ Fort +3, Refl +6, Will +6 Resistance - Cold Pool \[recharge] - As an swift action, a shadowling can turn into an amorphous dark liquid. They can choose to maintain this form indefinitely, but cannot attack while pooled. While in this form, they can move along any surface, including liquids, walls and roofs. They are also amorphous (AC+15). This form can be ended as a free action. This ability cannot be used in consecutive rounds. Offense Traits (DC 15) Stomp (P) +6\ 2d6+3 (10) Multiattack - Make 2 stomp attacks Innate Techniques - Darkness, Nearsighted, Toe Smasher, Frenzied Leap\ 1/day - Terminal Isolation (U2) Possession (Su) \[recharge] - A shadowling can transform into a vapor and advance rapidly towards a creature within 30 ft of them, inhabiting their body. The extent to which varies based on the targets level. Shadowlings cannot possess creatures that are a higher level than them. Ing always instinctually understand what they can possess and how to activate their hosts abilities. Same or Lower Level - The shadowling takes control of the creatures actions (will negates). During the possessed creatures turn, instead the ing acts. All damage taken by the host also damages the ing possessing the creature (up to a maximum of the hosts current hp). At the end of each turn the ing possesses, they get a new save to end the effect. The shadowling can choose to end this effect as a free action. When it fails or ends, willing or not, they appear within 10 ft of the creature they targeted.\ Minion - The shadowling has full control over the creature while it possesses them. The effect has no save and lasts indefinitely. The shadowling takes damage equal to half the damage its host takes (up to a maximum of half hosts current hp). The ing can choose to end this effect as a free action. When it ends, willing or not, they appear within 10 ft of the creature they targeted. Weaknesses/Deep Lore The Light, It Burns! - While in direct sunlight, a shadowling is persistently set ablaze, but it instead deals true damage. This weakness is suppressed while it possesses a creature. Weakness - Holy 3. When a shadowling takes holy damage while possessing a creature, it must make a will save (DC 10+possessed creatures level) or be ejected. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +3, Lucc +0, Int +0, Wis +1, Cha +0 Darkvision Speed - 40 Superior Jump - A shadowling can jump as far and as high as its movement speed Feats - SF Stealth, SS Stealth Skills - +8 perception, +10 acrobatics, +10 stealth, +5 athletics Metroid Prime 2 Art

entries.title: space-crab
entries.content: Space Crab Level 0 Tiny Aberration Defense Traits AC 12\ HP 20\ Poise 15\ Fort -1, Refl +3, Will +0 Resistance - Necrotic Home Field Advantage - While attached to a creatures head, the space crab gains DRA 10 and +4 AC. Offense Traits (DC 12) Bite (P) +1\ d8+1 (5) (+d8 vs DD) Innate Techniques - Finisher Sneak Attack - Against a DD target, a space crab does an additional d8 damage. New Home - Against a defeated creature, a space crab can attach to the creature's head and gain control over the actions of the soon to be corpse. After 1 hour, it kills the creature and reanimates it as a zombie as though casting animate dead, but the creature retains its full level. entries.title: shirshu
entries.content: Shirshu Level 8 Huge Beast Defense Traits AC 23\ HP 84\ Poise 33\ Fort +13, Refl +10, Will +8 Offense Traits (DC 20) Tongue (S) +13\ 2d6+3 (10) +poison Claw (S) +11\ 3d6+3 (13) Multiattack - Make 1 tongue attack and one claw attack Innate Technique - Preparation, Bestial Claw (U4), Break Free\ 1/day - Burst of Speed \[Poison] - On hit character is stunned. Creature can save against the effect at the end of their turn. Creatures get advantage on saves against this poison if they have saved out of it once already in the last hour.  Extend - As a swift action, a shirshu can increase the range of their tongue to 30 ft. Special Attack: Tongue Lash - You can use your tongue attack on two creatures within 10 feet of each other. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Elite Tracking - Shirshu are practically extinct, with the few that still live existing in captivity. They are naturally gifted trackers and such talents are typically nourished by a knowledgeable captor. When presented with an item that has a creature's scent on it, very little can prevent the shirshu from finding its target. It can follow its scent across continents, under water, underground etc. If the creature currently exists on the same plane, the shirshu will follow the most direct path to reach this creature, usually informing its master of the general distance (within a mile, dozens, hundreds or thousands of miles) via gestures. If the target is dead, it will lead you to its body. If the target went to another plane, it will bring you to the portal (potentially allowing you to continue the chase) or its last location before teleporting. Other strange circumstances can also completely prevent a shirshu from smelling anything related to a creature. Only through repeated exposure to powerfully smelling chemicals (such as perfume) can a creature evade a shirshu's scent. Such exposure requires enough to fully submerge a creature, typically increasing its price 10x for medium creatures. You must submerge yourself in this fluid every day. You can also choose to make yourself smell rancid for a similar effect that instead lasts for a week, provided you don't clean up. Such a scent can easily be obtained via smearing yourself in fecal matter or taking a dip in a sewer, but you yourself are always sickened 2 while this persists. entries.content: Scavenger Level 2 Cryptid/Humanoid Defense Traits AC 15\ HP 54\ Poise 28\ Fort +8, Refl +5, Will +4 Immune - Drain, Envenomed Resistance - Poison Rigor Mortis \[recharge] \[healing] - When a scavenger is killed, they do not truly die. A creature must have been dead for at least 24 hours to be worthwhile to consume to a scavenger, though the longer the better.  As a swift action against an adjacent corpse, a scavenger can consume such meat to heal 10 hp. If the creature is undead, they instead heal 15 hp. That creature is forced to repeat whatever the last standard action then performed on their next turn (will reduces to repeat swift action). If the creature is unable to perform its last standard action, such as if the ability they used last is a recharge ability, they are effectively dazed.  Trapped (Su) - In order to leave a space within 5 feet of a wobbler, a creature must spend 15 ft of movement to push past its psychic field. Counter (Su) - As a standard action, a wobbler can ready itself for an incoming attack. When it takes damage, it can choose to rebound this damage back at its attack and multiply it 1.5x. This can happen no matter the distance between them or the method of damage. Indirect methods of damage, such as fall damage, or being lit ablaze, do not proc counter. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Staring(?) Contest - Wobblers have incredible endurance. They test it against one another constantly in what basically ends up being a staring contest. But instead of keeping their eyes open, they simply try to remain completely still. The first to break posture loses. They typically perform these contests in areas with hazards to increase the speed of the contest, such as in rivers, or unstable terrain. In game terms, creatures must roll a fortitude save. Subtract 20 from this result. If he number you get is greater that 0, subtract that number from your poise. First to get poise broken loses.\ Every fortitude save receives a cumulative -1 penalty from the last. If a creature rolls at least 32 on perception, they can push them to safety, treating them as though they noticed the fissures. This does not require an action and is intended to be used as an opener in place of stealth. Boss Actions - Usable 1/turn. When a wildfire dragon reaches 210 hp, and every time it loses 50 more (160, 110, 60, 10), a layer of the scales explodes violently, activating scale shatter, decreasing the dragon's AC by 1, but increasing its speeds by 10. Innate Techniques - Weapon Toss, Silencing Strike, Fraudgg, Time Shudder, Star Fall, Stunt Double Imagination (U4) Stench Aura \[poison] - A deadbeat djinn has a natural musk. Creatures within 5 ft of the djinn are made sickened 2 until they leave this aura. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Lucky Contestant! \[curse] - A deadbeat djinn lives in bottles of discarded alcoholic beverages, revealing itself and its horrid stench only when someone attempts to drink from this unusual looking empty vessel. If someone is unlucky enough to encounter this creature is now cursed to live with this creature for 1 week. It will inject itself into social situations with its outdated and offensive opinions, it will ruin the mood at gatherings and it will steal all of your alcoholic beverages. While this curse persists, you cannot escape the djinn, and its vessel is always in your pocket, bag or conveniently between you and your drink. If you use its wishtidigitation feature, you can decrease the amount of time they follow you around for by 1 minute. If you spend downtime thinking about random wishes to make, you decrease the duration of the curse by (int+1) days. Wishtidigitation - A deadbeat djinn is a master of only the most obscure magics, functioning in ways that defy all reason or sense. They are able to perform great feats, but only when the end result would not be particularly beneficial, only interesting, quirky or mundane. If the object or information in question can be considered useful, it the deadbeat djinn cannot perform it. If you wish for your date's favorite flower, then the deadbeat djinn can teleport you A flower, but not the one you are looking for. They can teleport the flower from another planet, but it looks like another flower on the current planet and has no medicinal properties. The more impressively mundane the better. Trivia on dead commoners, the number of breaths you've taken during your life, the number of grains of sand in the world compared to planets in the multiverse are all just one "I wish..." away. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +2, Dex +0, Lucc -1, Int +3, Wis +0, Cha +0 Speed - 30 hover Feats - Bonded Weapon Skills - +3 perception, +6 knowledge (all)

entries.title: README
entries.content: Hag Level 5 Large Fey \[boss] Defense Traits AC 20\ HP 100\ Poise 26\ Fort +7, Refl +5, Will +9 Spell Resistance - Masters of magic, hags have protective wards created from their coven magic to reduce the effectiveness of magic against them. The reduce the damage taken from any spell or supernatural ability by 3. Offense Traits (DC 18) Claws (S) +7\ 2d6+2 (9) Innate Techniques (CL 7) - Mage Hand, Detect Pregnancy, Ventriloquism, Imagination, Dispel Magic, Violent Accident, Poison the Well, Grasp of the Undying\ 1/day - Persistent Pranksters, Pollinate (U3), Gutwrench, Animate Dead, Corpse Explosion\ Constant - Spectral Hand Boss Actions - Only one can be used 1/round Scatter Clones (Su) \[elusive] \[figment] \[recharge] - At the end of the hags turn, she can cause 4 exact copies of herself appear in adjacent spaces. She and her copies immediately scatter in every direction. A creature can detect hidden presence to tell which one is the real one with a DC 20 perception check. However, if the clones live until the start of the hag's next turn, they also get 30 ft of movement and a standard action to cast the Grasp of the Undying spell. They continue to do so every turn they survive. The clones automatically disappear when they take damage or fail a saving throw. Deep Digs \[mind-affecting] \[psychic] - This can only target an enemy at the end of their turn. Against a creature it has successfully rolled a knowledge check against, a hag can unbury some deep insecurity. The creature takes 3d6 (10) psychic damage and has disadvantage on its next attack roll (will halves dmg and negates disadvantage). Imposter (Su) \[teleportation] \[figment] \[recharge] - At the end of another creature's turn, a hag can teleport within 10 ft of a that creature if they are within 60 feet. When she does, the target creature also teleports to another location within 10 feet of their original position and the hag copies their appearance exactly.  Using this on enemies tends to fall through if they know each other well enough, so hags prefer to choose neutral parties, such as creatures they capture. If they aren't participating in combat because they are a noncombatant, she can use this ability at the end of any other creature's turn to target this noncombatant. Summon Ally \[recharge] \[companion] - At the end of another creature's turn, the hag can summon 2 fey of level 2 or lower to appear within 30 feet of her. They share her teamwork feats. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Dealer - Hags typically do not like to engage in combat, and instead prefer to cooperate with other sentient creatures. This is to get something out of them rather than the goodness of their heart. As such, a hag will employ any method in her arsenal: threatening loved ones, offering valuable items or information, healing unique ailments, threatening retaliation etc. Coven - Hags typically exist in trios. They don't live with their sisters, but they tend to have some method to regularly visit them. This could mean they live somewhere close by, they teleport whatever. They keep in regular contact and come to eachother's aid when needed. When gathered, hags possess the ability to perform magical rituals. This allows them to cast spells beyond what they are normally capable of.  The most notable of which is a type of resurrection usable on the sisters. This happens automatically when the hag dies, and she appears within a special predesignated location in one of the homes of her sisters. The hag is drained 10. More info about covens, such as how to stop the resurrection, can be found in subsection, which requires more direct research for players to find than just a successful knowledge check. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +2, Dex +0, Lucc +0, Int +3, Wis +2, Cha +3 Believer - Gain Tier 3 favor in the god Shira. This gives access to the contract ability, which hags use liberally with mortals to fulfill their desires. Feats - Skill Focus (Local), Signature Skill (Knowledge), MM Sniping, Cooperative Casting Skills - +9 perception, +9 insight, +11 deception, +11 persuasion, +13 disguise, +13 (adv) local, +11 nature, +11 arcana, +11 religion, +11 history, +11 cryptozoology Auntie Ethel, Baldur's Gate 3

entries.title: censorship-fairy
entries.content: Censorship Fairy Level 0 Tiny Fairy Defense Traits AC 12\ HP 20\ Poise 15\ Fort -2, Refl +3, Will +3 Natural Invisibility - While censoring, a censorship fairy is affected as per invisibility. Offense Traits (DC 12) Innate Techniques - Prestidigitation, Living Roots, Acid Splash\ 1/day - Fairy Dust Censor \[sonic] - Whenever a creature says a curse word, or something particularly vulgar, a censorship fairy can cause a black box to appear over their mouth, and substitute the word with a loud beeping sound as an immediate action. The target creature's word cannot be heard, and they take d10 (5) sonic damage. This breaks invisibility. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Weakness -  Other Traits Ability Scores - Str -2, Dex +1, Lucc +3, Int +0, Wis +3, Cha +0 Censorship (Su) \[figment] \[concentration] - Censorship fairies specialize in a very particular type of censorship: That of protecting the nudey bits of naked creatures. They can create incredibly detailed and fine-tuned illusions, but only to cover up breasts and other erogenous zones in incredibly tasteful ways, such as a bunch of leaves in the wind, a ray of light or something more elaborate and unusual. They can censor such things by creating the figment as a standard action, and maintaining it as a free action. They need to stay within 30 feet of the creature they censor to maintain the illusion. Speed - 30 hover. On their turn they can use this speed to fly Feats - Signature Skill (Stealth) Skills - +5 perception, +5 (+15) stealth

entries.title: gnome
entries.content: G'nome Level 1 Small Fey Defense Traits AC 15\ HP 30\ Poise 26\ Fort +3, Refl +3, Will +2 Stick the Landing - When a gnome falls, they can choose to stick into the ground with their pointed hats to negate the fall damage as an instant action. Their speed is reduced by 20 and they cannot use their pointy feature for 1 round. Offense Traits (DC 13) Battle Ladder (C) +3 (+4 MI, +4 gang up, +2 disarm/drag/dirty trick)\ 2d6+2 (9) Innate Techniques - Boasting Taunt, Fake Out\ 1/day - Backstab, Pocket Sand, Kidnap Snatch and Grab - After using sleight of hand to steal something, or disarming an opponent, all of the gnomes actions become \[elusive] against the target of their theft. Pointy \[elusive] - When a creature falls onto a space or jumps into a space within 10 ft of a gnome, the gnome can move to the space directly where the creature will land and use its pointed hat to damage them as an immediate action. The creature takes 2d6 (7) pierce damage and is made clumsy 1. They can choose any space adjacent to the gnome to land. Sharp Aim - A gnome can spend a standard action to assume the position. Any other allied creature of at least medium size can throw a gnome in the position as though they were a thrown weapon with +2 attack (as though the gnome was aiding them), dealing 4d6 (14) piercing damage. If a gnome is poise broken while assuming the position, its stance falters and it can no longer be thrown. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Gnome Toss - Gnomes are surprisingly aerodynamic and light. After grappling a gnome, you can choose to end your grapple to toss the gnome (athletics roll) feet in a direction of your choosing. This also happens if you successfully shove, with the athletics roll determining the extra distance moved. This happens instead of the usual effect of grapple and in addition to the effects of a shove. One of a Kind - Gnomes love to steal things that normally come as a set, but only 1 of them, such as a pair of socks or several wheels on a vehicle. When presented with the opportunity to pilfer such an object, a gnome will do everything in their power to steal it. This could mean invading a home after hours, staking out a vehicle etc. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +2, Dex +2, Lucc +2, Int +0, Wis -1, Cha +2 Gnome Chomsky (Su) \[poly, true] - Gnomes can transform into a lawn ornament that resembles a gnome. In this form, they can only move while not observed, unless the observers are gnomes. This effectively functions as Hide in Plain Sight. Feats - Maneuver Initiate, Maneuver Master, Gang Up Skills - +2 perception, +5 stealth, +7 sleight of hand, +5 deception, +3 cryptozoology

entries.title: high-roller
entries.content: High Roller Level 4 Tiny Fey Defense Traits AC 18\ HP 52\ Poise 17\ Fort +3, Refl +7, Will +5 Blessing of Frogg Saran - High rollers receive a unique blessing from their patron deity. Whenever they take damage type (fire, crush, force), there is a 1 in 6 chance they are resistant to that damage type for that day, including the instance of damage they just took. Once they fail to gain resistance to a damage type, they don't roll it again for the rest of that day. Keep on rolling baby. Offense Traits (DC 16) Rapier (C) +7 (+Lucky Break, Crit vs DD)\ d6+3 (6) Multiattack - Feint and make a melee attack Innate Techniques - Mage Hand, Ventriloquism\ 1/day - Fairy Dust, Memory Lapse, WonkaS, Bladed Dash Lucky Break - A high roller gets its name from its ability to pull wins out of its ass from seemingly nowhere. Whenever it rolls a d6 and rolls a 6, it rolls an additional d6. This can happen infinitely. Loaded Dice \[recharge] - By blowing on a standard dice (a d6) and throwing it up to 30 feet, a high roller can cause it to explode. Deals a number of d6s of force damage equal to the end result of the loaded dice (reflex halves). This explosion is a 10 ft radius, with its center point on the ground where the dice lands. For example, i roll a 4 on the d6. This ability does 4d6 damage. Because of lucky break, this can potentially do infinite damage. If the high roller initially rolls a 6 when determining how many damage dice there are, this ability immediately recharges. Weaknesses/Deep Lore "Nature Spirit" \[poly, true] - A high roller has the ability to transform into a particular butterfly. They are typically exceptionally colorful and sparkly. They can speak while transformed. They use this form to tempt unsuspecting creatures into playing their silly games of chance. 99% of Gamblers - A high roller is always enticed by games of chance, the higher the risk the better. They respect the results of such gambles, even to their own detriment. As such, high rollers are typically in crippling debt. Only 1% of them are filthy rich. Rich high rollers typically have expensive magic items at their disposal. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str -1, Dex +3, Lucc +3, Int +0, Wis -1, Cha +0 Fairy Dust - High rollers have bags of their own natural dust they keep at their hip. It takes a week to gather enough dust to fill a bag. This bag can be used to conjure a single item into existence worth 100 gold or less from the bag. The item is real, but causes the fairy dust to disappear.  Speed - 30 hover. On their turn they can use this speed to fly Feats - Antagonize, Scapegoat Skills - +5 perception, +9 stealth, +8(+2 feint) deception, +11 profession (gambling)

entries.title: spelling-bee
entries.content: Spelling Bee Level 7 Medium Fey Defense Traits AC 21\ HP 74\ Poise 24\ Fort +7, Refl +11, Will +7 Resistance - +4 vs confusion Protect - A spelling bee can use an immediate action to command their bees to protect them, giving a +4 bonus to AC or reflex saves vs an incoming harmful effect.  Offense Traits (DC 19) Sting (P) +9 (+stagger on hit, +Venom)\ d8+2 (6) Innate Techniques - Nap Time, Splatter, Pollinate (U3), Ants in Your Pants\ 1/day - Floristry, Leech Seed, Solar Power, Chimpanzee Bolt Venom  Quiz! - As a swift action, quiz a creature within 30 ft on the spelling of a particular word. Spelling bees usually start off with simpler words then move on to more complicated words, unless things look particularly dire. A player can choose to spell it out OR have their character roll linguistics (nat 20 always succeeds).\ "Easy" DC 14 - Thoughtful, influential, equipment, syndrome, claimant, intuitively\ Medium DC 20 - Eusociality, splendiferous, separate, etymology\ Hard DC 26 - Platitudinous, antennae, silhouette, acquiesce\ Incorrect responses or cheaters cause the spelling bees swarm to home in on the creature, dealing 10 pierce damage and staggering them for 1 round (fort negates stagger).\ If multiple spelling bees are present, they give one the floor and don't interrupt with their own questions if one has already been asked this round. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Student Becomes Master - When quizzed, creatures trained in linguistics can make an opposed roll as an immediate action to trip up the spelling bee and have her own swarm sting her. She is immune to the poison however. Mix and Match - Spelling bees love to combine bees with other creatures. By bringing a creature back to their hive, they can transform them to get a new yellow and black coat of paint. For bestiary creatures, this can result in interesting fusions like the Bee Rex.  If a player offers to be part of the bee's experiments, they can choose to undergo a 1 week transformation. Over this week they transform to more closely resemble a bee with additional limbs, black and yellow fuzzyness and antennae. They also get one of the following boons and banes....\ Boons - \ 1 - You can produce honey. You can produce a few ounces of honey each day, as long as you are not going hungry and have a steady supply of flowers. This honey takes about an hour of work and 24 hours of waiting for the moisture to evaporate to be ready for consumption.\ 2 - You get functional wings, giving you the glide quality.\ 3 - You get functional antennae, giving you scent 5 ft.\ 4 - You get a stinger attack with d8 base damage that applies venom on hit. Banes - \ 1 - You become an herbivore, only able to eat sweet foods like fruit/honey as well as nectar/pollen.\ 2 - You become a little too fuzzy, making you better adapted for cold climates. In warm climates you are persistently drained 1 without some cooling method.\ 3 - You are protective of your kin. You cannot harm bees unless they attack you first. The first time one of your allies is defeated in combat, you are taunted by the creature that defeated them.\ 4 - Your additional bee limbs throw you off balance. You take a -2 penalty to all dexterity based checks.  Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +2, Lucc +1, Int +3, Wis +0, Cha +2 Blindsense - Scent 5 ft Speed - 20, 30 hover, 30 fly Feats - Signature Skill (Linguistics), Lead by Example, Photographic Memory, Toughness Skills - +9 perc, +11 persuasion, +12 profession (dance, sing), +12 nature, +12 arcana, +16 linguistics, +11 acrobatics By Muhut

entries.title: README
entries.content: Slur'Nesh Level 10 Medium Fiend \[unique] \[boss] \[mastermind] Defense Traits AC 25\ HP 80\ Poise 24\ Fort +10, Refl +10, Will +15 Resistance - +4 vs mind-affecting Offense Traits (DC 22) Touch +10\ Charms indefinitely. If in combat, reduces to 1 round. Innate Techniques - Corpse Transposition, Darting Duplicate, Overstimulate, Tongue Twister\ 1/day - Nightmare, Domination, Order 66 Power Word N (Su) \[mind affecting] \[language] \[recharge] \[subtle] - Slur'Nesh can utter a heinous word, and have it echo from the mouth of a creature within 60 feet. This word carries such vulgarity that it causes another creature within 30 ft of the original target to fly into a blind and senseless rage at the original target. They are taunted by the creature for 3 rounds, and use their deadliest most powerful abilities to kill them as quickly as possible. If the creature is a minion to Slur'Nesh, or if the secondary target has been subjugated by the race/people of the primary target, this has no save. If they are not they have disadvantage but (will negates). If the creatures have been allies for an extended amount of time, are family etc, then they do not make the save at disadvantage. Essentially, target 1 creature to taunt another with the power of racism. The two creatures relationship and races affect how difficult it is to resist. Summon Ally \[companion] - 1 Living Forge Cycle of Hate -  Weaknesses/Deep Lore Superior Polymorph - Any successful checks to transform Slur'Nesh back into its true form instead deals 20 true damage to it. True Form - Slur'Nesh avoids its true form at all costs. If it drops to 0 hp, all remaining damage is ignored and it transforms into its true form. It cannot use its polymorph ability again until it rests. It cannot use any abilities listed in this form while in its true forms, and gets a new set of abilities and stats. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +0, Lucc +2, Int +3, Wis +3, Cha +3 Hierarchy - When Slur'Nesh is in a settlement of intelligent creatures, it can intuitively tell certain aspects of the social hierarchy. It knows which types of people are subjugated, as well as who does the subjugation, and can generally tell how extreme said subjugation is. If the settlement is generally egalitarian, then it can intuit 3 specific creatures who break this mold. Shape Change \[poly, true] - Any humanoid, including any racial features. Can be used as a free action 1/turn. Rumormonger - Slur'Nesh can attempt to spread a rumor throughout a small town or larger settlement by attempting a deception check. The difficulty depends on the size, ranging from 10 for a small town to 30 for a metropolis, though this difficulty may be modified if the population as a whole tends towards skepticism or insanity. It takes a week for a rumor to spread. If it succeeds by 5 or more, the time is reduced to 3 days. If it fails by 5 or more, the rumor mutates into a competing theory. Can only have 1 rumor brewing at once. Feats - SF Deception, SS Deception, SF Insight, SS Insight Skills - +15 perception, +19 (adv) insight, +19 (adv) deception, +19 disguise, +15 local, +15 planes, +15 history, +15 linguistics Envy from Fullmetal Alchemist by Jinwu

entries.title: blessings
entries.content: Blessings Level 2 Medium Fiend \[monster] \[lewd] Defense Traits AC 16 (+2 tangled)\ HP 40\ Poise 27 (DR5 poise tangled)\ Fort +7, Refl +2, Will +3 Offense Traits (DC 14) Grapple +11 (+4 MI, +2 charge)\ +tongue action, +share the love Innate Techniques - Sprint Powerful Charge Tongue Action - While grappled by a blessed, the creature's mouth is also busy. They are also silenced. Share the Love - Whenever a blessed maintains a grapple or services a creature, they inflict a T3 affliction (will negates). The Master's blessing - Creature experiences the aches and pains of the world much more vividly as their bones grind against each other and each breath too warm, too cold or too wet. They gain weakness 2 to all damage. During this time they will be visited in the night by The Master. Without some form of outside assistance to protect their mind from dream intruders, they must roll a DC 24 will save or be unable to resist the temptations of this silent dream visitor and partake of her flesh. Interacting with The Master temporarily abates the pain, and the debilitating status of this affliction, for 24 hours. After passing the save, the creature can choose to ignore the master on their own without assistance. But if the creature cannot resist for 3 nights in a row, they are unable to resist at all on their own and begin to rapidly transform into a Blessing over the next 3 days. Cure - Only by meeting with and resisting the temptation of The Master can the affliction begin to fade. Slowly your body acclimates back to your painful existence. After 1 week of standard downtime resting activities, and avoiding all temptations of the flesh, the affliction is removed. A creature cannot receive this affliction more than once. Weaknesses/Deep Lore Service - Those blessed by The Master exist to serve. If a creature presents an erogenous zone to the blessed, they will spend their entire turn moving towards that creature and clamor to appease them. Said creature is exposed to the Master's blessing feature. Reaching 30 transforms the creature into a tramp. This is why they are often called "tome imps." Certain types of magical books can keep tramps trapped inside indefinitely. With planes or religion proficiency and 100g of holy water or purified salts, you can bless the book to turn it into a prison for the tramp. They can only leave the book by having their name called while the book is open. When they are outside of the book, they cannot interact with the book, except to enter it again. They cannot move more than 60 ft away from the book, getting dragged along with it if it happens to move. entries.title: navigating-the-bestiary
entries.content: Navigating the Bestiary The bestiary is arranged first by the creatures type. Some creatures have multiple types and I decided to put them in the camp they felt more at home in. Some creature types inherently have qualities, other just have a general vibe. Feel free to mix and match or add more! Some monsters will have tags listed at the top of their entry. There are general tags, and some specific to creature types.\ One such tag is \[unique]. These creatures are one of a kind. They usually have more complicated game plans to their tactics and have a very distinct identity that is separate from other creatures of the same type. Often they are intended to be a singular specific creature.

entries.title: lava
entries.content: 🌋 Lava Molten rock and metal. Lava is most commonly found around volcanoes, but can also be found erupting from the ocean floor and flowing through deep underground caverns. Lava typically comes in 2 variations; semisolid and liquid. Both are considered \[persistent] effects. Semisolid Lava - Semisolid lava feels a bit like chunky mud if it melted your toes. Semisolid lava is difficult terrain, and every turn you move through it, you take 4d6 (14) fire damage. Liquid Lava - Liquid lava is much more dangerous since it can pool into large enough quantities for you to get completely submerged in. Each round you are submerged in lava, you take 10d6 (35) fire damage and are drained 1. If you survive that and manage to escape, lava still clings to you, burning you while it cools. This damage starts at 4d6 (14), then decreases by d6 each round until it ends. By taking cold damage, getting hit with a \[water] effect or otherwise rapidly cooling or removing the clinging lava, you can avoid this damage over time.  If you are only partially submerged, like if it is only waist deep, the initial damage is reduced to 6d6 (21) fire, and the cling damage starts at 3d6 (10) fire.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Environmental Hazards What happens when you fall in lava? What does altitude sickness do? Extreme heat? Geysers? There are all kinds of things that aren't exactly creatures. It would be a tragedy if you had to figure out what happens yourself. This section is filled with all kinds of things that can pose a threat to the squishy humanoids ill prepared for what mother earth has in store for them. {% hint style="warning" %} Many creatures you encounter will be adapted to the environment they are in. You should probably not bother having lava affect creatures that are made of fire or obsidian for instance. These are soft immunities that are not included in the creature's stat block and should be granted based on vibes. {% endhint %}

entries.title: water
entries.content: 🌊 Water Water has a lot to talk about, so I'll break it up into 4 sections: Aquatic combat, underwater combat, water pressure and drowning. Aquatic Combat - This refers to combat that happens in and around water, but typically not completely submerged. As far as visibility is concerned, most of the time you can see to the bottom of lakes and rivers unless they are particularly murky. Oceans, seas and particularly wide lakes or rivers are the exception to this, where they can be deep enough that even in ideal conditions you can't see all the way down. When a creature not in water attacks another creature that is at least waist deep in water, they have cover. Creatures not in water cannot attack creatures that are completely submerged if they are more than 5 feet deep. Underwater Combat - Fighting underwater can make many fighting styles completely useless. Projectile weapons like guns can't fire at all. Thrown weapons don't function at all either. Bows and such have their range reduced to 10/20 ft. Melee combatants take a -4 penalty to attack unless they use a piercing weapon. Many of these things have workarounds. Certain types of weapons can be specifically designed for underwater use. Aquatic creatures, amphibious creatures and creatures trained in athletics figure out methods to ignore the melee attacking penalty. Water Pressure - Roughly every 30 ft you descend into water, you double the amount of pressure your body experiences. Going past 150 ft is usually impossible without being an aquatic creature, special equipment or magic. If you do not have such aid, then going deeper than 60 ft is usually a bad idea. In combat you don't have the luxury of slowly ascending to avoid the bends. If you ascend more than 5 feet a round after diving to this depth, you must make fortitude save or become drained 1 and dazed. The DC is 20+every additional 5 feet you moved (10 feet DC 21, 20 ft DC 23 etc.). Even if you pass your save, you are still drained 1. Drowning - Most creatures can pretty handily hold their breath for 30 seconds while under duress (or 5 rounds). For every point of strength you can hold it for an additional round. Every round past this limit inflicts drain. The first round you drain 1, the second drain 2 etc, causing you to rapidly die if you are unable to somehow breathe. With specific equipment, magic or training, or being aquatic/amphibious, you can increase or eliminate this limit entirely. The most common way is gillweed.

entries.title: boss-creatures
entries.content: Boss Creatures [Boss]These creatures are distinct in that they command a certain degree of authority or power. Bosses are not always unique enemies, but there is a overlap. Bosses have significant boosts to their action economy. They get a handful of other bonuses as well.Monster LoreAs part of a successful monster lore check, a character also learns any special mechanics of a boss creature, something more involved to defeat it. Think like a video game boss fight where you need to break its armor before you can get to the weak spot. Bonuses RecoveryAt the start of a boss's turn, if it is still suffering from an effect from status that affected it last turn, it gets a new save against the effect.The intention is to stop stun-lock from a single effect.Boss ActionsThe boss can act out of turn in response to specific events, usually at the end of a player's (or their allies') turns. These actions should typically be low impact compared to its main turn, doing things like creating disruptive terrain, summoning minions etc.The intention is to make the boss feel a little bit more dynamic, like it's responding to the player's actions and acting accordingly. Try to avoid adding too much mobility or risk having this be an easy escape.Poise ResistanceBoss creatures sometimes have resistance to poise damage. Types of Boss Actions Wind UpWind up abilities all have a major indicator that lets the players know that something dangerous is about to happen. A boss charges up its laser, the ground quakes in an area, a burly boss lifts a titanic object etc.

entries.title: defense-traits
entries.content: Defense Traits Amorphous In order to crit the creature, you must exceed its AC by a value higher than 10. Example Amorphous - +15 Damage Reduction (DR) Damage reduction (shortened DR) is a unique defensive property that comes in two different forms. Whenever a creature takes damage that their DR applies to, reduce the damage by the corresponding amount.\ Denoted as follows. The x represents a numerical value. DR x\ Only applies to physical damage (Crush, slash, Pierce) and poise damage. Some instances of DR only apply to poise damage from specific combat maneuvers DRA x\ Applies to all damage types (minus true damage) All forms of damage reduction stack with each other. Damage reduction applies in the most advantageous way possible for the creature (after halving from saves or resistances for example). If an attack's damage is reduced to zero, any additional effects the attack would apply do not occur. Fast Healing The creature gains specified amount of hp the start of their turn if they are not defeated. When the creature is defeated, this ability is disabled for 10 minutes (see medicine for other means to keep those pesky healers down). If a creature with FH is bleeding, roll a luck check (DC 10) to see if the bleeding stops at the end of their turns. Ferocity When the creature is reduced to zero hit points, they are not defeated until the end of their next turn. On said turn they are staggered. If a creature with ferocity is healed before their next turn, the creature is not defeated at the end of its next turn, and this ability is not consumed, however they are still staggered. This ability can only activate once per minute. FH does not function while in ferocity. Incorporeal Incorporeal creatures have resistance to crush, slash and pierce damage. They cannot be combat maneuvered without special equipment or techniques. Incorporeal creatures universally have hover speeds. Incorporeal creatures can pass through physical objects, but cannot end their turn inside of one. This allows them to ignore cover bonuses and more easily hide. Immunity Rare defensive quality. This creature is immune to a specific type of status effect and/or damage type. A common one is mindless creatures (creatures that lack an intelligence score, denoted by a - in the ability scores section) are immune to mind-affecting effects like fear and charm. Resistance When a creature has resistance to a type of status effect or damage type, the creature takes only half damage from effects that deal that damage type. When a creature has a resistance to a tag, it lists the numerical value that it gets a bonus to saves against abilities with that tag (such as \[fear] \[charm] etc). {% hint style="success" %} Creatures with resistance to poison also have a +4 bonus to the envenomed condition {% endhint %} Regeneration The creature regains a specified amount of hp at the start of their turn. This healing is capable of restoring lost limbs over a few days, or instantly if the limb is reattached. At the start of this creature's turn it loses the defeated condition, restores HP, and the creature is staggered instead of dazed. All forms of regeneration have some means to stop it (typically for 1 round), usually taking a specific type of damage.  If a creature is defeated while its regeneration is disabled, it is unable to regenerate for 10 minutes (see medicine for other means to keep those pesky healers down).

entries.title: fundamentals
entries.content: Fundamentals Natural Attacks Natural attacks always have the light property. It's very common for monsters to have sharp claws and teeth, but having more claws and more teeth doesn't necessarily lead to them having more attacks. In a typical bestiary stat block, a monster will have sets of attack actions each with their own specified stats. If a creatures stats mentions the multi-attack property, then when they take a standard action to attack, they are allowed to make multiple attacks of the specified types. Some creatures have conditional multiattacks. Example Sting (P) +3\ 2d6+2 (9) Multiattack - Can only be made against creatures with a speed of 0 (entangle, stun etc). \ Make 2 sting attacks. Innate Casting Some techniques can be granted outside of the standard progression, such as things gained from race, class, magic items, specialized training, or some kind of boon granted by another creature. Usually quite limited in scope and much more common on monsters. Innate techniques do not take up memory slots and are always memorized. Innate techniques grant creatures the ability to use a specific set of techniques. Spells do not require the staff/seal component that other casting typically requires. If a spell has a material or focus component, that is also ignored with innate casting. By default, creatures with innate techniques can use their techniques an unlimited number of times. Number values are included next to techniques that have limited uses per day. Mana burn still applies to innately casted spells. If a spell is constant, the spell is persistently active on the creature and takes up its \[buff] slot. A new buff can be cast on it, rendering the constant spell inactive. If it's constant spell is deactivated, it can reactivate it as a swift action.

entries.title: groups
entries.content: Groups Packs of beasts, platoons of soldiers and swarms of insects are all groups of weaker enemies that have slightly different representation than a typical monster. Group type enemies have a few quirks Universal traits AoE VulnerabilityTake 50% more damage from any AoE effectSingle Target ResistanceResistance to any damage that only affects a single creature, most common with attack rolls. Certain attacks like cleave can ignore this resistance.Single target effects that deal no damage have no effect.Poise ResistanceCannot be poise broken Other traits DistractionWhen a creature takes damage from certain group enemies, they can be overwhelmed by the sheer number of creatures. They are staggered for one round (fort negates)Swarm attackCommon with insects. Does not threaten. These creatures cannot make attacks and must instead enter a creatures space to deal their damage automatically at the end of their turn. This allows them to damage multiple creatures if they are close together with a big enough swarm.Auto attackDoes threaten. Any attacks they make automatically hit. If they choose to combat maneuver, they deal 20+lvl poise damage.

entries.title: offense-traits
entries.content: Offense Traits Aura (Su) A creature has the ability to generate an area of effect surrounding them. Some are passive some require activation.  All auras are \[persistent] effects, meaning creature can only be affected by a negative aura once per round. Breath Weapon (Su) The creature has the ability to use a supernatural area of effect attack. Common forms include lines and cones of elemental damage. Most breath weapons are \[recharge] effects that have some condition to use them again. Deathrattle An effect happens when the creature dies, requiring no action. This typically involves exploding or releasing toxic gases. Gaze (Su) Merely by looking at another creature nearby, they can inflict some kind of effect. The creature can use a standard action in order to gaze at a specific creature within 30 ft. Some creatures have gaze attacks that automatically happen to all creatures within a specific range. Anybody combating a creature with a gaze attack has a few options to try and negate it, made when they first are affected by the gaze attack. * They can choose to close their eyes (instant action), giving themselves the blinded condition until the start of their next turn, making them immune gaze attacks. * Alternatively they can choose to avert their gaze, giving them blurred vision and advantage on saves against gaze attacks. Gaze attacks can be avoided entirely by looking at the creature through a proxy, like a reflective surface. Grappling Abilities Attach - When the creature grapples another creature it instead gains the grappled condition, typically due to its smaller size. Creatures with the attached property typically have special abilities that can only be used while attached. Constrict - When a creature with the constrict property succeeds on a grapple check they automatically deal damage from a specified attack form. Every turn they maintain the grapple they also do this effect. Engulf - When the creature succeeds on a grapple check they can engulf the target. The target gains the entombed condition. Usually the creature can take no action other than to use athletics to escape. Allies can use athletics to pull you out or poise break the creature to set you free. Swallow - After successfully grappling a creature, the creature can choose to swallow its prey if it is at least one size category larger. The prey maintains the grapple penalties and the swallowing creature doesn't need to take any actions to maintain the grapple. The prey gains total cover and takes a specified amount of damage the turn it is swallowed immediately and at the end of the swallowed creatures turn thereafter. A creature cannot use its swallow quality while sickened 2 or higher. Becoming sickened 2 causes it to vomit any swallowed creatures. The prey escapes automatically when the swallowing creature is defeated. Powerful Charge The creature gets a +2 bonus to attack during any round they make a charge. Rend Whenever the creature lands the listed attacks (including poise breaking the creature), they inflict an additional effect, usually damage. Example Rend - Two claws (2d6) Summon Ally (Su) [companion] Functions like a summoning contract, but does not require a contract, usually only summoning lesser creatures. Only requires a standard action and can potentially summon multiple creature at once. Can also grant other bonuses to summoned creatures, in addition to the companion boost to attack. Trample Creature can move around through other creatures spaces to knock them over. As a FRA a creature can move its speed, or double its speed in a straight line, and harm all creatures along its path, dealing damage and knocking them down. Creatures can choose to either AoO or make a reflex save for a reduced effect. Venomous Inflicts the Envenomed status effect with one of its attacks or abilities, which functions as follows. Venom comes in 3 stages. In order to advance from one to the next, the afflicted creature must fail a fortitude save. The venom continues until they creature passes a fortitude save. Some creatures may have different effects for their venom, but this is the assumed default if no other details are listed. Stage 1 - Creature is sickened 1, which cannot be removed until the creature is no longer poisoned.\ 1 minute after the creature fails its first save, it must roll again or hit stage 2.  Stage 2 - Creature is sickened 2, which cannot be removed until the creature is no longer poisoned. The creature also has disadvantage on skill checks.\ 10 minutes after the creature fails its second save, it must roll again. Stage 3 - Creature is sickened 3, which cannot be removed until the creature is no longer poisoned. The creature gains the defeated condition. In stage 3, a creature must roll a save every 10 minutes. Each failure adds a stack of drain.

entries.title: other-traitss
entries.content: Other Traits Amphibious Amphibious creatures can exist comfortably on land or underwater, including the ability to breathe underwater or the ability to hold their breath for long periods of time. Blindsense This creature has extraordinary senses that allows it to sense the presence of creatures without sight. A creature with blind sense has +4 bonus on perception against a creature to which its blindsense applies. The creature automatically receives a perception check with no penalty when a creature enters this range, even while naturally asleep, and automatically wakes up if it senses something. A successful perception check indicates the creature has "locked on" and identified the space the creature is in. They gain seeking against any creature "locked on." Once a creature with blind sense has "locked on" to a creature, it stays detected until it leaves the creature's blindsense range, or the creatures blind sense is disabled. A creature with blind sense can use the "detect hidden presence" feature of perception as a free action once per turn, but only the affecting the range of its blind sense. Blind sense relies on a specific sense (mentioned in the ability), usually hearing or scent, but can also include things like detecting life (with undead creatures), or feeling tremors in the ground/water. Blind sense can circumstantially be negated, based on the source. Echolocation - Sound based. A creature that takes sonic damage has their echolocation disabled for one round. Lifesense (Su) - Functions against living creatures. Undead, constructs (and other similar not really alive) creatures cannot be detected with life sense. Scent - Uses a creature sense of smell. Aquatic creatures can only use this underwater. Amphibious creatures can use it in water or land. If you have an item with a creatures scent on it, you get a +2 bonus on survival checks to track them. Scents can be remembered similarly to how you can recognize someone's voice. Creatures with scent automatically get a perception check (vs disguise) against someone impersonating a creature they are very close to. A creature that is sickened cannot use scent. Tremorsense - Vibration based. Aquatic creatures can use this underwater. Amphibious creatures can use it in water or land. Only functions if the creature (and any creatures it is attempting to detect) is in direct contact with a physical surface. A creature that is clumsy cannot use tremorsense. Thought Sense (Su) - Functions against intelligent creatures. Mindless creatures cannot be detected with thought sense. A creature that is shaken cannot use thought sense. Sightless Blind Sense - In the absence of sight, blindsense is enhanced. The usual methods for preventing blindsense (sickened with super scent) from functioning impose partial concealment on all creatures that their blindsense cannot negate until the condition is removed. Creatures with sightless blindsense instead get a +8 bonus to perception when blindsense applies and its range is usually higher. Compression You are able to move through spaces designed for creatures 1 size smaller than you without treating it as difficult terrain. You are able to move through spaces designed for creatures 2 sizes smaller than you by treating it as difficult terrain Camouflage Creature can use stealth to hide without cover or concealment. Cannot be used while being directly observed. May come with other conditions for use. Hide in Plain Sight Creature has the ability to successfully hide from creatures while standing perfectly still by pretending to be an inanimate object or changing colors. If the creature is already being observed, or enemies have already been surprised by the creature using this ability recently, then it does not function. Typically creatures do not get a check to see a creature that is hiding in plain sight until they go out of their way to inspect the nearby area, or the hiding creature acts. The DC to detect them is based on their offense trait DC rather than stealth, but functions similarly when used to surprise attack. If creature has stealth, they can choose to roll it as normal to ambush. Movement Types Burrow - A creature with a burrow speed can tunnel through dirt, but not through rock, unless the descriptive text says otherwise. Creatures leaves a temporary trail behind, unless measures are taken to maintain the hole. You cannot charge while burrowing. Starting to burrow underground requires a swift action and provokes an AoO as though moving out of a threatened space. Climb - A creature with a climb speed can easily ascend or descend trees, walls buildings etc, provided there are ample places to place hands, feet etc. Creatures with climb speeds can even climb things without ample handholds using creative methods or exceptional biology in some cases (gecko, snake wrapping around). Flight - You can use a fly speed to move directly up into the air. Any movement moving up at greater than a 45 degree angle is considered difficult terrain. Taking flight requires a swift action that provokes attacks of opportunity as though moving out of a threatened space. Whenever you take damage while flying, gain clumsy 1. You cannot ascend while clumsy. Creatures with flight automatically also have glide. While a creatures speed is reduced to zero, it cannot fly, and plummets. Glide - While not movement impaired, take no fall damage. Reduce any fall damage to minimum value. When falling, move horizontally 5 feet per 1 foot fallen at a speed of 60. Hover - A lesser form of flight, or perhaps something supernatural like telekinesis. Functions as a land speed, but you float around a foot above the ground, allows you to ignore small changes in terrain.  Some creatures can use hover to fly during their turn, but they must end their movement hovering over flat-ish ground. You cannot use hover to temporarily fly while clumsy. While clumsy, your hover speed is reduced by 15. Swim - Creatures with a swim speed take no penalties to fighting underwater. Most creatures with a swim speed are either aquatic or amphibious. Polymorph (Su) \[Poly] Allows a creature to turn into a different creature. The description of the ability will include the features that it gains when it does so (based off of the features of the shapeshifter class). If there are no listed features then assumes that it gains none. While polymorphed a creature is unable to use any of the abilities based on its physical form, such as its natural attacks or poison, if they originate from their original form. Descriptions typically use features from the shapeshifter class. Ex Polymorph: Humanoid (Su) \[poly, true] - Any medium or small humanoid Polymorph: Beast, Dog (Su) \[poly, true] - Attack (bite), Manhandle (topple) Special Senses Darkvision - You can see well in complete darkness. Treat any form of darkness as bright light. Everything in darkness is grayscale. Green Sight (Su) - Can see through any form of vegetation. Creatures cannot use vegetation as a source of cover to hide against this creature. Nightvision - A lesser form of darkvision. You treat dim light as bright light. You treat darkness as dim light. These effects do not combine to allow you to treat darkness as bright light. Everything in darkness is grayscale. Telepathy (Su) The creature can speak directly into the minds of other creatures it can see. A creature must have an intelligence score of at least -2 in order to be telepathically communicated with. A creature can telepathically project its thoughts to several creatures in the nearby vicinity, even if it cannot see them.  Once a creature initiates a telepathic conversation, the other creature can communicate back using telepathy. The creature that initiated the telepathic conversation can choose to end it whenever they wish.

entries.title: weaknesses
entries.content: Weaknesses Monsters often have specific and niche weaknesses, allowing characters with specific skills or abilities to exploit the monster in a specific way. There are also generic weaknesses. Weakness Many creatures are susceptible to specific forms of attack. This is represented by a numerical value that increases damage taken. Common examples include elemental damage, such as frosty creatures being weak to fire. Whenever a creature takes a listed type of damage that it is weak to, increase the damage by the list of amount. Ex. Weakness 5 (fire)\ A 10 damage fire sword swing would deal 15 dmg instead.  Light Sensitivity Whenever this creature is in a well-lit area, they have blurred vision.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Bestiary Basics The bestiary is separated into 3 main groups: Monster qualities, the monsters themselves and environmental hazards. Monster qualities are not always exclusive to monsters, but they are much more common on them. Many qualities that appear frequently are not described in bestiary entries and are instead described here in order to save time/space.

entries.title: demigod
entries.content: Demigod You are well known and beloved/feared throughout the land through your deeds and people worship the ground you walk on. You defeated a demigod previously and absorbed their power. \ Through some means you have literally ascended to godhood. Gain the following benefits…\ Deific Boons - Take a T1 boon from another god, or make one up. You and creatures that choose you as their god gain this benefit. By achieving even greater (story/world related) feats, you can acquire greater boons. Emissary - Form a summoning contract with your chosen one. The creature must be level 10 or lower. You can telepathically communicate with this creature over any distance. Prayers Answered - You can innately cast sending (Larella 1) upcast to 3rd level so long as it is to communicate with to any of your followers. Deific Aspect - You can project yourself anywhere you have seen, as though you had been summoned via summoning contract. This requires a 1 minute cast time with a very obvious physical phenomenon occurring to indicate your imminent arrival, such as storm clouds, whirlpool, magic circle (something appropriate for you) during the cast time. You do not need to know the location if your followers pray for your assistance. You are not drained if you gain summoning sickness. Otherwise this has a cooldown of 1 day.

entries.title: immortal
entries.content: Immortal You have harnessed the power of a powerful artifact. You have received the blessing of a god. You have unlocked forbidden magics. Through some means, you have managed to figure out how to prevent aging for yourself. Gain the following benefits…\ Timeless - You cannot die of old age, nor can you be forced to magically age. You can alter your age to appear as a younger or older version of yourself, going anything from your prime to an elderly form. Changing requires a standard action. Optional - You no longer need to drink, eat, sleep, breathe or anything else tied to your biology that requires your continued operation. You must still must only do light physical/mental activity in order to rest. You can still do any of these things if you so choose. Ex Machina - Whenever you are slain, you automatically resurrect 1 day later at a pre-designated significant location, such as your hometown or primary place of worship. This ability goes on cool down for 1 month. If you die during this time, you stay dead.

entries.title: legendary-weapon
