This does not function against particularly dry plants like tumbleweed or dead plants. Against plant creatures, your blasts have a +2 bonus to attack or the DC as appropriate. 1 - Bubble (1)  As a standard action, you can bend water around the head of a creature within reach. A protective bubble forms around it, allowing it to breathe freely underwater for 1 hour. 1 - Water-Ish Bending (1)  You can use water bending to manipulate any liquids in the alchemical items section as though using the catapult technique, but it deals your blast damage instead of its standard damage. When you use the administer potion action, you can use waterbending to administer it as a swift action. This also makes it so it does not consume the targets immediate action. 4 - Ice Slick (2) \[concentration] \[Persistent] Completely freeze over a surface in slick ice. Freeze a 10 ft radius, centered on a point. Creatures inside of this radius are knocked down (reflex negates). Moving through an iced space knocks down creatures (reflex negates). You can avoid falling by treating icy spaces as difficult terrain. 4 - Icy Hold (2) Creature within 30 ft takes blast damage and is made frosty or entangled (reflex halves dmg and negates status). \ Athletics to escape entangle as a swift action. 1 fire damage frees the creature automatically. 4 - Imbalanced Whenever you use your elemental wave feature, creatures are made clumsy 1 on a failed save.\ When you land your elemental blast, creatures are clumsy 1. 4 - Push OR Pull  Remove the mana cost of elemental wave.\ Creatures that fail their save against your elemental wave are pushed away from you or pulled towards you 10 ft (your choosing for all affected creatures). 6 - Water Pressure Your water attacks are considered to be of adamantine toughness for the purposes of destroying objects. 6 - Ice Wall (3) \[concentration] Create a barrier made out of ice with enough water. Creatures cannot see through the wall. You can make this barrier in different shapes. At least one section of the wall must be within reach.  Igloo: 10 ft radius dome, complete with door.\ Castle: 5 ft radius wall 10 ft high.\ Wall: 10 ft tall, 30 ft wide.  Creature can use athletics as a standard action to break through a 5x5 section of a wall (or more for larger creatures). Alternatively an attack that does 10 crush damage or 5 fire damage destroys a 5x5 section of the wall. 6 - Favored Terrain (3)  As a swift action, you can use waterbending to create icy terrain that lasts until the end of your turn, or until the end of your next turn. This can be used to make things like bridges, ramps, stairs or a small barrier to avoid an AoO. 6 - Water Prison  You permanently memorize aqueous orb without spending memory. If it originates from a body of water, your CL is increased by 2 and the orbs speed increases to 40 ft. 8 - Cryofreeze (4) You can freeze a defeated creature, giving them stasis permanently. Must take at least 30 fire damage to unfreeze. You can unfreeze them as an instant action if they are within 30 ft. 8 - Whirlpool (4) \[concentration] \[persistent] Choose a point on the surface of the water within 60 feet of you. Water within 30 ft rapidly starts to twist and turn toward that point, carrying anything within. Creatures within the area are immediately caught in the whirlpool (fort negates, putting them out of the AoE at nearest point). When the creature is caught, and every round thereafter, they take your blast damage (crush) and are pulled closer to the center in a very random fashion (roll dice to determine which side they end up on). After the second round of being caught, they are completely submerged underwater. Each round a creature can attempt an athletics check as a FRA to escape the whirlpool's area.\ You are immune to the effects of your own whirlpool.\ All creatures in the area are made wet. Special: If you use this outside of a body of water, its DC decreases by 2 and its radius decreases to 15 ft. 8 - Icy Prison (4) \[recharge] Entomb a creature in ice (reflex reduces effect to frosty). An attack that does 10 crush damage or 5 fire damage destroys the ice and frees the creature. An entombed creature can roll an athletics check as a standard action to escape. 10 - Waters of Life (5) \[recharge] \[healing] By spending 1000g to perform a special ritual, requiring 10 minutes of concentration, you can bless a small vial of water with incredible healing capabilities. You can use this blessed water to bring a creature back from the dead at 1 hp if it died within the last minute. You can innately tell when a creature is too far gone to heal with this.\ You can only have one vial of this blessed liquid at a time. 10 - Octopus Stance (5) \[buff] \[recharge]  As a standard action, enter octopus stance for 10 minutes, causing 8 tendrils of water to form around you. As an instant action, you can take a shield action or parry by sacrificing a tentacle. 10 - Tsunami (5) \[recharge] \[concentration] \[persistent] Cause an enormous and powerful wave of water to wash over the world. Form a wave 60 ft wide and 30 ft high that originates from your space and launch it in a direction. It moves 60 feet each round on your turn for 3 rounds before crashing. When the wave passes over a creature, it gets picked up by the wave (fort negates). When it gets picked up and every round after it takes blast damage and is entombed in the wave. A creature can attempt athletics with a -4 penalty as a FRA to escape, getting deposited somewhere near where they were trapped. If a creature is within the wave when it crashes, it takes 50% increased damage and is stunned for 1 round. You can choose to ride the wave if you wish. The wave deals massive damage to structures and carries objects unless they are securely rooted in the ground. All creatures in the area are made wet. Special: If the waves starting point is outside of a body of water, its DC decreases by 2, its height decreases to 15 and its width decreases to 30. 10 - Blood Bending (5) \[concentration] \[recharge]  Take control of the body of creature within 30 ft of you (assuming a significant portion of its body composition is made of water like humanoids), stunning it for 3 rounds (fort reduces to stagger for 3 rounds). As part of initially using the ability, and each round it is staggered/stunned by this ability as a swift action, you can cause the creature to attack its friends. If the creature is stunned, you can move it up to its speed and make simple attacks or take the charge action. If it is staggered, you can only force it to make a simple attack.

entries.title: oddball-spells
entries.content: 🤔 Oddball Spells Because the technique progression of the Bender class is awkward, I have gone out of my way to take the work out of finding what techniques work for your element outside of the technique trees I recommended. I will also include a handful of spells I feel are thematically appropriate even if they do not have matching tags since there isn't enough content for some tags. You can still cast any of these spells without staff components. Just as a reminder, some of these techniques you won't have access to until certain levels, since firebenders and waterbenders don't unlock the variants to their blasts until levels 5 and 3 respectively. The techniques are listed in order of their level. Any cantrips are permanently memorized without consuming memory. Air - Feather Fall, Second Wind, Euphoric Cloud,  Earth - Stubbed Toe, Living Roots, Call of the Grave, Pocket Sand, Frenzied Leap, Quake, Toe Smasher, Mud Buddy, Ups and Downs, Iron Man, Man Drop Fire - Catch Flame, Shocking Grasp, Fired Up, Endothermic Touch (though this one is already covered by what the base firebending ability does), Hidden Power, Spontaneous Combustion, Flame of Destiny, Hot Potato, Solar Power, Elemental Shield, Prismatic Body, Rod of Roasting Water - Icicle, Free Swim, Wave of Darkness, Hidden Power, Enhance Water, Fog Cloud, Blanket of Snow, Ice Skating, Frost Armor, Snow Fort, Ice Lance, Shadow Weapon, Powder Snow, Liquefy, Elemental Shield

entries.title: README
entries.content: Bender Gain mastery over a specific element, using it as an extension of your own body. Benders use their favored element in order to augment their attacks and movement. They also get unique quirks based off of the qualities of the elements that they bend. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art" %} From the cover art of the game Avatar: The Last Airbender - Quest for Balance {% endtab %} {% tab title="Basic Stats" %} Requires Archetype | HP (mixed) | 20(+8 per level) | | ---------- | ---------------- | | Poise | 6 | | Skills | 4 | | Save | Refl | | Memory | 3+lvl | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} 1 - Elemental Techniques Benders ignore the standard technique point progression when it comes to abilities that match a tag of their favored element. They automatically know all techniques (still capped by the technique level maximum) that match the tag of elemental blasts they can use. In addition, I added a list of other techniques I thought thematically appropriate. You can replace the damage of any attacks in techniques with your blast damage (not compatible with upcast damage). You can use your blast to deliver the effects of techniques and special attacks, though they still must match the type of attack (ranged attack, melee attack etc). You ignore the staff component of any spell you gain through this feature. Techniques/special attacks that require simple attacks cannot use your blast damage. Waterbenders initially get the \[water] tag and @3 get the \[frost] tag. Most water techniques are in the Goomshroom tree and most frost techniques are in the Cryomancy tree. Earthbenders get the \[earth] tag. Most earth techniques are in the Cataclysm tree. Firebenders get the \[fire] tag and @5 get the \[zap] tag. Most fire techniques are in the Pyromancy tree and most zap techniques are in the Clairvoyance tree. Airbenders get the \[air] tag. Most air techniques are in the Clairvoyance tree. Instead of a particular specialization, you ignore the staff component of any spells that match your elemental tag(s). 1 - Favored Element (Su) At level 1 you choose an element. Once chosen it cannot be changed. Your elements decides many aspects of your class. In order to use any (Su) class abilities, you must meet requirements based on the element. You get a +4 bonus on saves against effects that share the same tag as your element. 1 - Elemental Blast (Su) As a standard action you attack a foe within 30 ft using either str or dex as your attacking stat. If the creature is out of reach, it counts as a ranged attack. If the creature is within your natural reach, you can either make the blast as a melee or ranged attack. It's damage is 2d6+str/dex, increasing by d6 @3 and every odd level after. The damage type is determined by your favored element. 1 - Elemental Movement (Su) Gain a bonus movement type based off of your favored element. 1 - Elemental Defense (Su) Gain a defensive property based off of your favored element. 1 - Elemental Intuition (Su) These features are passives gained regularly by leveling up. These features are universal for each element. Gain one each odd level. 1 - Elemental Styles (Su) These features give your bending more options. If an ability has a mana cost, it is noted next to its name (in parenthesis), or in the description if only a specific part costs mana.\ Gain 1 this level and another one at level 2, 4, 6, 8 and 10.  2 - Elemental Wave (Su) Spend 1 mana to launch your element at all creatures in a 30 ft line or in a 10 ft burst (centered on you). Deal your blast damage to all affected creatures (reflex halves). If you can change your blasts damage, you can change the damage of elemental wave as well. 2 - Elemental Counter You can innately cast dispel magic (CL=lvl+2), but only on effects that share the tag of your blast tag(s). 4 - Improved Blast The damage dice of your elemental blast increases to d8. 6 - Planar Travel (Su) 1/day you can use plane shift to transport yourself to your corner of the elemental plane based on your favored element. At any time thereafter you can perform a similar ritual to return to the exact position you came from. 8 - Greater Blast The damage dice of your elemental blast increases to d10

entries.title: when-can-i-bend
entries.content: When can I bend? In order to be balanced, some limitations are required to determine when you can and can't bend your particular elements. Treating every moment in a piece of media as canon that you can mimic in game can pose some problems. For example, King Bumi earthbending when inside of what is essentially a coffin when only his head is exposed. Allowing that kind of power while completely restrained can create problems. In general, I'd say that anything that can prevent you from making unarmed attacks can also prevent you from using elemental blast/wave/techniques. Some exceptions can be made (like firebending's melt feature), but in general, standard methods of restraint should be sufficient to prevent most abilities from functioning. Elemental Jank In the show, elemental attacks can originate from places other than directly where the attacker is standing. I have simplified elemental blast to always be ranged from a range, and letting you choose to make it ranged or melee when creatures are within your natural reach. Most abilities require you, or a spot near you, as the origin point.

entries.title: beast-whisperer
entries.content: Beast Whisperer 1 - Band of Beasts \[recharge] Most druids have a way with animals, but you are truly their maestro. When you succeed on a wild empathy check against a beast, you can communicate a complex set of instructions that are unusual, even uncomfortable, but not physically impossible for the creature. This can include things like a cat or dog walking on 2 legs for a short period, a rat making an unusually large amount of noise squeaking or a fish jumping out of water to do a barrel roll.  This beast can also serve as an emissary to its kind in the surrounding area. If you are willing to wait 10 minutes (and the beast in question has a substantial local population), this singular beast can multiply into dozens, or potentially hundreds to perform incredibly unusual activities. A bunch of local cats marching in the streets to your marching orders, a band of differently sized rats squeaking a simple jingle you orchestrate or an entire school of fish moving to make shapes of your choosing as you speak (ex finding nemo). You can only call a group of beasts in this way 1/week. 1 - Phone a Friend You can always find a general category of beast (something smart, a swimmer, something rideable, beast of burden, a reptile etc) by spending 5 minutes to look around your environment, provided there is one that exists. If you \[mana burn], you can will a general category of beast to come to you immediately, even if it isn't native to this environment, so long as it wouldn't quickly die existing where you are. You can never call upon a specific type of creature when you use this feature. Generally speaking, weaker creatures and herbivores are the first to respond. 1 - Petting Technique You get advantage on wild empathy checks when used against beasts/magical beasts. 2 - Copycat \[poly, true] As a swift action, you can copy any animal you can see within 30 ft. This transformation gives no boons, merely changes your size/appearance. You can speak normally while in animal form. This transformation lasts indefinitely, but can be ended as a swift action. While transformed you have advantage on disguise checks to go unnoticed if the animal could reasonably be there (dogs in urban areas, birds perched on trees, but not horses in an inn or a dinosaur in the arctic). 2 - Nature Strikes \[recharge] You can call beasts and magical beasts to your side to aid you in battle. The type of help they provide is something they must be able to do naturally. The entire effect must happen within 60 ft of you and the AoE is a 20 ft radius or a 60 ft line. Each effect that deals damage always does (3d6+CL) damage. The effects are not limited to, but should be no more powerful than… StampedeA large quantity of beasts rush through the area, plowing through anyone in their path.Crush damage, applies clumsy 2 (reflex halves).BombardBeasts positioned above the battlefield toss trash, spit, or deposit their leavings on some unfortunate soul.Poison damage, applies sickened 2 (fort halves)HowlBeasts starting hooting and hollering, making as much noise as possible to disorient.Sonic damage, applies shaken 2 (will halves) This ability has a 1 minute cooldown. 3 - Beast Companion \[companion] You gain the service of a specific animal to aid you on your journey. It grows more powerful as you do. More rules on beast companions in the beast companion section of beast trainer. Its level is 1/3 your level. 4 - Get Shit On \[Recharge] 1/day you can force a serendipity check, so long as the result includes animals as a major component. You must decide what you want to happen first, then your DM tells you its DC. Negotiate a simpler task if you think the DC is too high. Some examples of what you can accomplish… 5Get a group of animals to agree with you by making some kind of vocalization10Get a bird to poop on someone while outdoors20A vendor that sells pets renders in town If you fail the check then nothing happens, potentially making you look like an idiot depending on the setup. 6 - Lolcat Gain a new option with Nature Strikes You summon a cat/kitten to a spot you can see within 100 ft. The cat immediately starts doing something silly or adorable, like eating a cheeseburger or existing with a silly outfit. Creatures within 30ft of this cat are fascinated for 1 minute (will negates). Creatures that are minions to you get no save. Creature doesn't need to be a cat. Can easily be some other silly animal. Cats just have a high concentration of silly. 11 - King of Beasts You get an honorary crown, befitting of a king of beasts. All beasts treat you with the reverence usually only afforded to royalty by their subjects and servants. Unless a beast is under direct control from another creature, or a higher level than you, it will not harm you or otherwise impair you. Nature Strike can be used every other round and commanding large groups of beasts using Band of Beasts can be performed every day. If you stay in the same roundabout area, such as a forest or a valley, all your beast subjects will come to you when your kingdom comes under siege. This could mean the destruction of habitat, hunting on a large scale or particularly ominous creatures moving in. They can give you detailed descriptions about unnatural phenomenon or strange creatures as well as their general location.

entries.title: hive
entries.content: 🐝 Hive Your body has transformed to be a suitable home for a specific type of insect. Your symbiosis with this hive gives you the ability to command them. You protect them, they protect you. 1 - Hive Mind +2 vs any effect with the \[mind affecting] tag. 1 - Territory Mark a location as your territory by allowing your hive to build structures there over the course of a few days. This location is a 100ft radius, centered on a point. Your territory gives the following benefits \>You have regeneration 1 in your territory\ \>You have +4 perception in your territory\ \>You have +1 priority in your territory\ \>Your hive watches over the area constantly, using your perception. If they detect something, you know what they see as though you had seen it yourself, even if you are not there (Su). 1 - Hive Body Parts of your body are constantly shifting and moving, making it difficult to pinpoint where your weak points are. You have the amorphous quality, which means to crit you, the enemy needs to roll your AC+12. You can command your hive to attack any creature within your natural reach as a standard action, automatically dealing (2d6+CL) pierce damage. 2 - Hive Consumption \[poly, true] Become the hive. As a standard action, turn the entirety of your body/gear into a large swarm, gaining the following features. AoE VulnerabilityTake 50% more damage from any AoE effectSingle Target ResistanceResistance to any damage that only affects a single creature, most common with attack rolls. Certain attacks like cleave can ignore this resistance.Single target effects that deal no damage have no effect.Poise ResistanceCannot be poise brokenSwarm attackDoes not threaten. These creatures cannot make attacks and must instead enter a creatures space to deal their damage automatically at the end of their turn. This allows them to damage multiple creatures if they are close together with a big enough swarm.Doesn't affect allies.Fly40 You can speak but you are unable to wield a staff in hive form, making you unable to cast spells.\ You can revert back to your original form as a standard action. You can also choose to host groundborne insects, such as ants. You lose the fly speed and gain a land and climb speed of 40. Your swarm attack damage increases to 3d6. 2 - Eye of the Swarm Any hive of insects under your control also protects your allies. While within the swarm, you allies are treated as though they have cover (+2 ac and reflex). 4 - Bug Bite When you attack with hive body, you can attack all creatures within your natural reach.\ Your hive attack applies sickened 1. 4 - Expanded Territory The size of your territory expands to a 1000 ft radius. 6 - Distraction Your hive attack staggers for 1 round (fort negates). 8 - Hive Separation \[companion] You can lose your hive mind and hive body features and have your hive separate from your body as a standard action. Treat it as an insect swarm (lvl 4 beast). It cannot be more than 100 ft away from you, or else it immediately returns. If it is ever defeated, it returns to you and this ability is disabled until you rest. While reunited with you, your swarm has regen 1. If you share a space with your swarm, you can choose to absorb it as an instant action.\ Your hive is always half your level. 10 - Home Defense You always have a bonus hive defending your territory, functioning exactly as hive separation, but it cannot leave your territory.\ Your territory increases to a 1 mile radius.

entries.title: mushroomancer
entries.content: Mushroomancer Silly Art 1 - Fungus Amungus Infect willing, sleeping or defeated creatures with parasitic spores as a standard action. You can also inflict this upon a creature you have skin to skin contact with as a standard action. This infection deals no damage and has no noticeable side effects or visual symptoms at all. While a creature is infected, you get a +2 bonus on skill checks made against it. You also know the direction they are from you. You can infect up to 5 people at once. Infecting more forces you to decide to free another. You can remove an infection as a free action. This infection can be identified and removed with a medicine check (DC=class DC). 1 - Power Up (Su) You don't just grow mushrooms, you become the mushroom. Every day you can grow 3 mushrooms on your body that contain magic within them that is unleashed when plucked and eaten. The magic is chosen when they are plucked. Plucking and eating/feeding is a single swift action. You can choose to grow new mushrooms with new powers on the following days, but growing new ones drains the magic from the old ones.\ Mushrooms can be preemptively plucked and handed out to allies so they don’t need to be next to you to consume. In addition to spreading your infection, the mushrooms can have the following effects… Mega Mush [buff]Grow to huge size (1 minute)Mini Mush [buff]Shrink to tiny size (1 hour)Metal Mush [buff]Gain DRA 2 and resistance to poise damage. Decrease speed by 15. -10 to stealth. (1 minute)Rainbow Mush [mind affecting]Creature is fascinated for 1 hour. When interrupted during this hour, they naturally return to being fascinated after 1 minute.Double Mush [figment]An illusory copy of you appears adjacent. You can give it a simple task and it does it to the best of its ability. It cannot interact with physical objects. Lasts 1 hour or until harmed.Royal Mush [glamer]Transforms creature into princess version of itself, giving it an air of nobility. Any situation that could benefit from being of a privileged class grants you advantage on skill checks, such as getting into an exclusive party, seeing real royalty etc. Lasts until rest.Return to Fungus [poly, true] [dismissable]You transform into inanimate fungus. You can transform into a very large stalk, or as many smaller fungi grouped together as appropriate. You maintain you senses, but can take no actions or move other than to revert to your original form. Lasts until rest or until harmed. 1 - Mush Touch (Su) By touching a surface, you can cause a tiny toadstool to sprout at that location. In less than ideal environments, they quickly perish. You can choose to leave behind a trail of these tiny toadstools behind when you while you walk. 2 - Resonant Spores You can telepathically communicate to any creatures infected by your spores. 2 - Puffed Up (Su) 1/minute when you fall below half hp, you release a cloud of toxic gas within a 10 ft radius. While within the gas, creatures not infected by your spores are sickened 1 and have blurred vision. These effects persist for 1 round after leaving the cloud. 3 - Shiny \[Light] As a swift action, you can cause your creations to glow with bio luminescence. Any creatures you have infected with spores as well as any mushrooms you create with Power Up or Mush Touch glow with a bright light in a 5ft radius. This isn't particularly useful in bright places, but in darkness it can light the way.\ Glowing creatures take a -5 penalty to stealth and cannot use darkness to hide. 4 - Decomposition (Su) \[Recharge] You can cause dead or decaying organic matter to be overtaken by fungus and accelerate the decomposition process. This can be used to target things like corpses, fallen trees and leaves, or even wooden doors. This typically has the effect of damaging the structural integrity of the object. For something like a small wooden barrier, it only takes a few rounds. For something much larger like a wall or an enormous fallen tree, it can take minutes. This provides sustenance to you, and this limits its usability. Decomposing something about your size like a door is more like a snack, but a particularly large object like an ornate wooden staircase is like eating a feast all on your own. You may need to wait until you are hungry again to fully decompose such objects. 4 - Mush Men (Su) \[mana burn] \[scrying] By spending 1 mana, you can animate a tiny mushroom to have little legs and eyes. They perish if attacked, have a speed of 30 and use your perception/stealth scores. You can give them telepathic orders, but they can do little more than keep watch or wander in general directions. They will mentally alert you (waking you up) if you they see something unusual, like an intruder, or something dangerous/scary. You can teach them a specific creature if you wanted them to find someone or something in specific. If they touch a creature, they can transfer your infection. This is usually only possible against incapacitated, friendly or willing creatures. Against an unwilling creature, you must succeed on a melee attack against a DD creature (uses your attack bonus). You can scry through the mushmen. You cannot recover the mana as long as the mushman persists, even if you rest. If the mushman returns to you safely, you recover the mana burn. If it dies, you must rest to restore it. You can willingly dismiss a mu 5 - Absorb When you get the wet condition, you increase 1 size category instead. Further applications of wet apply normally. You shrink back to normal size after you rest or with exposure to direct sunlight for a few minutes. 6 - Power Up+ (Su) \[poison] You can create an additional Power Up each day. Gain additional options. Magic MushroomYou can temporarily abate the negative effects of a T1 affliction for 1 hour.Higher PlaneCreature gains the time out condition until rest. 8 - Green Demon (Su) \[poison] \[recharge] Target a creature more than 30 feet away from. A dangerous and toxic mushroom pops out of your hand and relentlessly follows them for 1 minute. It flies at a speed of 30 at the end of each of your turns, moving in a direct line towards its target. This can lead to the mushroom getting "caught" on solid terrain. If it ever enters the space of the target creature, or if another enemy enters its space, it is immediately infected. The creature then takes d6/lvl poison damage (fort halves) and is dazed for 1 round. 10 - 1-Up (Su) \[healing] \[recharge] Make a mushroom that you can feed to a creature that has died in the last minute to restore them to 1 hp. Usable 1/month.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 🌍 Druid Druids focus on the supernatural side of nature: with the ability to commune with it as though it were a person. They choose a specific aspect of nature to focus on, such as plants or animals. The abilities granted to them by Mother Earth allow them to interact and manipulate these things to a sometimes comical degree. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art" %} Art by  {% endtab %} {% tab title="Basic Stats" %} Requires Archetype | HP (specialist) | 20(+6 per level) | | --------------- | ---------------- | | Poise | 5 | | Skills | 4 | | Save | Will | | Memory | 2+(2\*lvl) | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} 1 - Technique Specialization (Magical) You gain 2 technique points at level 1, then another 2 points every 2 levels after.\ These technique points can be used on the Mother Earth, Lunar or Shroomlette tree. Characters with magical specialization gain points in wild card equal to their highest tier of magic technique and cantrips. 1 - Druidic You learn the secret language, druidic. In text form it can only be seen by other creatures that know druidic. You can essentially write secret messages by touching your finger to any natural object (typically boulders and trees) and writing. Any message written in this way can be erased by a creature that knows druidic with ease. 1 - Nature Tongue You can speak with animate plants, beasts and magical beasts as though you share a common language. They are able to much better articulate their feelings as though they possessed the intellect of a simple humanoid, but their instincts, desires and attitude toward you remain largely the same.  You can also interact with inanimate plants, but these creatures only have the most basic of ideas, only able to give single word answers like yes/no or a direction. 1 - Nature Stride When traveling through natural terrain that restricts your movement, such as thick snow or dense jungle, your speed is not affected. All allies that can see you also gain this benefit. After not seeing you for a few minutes, your allies lose this benefit. 1 - Wild Empathy Gain the wild empathy feat. Its usable on any creatures you can speak to with nature tongue, allowing you to influence plants. You need not roll against inanimate plants, but their influence is incredibly limited, only able to help by shaping their growth for instance. If multiple druids try to influence the same plant, they roll to establish dominance permanently. 1 - Skill You automatically get knowledge nature as a skill with a +4 bonus.

entries.title: vegetable
entries.content: 🥕 Vegetable Silly Art .png>) 1 - Gardening Your body is host to a variety of plant life. You have wooden parts, blooming flowers, leafy hair, roots growing along your body or moss growing on your face.  Gain the following benefits…\ \>You are constantly under the effects of the vine whip spell (mother earth 1). It does not have the buff tag and you can multiattack with It (2 whips)\ \>You have advantage on stealth in areas with suitable vegetation.\ \>When in direct sunlight, you gain FH 1. 1 - One With Nature (Su) \[poly, true] As a swift action, you can copy any inanimate plant you can see within 30 ft. This transformation changes your size/appearance. You can speak normally while in plant form. You can also have the face of someone you know appear along the surface of the plant in leaves or bark. This transformation lasts indefinitely, but can be ended as a swift action. While transformed you have advantage on stealth, perception, disguise and deception. If a creature saw you transform or is already very familiar with your voice, you lose the advantage on deception, disguise and stealth. 1 - Talent You have advantage on wild empathy checks against plant creatures. 2 - Bramble Back You can cause the vegetation that grows on you to become dangerously pointy as a free action. Creatures you are currently in contact with take 2d6 (7) pierce damage. Creatures you initiate contact against, or that initiate contact against you also take this damage. 4 - New Recruits (Sp) You are constantly under the effects of arboreal army (mother earth 2). Their attack bonus increases by 2. You can use them to perform any combat maneuvers instead of only bullying.

entries.title: destroyer
entries.content: Destroyer Destroyer shifters are the most monstrous of all fiend shifters. They specialize in destruction, feats of strength and striking fear in the hearts of their enemies. Destroyer abilities are inspired by fiendish, animalistic and monstrous creatures with little more than the desire to kill.  Your specialization is martial. Your technique trees are Barbarism and Cataclysm. 1 - First Seal: Fiendish Frenzy (Su) When you break the first seal, you increase to large size and increase your speed by 10. If there isn't enough room for you to grow, you can roll athletics as an instant action to make room. When you transform you can willingly choose to give yourself the taunted condition against one enemy that you can see. You can also choose to immediately take the focus action against them. You get +4 to d20s (attack, skills, saves etc) against enemies that taunt you. You can choose to automatically fail any effects that taunt. Whenever you use this self-inflicted taunt and you do not attack or otherwise attempt to cause harm to the creature that you are taunted by, you take 3 psychic damage and the taunt ends. 6 - Second Seal: Bloodlust (Su) When you break the second seal, you increase to huge size. As part of the action to break the seal, and every turn after as a swift action, you can dash, as long as you are taunted. If the creature you are taunted by is defeated, leaves combat, is devoured, or you otherwise aren't taunted, you can choose to be taunted by another creature as an instant action. 11 - Final Seal: Monstrosity (Su) \[fear] When you break the final seal, you increase up to massive size. Any creature you are taunted by must make a will save or be frightened for as long as you are taunted by them (will negates). * Fiendish Growths Numbers indicate level requirements (10 total) 1 - Terror to Behold You can demoralize creatures up to 60 ft away.\ When you break the seal, you gain a +4 bonus to intimidation.\ You gain the fearsome finisher feat. 1 - Cacophonous Clap \[sonic] You gain the rend monster ability (2 claws). Deals 2d6 (7) sonic damage. As a standard action, or at the end of a charge, deal 2d8+lvl (9+lvl) sonic damage to all creatures within your natural reach and stagger all creatures hit for one round (fort halves damage and negates stagger). 1 - Tongue Gain a special attack\ Grasping Tongue (Special Attack) - Kidnap your foe. If the attack lands, make an additional drag attack. You gain an extra long and dexterous tongue capable of grasping and finely manipulating objects as well as your hands. You can also use it to make attacks with +10 reach during your turn (deals crush damage). 2 - Taste Test (Su) Whenever you land a tongue attack, or just lick someone, you learn a tidbit of information about the creature. This information is one of the few things: A random piece of personal information (such as a love interest), something that weighs heavy on the creature's mind (such as upcoming important events) or the creature itself (as per one section of monster lore). If you've already learned about the creature through monster lore (even from an ally or previously licking the creature) you can instead learn about another category. 4 - Destructive Tendencies Your claws are considered to be of adamantine toughness. You get a +4 bonus to sunder attacks and athletics checks to break things. 4 - Path of Ruin Whenever you take the charge action, you automatically destroy obstacles, cover and difficult terrain that is of solid or lesser toughness. Anything harder you get a free attempt to break it. You can charge directly into the air and are immune to fall damage any round you charge. You have resistance to all damage when you charge. 4 - Devour You gain the swallow monster quality. Deals 3d8 (13) poison damage.\ You get DRA 3 vs swallowed creatures. You can also swallow creatures you successfully drag with your grasping tongue special attack. 4 - The Succ \[sonic] \[air] Once per minute you can inhale with such sudden force as to evacuate the air in its proximity, causing a sudden wave of air pressure from the implosion. All creatures and loose objects within 30 feet of the you take (2d6+d6/odd lvl) sonic damage and are pulled adjacent to you (fort halves damage and negates pull).\ Swallowed creatures are also affected and automatically fail their save. 10 - Endless Abyss (Su) You become a pure destructive force of the universe to such a degree that you can manifest the Endless Abyss. This takes the form of a black hole that is integrated into your body somehow (replaces eye, in the back of the throat, or something more exotic like the dark star skins in league) and is immediately recognized as dangerous by most. You can choose to annihilate objects that you comes into contact with, absorbing them into the abyss, as long as you are larger than them. You can concentrate for 1 minute to allow the Abyss to consume a defeated creature within reach. Add 1 to your soul counter. For every soul consumed, you can regurgitate an annihilated object or creature. Regurgitated creatures and objects are in the same state they were in when they were annihilated. 10 - Eater of Souls (Su) \[healing] \[teleportation] \[overheal] Whenever a creature within reach is defeated, you consume a piece of its soul and recover 10 hp. If they are within 60 ft of you, you can teleport adjacent to them as an immediate action to get a nibble of that soul.\ You can only munch a specific creature's soul 1/day.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Archetypes

entries.title: succ
entries.content: 💋 Succ Succ shifters are the schemers of the fiend shifters. They know when you've been naughty.\ Succ shifters have altered base stats. | HP (mixed) | 20(+8 per level) | | ---------- | ---------------- | | Poise | 6 | | Skills | 6 | | Save | Fort | | Memory | 3+lvl |  Your specialization is magical. Your technique trees are Shira and Larella. 1 - First Seal: Hugs When you break the first seal, you can roll persuasion in place of your attack when making grapple attacks. Any bonuses/penalties to attack don't apply (flanking, powerful charge, sickened etc). Any bonuses/penalties to skills do apply. You count as having the maneuver initiate feat for feat prerequisites. 6 - Second Seal: And Kisses (Su) \[healing] \[charm] When you break the second seal, You gain constrict. Initiating a grapple and every turn you maintain it thereafter inflicts drained 1 on your target and you heal 5 hp.\ Whenever you succ a creature like this, the creature is also charmed for 1 minute (will negates).\ You can apply either or both effects with a normal kiss. 11 - Final Seal: ? When you break the final seal,  * Fiendish Growths Numbers indicate level requirements (8 total) 1 - Charmer (Sp) \[charm] \[subtle] \[companion] As a swift action, you can attempt to charm a creature within 30 ft permanently (will negates). If you do not want to take companion slots, it functions as the spell charming gaze. These creatures do not gain the companion attack bonus. 1 - Dealbreaker \[curse] \[subtle] \[scrying] Whenever a creature makes a promise (verbally, written, etc) to you, you can unknowingly curse them (will negates).\ Whenever the cursed creature breaks that promise, you know. As a standard action, you can scry on them. You can do this indefinitely.\ You can remove this curse at any time as an instant action. A creature must apologize to you and provide some form of penance to remove the curse. 1 - Cuddle Gain the body block feat.\ Whenever you rest with another creature(s, max three others), you and the creature(s) gain (2\*lvl) temp hp, lasting until they are lost. 1 - Chant Your CL increases by 1.\ By decreasing your speed by 30 and chanting in a fiendish tongue, you can increase the CL and DC of the effect of spells you cast this round by 1.\ A creature can perform the aid action to increase your CL by 1 if they also chant in a fiendish tongue. 1 - Cleavage Cache (Su) You gain an extra dimensional space as a part of your body. You can access it by reaching into your chest if you're feelin lewd, or through something more exotic like a literal drawer integrated into your body (a la Ava's Demon). This space has an unlimited quantity of volume, allowing you to put and pull out comically large objects, but anything stored within counts against your carry weight. \ Gain 100 carryweight.\ A creature can only remain inside for 1 minute before being forcefully ejected. It cannot enter again until you rest.\ Other creatures can access your cache while you are defeated, dead or asleep (with sleight of hand). Though it may require a lot of searching to find the desired object. 1 - Succ Insight (Su) \[poly, true] You are constantly under the effects of Detect Thots. It does not have the concentration tag.\ By making skin to skin contact with a creature (or whatever you/they have that replaces skin), you can learn one piece of information. Prolonged contact gives you multiple chances to gather more information.\ \>One kink or fetish the target has\ \>The name and appearance of the creature the target is most attracted to\ \>The name and appearance of the creature the target most recently did something lewd with\  \ You can transform to match the appearance of a creature you learn about from this ability as a standard action, even if it isn't humanoid. If you succeed on disguising yourself as this creature, you have advantage on all rolls made concerning this creature. Though depending on the target's familiarity with the creature, it may be difficult to disguise as them, or benefit from the transformation at all if their relationship soured post intercourse. 4 - Handwave (Su) You can telekinetically manipulate objects within 60 ft, limited by your carry weight. You can hold a large quantity of smaller/lighter objects if they are all close together. These are essentially treated as an additional limb that requires concentration to use. 8 - Profane Tribute (Sp) Gain a +1 bonus to one of your ability scores (max +3). You can confer this benefit on up to 3 willing creatures. Gifted creatures also receive other effects. \>You can telepathically communicate with these creatures over any distance.\ \>They are permanently charmed by you, which cannot be removed without first removing the gift.\ \>As a standard action, you can scry on these creatures. You can do this indefinitely. This portion of the ability has the \[scrying] tag\ \>You form a summoning contract with these creatures. You can summon one as a standard action. You can only have 1 summoned at any given time. This portion of the ability has the \[companion] tag, but only when the creature is summoned.

entries.title: unchained
entries.content: ⛓️ Unchained Unchained shifters are all about inflicting as much pain upon themselves and others as possible. They take their favorite parts of other creatures and add it to themselves. Your specialization is martial. Your technique trees are barbarism and beastmode. 1 - First Seal: Shackled (Su) When you break the first seal, 4 spiked chains burst from your back that you can make attacks with (deals crush damage). They function as additional opposable limbs that can be used to hold objects, climb walls, grapple creatures etc. The chains have an additional 5 feet of reach during your turn. 6 - Second Seal: Share my Pain (Su) When you break the second seal, your chains now have an additional 10 ft of reach during your turn. You can innately cast shackles of pain as a swift action, taking up one of your shackles while the effect persists. Instead of its usual range, it has a range of reach. It also has an altered effect. It does not reduce any of the damage you take, but instead causes chained creatures to take half the damage you take as true damage. 11 - Final Seal: Generosity (Su) \[fear] When you break the final seal, your chains now have an additional 15 ft of reach during your turn. Your share my pain feature can target up to 4 creatures within reach at once. * Fiendish Growths Numbers indicate level requirements (9 total) 1 - Infernal Shackle (Su) By spending 1 mana when you land an attack against a creature with your chains or claws, you can shackle them. One of your chains pops out of your body and stays put at the point they were at when you attacked them. At the end of their next turn, they are pulled back to that position and your chain returns to you. The chain immediately breaks if the creature gets more than 60 feet away, or if someone uses athletics to break it as a standard action. In any case, escaped chains reappear attached to you. 1 - Bits and Pieces After a battle, you can peruse the bodies of your defeated foes for pieces of them you like, such as their eyes, teeth, feathers, scales etc. You can surgically remove them with your claws and add them to yourself after 1 minute, either replacing that part of your body or you somehow make room. Increase your max hp by 1 each piece.\ The parts need to be fresh, so waiting for more than 5 minutes ruins their potency. Unchained shifters are a bit picky and will only add pieces of creatures of their level or higher (though they won't retroactively remove pieces as they level up). \ You can have a maximum of (3+3\*lvl) pieces. 1 - Return the Favor Gain combat reflexes as a bonus feat.\ Whenever you provoke an AoO, the attacking creature provokes an AoO from you. The act of provoking isn't enough and the creature can simply opt to not attack you to deprive you of your AoO. 1 - Flesh Wound \[healing] \[overheal] Whenever you take damage, keep a running tally of how much damage you have taken. After 1 minute of not taking damage, restore half of this value as hp. Any \[healing] effect that does not grant temp hp subtracts twice the healing amount from this value. 1 - Masochism You can attack yourself, dealing damage as normal, requiring no attack roll. You gain +2 attack and +10 speed for 1 minute after doing so. If an ally attacks you, or includes you in the AoE of an effect that deals damage, you also get this bonus. Any damage you take during your turn has 100% effectiveness against creatures shackled by share my pain. 1 - Battered and Bruised While at or below 50% hp, you have +2 AC, +2 to all DCs you inflict and +2 to all saves. 4 - Sadism On-hit your attacks apply a stacking debuff (similar to shaken/sickened) called pain. Pain gives a creature weakness 1 to all damage types. Any \[healing] effect removes all pain stacks. 6 - Sharing is Caring (Sp) You can use your share my pain feature on allies. Instead of its usual effect, it causes them to take half damage, redirecting the mitigated damage back to you. 8 - Shadenfreude (Su) \[healing] Whenever an enemy within 60 ft of you fails a skill check, fails to even graze with an attack or fails a saving throw, you restore 5 hp. This healing does not interfere with flesh wound's healing.

entries.title: youkai
entries.content: 👺 Youkai Youkai shifters have a powerful being sealed inside of them. As their relationship deepens, so too does their power. Youkai abilities are inspired by Japanese folklore.  Your starting spell list is Moogan and ??? 1 - First Seal: Spirit Guide When you break the first seal, you gain FH 1 while below half hp. When you roll a natural 1, your youkai spirit intervenes, allowing you to reroll it as an immediate action. You can break the first (second and final) seal as an immediate action to activate this reroll ability. 6 - Second Seal: Spirit Cooperation When you break the second seal, your FH increases to 2 while below half hp, and you gain FH 1 when at or above half hp. Even when you are deprived actions (such as being staggered, dazed or defeated), your youkai spirit can take any of the actions listed in the below abilities.\ Spirit Siege, Spirit Guide, Spirit Guardian 11 - Final Seal: Quickened Spirit When you break the final seal, your FH turns into regeneration, stopped by poison or fire damage. Through you and your youkai spirit acting in tandem, you gain an additional swift action each turn. * Fiendish Growths Numbers indicate level requirements (6 total) 1 - Blood Claws (Su) As long as you are missing hp or are bleeding, you can use this ability.\ 1/rnd you can make a claw attack as though it was a thrown weapon (20/40 range) by digging your claws into your wound and throwing blades of blood at an enemy. 1 - Vigilance Your youkai spirit is always watching over you, even when you do not manifest it. You get a +4 bonus to initiative and perception. You do not take a penalty to perception while sleeping. 1 - Spirit Guardian In combat your spirit actively participates to defend you. You cannot be flanked. Your spirit can possess your body and move with a 30 ft hover speed and automatically spend your standard action to disengage, even if you lack those actions from being stunned for example. When you are defeated, creatures must still beat your AC or poise break you to attack/move you and you can still make reflex saves. 2 - Spirit Snatcher (Su) When you grapple a creature, your spirit also grabs a piece of their soul, making them fatigued. If you are not poise broken by the start of your next turn, your spirit devours this piece of soul. The creature you grappled becomes drained 1 and you regain (the creature's lvl) HP. A creature can only be affected by spirit snatcher 1/day.\ The creature remains fatigued for as long as they have the drained condition. 8 - Destructive Tendencies You grow a third eye, giving you the ability to innately cast glimpse of truth 1/day.\ As a swift action, you can fire a laser beam from this eye. Roll a d4 to see what you get, then choose a target. Make an attack roll as though using a thrown weapon (20, 40). It deals 3d6 (10) damage with a random type and bonus effect.  1 - Smoke[Fire] damage. Creature has blurred vision for 1 round.2 - Blood[Poison] damage. Heal the damage you deal.3 - Shadow[Necrotic] damage. Creature is bone chilled for 1 round.4 - Ice[Cold] damage. Creature has its speed reduced by 15 for 1 round. You can decide which eye beam you would like to use, but doing so closes your third eye, disabling this ability for 1 minute. You cannot use this ability while blinded or while you have blurred vision. 10 - Spirit Siege Your youkai spirit plays a much more active role in combat. It is capable of dashing around the battlefield before quickly returning to defend you once again. As a swift action, limited to once each round, you can command your spirit to do one of the following actions. Its attacks don’t suffer your MA penalty. CrushMelee attack a creature within 30 feet. It is stunned for 1 turn on hit with no other effect (fort reduces to stagger)BlockYou gain improved cover against 1 specific creature. Spaces moving towards you are considered difficult terrain for the creature.SliceMake a simple attack against the creature within 30 ft using your claw damage.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Fiend Shifter A Fiend Shifter is someone who has stolen the secrets to the powers of fiends, slowly letting this power overtake them. They only grow into a more terrifying monster capable of combating even the most terrifying the fiendish realms have to offer with the very same power they wield. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art" %} Art by me! {% endtab %} {% tab title="Basic Stats" %} Requires Archetype | HP (martial) | 20(+10 per level) | | ------------ | ----------------- | | Poise | 8 | | Skills | 4 | | Save | Fort | | Memory | 3+lvl | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} 1 - Technique Specialization You gain 1 technique point in a tree (determined by archetype) this level and 2 levels after. 1 - The First Seal You add fiend to your type, in addition to any others you possess. As a free action, deal 1 true damage to yourself to break the first seal. This gives you bonuses based off your archetype. This lasts for 1 minute, or until you exit combat (or something similarly strenuous). 1 - Shifter Claws You possess claws on your hands that you can use to make natural attacks. They deal 2d6 slashing damage if your hands are empty, or d10 if they are not. Any other natural attacks that you gain through this class share this damage, but often with a different damage type. These attacks can be used interchangeably with claws. Your claws share the properties of a single weapon in your possession, such as magic enchantment, a magic focus' ability to cast spells, or special attacks. You can bond to a new weapon with a 1 minute ritual requiring concentration and contact with the weapon. 1 - Multiattack 2 claw attacks. 1 - Fiendish Growth Gain a fiendish growth from your chosen archetype, or the universal list. Get another one at level 2, 4, 6, 8 and 10. 1 - One of Us (Su) \[poly, true] The physical transformation into a fiend shifter is a dramatic one that can draw unnecessary attention. You gain a specific form reminiscent of your original form that you can revert back to as a standard action. Breaking the seal or using a feature gained through fiendish growth ends this disguise. 2 - Telepathy (Su) You can speak directly into the minds of other creatures you can see. A creature must have an intelligence score of at least -2 in order to be telepathically communicated with. A creature can telepathically project its thoughts to several creatures in the nearby vicinity, even if it cannot see them. Once a creature initiates a telepathic conversation, the other creature can communicate back using telepathy. The creature that initiated the telepathic conversation can choose to end it whenever they wish. 4 - Hell and Back (Sp) \[recharge] You can innately cast the spell Hell and Back. 6 - Second Seal (Su) You break the second seal, improving the ability that you gained at first level. 8 - Shadow Realm (Su) You can banish a willing or helpless creature to the realm of fiends. The creature is unable to return through any means other than a naturally existing portal. The Fiend Shifter can telepathically communicate with banished creatures. They can also stun themselves to observe them, as though floating overhead. 11 - Final Seal (Su) You break the final seal, perfecting the ability that you gained at first level.

entries.title: universal-fiendish-growths
entries.content: Universal Fiendish Growths The numbers next to the abilities are level requirements (4 total so far)\ Any archetype can select these options. 1 - Horny Gain 2 special attacks, usable with a gore attack (deals pierce damage). Knockdown (Special Attack) -\ Knockdown (Special Attack) - KnockdownSpecial attackOn-hit make an additional topple attack.KnockbackSpecial attackOn-hit make an additional shove attack. 4 - Shape Change (Su) \[poly, true] You can change your appearance to that of any small or medium playable race. Can change back as a standard action, or as a swift action when you break the seal. 6 - Hellfire (Su) \[persistent] \[fire] Gain a breath weapon.\ Unleash a 30 ft cone or 60 ft line of flames that persists until the start of your next turn. Creatures within the area, or that later move into it take (2d6+d6/odd lvl) fire damage (reflex halves). This ability ignores fire resistance. Recharged by consuming an organ of a freshly killed playable race, or by resting. 10 - Death From Above Grow a pair of wings that grant you a fly speed equal to your land speed.

entries.title: flashback
entries.content: Flashback Having the situational awareness to capitalize on quirks of your unique scenario using the environment (I use low gravity to lift a rock and make cover) or some niche feature interaction (can I mine the earth elemental?) is core to table top, so sectioning it off as a mechanic feels odd. Instead to represent your intelligent character's scheming, you can flash back a few minutes into the past to perform a simple and subtle item interaction that can improve your scenario. Things like placing inconspicuous objects in specific places, locking or unlocking doors or reactivating traps are good uses of flashbacks. Things like casting persistent spells, preparing attacks and using magic items are bad examples of flashbacks. Don't let your players do this. The idea is to make your character feel like they plan for things, not give them an extra standard action. Flashbacks can be done as an instant action once per minute. Some actions may require skill checks (such as the aforementioned locking and unlocking) but not all should.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Tactician The more well informed a tactician is about a battle, the better they perform. The longer a battle goes on, the greater an edge they have by analyzing their opponent's moves. 1 - Commander As a standard action, give an ally with 30 ft a command. They make a simple attack. 1 - Study Techniques The first time you miss with an attack in a combat, allies get a +2 to attack when attacking with your commander feature for the rest of the combat. If they miss with their attack, the bonus of the next command increases to +4 for the rest of combat. This bonus can increase by 2 indefinitely. 1 - All Planned You can make flashbacks. See subsection for details. 2 - Secret Techniques You can use any kind of special attack on the equipment page with shields.\ This ability cannot be used in consecutive rounds. 2 - Tactical Reposition \[elusive] As a swift action, give an ally additional movement. This movement can be used only while being threatened. The creature must end this movement in a space threatened by at least 1 creature that was originally threatening it. 4 - Hard Read \[recharge] As a swift action, predict what a creature within 60 feet of you will do on its next turn with its standard action.\ If you predict the creature will attack, you must predict who it will attack.\ If you predict the creature will cast a spell, you must predict what the spell will target.\ If you predict the creature will use a Su ability, you must predict what the ability will target.\ This is not an exhaustive list, but a prediction requires a high degree of specificity. If you predict correctly and the creature performs the action you anticipated, increase your study techniques bonus by 2.\ Recharge 1 minute. 6 - Build a Wall Enemies treat squares within your natural reach as difficult terrain. When you use the tank up feature of a tower shield, it doesn't lower your speed on subsequent turns when you advance forward.

entries.title: aran
entries.content: Aran Cleave through waves of enemies eventually gaining the strength to spin through entire armies. Aran is the premier AoE DPS martial. Spin to win! Silly Art .png>) 1 - Smash Swing Gain weapon focus (slash) as a bonus feat. You cab use great cleave at will. When you cleave, it is referred to as Smash Swing. 1 - Combat Step \[elusive] If you defeat at least one enemy during Smash Swing, you may activate Combat Step as a swift action to move an additional 10 feet without spending your movement. Cleave normally requires you stand still to attack all foes in range, but movement using combat step ignores this, allowing you to continue your cleave as you step through combat. You still can't continue the endless cleave with your normal movement. At level 6, Combat Step is always a free action. 2 - Combo After defeating an enemy with a melee attack, you get another Superior Attack that must be used before the end of your turn (doesn't work off-turn). Whenever you defeat another creature past the first in a round, get you an additional Combat Step that can be used as a free action. 4 - Hoard Breaker You can attack all group-type enemies normally and without penalty, and deal double damage to them. In addition, you cannot be flanked. 6 - Combo Drain \[healing] Defeating an enemy heals 3 hp. 8 - Aero Swing If you Smash Swing while in the air, you may spend all of your remaining movement to hover in place until the start of your next turn. You may use this to fly using your Combat Steps, should you defeat enemies in the air. 11 - Smashing You push your combat prowess to its absolute maximum in the heat of a combo. Superior Attacks deal maximum damage to opponents you struck with Smash Swing on the same turn.

entries.title: basic-bitch-fighter
entries.content: Basic Bitch Fighter For when you really don't want to think about complicated class features. 1 - Superior Stats You gain a bonus feat every level. Every time you gain a technique point, you can choose to instead turn it into a feat. You get access to the following feats, each of which can be taken any number of times. Ability Increase - Increase an ability score by +1 (up to +3) Super Strength - Increase strength by +1 (up to +5). Super Armor - Gain +1 AC and poise. Paladin Cosplay - Get a +1 bonus to saving throws. Superior Genetics - Get an additional major feature from your race

entries.title: bloody-finger
entries.content: 🩸 Bloody Finger Suddenly end fights with the power cause creatures to explode into bloody chunks long after you cut them with your blade. 1 - Bleed Them Out Any piercing or slashing weapon you wield gains the bleed property. Whenever you hit a creature with a bleed weapon (even if it does no damage), keep a running tally of how many times the creature was hit. This number is referred to as "bleed stacks" and is separate from other bleed effects. Crits apply 2 bleed stacks. Bleed stacks are visible on the creatures body and last until you rest. Even if a creature cannot bleed, it can still gain bleed stacks. 1 - Hemorrhage (Su) Sheathe your weapon(s) as a standard action. Creatures that have bleed stacks (no matter the distance) lose all stacks and take 2d6 (7) true damage. Creatures with 5+ stacks take 8d6 (28) true damage. Creatures with 10+ stacks take 16d6 (56) damage. This damage continues to double every 5 stacks infinitely. 1 - Bloodied Finger One of the bloody finger's fingers is always a crimson red. It can be used to write in a bloody ink. 1 - Weeb Training You can dual wield one handed weapons using dex or strength as long as the weapon has a Japanese name.\ If you wield a Japanese weapon in two hands, it applies 2 bleed stacks on hit, or 4 on a crit. 2 - Special Attack: Bloody Slash (Su) Make a thrown weapon attack with a held weapon without actually throwing it, instead throwing a sharp projectile shaped like your weapon. If dual wielding, throw one with each weapon. 4 - Invasion \[Sigil] You can inscribe your name, or a symbol of significance to you on a surface using your bloodied finger. When a creature triggers the sigil, you get a glimpse of the surrounding area briefly. Anytime it is triggered, you can choose to crawl out of the sigil as though you were summoning yourself, causing the sigil to disappear. You can stay summoned this way for 5 minutes before you return to your body. You cannot use this feature while you have summoning sickness. If you create a sigil while you already have one, the old one disappears. 4 - Rivers of Blood \[recharge] As a standard action, slash the air rapidly, causing many bloody projectiles to fly out in a 30 ft cone in front of you. Creatures in the area take 6d6 (21) slash or pierce damage and get 4 bleed stacks (reflex halves damage and bleed stacks). This ability recharges when you use your hemorrhage ability against a creature with 5 or more bleed stacks. 6 - Blood Scent Gain blind sense (scent 100 ft) against wounded creatures. Gain seeking against wounded creatures. 11 - Lord of Blood Whenever a creature takes bleed damage within 30 ft of you, they gain a bleed stack.

entries.title: dark-knight
entries.content: 👁️ Dark Knight Stand stalwart in the face of danger, an immovable obstacle that your opponents must fight tooth and nail to merely walk past, let alone survive. Outside of combat your massive skill bonuses can allow you to sense what others don't, and sniff out liars. Based on the Maplestory class of the same name. 1 - Evil Eye (Su) You can manifest an ominous looking eye that floats around you, enhancing your senses and giving you a palpable aura of menace. You get proficiency in intimidation and insight. You get a (4+½ lvl) bonus to perception, insight and intimidation. You also add this bonus to the DC to intimidate you. You can choose to make this eye disappear 1/turn as a free action, but you lose the bonuses to perception and intimidation. 1 - No Escape All effects that grant \[elusive] movement do not function against you while you wield a reach weapon, allowing you to make AoOs against a much larger number of creatures. If a creature tries to move around you safely using acrobatics while you wield a reach weapon, you add a bonus to your reflex save equal to the perception bonus granted by evil eye. 1 - Hyper Body You get a +4 bonus to fortitude saves.\ Your starting HP increases by 10. Each level after you gain an addition 4 hp. 2 - Stalwart You take half damage from fortitude saves. When you pass a fort save, it deals no damage and has no additional effect. 4 - Polearm Mastery You can make an infinite number of attacks of opportunity, and you have a +4 bonus on attacks made as an AoO. 8 - Special Attack: Impale (Su) You can leave behind a phantom weapon inside of your target on-hit. The creature is is unable to leave your natural reach and is anchored, making them unable teleport. This condition only ends if you are disarmed, dazed, stunned, you or the target are moved out of reach or you are defeated. You can use this special attack an infinite number of times, but if you impale a second creature, the first is freed. 11 - Hyper Army (Su) \[recharge] \[buff] As a standard action, you can inspire all allies that can see you, giving them (10+4\*the creature's lvl) additional current and maximum hp until they rest, or until you are defeated.

entries.title: flying-blade
entries.content: Flying Blade A slightly more supernatural eccentric fighter whose primary gimmick is flight. 1 - Who's Next? If you defeat an enemy and don't have enough speed to reach a new enemy, you can move until you threaten the next closest enemy. 1 - Full Attack You can make (remaining speed/30) additional superior attacks a turn.\ Basically, make an attack as a free action for every 30 feet you haven't used this turn. {% hint style="danger" %} You cannot use techniques after full attacking. If you dash, use an action that resembles dash, or if you use a technique during your turn, you cannot full attack. {% endhint %} 2 - Rush of Battle! During combat your speed increases by (30\*lvl-30), but you must always end your movement threatening an enemy.  If you ever end your turn not threatening any enemy for any reason, you receive a stacking 30 speed penalty each turn, to a minimum of your speed before this buff is taken into an account.\ You also become clumsy 1.

entries.title: full-attacker
entries.content: Full Attacker Feeling nostalgic about 3e, 3.5e or PF1e? Well here's me doing my best to recreate that experience in a slightly less heavy handed way than BB fighter. The fightiest guy is all about gaining insane amounts of movement speed and then using that speed to gain more actions. Woe to those who dare to stand in your face. 1 - Who's Next? If you defeat an enemy and don't have enough speed to reach a new enemy, you can move until you threaten the next closest enemy, unless your speed is 5 or less. 1 - Full Attack You can make an additional MELEE superior attack a turn by sacrificing 30 speed once per turn. At level 4 and 8, you can do so twice and thrice per turn respectively (potentially meaning 3 bonus superior attacks by sacrificing 90 speed). {% hint style="danger" %} You cannot use techniques or special attacks after full attacking. If you use a special attack or technique during your turn, you cannot full attack. {% endhint %} 1 - Fervor of Battle! During combat, your speed increases by 30 this level and another 5 every level after. You must always end your movement threatening an enemy. If you ever end your turn not threatening any enemy for any reason, you become clumsy 1. 2 - Talents Gain one of the following abilities at level 2, 4, 6, 8 and 10. Each one can be used in place of a superior attack and they all share a global cooldown, only able to be used 1/round. You cannot sacrifice superior attacks gained from baby slayer to use these abilities. 5 Steps Ahead \[elusive] - Prepare for an incoming attack. While preparing you can trigger this ability as an immediate action, moving up to 30 feet to the opposite side of a creature that affects you with a harmful effect. You get a +4 bonus to AC and saves against this effect. Random Bullshit Go - Throw a consumable item or something that is not designed to be thrown. A consumable item could be an alchemists fire, or troll oil. If it is a helpful item then it has its normal effect as if it were consumed or applied (assuming it can be done as a standard action or less). Something not designed to be thrown could be an improvised weapon, like a chair, or you could throw a cannon firing at an allied ship overboard. Action Surge - You can disengage, jump, aid, focus or make a combat maneuver. Brute Force - Roll an athletics check to move or break something. Impossible Advance (Su) -

entries.title: iron-knuckle
entries.content: Iron Knuckle Your armor is a second skin to you. Your armor is also your first skin. The iron knuckle has 2 "phases" to their battles. The first is a walking tank with multiple layers of armor, durable and stubborn until you get to the squishy single layer of plate armor underneath. The second is a nimble warrior that gets a boost of adrenaline, feeling light as a feather just after their outer shell is cracked open. Iron knuckles are practically invincible to being attacked head on while layered up, and must be ganged up on or their armor destroyed. Mages will find a much easier time breaking the outer layer Art (official Nintendo LoZ) 1 - Metallurgy You are fused with a set of standard metal plate armor. You can enhance this armor with new metals and enchantments with a more involved process. You are permanently treated as though you are wearing heavy armor. It is part of you and cannot be separated without causing extreme life-threatening damage to you. Because this armor is a part of you, it being destroyed hurts you. Whenever your armor is sundered it deals 10 true damage to you instead of its usual effects. Other effects that destroy/degrade armor can also do this. You add construct to your creature types. You gain proficiency in the profession (blacksmith) skill. 1 - Layer Up You can choose to put on an additional layer of heavy armor over the first, providing you with the following benefits after 1 minute of preparation. * +4 AC * You benefit from the Quake technique constantly While layered up you also take a -5 penalty to your speed and cannot fly or hover. Enemies can remove layer up by dealing damage that drops you below half hp. It takes 3 rounds to remove layer up manually. It requires a set of heavy armor in order to use layer up. When an enemy removes layer up, you cannot use that particular set of heavy armor to layer up again until you repair it. Be sure to pick it up after the battle! 1 - Light as a Feather After carrying the weight of incredibly heavy metal armor during the heat of battle, to have the burden removed suddenly fills the iron knuckle with new vigor. When an enemy removes layer up from you, you become light as a feather, gaining the following benefits. You gain (10+2\lvl) temp hp \[healing], potentially preventing you from dying from single instances of damage. You are set to 1 hp in such cases. * Your speed and jump distance increases by 10 until combat ends. * You can choose to be immediately effected by the Unbreakable Advance technique. * You gain access to the sudden strike special attack until combat ends. Special Attack: Sudden Strike - Advance 10 ft towards an enemy \[elusive] and make a melee attack. On hit the target is pushed back 5 feet and knocked down. On a graze the target is only pushed back 5 ft. Deals an additional d6/odd lvl damage. 1 - Metallicize Your armor shifts to steady your stance, and absorbs bits of metal from things you break. You recover 5 poise at the start of your turn. When you sunder metal equipment, or use athetics to break metal objects, recover 10 poise. This poise recovery cannot exceed your poise maximum. 2 - Bully You gain the power pose feat. When you use it, it deals 15 poise damage instead of 10. If you are layered up then you can use it as an instant action 1/turn. You can use power pose against AoOs an unlimited number of times as an instant action. You can choose if you want to leave a creature at 1 poise, or poise break them with this ability. If a creature is poise broken by this ability then they are made clumsy 2, or you can sunder the equipment used to attack. While light as a feather, when a creature misses you with an AoO, or you successfully use acrobatics to evade AoOs, you can make a bully attack as an instant action. 4 - Bull Rush If you are layered up, when you shove a creature, you can move with them to increase the shove distance by your remaining movement. While light as a feather, you gain powerful charge. 6 - Adrenaline If you are layered up then you are immune to fatigue. You gain the innate technique adrenaline burst while light as a feather. 8 - Invincible You are immune to attack rolls made by minions while layered up. Any minion that attacks you is instead set to 1 poise automatically as it bounces off of your metal body. While light as a feather, you gain resistance to damage from failed saving throws. If the ability has no effect other than damage, and does half damage on a passed save, you need not make a saving throw. 10 - Exoskeleton ??? 11 - Special Attack: Iron Wave \[healing] Strike at a foe, dealing an additional 6d6 (21) damage. If you are layered up, gain temp hp and poise equal to the total damage dealt. If light as a feather, also immediately layer up again until this temp hp is lost. This poise recovery cannot exceed your poise maximum.

entries.title: kazekenshin
entries.content: Kazekenshin Wind Swordsman are focused on being annoying and slippery with an incredibly powerful signature attack: Steel Tempest. Their abilities are centered around mobility to get into a better position to use this attack. 1 - Special Attack: Steel Tempest (Su) Once per round when you land a melee attack against a creature, gain a stack of gathering storm. With two stacks of gathering storm, you can use this special attack. This special attack can be used any number of times in a combat. Your attack whips up a whirlwind, targeting all enemies in a 60 ft line. Compare your attack roll to the ac of all creatures in the line. Those you hit are staggered for one round and take an additional d6/odd lvl damage. \ Attacks landed with this special attack do not generate gathering storm stacks. 1 - Flow \[healing] Keep a running tally of how far you move. Every time you move 60 ft, you gain (4+2\*lvl) temp hp. This temp hp lasts indefinitely. 1 - Sweeping Blade \[elusive] Once per creature per round, you can choose to dash in a straight line through a creature within reach as a free action, appearing directly on the opposite side of the creature. You can also choose to continue dashing in the same direction until you leave the creature's threatened zone. This movement doesn't count against your movement each round. You can combine sweeping blade with steel tempest, creating a new unique effect. You can either attack a 60 ft line as usual, or you can choose to attack a 10 ft radius around your destination. 2 - Wind Wall (Sp) \[recharge] You can innately cast Wind Wall. You can use wind wall as an immediate action, but its size is decreased to a 15x15 square, its duration changes to 1 round and its range decreases to reach. It does not impede you or your allies' movement or attacks. The penalty to ranged attacks also applies to the DC of any ability that must physically pass through the wall. It would not apply to a spell like charming gaze, but it would apply to a spell like bestial claw. You can only use this ability again after 1 minute passes. 4 - Ride the Wind You can use sweeping blade against a single target you attack with steel tempest. 6 - Already Dead (Su) \[teleportation] As an immediate action, you can teleport adjacent to any creature you can see within 30 feet that gets inflicted with a debilitating status effect (such stagger, poisoned, sickened) and make a simple attack against them. This ability must be used in response to the status being inflicted, it cannot be used against a creature that merely happened to be status'd. 8 - Last Breath Creatures hit by steel tempest are dazed for one round.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Fighter Men-at-arms clad in steel that use various fighting styles to achieve the same goal: destroy as many enemies as possible using overwhelming martial prowess. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art" %} Deadly Arsenal, Hearthstone Card Art {% endtab %} {% tab title="Basic Stats" %} Requires Archetype | HP (martial) | 20(+10 per level) | | ------------ | ----------------- | | Poise | 8 | | Skills | 2 | | Save | Fort | | Memory | 3+lvl | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} 1 - Technique Specialization (Martial) You gain 1 technique points at level 1, then another point every 2 levels after.\ These technique points can be used on any martial tree. Characters with martial specialization gain points in warfare equal to their highest tier of martial technique. 1 - Superior Attack Once per any turn where you're capable of taking the attack action, you can make a simple attack as a free action, or as an additional simple attack if you do take the attack action. 1 - Weapon Training Gain +2 to attack and DR 5 vs sunder and disarm. 1 - Armor Training Armors/shields require 2 less strength to use. You ignore the stealth penalty to heavy armor.\ Increase the value required to graze you by your level while you wear armor. At level 5, you are immune to being grazed. 1 - Physical Training Gain athletics as a skill with a +4 bonus. You can roll athletics to aid an ally as a swift action. 2 - Bravery +4 to saves vs \[fear] effects.
