entries.title: README
entries.content: Armor and Shields Armor does not decrease your speed. \ Gain poise equal to the armor bonus the armor gives.\ Heavy armor imposes a -2 penalty to stealth checks.\ Dex column decides how much dex you get to add to AC. If it has no value, your dex doesn’t add or subtract from your AC. If you do not meet the armor's strength requirement, your speed is reduced by 30 (minimum 5). ACDexWeightStr RequirementSQsLight1∞10 Medium4125+1 Heavy6 50+2DRA 1 Shields Shields do not passively give AC. Instead they give you poise and additional combat options. If you un-equip a shield, you immediately subtract the bonus poise it grants (min 1).  PoiseWeightStr RequirementSQsHeavy Shield515+0CM (Shove, Bully)Tower Shield1040+1CM (Shove, Bully)  ALL Shields Shields Up (Immediate) - Raise your shield. You gain resistance to any damage originating from a ranged attack roll until the start of your turn. Can be used on attacks targeting allies within reach instead, but ends if they leave your reach. \ Block (Immediate) - Decrease the bonus to an incoming attack by 2. If it grazes, it instead misses completely. Can be used on attacks targeting allies within reach. Multiple creatures can block the same attack. Tower Shields Tank Up (15 ft of movement) - Plant your shield to gain total cover from one particular direction. Essentially defends you from all attacks originating from a cone in that direction. A creature within 5 feet of you behind your shield gains cover, but only from a direct line. On subsequent turns reduce your movement by 15 to maintain this.\ You can choose to attack from behind the shield, but it gives cover instead of total cover.\ Using other shield abilities ends tank up.\ You can only use tank up once per turn, forcing you to stick to a particular direction.\ You cannot tank up in the same turn you charge.\ Blast Shield (Immediate) - When you fail a reflex save, gain resistance to the damage taken.

entries.title: the-buckler
entries.content: The Buckler Buckler Buckler doesn't count as a shield and doesn't provide any passive defensive bonuses. Instead you get access to the parry ability. You can still interact with objects with a buckler on hand, but bucklers cannot be used if the hand is occupied. Parry (standard) - Prepare yourself for an incoming attack. When you are attacked, you can choose whether or not to parry it. If you do, roll an attack as an instant action. If your attack roll is higher, the attack is negated.\ You can decide to parry an attack after the result of the roll is revealed.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 🪨 Rocks It's not a boulder, it's a rock! Rocks are the premier transportation and shipping vehicles in the world of Nack. They are incredibly fast, cheap and can plop down anywhere and look natural because they're rocks. Rocks are construct creatures that have their programming optimized for navigation and high speed transportation. More details in the stats subsection. Pricing A standard rock costs 1,500g. If you would only like to rent one, you are typically limited to predesignated paths, such as state roads. It costs 10g for short trips within 600 miles, 30g for something between 2-6 days and 80g+ for anything longer. Prices for augments are included below. Using augmented rocks multiplies adds 50g to the price to rent them, with particularly expensive ones being even more expensive or unavailable for most customers. If the rock is lost, destroyed or damaged, the owner/company that provided the service expects compensation for replacements/repairs. Augments All prices listed are in addition to the base 1,500g price. Offroad - 2,000g\ Capable of traversing a specific type of terrain, such as forest regions, snow etc. Each sold separately. Climbing/Swimming - 1,000g\ Rock is capable of using its full speed while climbing or swimming. Each sold separately. Armored Plating - 10,000g\ Adds +5 ac, +5 to all saving throws, +10 poise and +20 hp. Flight - 60,000g\ Rock is capable of using its full speed while flying.

entries.title: rock-stats
entries.content: 🪨 Rock Stats Level 0 Construct (+0 init) Defense Traits AC 10\ HP 20\ Poise 15\ Fort +0, Refl +0, Will +0 Offense Traits (DC 10) None Weaknesses/Deep Lore Vehicle - Standard rocks are streamlined to be useful as transportation and shipping vehicles, but leave a lot to be desired in terms of their combat capabilities. If attacked, a rock is helpless to stop its attacker aside from running away. As such, rocks must be kept away from danger. Other Traits Ability Scores - Str +0, Dex +0, Lucc +0, Int -, Wis +0, Cha +0 Speed - 100 land, increases to 45mph out of combat.\ In ideal conditions, such as well-maintained roads, a rock can travel about 1000 miles a day, assuming it travels through the night, or 600 assuming it doesn't. These speeds are halved when moving through areas without well maintained roads, and reduced to 1/4 if you are traveling through wilderness with unwieldy terrain, such as snowy, sandy, mountainous or forested biomes. Some rocks come with specific terrains in mind and ignore such penalties. Camouflage - Wherever rocks are common (most places), it requires a DC 25 perception check to notice a rock is abnormal when it is not in use. A rock can hide any kinds of custom augmentations while camouflaged, including decorative additions like paint jobs. Autonomous - A rock is programmed to move towards specific well known destinations, in cardinal directions, or to move the path of least resistance towards a set of coordinates. If the rider wishes, there is also a driver's seat that allows them to more finely control the rock's movement. The autonomous driving controls leave a lot to be desired for sleeping passengers. You can get some sleep, but you do not gain the benefits of rest unless you stop to sleep. Seating/Storage - Rocks have compartments that can be easily hidden when not in use, both for seating and for storage. Standard rocks have seating to comfortably accommodate for 20 medium creatures. Such seating is protected from the elements via a weak magical barrier, capable of stopping small insects, wind and rain, but not arrows and swords.\ They can carry up to 5000 lbs in a compartment that is 8x8x8ft.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Goods and Services In order to adventure, you need to eat, sleep and relax after a hard day of getting munched on by wolves. These things are going to steadily eat into your wallet. This section is dedicated to quantifying these basic necessities. That being said, not all restaurants and inns are created equal. Some more expensive ones may have access to special types of services, or provide you with connections to a specific type of clientele for an enormous price hike. Food/Water It costs 25g a week to keep yourself fed. Certain features, like proficiency in the survival skill or the Hellion's dirt consumption can significantly decrease or eliminate this cost. 25 gold a week translates to \~110g a month or about \~1,300g a year. Lodging It costs 100g a week to keep a roof over your head, provided you don't already have a house and need to acquire rooms at inns or pay farmers to sleep in barns. Sleeping out in the wilderness costs nothing, but can bring dangers like weather, monsters, thieves and the like. If you already own a house, this cost is decreased to 50g a week. This represents upkeep for your house in the wilderness or upkeep, taxes or loan repayments for your house in a city. 100 gold a week translates to \~440g a month or about \~5,200g a year.\ 50 gold a week translates to \~220g a month or about \~2,600g a year. Supplies Adventuring/travel requires a lot of miscellaneous things, amounting to 25g a week. Adventuring requires many things. You need to keep your swords sharp, your fires lit, your tents and bedrolls without holes etc. You're also gonna need a lot of rope. What counts as "adventuring" doesn't necessarily require you be out in the wilderness and could just as easily involve you snooping around towns gathering info, harassing farmers and exploring haunted houses. As a benefit for paying for supplies, you need not write down many miscellaneous items on your character sheet as you or a party member are assumed to have such things. This usually means something like a hammer, rope, flint and steel etc. 25 gold a week translates to \~110g a month or about \~1,300g a year. Recovering from Afflictions A night at the tavern is usually enough to wash away your woes, getting rid of all T1 afflictions. This usually involves you blowing a good amount of money all at once, costing 100g. General recovery can refer to visiting amusement parks or eating out at a nice restaurant. Such activities must always be performed at some type of "for leisure" location. It doesn't necessarily need to be in a settlement, so it could also include remote locations like hot springs in a mountain.  Higher tiers of afflictions will likely require a specialist and a large degree of time. The cost for these services is tied to how long it takes to heal, using the economics chart to determine cost. Some afflictions require very specific treatment that might not be generally available. Transportation Speed is usually the name of the game, but might not always be available. Because of the variety in transportation, it is its own subsection. A creature with 30 speed traveling on foot can travel 30 miles a day on a road, 24 miles a day in wilderness or 15 miles a day in dense/difficult terrain like snow, mountains and jungle. Judge overall travel speed based on the weakest link.

entries.title: teleportation
entries.content: Teleportation A teleportation circle is an undertaking that requires a great deal of upkeep to maintain, with skillful mages on call for when things go wrong. Only the most rich and powerful nations have access to a teleportation circle, and only in their capital. The number of teleportation circles in a world typically does no exceed a dozen. That being said, the process of teleportation between circles is usually an easy, painless and routine task. Teleportation between these circles costs 100g and typically only takes a few minutes of waiting in line. Certain restrictions may be in place during times of war and strife preventing teleportation while they last.

entries.title: bandage
entries.content: Bandage Expensive (5,000g) This badge is meant to resemble bandages, but when the wearer is afflicted with a bleed effect, it automatically negates it. This has a 1 minute cooldown.

entries.title: bull-goat
entries.content: Bull-Goat Expensive (20,000g) This tiny ram icon can be affixed to any piece of medium or heavy armor, increasing your poise by 5.

entries.title: bullseye
entries.content: Bullseye Expensive (5,000g) This badge literally puts a target on you. Any ranged attacks directed at allies within 5 ft of you are instead directed at you.

entries.title: peace
entries.content: Peace Expensive (5,000g) This badge is a symbol of peace. If you perform no action on your turn in combat, you are affected as per sanctuary until the start of your next turn. This has a 1 minute cooldown.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Baubles Baubles are little badges, icons, talismans and whatnot that you affix to your person, providing you with a passive bonus. You can only have one bauble.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Wand, Standard 2,000g (DC 12) This piece of enchanted wood is infused with mana from those adept at magic casting, allowing you to channel their experience through it. While wielding a wand, you can increase the CL of a spell you cast by 1 as a swift action. A wand comes with a cantrip that you can innately cast while you wield it.

entries.title: wand-enhanced
entries.content: Wand, Enhanced 5,000g (DC 15) This piece of enchanted wood is infused with mana from those adept at magic casting, allowing you to channel their experience through it. While wielding a wand, you can increase the CL of a spell you cast by 1 as a swift action. An enhanced wand, in additional to casting a cantrip, allows you to innately cast a tier 1 technique 1/day.

entries.title: banner-of-doom
entries.content: Banner of Doom 7,000g (DC 15) This flag is inscribed with symbols of fiends, prominent criminal organizations or evil mages. Those that exist within 30 ft of the banner while it is planted (a standard action) hear whispers from it, causing them to become shaken 1, unless they are allied with the group the banner's iconography showcases. This has no effect on creatures that are already shaken. If the creature was not already shaken when it entered the area and it leaves the area, the shaken the banner inflicts immediately dissipates as the whispers vanish. A creature can roll a DC 15 athletics check to push the banner over.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Interesting Items

entries.title: seal-standard
entries.content: Seal, Standard 2,000g (DC 12) A seal is a vague title given to an item of significance to channel magic power through. For more information see seals. Seals are typically attuned to a specific type of magic, such as Brazzeria or Pyromancy, allowing you to cast spells of that tree with +1 CL.

entries.title: summoning-contract
entries.content: Summoning Contract Price Varies, See Details Below Summoning contracts are written in order for a creature to provide aid to another without following them around all the time. There are always 2 parties involved in a contract: the summoner and the summoned. Typically it is up to the summoner to convince the summoned to sign the contract, as the magic does not work with unwilling creatures. It is possible to find summoning contracts with a signature from a summoned creature, but not a summoner. Contracts are often temporary, being lifted after a certain number of summons, or after a specific task is complete. When the summoned creature signs the contract in blood, so to must the summoner. The summoned creature takes up a \[companion] slot while summoned. 1/day as a FRA, you can summon the contracted creature. Creatures summoned in this way always have a pseudo-ethereal translucent quality to them that is easily identifiable (DC 10 arcana). A summon typically only lasts a minute, but can last up to an hour if the summoned creature accepts summoning sickness. The creature also gains summoning sickness if it drops to 0 hp while summoned. Summoning Sickness - A specific type of ailment that occurs as a result of a summoned creature pushing themselves too hard while summoned from a summoning contract, usually by sticking around for too long or being defeated. The creature is drained 2 and cannot be summoned for two weeks, even if the drain is removed. In most aspects, a summoned creature functions exactly as they would if you were fighting by their side in their actual body, with a few key differences. As a magical effect, they can be dispelled (DC 12+summoned creatures lvl). They have all of their gear and any resources that they expend (such as potions) while summoned are still expended when they return to their body. Summoned creatures only have 50% of their max hp. To the summoned creature, when you attempt to summon them, they receive a mental message from their summoner no longer than 2 sentences. They can choose to deny being summoned if they pass a will save (your class DC). If they succeed, they can send 2 sentences back. Otherwise, they enter a trance like state and their spirit leaves their body and appears next to you. If their body takes damage, or is otherwise harmed, then their spirit immediately winks out of existence. A summoned creature can dismiss itself as a standard action. A creature can only be summoned once per day. The more powerful a creature is, the more expensive it is to bind them to a summoning contract. 1,000\*(1+summoned creatures lvl)^2 | Creatures Level | Contract Cost | | --------------- | ------------- | | 1 | 4,000 | | 2 | 9,000 | | 3 | 16,000 | | … | | | 12 | 169,000 |  If the contract has a limit on uses, adjust price as below. | # of Summons | Price Adjustment | | ------------ | ---------------- | | 3 | -50% | | 1 | -66% | If the contract has stipulations that limit when the creature can be summoned, halve the cost again. (only summon vs fiends)  Ex. Level 1 creature, limited use cases, 3 times. 1,000g.

entries.title: tracking-device
entries.content: Tracking Device 2,000g (DC 13 engineering) This tiny device is about the size of a peanut and resonates with psionic energy. You can attune to it by concentrating on it while in contact with it for 1 minute, provided you don't have negative intelligence. More importantly, it can fit inside of a creature's body. With engineering or medicine proficiency, you can implant this device into a creature. The process is painful and obvious, so it can usually only be done on knocked out creatures.  While implanted, you can know the general direction and distance of any tracking device you have attuned to. Each tracking device has a slightly different signal, allowing you to tell which one is which, provided you have the mental capacity to do so. You can be attuned to (1+int) tracking devices at once. If the creature ever receives medical examination, a DC 20 medicine check also reveals a strange bump, or an unusual ache that indicates where the tracking device is, and it can be removed.

entries.title: amplifying-staff
entries.content: Amplifying Staff 2,000g (DC 12) Favored by bards, this light staff shimmers in the light. If you hold it up to your mouth, it doubles the volume of any vocalizations. By spending a swift action to increase the mana cost of any ability with the \[healing] tag by 1 (or adding a mana cost of 1), you can increase its range by 10 feet, or its radius by 5 ft. Manathirst 12\ The range/radius extension can be done as a free action. Manathirst 22\ The range/radius extension no longer requires mana. It is a 1h crush weapon.\ Also comes in a battle staff and light variant, like most staves.

entries.title: anal-probe
entries.content: Anal Probe 3,000g (DC 14 Engineering) This baton looks unimpressive until you press a button on its side to coat it in a strange liquid and electrify it as a swift action. It can remain electrified for 1 minute before it must recharge for 5. When you thrust it, it seems to magnetize to the target's orifices. It is a 1h light club. When electrified it instead deals 2d6 zap dmg. It also gains a special attack. Special Attack: Terrestrial Exploration\ Shove the probe in whatever hole the creature is most uncomfortable with. They are clumsy 2 on-hit.

entries.title: benevolent-blade
entries.content: Benevolent Blade 1,200g (DC 11) This silver sword has a hilt that shines a radiant gold. This weapon is used to non-lethally dispatch creatures when defeating them since it has no chance of potentially killing them. Special Attack: Lifesteal \[healing]\ On hit heal (2+lvl). Manathirst 7\ Special Attack: Benevolence \[healing]\ Strike at an ally as the blade transforms into a warming radiance. It grants the attacks damage as temp hp and has no harmful on hit effects. The sword is a 1h slash or pierce weapon with the one and done property.

entries.title: boring-blade
entries.content: Boring Blade 200,000g (DC 25) This mundane sword shows its true power only when the user does not use any fancy shmancy techniques with it. If fact, the sword appears to "activate" glowing with power for a minute when using a technique, but counter intuitively, this is how the sword appears when it deactivates. As long as you have not used a technique in the last minute, it is treated as though it has every special weapon property seen in the weapon rules page, with the exception of reach and ranged weapon properties. It has conceal, bleed, etc. You can use every special attack that doesn't have a specific weapon requirement. Boring blade has 3 enchantment slots. The sword is a light pierce weapon with the chink magnet and the attached property.

entries.title: demons-grasp
entries.content: Demon's Grasp 1,000g (DC 11) This green metallic gauntlet has its fingers honed at the tip like claws. Imprinted on the back of its "hand" is inscribed a slur written in infernal against fiends. It is exceptionally good at capturing the attention of fiends. When attacking with fiendish allies, they are all taunted by the target of your attack on-hit. Fiends you grapple are automatically taunted by you. Manathirst 12\ When fighting a fiend, every attack with this weapon taunts on-hit for 1 round (will negates).\ Allied fiends get a +2 bonus to attack against any creature you attack with Demons Grasp for 1 turn. The gauntlet is a light slash weapon with the attached and CM (grapple) qualities.

entries.title: elemental-staff
entries.content: Elemental Staff 2000g (DC 12) This staff has a mana crystal affixed to its end, shimmering with a color that indicates the type of element it favors. All spells with the elemental tag shared by the staff get +1 CL. 1/day it can reduce the mana cost of such a spell by 1. Manathirst 12\ 1/day you can spend 1 mana to change the elemental damage type of the spell to the stave's elemental affinity. The standard staff is a 1h crush weapon.\ Also comes in a battle staff and light variant, like most staves.

entries.title: fiery-war-axe
entries.content: Fiery War Axe 5000g (DC 14) Favored by veteran fighters, this axe is the color of obsidian, with a blade that looks white hot. When pointing the weapon at any creature that is considered a minion to you, it ignites in flames. Against any such foe, the axe deals an additional d10 fire damage. The axe is a 1h slash weapon with the one and done property.

entries.title: garish-gavel
entries.content: Garish Gavel 4000g (DC 13) This hammer is bejeweled all along its head and has a finish to its wooden handle that makes it sparkle. When you strike it against a solid surface, it is exceptionally loud, even with only a light tap. Everyone can't help but look upon he who slams the gavel. Special Attack: ORDER - Must be directed at a solid object instead of a creature. \ Taunt all creatures within 30 ft for 1 round. The hammer is a 1h crush weapon the one and done and dueling properties.

entries.title: heavy-metal
entries.content: Heavy Metal Expensive (4000g) This oversized guitar is made almost entirely out of iron with chrome plating. It weighs 50 lbs and is hilariously impractical as an instrument. In order to even properly play the guitar, the wielder must possess at least +1 Str. It has the following special attack. Instrumental Destruction - \ Whack someone with Heavy Metal so hard it breaks and becomes unusable, dealing an additional 2d6 (7) sonic damage. The mana cost of the next technique you use this turn is decreased by your strength score.  You must \[mana burn] 1 as a FRA to repair it so it can be played/wielded again. The guitar functions as a large hammer-esque 2h crush weapon with the meteor swing special attack and the CM (sunder) quality.

entries.title: hunters-rifle
entries.content: Hunter's Rifle 6,000g (DC 14) This gun has a barrel that grows to comically large size at its tip. You get a +4 bonus on survival checks to track any creature you have hit or grazed with this weapon in the last week. Special Attack: My Brand - On hit apply a brand to a creature, physically marking them. You and your companion creatures attacks do an additional d6 damage until the end of your next turn. The gun functions 2h rifle (see exotic weapons).

entries.title: icebreaker
entries.content: Icebreaker 1,500g (DC 11) This mace is a cool blue color and, when wielded, the air around is visibly chilled as though it was exhaling on a cold day. It excels at crushing ice, and can easily smash through any type of icey barrier less than 1ft thick. Anything thicker becomes something of a mining operation. If a creature is frosty, or otherwise mostly made of ice, the mace does an additional 5 damage and makes it clumsy 1 on-hit. \ It has the following special attack... Rime Time - \ Make a swipe at the air and target a 30 ft cone. All creatures in the area take 2d6+lvl (7+lvl) cold damage and are made frosty (reflex halves and negates frosty). The mace is a 1h crush weapon with the CM (Sunder) and one and done properties.

entries.title: likkem
entries.content: Likk'em 2000g (DC 12) This staff has a smug frog carved into the tip of it. Its eyeballs are wheels with numbers inscribed on them from 0 to 9. Whenever you defeat a creature with a melee attack using this staff, or a spell cast using this staff, the staffs eyes start spinning, stopping when they reach how much damage you overkilled the target. If you did exactly enough damage to defeat the creature and the eyes stop on zero, it plays a frog croaking sound and you gain a luck dice. By spending a luck dice, you can innately cast Lucky Star The standard staff is a 1h crush weapon.

entries.title: nosey-knife
entries.content: Nosey Knife 4,000g (DC 14) This knife makes the wielder feel uneasy, like it knows what its thinking. Whenever you crit a DD creature, the knife randomly chooses a technique the creature knows to memorize, up to your highest tier technique known. While you wield the knife, you also have that technique memorized. The knife has a will of its own, and will memorize new techniques if you keep critting whether you want it to or not. The knife is a light pierce weapon with the conceal and chink magnet property.

entries.title: ogre-club
entries.content: Ogre Club 500g (DC 11) This club has metal plates at its end, each face inscribed with magic sigils to enhance this heavy weapons power. Unfortunately, ogres' propensity for randomness creates a different definition of power than most. While the you are threatening multiple enemies, you get a +2 bonus to attack, but you decide which enemy you attack randomly among all creatures you threaten. The club is a 2h crush weapon with bewildering blow special attack and the easily repaired quality.

entries.title: ogrelords-whip
entries.content: Ogrelord's Whip 2,000g (DC 12) Unlike the standard whip, this whip is capable of threatening, but only your allies. When you make an AoO against an ally, it always does 5 slashing damage and increases their speed by 20 this round. You also gain a charge, up to 3. Each charge you can spend as an free action to increase the bonus of your next attack by +2 (max +6). Charges are lost when you roll initiative. See whip in exotic weapons for more details.

entries.title: orcish-hammer
entries.content: Orcish Hammer 5,000g (DC 14) This hammer is infused with the power of the wind itself by orcish shamans. It feels practically weightless while you swing it through air, despite its otherwise unwieldy size. Its wielder can innately cast storm stomp 1/day. The wielder also gains this special attack... Windfury -\ Attack twice in rapid succession, applying DR only once. The hammer is a 1h crush weapon with the strings attached and one-and done quality.

entries.title: quaking-hammer
entries.content: Quaking Hammer Expensive (4,000g) This hammer makes the ground shake when it strikes the ground. When a creature disarms you of this weapon, it smashes into the ground at their feet, letting you make a topple attack as an instant action. Special Attack: Fissure - Strike the ground to attack all creatures in a 30 ft line. Compare your attack to every creature's AC in the AoE. If you spend 3 mana, you can make the 30 ft line 15 ft wide. Manathirst 12\ Fissure deals an additional 2d6 (7) damage and always does the enhanced version. Manathirst 22\ Fissure staggers targets on hit. The hammer is a 1h crush weapon with the CM (topple) and one and done properties.

entries.title: ray-gun
entries.content: Ray Gun 10,000g (DC 17 Engineering) This pistol looks like a child's toy, made of colorful plastic with superfluous details. Pulling the trigger reveals otherwise. It blasts rays of pure energy, dealing force damage instead of a pistol's usual damage. It does not need to be reloaded, but it can only fire 5 times per day. Special Attack: Pack a Punch\ Creatures within 5 ft of the original target take 2d6 (7) force damage and poise damage. If this poise breaks a creature, it is knocked down. Functions as a pistol.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Unique/Magic Weapons A category for things you make attacks with. Includes staves, swords and bows alike. I'm not opposed to changing some of the details of many of these weapons, like making them 2h weapons/light weapons. Or changing their qualities if you're a grapple focused build to give it CM (grapple) instead of one of its default properties.

entries.title: rusty-sword
entries.content: Rusty Sword 4,000g (DC 14) This curved iron sword looks as though the black iron exterior could peel off at any moment and is covered with patches of rust. It has a -2 penalty to damage. When used to cut down creatures that can bleed, it changes. The iron in the blood repairs the weapon and then some. Each time you successfully strike a foe, the rust fades and the blade sharpens, adding +1 damage, up to 4 times for a total of +2 bonus damage. The sword is a 2h slash weapon that has the bleed and easily repaired property.

entries.title: scrappy-swordfish
entries.content: Scrappy Swordfish 8,000g (DC 16 Nature)  This fish was subject to a magical ritual akin to taxidermy after all of the useful parts were removed. The fish is a bit small for its kind, but it is certainly as sharp. It remains rigid even when clashing with metal swords. 1/day you can say a brief prayer to Mother Earth as a swift action and the fish briefly springs back to life. It immediately readies to parry, allowing you to decide which attack to deflect during the next round of combat.  If you worship Mother Earth, you can use a point of prayer to parry with this weapon. The fish is a 1h pierce weapon with the CM (disarm) and one and done properties. Despite being gutted and undersized, the fish is still rather heavy and weighs 20 lbs.

entries.title: soul-eater
entries.content: Soul Eater 22,000g (DC 20) This black great sword has a red mana crystal in the shape of an eye affixed to its hilt. Any who hold the blade in their hands can feel its blood lust. While wielding this blade, the wielder has weakness 3 to all damage, but reduces the mana cost of all techniques by 1. This effect cannot prevent mana burn. The wielder gets a +2 bonus to attack with this weapon. The Soul Eater can be enchanted 3 times. It is a 2h slash weapon with the bleed and easy repair properties.

entries.title: spirit-claws
entries.content: Spirit Claws 100g (DC 10) These gauntlets have a faint blue glow to them. As a free action while your hands are free, you can clench your fists and cause a pair of glowing blue spectral claws to appear over them. The claws deal d6 slashing damage.

entries.title: sticky-spear
entries.content: Sticky Spear 3,000g (DC 13 Alchemy or Nature) This long, pointed piece of wood is covered in a sticky sap. The wielder cannot change weapons using the swapping gear action without first spending a standard action to attach it to another object and pulling it off. \ However the spear is very fickle. Whenever you disarm a creature, it leaves you behind and hops directly into your targets open hand. It is a 2h pierce weapon with the reach, CM (disarm) and attached properties.

entries.title: supercharged-sword
entries.content: Supercharged Sword 8,000g (DC 16) This unassuming short sword hums with electricity. It is slightly magnetic, almost as if it wants weapons to hit it. Sunder attacks made against this weapon receive a +10 bonus. When sundered, it zaps the sundering creature for 2d6+lvl (7+lvl) zap damage. The sword comes with the elemental (zap) enchantment baked into it, and can be enchanted again. The sword can also be used as the spell focus for any spell with the \[zap] tag. Manathirst 12\ Sunder attacks made by enemies that threaten you always target this weapon, even if they target other creatures or pieces of equipment. It is a 1h slash weapon with the easily repaired property.

entries.title: wheel-of-momentum
entries.content: Wheel of Momentum Expensive (9,000g) This strange item is a large shield-like weapon with glowing blades along its edges that constantly circle the outside of the weapon. Because of this motion, it is ill-fitted to be used for defense. Every time the user misses an attack roll with it, the blades circle faster and glow more vibrantly, giving the wielder +1 attack that stacks with each miss. Once you land an attack, the speed resets back to default, removing the attack bonus. This stacking effect cannot be used outside of combat. It is a 1h slash weapon with the one and done and attached property.

entries.title: magic-weapon-properties
entries.content: Magic Weapon Properties These properties can be attached to most weapons. Classes like fighter and magus can add these properties to their weapon temporarily. A weapon can typically only be enchanted with one of these properties.\ Such enchantments cost 5,000 gold. Bane+2 att/dmg vs a specific creature type (plant, giant, etc).Feels strange to hold a weapon baned against your creature typeBenevolentIncrease the bonus of the aid action by +2 while in combat while wielding this weapon (doesn't stack with itself).DivingThis weapon doesn't have reduced effectiveness when used underwater.ElementalWeapon can swap between its usual damage and a specific type of elemental damage (determined on creation) as a free action 1/turn.FortuitousOnce per round, when the wielder of a fortuitous weapon hits with an attack of opportunity, they can make a second attack of opportunity with this weapon against that foe at a –5 penalty.Ghost TouchWeapon treats incorporeal creatures as corporealGroundingWeapon attacks against flying creatures inflict grounded for 1 round (fort negates)HemorrhagingWeapon gains the bleed property.ImperviousDR 10 vs ALL sunder, not just against the enchanted itemInvigoratingWhen you defeat a creature with this weapon, you lose the fatigued condition. If you are not fatigued, get +10 speed this turn.LockingOn hit you can lock the weapon in place, entangling the creature struck (reflex negates). While entangling a creature, you cannot use the weapon.MimeticWeapon attacks against a creature allows the wielder to copy one of the creatures elemental resistances for one round. You can only have one copied resistance at a time. On hit the wielder has an intuitive sense the creature is resistant to, allowing them to choose.Phase LockingOn hit apply anchored for 1 round. Anchored creatures cannot use teleportation effects.RadiantThe weapon is constantly emitting light as per the Radiance spell.ReturningAs a free action, you can call your weapon back to your hand. If it is within 60 feet of you it returns instantly. Anything beyond requires 3 rounds. If there are any physical barriers preventing its return, this does not work.If a creature possesses the weapon (reflex negates).SeekingWeapon attacks ignore partial concealment, total concealment and other forms of miss chance created by the environment or magic.Summon BaneFunctions as bane, but against summoned creatures.StickyDR 10 vs ALL disarm, not just against the enchanted itemTransformativeAs a swift action you can change your weapon into another type of weapon of any type (sword>gun>dagger etc).You can use this to give new special attacks based on damage type, but not special attacks that normally require weapon points like determination.Vicious+2 dmg. On hit the wielder takes 2 true damage.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Magic Items Some magic items have a scaling component to them called Manathirst, growing more powerful when in the hands of someone who is more powerful. Manathirst features are unlocked when you have 12 and 22 max mana, typically kicking in at level 5 and 10.

entries.title: lead-architecture
entries.content: Lead Architecture Varies Lead structures are the most expensive, but most effective way of making sure an area is safe from scrying. This is done by lining the building materials with layers of lead during construction, or as a later add on. Scrying attempts inside of lead structures always fail. Even going near the structure causes scrying magic to be faulty, obscuring the senses. A singular room costs 25,000g An average home costs 60,000g Large or complex structures such as prisons, dungeons or palaces have a starting price of 150,000g, which can easily increase based off the scale of the project.

entries.title: lead-container
entries.content: Lead Container Varies Lead containers are mostly made of other metals like iron, steel, or for the particularly paranoid, adamantine. There is a layer of lead that prevents divinations of the container entirely. To anybody scrying on the area, the container (and its content) is completely invisible. A small container for handheld items like books, the family jewels or light weapons costs 2,000g A medium container for sizable items like great weapons, or your rock collection costs 5,000g A larger container for very large items like humanoid bodies or golden toilets or costs 12,000g {% hint style="warning" %} Care must be taken when dealing with lead containers. There are methods of detecting lead and it usually indicates somebody has something to hide. In addition, if you place objects on a lead container, one could infer the location of something important since they would appear to be floating in midair while scrying. {% endhint %}

entries.title: lead-paint
entries.content: Lead Paint 100g per bucket Lead paint is the most convenient and cost effective way method of preventing scrying from would be spies over large areas. However it is a much more temporary solution. The high concentration of lead in the paint, as well as the additional binding agents, causes the paint to peel much more often and release a toxic gas that can cause problems over time. This requires a monthly cleaning and reapplication to maintain the anti-divination properties. A bucket of paint can cover the average sized room. Larger rooms with high roofs require many buckets. Buckets of paint are typically used for smaller private meeting rooms.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Lead Price Varies Lead seems like an unusual item to catalogue, but it has unique properties that make it desirable despite its drawbacks. Lead has the unique property of interfering with \[scrying] effects. Lead paint is the most convenient method of preventing scrying from would be spies, but it can also be used in other clever ways. For example if you have a treasured item you don't want a spy to see, you can use a metal box lined with lead to cause it to appear invisible to any \[scrying] effects. Particularly rich and paranoid creatures, like wizards an beholders hoard lead in order to cover their entire lairs in it. It only takes a very thin sheet of lead that mostly covers an area to veil it from these pesky divinations. There are various security measures available for sale.

entries.title: dragon-weapon-special-attacks
entries.content: Dragon Weapon Special Attacks Sever - This attack gains +2 attack. On-hit sever the connection a creature has to their deity. Any abilities related to prayer they cannot use until they rest. Similar abilities that rely on divine power like Smite are unaffected.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 🐉 Dragon Metal 100,000g per item Dragon Metal is often referred to by what its made into rather than as a material more often than not; Something like "dragon plate armor" or "dragon greatsword." It is made by combining a rare form of jewel, called dragonstone, with steel. When in the presence of a dragon, the dragonstone absorbs bits of expended mana over time and change color to match the color of the dragon's scales. The dragon metal that is created by this often superficially resembles the dragon whom the dragonstone absorbed its power.  When dragon metal is made into a weapon, the weapon has a +2 flat bonus to damage. They also get a bonus special attack, selected from the attached list. When dragon metal is made into a set of medium or heavy armor, it gives a +1 bonus to AC. It also gives resistance to an elemental damage type, based on the dragonstone used in its crafting, defaulting to fire. For light armor see dragonhide.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Materials

entries.title: caltrops
entries.content: Caltrops 500g Caltrops are small pointy objects designed to harm creatures that walk through areas where they are deployed. Every space a creature moves through occupied by caltrops, they take 2 piercing damage and start bleeding for 2 damage. A creature can avoid this damage by treating it as difficult terrain. 500g is the price attached to the package of caltrops that can be deployed immediately as a standard action. Treat it as a thrown weapon to determine the distance you can throw it. All spaces within 5 ft of its landing point are covered in these pointy bits. If deployed beforehand carefully over 1 minute, a similar package can cover a 10 ft radius. Caltrops can be swept up in the AoE of many effects, such as aqueous orb, causing them to be rendered ineffective.

entries.title: holy-water
entries.content: Holy Water 100g Holy water is an item that is regularly created by churches and sold to commoners as a form of protection against the profane. Many fiends and undead have an aversion to this substance, and can often cure diseases inflicted by them and prevent some of their supernatural abilities. The most common use of holy water is as a weapon. You can throw a small bottle of it as a thrown weapon. It deals 2d6 (7) holy damage on hit. Many uses of holy water require its direct application, such as on wounds inflicted by the profane, or directly on the remains of the profane to put their spirits to rest.

entries.title: property
entries.content: Property Varies Property is synonymous with land, and everything on it. Property can include facilities, homes or it can just look pretty. The price of property changes based on a few factors: Size, buildings, appearance, location and the overall state its in can influence its price. Small bits of land with little intrinsic value generally go pretty cheap. You can buy an acre of unworked "wild land" for 10,000g Premium land, such as places that could be good spots for attractions or farmland are a bit more expensive. You can buy an acre of premium land for 50,000g A small home that can comfortably fit a single person costs 10,000g An average home that can comfortably fit a family costs 25,000g A luxurious home, like a mansion with many rooms for family and guests, leisure rooms for toys and sports and large outdoor yards costs 100,000g Large or complex structures such as prisons, dungeons or palaces have a starting price of 250,000g, which can easily increase based off the contents.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Mundane Items Things that you can usually buy in many locations around the world with the correct vendor in town. Many have real life analogues.

entries.title: tools
entries.content: Tools 80g Tools typically come in sets catered to a specific task, such as fishing, lockpicking or medicine. Some tasks require the use of tools, others only give a penalty if you don't have tools. Tools also come in a masterwork variety, giving the user a +2 bonus on the skill in question. The price is increased to 800g. {% hint style="danger" %} Not all tasks have tools, and therefore are not suitable for acquiring masterwork variants to them. Skills like medicine, alchemy and profession use tools. Skills like stealth, perception and persuasion do not.\ Some types of tools might be able to aid you with novel types of tasks, such as using a spyglass to roll perception long distances, but should not give any types of flat bonuses. {% endhint %} Tool kits weigh 10 lbs. Some tasks, such as smithing, require even more advanced tools you can't carry around like a forge.

entries.title: torch
entries.content: Torch 20g Torches are sticks wrapped with some type of cloth, chemical or vegetable matter that is flammable. Torches give off bright light in a 20 ft radius around them, and dim light 20 ft past that.  They can stay lit for up to 2 hours. Lighting and dimming a torch repeatedly can significantly decrease the amount of time they stay lit. If a torch ends up getting wet, it becomes unusable. If a torch ends up clattering to the ground from being knocked over or disarmed, roll a DC 10 luck check to see if it goes out, using the luckiest fellow benefiting from it in the vicinity if it was not wielded by anybody in specific.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Special Attacks {% hint style="warning" %} All weapons come with some of these special attacks, based on the damage type they deal, or their weapon type (ranged, melee, shield etc).  {% endhint %} Special attacks by default recharge after being out of combat for 1 minute. You can swap weapons to gain more special attacks, but you cannot use special attacks with the same name more than once in the same combat. Most special attacks require a melee attack, unless the weapon is ranged. The ALL in these subcategories refer to only manufactured weapons, not natural attacks and unarmed strikes.  All Slash Melee Special Attack: Lacerate - On the hits apply d6 bleed damage for 2 turns (fort negates)\ Special Attack: Cleave - Attack two separate creatures you threaten from your current position.  All crush melee Special Attack: Concussive Strike - On hit apply clumsy 1.\ Special Attack: Backbreaker - Deal 10 poise damage on-hit. All Pierce Melee Special Attack: Lunge - Increase your reach by 5 ft for this attack and all others made this turn\ Special Attack: Pierce Defense - Ignore DR. If your opponent uses an immediate or instant action in response to this attack, gain +4 attack. All Ranged Special Attack: Maim - On hit reduce the creature's speed by 15ft for one round (fort negates).\ Special Attack: Snipe - Ignore -2 penalty to attack for a long ranged shot All Shields Special Attack: Endure - Slam a target with your shield and continue to hold it up, focusing on them. Gain resistance to all damage from this target for 1 round, even if you miss.\ Special Attack: Shield Bash - Inflict clumsy 1 on hit.

entries.title: unique-special-attacks
entries.content: Unique Special Attacks This section is dedicated to helping you fill in the "special attack" portion of your weapon, or for giving unique weapons special abilities. See the "special attacks" section for the special attacks weapons get by default. All Melee Special Attack: Determination - Focus your conviction. You get a +4 bonus and seeking to your next attack with this weapon. You can also choose to not attack at all with this special attack, granting your next attack with this weapon a +10 bonus instead.\ If you choose to delay this bonus, Determination does not consume your special attack next round. Special Attack: Stacking Strike - Make an attack. If this defeats the creature, stacking strike permanently gains 1 damage. Weapon specific, so you have to stack weapons individually. You cannot farm stacks passively and must gain them in combats you actually roll out. Special Attack: Bewildering Blow - On hit creature is confused for one round (will negates). Special Attack: Dispelling Strike - Roll an attack roll in place of a dispel check against a magical effect you can attack, including one on a creature. Special Attack: Meteor Swing - On hit your target is unable to make AoOs for 1 round. Special Attack: Ankle Slicer - On hit your target has -15 speed for 1 round. Special Attack: Lifesteal - On hit heal (2+level). Special Attack: Throat Slicer - On hit silence a creature for one round (fort negates). Special Attack: All In - On hit instead of rolling for damage, you deal maximum damage. If you graze, you instead miss entirely. When you miss, you take 20 poise damage. Weapon Specific The above special attacks can be generalized to any type of weapon. Even the "slicer" special attacks could be achieved just as effectively if you crushed a throat or foot. In general I try to be lax with what weapons you give your character so mechanics to not interfere with flavor. However, the following weapons will specify a type of weapon you lock into, and are incompatible with each other. Special Attack: Volley - Fire many shots at once, targeting a 15 ft cone in front of you. Compare your attack roll to all creatures in AoE. \ This requires a bow, which is a 2h ranged weapon without the reload property. Special Attack: Rapid Fire - Fire two shots in rapid succession at the same creature.\ This requires a bow, which is a 2h ranged weapon without the reload property. Special Attack: Wild Strike - Swing around a flail without concern for the consequences. Deal an additional 7 damage. If you miss or graze, you instead treat the attack as if you grazed yourself.\ This requires a flail, which is a 1h or 2h melee crush weapon. Special Attack: Hack n Smash - Perform a free sunder attack against an opponent's armor or shield.\ This requires a hammer, which is a 1h or 2h melee crush weapon. Special Attack: Outmaneuver - While not being flanked, move 5 ft \[elusive] and make a melee attack.\ This requires a polearm, which 2h melee reach weapon. Special Attack: Dig Deep - Embed your weapon into your foe punch it in further, making them clumsy 2. They can remove it as a standard action, or a swift action with medicine proficiency. You let go of the weapon as part of using this special attack.\ This requires a pick style weapon, which is a 1h or 2h melee pierce weapon. Special Attack: Execution - Finish them. Against a knocked down or grappled opponent, deal an additional 7 damage.\ This requires a heavy sword or axe style weapon, which is a 2h slashing weapon. Special Attack: Overrun - Move your opponent 5 ft in a direction that isn't towards you on hit.\ This requires a heavy ramming or hammer type weapon, which is a 2h crush weapon.

entries.title: exotic-weapons
entries.content: Exotic Weapons Inherently function differently than other weapons and require a more nuanced description to describe their functionality. These weapons get no additional weapon points to customize with. Staff - d8 crush, 1h (5 lbs, 150g) \- A well crafted stick either made with wood infused with magic, or has an object affixed to its end to channel magic power. Can be used to cast spells.\ \- Comes in a light variant (d6, 2 lbs , 120g) and a 2h battlestaff variant (2d6, 10 lbs, 200g)\ \- When you wield 2 staves, or have a staff and some other magical focus, you get a +1 boost to your CL Shield - d8 crush, 1h (15 lbs, 50g) \- A large chunk of wood or metal with handles on one side to affix to your arm. Can be used to make shield actions.\ \- Comes with the CM (shove) quality\ \- Gives 5 poise\ \- Also comes in a tower shield variant, giving additional shield actions and 10 poise. (40 lbs, 100g)\ More details in armor/shields section. Lance - 2d6 pierce, 2h, Reach (10 lbs, 500g) \- While mounted, a lance can be wielded in one-hand while still benefiting from 2h crit damage.\ Special Attack: Joust - When you make this attack while mounted and during a charge, your movement is \[elusive] against your target. On hit dismounts the target. Net - Thrown, CM (Drag) (5 lbs, 100g) \- Nets deal no damage, but instead inflict the entangled condition on hit\ \- The entangled condition can be removed by a creature succeeding on a athletics check (class dc) as a standard action, or automatically as a standard action if wielding a slash weapon.\ \- You still benefit from the CM (Drag) feature of the net as long as the creature is entangled.\ \- You can use nets to make drag combat maneuvers against targets within 20 ft. When you drag with a net, you forfeit entangling your target\ \- Nets can only be used once per combat since they must be refolded again to be effective Boomerang - d8 crush, 1h, Thrown (5 lbs, 500g) \- Boomerangs return to the user when thrown automatically, allowing multiple attacks with a single thrown weapon.\ \- Boomerangs curve, allowing you to hit opponents with total cover, so long as you aim for the correct space\ \- Boomerangs do not return when caught with something like a goo dragon's sticky\ Special Attack: Wait For It... - Throw a boomerang at an unusual angle, initially missing a target. At the start of your next turn make an attack against them, but they're DD . Harpoon - d10 pierce, 2h, Thrown, Bleed (15 lbs, 500g) \- Harpoons come with a particularly strong 40 ft rope attached, allowing you to drag the weapon back to you in case you miss (standard action). Holding onto this rope after you toss uses a hand.\ \- Harpoons stick into the target. The bleed from this weapon cannot be stopped until after it is removed (class DC athletics, swift action).\ \- While embedded, you can make a drag attacks against the target without penalty from being at a range. Bola - d6 crush, Thrown, Ammunition, CM (Topple) (2 lbs, 20g) \- Bolas can be used to topple from a range.\ \- Bolas can only be used once per combat as they need to be untangled to be used properly Gun, Pistol - 2d6 pierce, Short Range, Reload (5 lbs, 500g) \- Requires an even more complex reloading process than crossbows. Their reload requires a FRA\ -Pistols are 1h weapons, but they cannot be used to dual wield\ \- Also comes in a 2h rifle version that has the 2h property and does 2d8 dmg (10 lbs, 800g) Blunderbuss - 2d6 pierce, 2h, Reload (10 lbs, 800g) \- Has the same rules as guns plus the following…\ \- Simultaneously attacks every creature in a 15ft cone, comparing a single attack roll to all creature's AC\ \- Does not provoke from shooting in melee\ \- Not compatible with special attacks Whip - d6 slash, Light, CM (Drag), CM (Trip) (2lbs, 200g) \- Whips can be used to attack with 10 ft of extra reach, but do not threaten (meaning no AoOs)\ \- You can use the whip to grab objects and pull them adjacent to you, provided you would normally have been able to lift them.\ \- Whips can be used to dispatch creatures non-lethally instead of killing when defeating them

entries.title: jizzle-physicks
entries.content: Jizzle Physicks A core part of a life of adventure is taking damage, and your friendly neighborhood alchemists have you covered. As part of your starting gear (or a fee of 50g if you lose yours) you gain access to a flask of wondrous physick with a regenerating ooze creature inside of it called a jizzle. When called upon, your jizzle will do its best to repair your body. Functions as follows... ActionStandard to drink yourself or administer to another creature.EffectHeal to max hp after 3 turns.Stuns for 3 rounds as it snaps your bones back into place and clogs your veins before returning to its container. If you take damage or are poise broken during these rounds, you vomit it out immediately, providing no benefits.QuirksJizzle physicks are personalized to an extent. It requires a creatures blood, and a 1 hour alchemical procedure (DC 11) for a jizzle physick to acclimate to a new user, otherwise it does not heal. Autumn Army - Polong

entries.title: README
entries.content: 💲 Approximating Gold's Value As a general rule, I have loosely tied the value of gold to the USD. Average laborers like farmers can be expected to make \~10-20k gold every year, with the amount increasing with more sophisticated trades such as smiths or merchants. Gold pieces are small coins and are virtually weightless due to the minting process performed by the financial wizards. Another benefit of this minting is it causes gold pieces to naturally stack into specific values (5, 10, 20, 100, 1000).\ Someone can easily hold 100g in their pockets, 1000g in a dedicated pouch. Anything more and they are bulging at the seams and would be better off with a bank. Roundabout CostDescriptionCheap1 - 100 goldCheap items are purchased several times throughout the day typically. Includes things like food, camping supplies, common alchemy goods, lodging and such. On the low end you might get a piece of candy, winter clothes or a dagger. On the high end you could get a specialized tool like a fishing rod, a great sword or a steel padlock.Common100 - 1kCommon items are generally purchased less often than cheap ones by most. Includes things like heavy armor, low impact magic items and exceptional alchemical goods. On the low end you get something like a furnace, a med kit or a cape of ever flowing. On the high end you get something like troll oil, or super goo.Expensive1k - 10kExpensive items must be saved up for my most. These include transportation vehicles, the average magic item and goods made with rare metals. On the low end you get something like a magic weapon. On the high end you get something like a cannon, a sailing ship or a meager home.Rare10k - 100kRare items are usually reserved for the rich, or require loans, savings or groups to purchase. Things like sizable houses, battleships, and masterfully crafted itemsLegendary100k+Reserved almost exclusively for powerful magic items and large scale projects.
