You count as both races for all purposes. Must match type . * Lore NumbersAmazon tend to be around 6'6 and weigh around 250 lbsAmazon are adults by 15, tend to maintain their youth until their 60s, then experience the usual physical decline, tending to live until about 100Appearance and BiologyAmazon typically appear similar to other humanoids, but with a much larger build. They are tall mesomorphs that tend to have a lot of variety, even within the same family. Amazon exclusively birth other amazon and are always female. Because of their inability to interbreed with each other, they must seek other races to maintain their population. This results in a larger degree of variety than most other races, inheriting varying skin colors, tusks, horns etc.Amazon typically wear armor, but the armors tend to be more "tribal" in appearance. That is to say they use materials on hand like animal pelts or bone. Amazon typically grow attached to specific trinkets they collect during their adventures: Special hats, jewelry etc. It is incredibly common for Amazon to have elaborate body and face tattoos, typically being more pattern focused than being of specific objects or creatures, and always avoiding the eyes. Amazon particularly desperate for male attention will wear what their sisters call "horny armor" which practically provides little protection and only serves to draw the gaze of potential mates.Scenic NowhereAmazon typically only live in smallish communities of only a few hundred in the far off reaches of the world, where they typically aren't bothered: Icey peaks, deep jungles and volcanic wastes. This makes actually finding their home very difficult for an outsider, but an Amazon always has a 6th sense for how she might return home. Amazon often have unique adaptations that allow them to exist sustainably in such harsh environments. Sometimes this comes in the form of hunting or farming techniques, others it means biological adaptation to extremes in temperature.Amazon are typically wary of outsiders when close to home. Each tribe have a different policy depending on their history, but typically outsiders are judged by those most knowledgeable, the elders or by their chieftess. The chieftess is usually the most powerful and influential member of a particular tribe and is treated with great respect. A slight against the chieftess is a slight against the family as a whole, and is a quick way to get kicked out, or worse depending on the practices of that tribe.FamilyAmazon have a particularly close bond with their family. They all share the same last name and rarely choose to change it, seeing their heritage as something to take pride in. They greatly emphasize the "it takes a village to raise a child" philosophy and every child is everyone's responsibility. As such the role of childbearing is seen less of a personal responsibility and more of a commitment to the continuation of the family. The role of mom specifically is also deemphasized, but what mother wouldn't show a bit of preferential treatment to one of their own. Amazon can typically expect their sisters, and especially their elders, to pick up on any slack with regards to child rearing as a result of being stretched thin by responsibilities. Amazon typically return back home if they experience great hardship, grow old or find a partner/get pregnant.To an Amazon, there is no greater threat than one that threatens their tribe. They will take up arms against anything if it threatens their way of life, and may be willing to resort to anything in order to protect their kin.Adventures and DuelsNearly every young Amazon is expected to leave home at some point, usually in pairs with a sister of similar age. There is always the underlying goal of hoping to find love, but rarely is that the priority. They go out to perform specific tasks, carry on where their older sisters left of, or to simply make a name for themselves. As such they often find themselves living off the land and doing small jobs where they learn what was fact and what was fiction from all the stories they heard from their sisters growing up: The "civilized" world can often be just as cruel as the harsh biome they hail from, but in entirely new and frustrating ways. Things like land ownership and bumping heads on tiny doorways are oft-sited frustrations with most civilization.Regardless of style, all Amazon are combat-trained. As such, scrappy folks looking to test their mettle will challenge amazon to battles. Amazon will usually accept duels with females if they're in the mood, but will only duel males they are interested in or attracted to. If the amazon is victorious, they usually lose interest.BanishmentIt does not happen often, but when an amazon betrays her family or does something the tribe sees as particularly heinous, they are banished: A specific type of mask-like tattoo is placed over their eyes that is always visible, even through magical transformations. Only through physically covering the face can the tattoo be hidden. The banished is stripped of their family name and forbidden from returning back home. Being banished from one tribe guarantees a life of hardship, as the tattoo is a universal sign to all amazon, making the banished unable to ever establish the bond of kinship again. Amazon instinctually detect and distrust any creature that bears the mark of the banished.

entries.title: anime
entries.content: 🎌 Anime The shiny race with crazy hair. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Art by me! {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageManganeseSizeMedium (See loli)TypeHumanoid {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major FeaturesPlot Armor [recharge]The first time per day you drop to zero hp, you negate whatever effect you suffered from that caused you to be defeated entirely, including its damage. When this happens, cleanse all negative status effects, minus curses, drain afflictions and other similar status. Eternal HopeWhen you roll a natural 1 on a d20, reroll it. You cannot reroll a reroll. Minor FeaturesFearless+2 bonus to saves against fear effectsSubtitlesWhenever you speak manganese, any creature that can hear you sees your words appear at the periphery of their vision in a language they understand, allowing them to understand you as long as they can read. Replace Features MajorPower of FriendshipWhen you gain the defeated condition, all allies within 60 ft of you gain advantage on their next d20 roll. When an ally gains the defeated condition, you get advantage on your next d20 roll.This ability can only activate once per round. Only functions in combat.DeterminationGain the determination special attack, usable with any attack roll.Tragic Backstory1/day you can tell the tale of your tragic backstory. Creatures within 30 ft of you become fascinated for 3 minutes (will negates).Share your tragic backstory via Larella's Memory Movie. You can cast it as a self only spell 1/day.BattlecryWhen you take the charge action, you can move three times your speed and ignore difficult terrain. Any round you charge, your allies also gain this benefit. * MinorBig Anime PersonalitiesAs a standard action, you can show off your assets to a creature within 30 ft. The creature gains blurred vision against all creatures other than you for one minute.Theme SongAs a free action you can activate your theme song for no mechanical benefit. Theme songs fade into the background when you are not taking actions, and gets to the good part at an increased volume when you do. Your theme song makes you instantly recognizable as you adventure over time.Nobody else can have your theme song as long as you live.Mixed BloodChoose the minor feature of another race (including alternate features). You count as both races for all purposes.LoliYou are inherently sexual. Whenever something calls for romantic or sexual compatibility, you automatically qualify, whether the effect is beneficial or harmful. Your size decreases to small.EncouragingYou can use the aid action to increase an ally's skill checks for a +2 bonus, regardless of proficiency. * Lore NumbersAnime are usually around 5'6 and weigh around 150 lbs If they survive early adulthood, anime live to be around 70Appearance and BiologyAnime are very shiny, have enormous eyes, have ridiculous hair and even more ridiculous outfits. Rarely will they ever see it that way though. The more colorful and eccentric someone is, the better they fit in with a crowd of anime. Anime are obsessed with being unique and will do everything in their power to make sure they have a different hair color, eye color, outfit, hair styles etc. They care deeply about being noticed. If anybody ever mentions their appearance, that is reinforcement that they are doing something right. Outside of these eccentricities, anime tend to closely resemble humans. Their skin and hair have a lot more luster that other humanoids. They can have deviations in their eyes, not only in their size, but also the shape of their irises. They also can sometimes have unusual extra features like the sharp teeth of a predator, an extra pair of ears on top of their head or whiskers.Main QuestAnime always have some major event that they cling to during their childhood that shapes their life forever. Tragic deaths and witnessing incredible feats of heroism are the most common, but it could also be something inconsequential like being a virgin or not having any friends. Either way, this event will put the anime down a specific path to get vengeance, be the best there ever was or watch the world burn. As such, they always spend their teenage years and early adulthood in pursuit of this goal by getting special training, isolating themselves in their research and such. Anime always make grandiose claims about their desires like "I want to become king" or "I want to be the strongest under the heavens" with regards to these desires. Once they get their fill of adventure or they accomplish their goal is when they typically settle down and live a normal life. Occasionally anime can be tempted to come out of retirement if a rival shows up or enemy they had thought defeated rears its head.Cranked up to 11Anime are always the most extreme version of whatever they embody. They are the most comically evil villain's, the most epic heroes and the dumbest drunks. They dive headfirst into things without even realizing what they are doing. Anime always go all in, rarely consider future consequences and regularly trust people they shouldn't. Anime also have the most intense reactions to things. Disgust causes them to turn purple and anger turns them red while they blow steam from their ears. They make tons of vocalizations to express their current emotional state.

entries.title: boner
entries.content: Boner The bone zone race. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Helltaker's skeletal enemy...with some slight alterations {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageNecrilSizeMedium or smallTypeWhile boners are undead, they cannot be targeted by effects that control undead creatures. For all other purposes they count as humanoid and undeadVitality [recharge]Once per minute as a swift action, boners can produce a cloud of blue mist (doesn't obscure vision) in a 10 ft radius around them to hamper non-Boner undead around them. Such creatures are staggered for as long as they remain in the mist, and 1 round thereafter.Through prolonged exposure to this mist, an undead creature becomes a boner (provided it has a skeleton). If it doesn’t, it is instead destroyed in such a way to free its soul from necromantic control. {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features ResistanceGain resistance to necrotic damage. Minor Features Trance+4 bonus to sleep effects. Instead of sleeping to rest, you enter a meditative state where you remain aware of your surroundings.Night VisionYou treat dim light as bright light. You treat darkness as dim light. Replace Features Major Play DeadBoners can collapse into a pile of bones on the ground and make all their equipment disappear as a standard action. This allows them to hide in plain sight and use disguise in place of stealth (if desired) with a +2 bonus. Exiting this ability is a free action. If the setting would be too unusual for a skeleton to be in (middle of a crowded street) or people see you activate this ability, then it doesn’t work.Lend a HandBoners can remove their arms and use them even while detached, albeit in a limited fashion. As a free action they can detach an armThey can use this ability to increase the reach of an attack only requiring one hand by 5-feet by wielding their sword arm in their other hand. Disarmed limbs move at a rate of 5 feet per round back to their owner and reattach when they enter your space. * Minor Big Boned+100 carrying capacity.Ghost WranglerYou treat incorporeal creatures as though they were a corporeal for things like combat maneuvers, attacks, spells etc.Favored Enemy+2 religion * Lore NumbersVaries based on humanoid bone'd. They weigh about 15% of their original body weight.Boners live to be about 50 before the animating force leaves their bones for goodAppearanceBoners are the skeletons of humanoid creatures and vary a bit in shape and size based on their original race. Since their bodies are without skin and only bones, they are often mistaken for the nefarious creations of necromancers, but boners try to mitigate that with an extreme sense of style. They wear fancy outfits, outrageous hats and use their boney bodies as a canvas for artistic expression. It isn’t uncommon to see a Boner embed gems into their body, give themselves extensive tattoos or apply trails of melted gold in their cracked bones.A particularly unusual feature they possess is the ability to bend parts of their skulls. This allows them to make facial expressions (imagine Grim Adventures of Billy and Mandy). Most possess glowing lights in their sockets to replace their eyes.VitalityBoners are the cure for undeath. They possess the ability to free the soul of the undead creature, granting it control over what's left of its body. Not only are they able, but they are obsessed with the idea of curing undead. You'd be hard pressed to find creatures with a greater distaste for undead. Most make it their mission to free what they see as imprisoned brothers and sisters.Vitality only works when exposed to the gas over a prolonged period of time, requiring undead to be captured instead of killed. Usually the process takes about 10 minutes for most undead, but particularly powerful ones can take hours or even days. Even undead that were quite fond of their previous forms have a drastic change in their mindset and are immediately disgusted by what they had become.'Til Death Do Us PartBoners typically remember very little, if anything, from their previous life, usually writing it off as déjà vu. Some of their personality remains intact and they have the same general shape, but most of their previous selves was erased when they washed ashore in the underworld through the river Styx. They do remember everything they experienced while an undead monster.The quest to cure the world of necromancy is an impossible one, but it is one the boners accept with gusto, as it means they get to increase the size of their family. Boners develop a closeness with their with their captures. They always develop a very close bond with the first creature that cure, unless that creature already had a partner. Lacking biology, they don’t care much for physical intimacy and pay little attention to gender or even species. Subsequent cures while a boner already has a partner are treated more like children. These comparisons are imprecise, considering most boners are of adult creatures and it can be difficult for most to imagine an intimate relationship without a physical component, but it serves as an easy way to explain to the meatbags.

entries.title: cyborg
entries.content: Cyborg The part robot race {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Art by me! {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageBased on creatorSizeVariesTypeHumanoid, ConstructBuild PurposeChoose one from the alternate major features. If you do not do tasks in line with your purpose, you acquire the purposelessness affliction (see below). {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features Extra StorageYour forearms are mostly hallow, allowing you to store small items inside of them that you can easily retrieve at a moments notice. You can even store a single light weapon in it.You gain a +2 bonus to sleight of hand to conceal weapons. As a free action once per turn, you can pop your wrist and open the compartment to slip items in or out of this compartment. Minor Features Cold LogicGain a +2 bonus to 2 intelligence based skills. You take a -2 penalty to all charisma based skills.Memory BankYou can place an average book inside of your head. While inside you can read it while performing other tasks. Replace Features BuildsBuild: AcrobaticYou can jump as a free action 1/turn. Your jump distance is a minimum of 20 ft, and you can jump as high as you can long jump.Build: Bot of Burden+100 carryweight. Large sizeBuild: CombatWhen a creature fails to break your poise, you can bully it as an immediate action.Build: HandymanYou get an additional limb. This limb can store 3 types of handheld tools inside of it, such as a hammer, crowbar or farming implement. You can swap between these stored tools is a free action 1/turn.Build: SentinelYou are ever vigilant, even while those around you rest. You get +2 perception, increasing to +4 when keeping watch.You do not need to breathe, eat or sleep. To gain the benefits of rest, you must merely not perform any physically or mentally intense activity for 8 hours.Build: Shadow+2 stealth, stealth proficiency, small size and nightvisionBuild: Magic Conduit+1 to attack rolls made with spells (does not include spellstrike)OR +1 to CLBuild: ExplorerWhether its making maps, archaeology or dungeon delving, you excel at adapting to the situation. 3/day you can add a d8 to a skill check while not in combat. This bonus can be added retroactively.360You can rotate your upper body in circles with a special joint at your hips. You cannot be flanked.Defragment [recharge]You can change one of your skill proficiencies by concentrating for 1 minute. * Minor Occular AdjustmentGain nightvision * Lore NumbersCyborgs size is largely based the preferences of the creator. They usually tend to be 5'6 tall and weigh 350 lbsShadow Builds are typically half as tall and 1/4 the weightBots of Burden are typically 1.5x as tall and 4x the weight.The lifespan of a cyborg is dependent on the creature used to create them. See creation and death for more info.Creation (and Death)Through a combination of engineering and magic, a talented individual can use the body of a creature who is recently deceased or on deaths door as a chassis for a cyborg. By augmenting the creature with replacement mechanical parts that circumvent the biological failings of a creature's meat parts, and offering a piece of their own soul, the creator can breathe new life into a completely new type of creature.Theoretically with frequent repairs, a cyborg can live forever. However due to the soul sharing being a necessary part of the process, the life of the cyborg is inevitably tied to that of their creator. When their creator dies, they take the piece of the soul that resides in their creation with them. This does not immediately kill the cyborg, but rather gives them a sickness that is similar to dementia that slowly eats away at their mental faculties until nothing remains.Appearance and BiologyThe aesthetics of a cyborg tend to be augmented humanoid: Limbs replaced by mechanical parts, additional seams in the skin to accommodate for added flexibility and visible nodes/circuits to channel electricity. Other than that, the cyborg's appearance tends to be based on the preferences of the creator and the body of the creature that was used in the process of creation.When it comes to what gets taken out and replaced with mechanical parts, that largely depends on the state the subject was in before the process of being turned into a cyborg. Ailments that affected mobility typically mean mechanical limbs, while those related to organ failure can cause most of the augmentations to be made internally. Either way there are usually new ways the creature can bend and new holes to accommodate for their constant need for electricity and fuel instead of food and water.Most of the engineers tend to favor function over form, but on occasion they can be compelled to keep particular biological functions in tact to make the cyborgs blend in better such as a digestive system or reproductive organs. Regardless, they do not appear to age, only physically changing in so far as they are repaired and augmented further.What is My PurposeCyborgs inevitably need to have their brain essentially wiped clean as part of the creation process. In order to avoid total mental collapse, the creators need to fill that space in with something else: a purpose. Usually a creatures build and purpose coincide with each other: A sleek build honed for stealth built to assassinate political rivals. Quick reflexes to counteract opponents in combat. No matter the purpose, the cyborgs are invariably bound by it, and must dedicate a large portion of their time to it. There is no finite amount of time a cyborg must schedule, but usually they must dedicate hours each day to their purpose, even if the task is indirect (I must protect my creator, therefore I will shop for them and buy them armor). Though even indirect methods will not substitute directly attending to their build purpose forever. If a cyborg spends too much time avoiding their purpose, they acquire a severe affliction called purposelessness (details below).Free WillCyborgs are like children when first created; they know little and are curious about everything. This usually passes quickly since they still have the mental faculties of an adult. Creators will quickly find them changing roles from parent to taskmaster as cyborgs are eager for direction. Once given the tools to do so, cyborgs can act completely independently. Though the words of their creator tend to carry more weight.Cyborgs might not have any biological memories from their previous life, but the memories of the soul remain. They leak into their unconscious thoughts and still serve as a guide for them concerning matters of morality. They might not remember the events that created these feelings, but the lessons they learned from them stick for good. As such, they function as and are usually treated like individuals rather than servants. Though to the cyborg that line can be blurry. Purposelessness (Tier 3 Affliction) EffectCureCyborg loses its free will and must achieve its purpose at all costs. It is obtained through abstaining from this purpose and so usually involves overcompensating for lost time. This could mean aggressively assisting creatures without them asking for it, picking fights for no other reason than to fight. Cyborgs are much more impressionable and will often do anything asked of them if it is aligned with their purpose while in this state.Receiving a direct order in line with their purpose from creator requiring at least 1 day and completing it without rest.If creator is unavailable, then after 1 week of constantly serving their purpose without rest, they become drained 2 and the affliction is lost.

entries.title: dwarf
entries.content: Dwarf The short and stocky beard dude race {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} By Malon By me! {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} | Language | Dwarven | | -------- | -------- | | Size | Medium | | Type | Humanoid | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features HardyGain resistance to poisonSlow and SteadyIncrease your poise by 5 and hp by 10 Minor Features Night VisionYou treat dim light as bright light. You treat darkness as dim light.Beard of HoldingYou can store 1 item that you can hold in a single hand that weighs no more than 10 lbs inside of your beard. Replace Features Major RacismChoose a race of humanoids. You gain +1 priority when you enter combat with them as one of your enemies. You're automatically taunted by them for 1 round.Salt BeardAs a swift action, coat a held weapon in your beard salt. Your next attack with it inflicts taunt for one round (fort negates). You must quaff food for at least one minute to recharge this ability.Flame BelchAs a standard action, you can light and raise a flame to your mouth, then belch on an adjacent creature. They are set ablaze (reflex negates). It takes another standard action of drinking an alcoholic beverage to recharge this ability.StubbornWhenever an effect would move you against your will, reduce the distance moved to 5ft as an immediate action.If you don't spend an action, reduce the distance of all forced movement by 5ft. * MinorNot Impressed+2 bonus to saves against charm effectsX to Doubt+2 bonus to insightMountaineerYou use your full speed to climb and ignore rocky difficult terrain, such as rubble, stairs etc.Value ScentYou possess blindsense (scent, 5ft). It is only usable on detecting the value of objects. You are automatically are able to discern the value of something with a quick sniff. Particularly valuable things such as rare magic items may have extremely powerful and wide scents as strongly scented creatures and objects normally would.Book of GrudgesYou meticulously record all events that you perceive as negative in a government approved book. Slights against your character, betrayals, enemies, lies and the like are all written down in the book. By presenting this book in a suitable situation, such as incriminating someone, you get a +2 bonus to skill checks. * Lore NumbersDwarves tend to be around 4' tall and weigh 150 lbsDwarves reach adulthood by 20 live to be around 150Appearance and BiologyDwarves are universally male. Rather than reproducing through traditional means, they go mining to find more dwarves. Dwarves are a naturally occurring resource just like iron, and can be harvested as such. They usually appear inside of stone-y egg-like structures with the texture of hair. These eggs naturally form as a result of "dwarf energy" which is created through the act of mining. Dwarfling eggs can only form in unworked stone, making it necessary to go far out from home to find them. More dwarf energy is generated when dwarves mine, and dwarves have a more keen sense when it comes to finding dwarfling eggs, making it uncommon for other humanoids to discover them. There are a handful of ways to hatch a dwarfling egg. Some use specific solvents like a shampoo to soften the protective outer beard shell while others warm it up and comb at it when it softens. When hatched, dwarflings start off a bit more developed then birthed humanoids. With roughly a year head start, they can already move around on their own, eat most foods and understand basic physics.Dwarves are easily identifiable from their wide frames, short statures and incredible beards. They typically have a higher density of muscles and hair than most other humanoids. They take exceptional care of their facial hair, prioritizing it over the hair on the top of their head. Dwarves hatch with beards, so it is very rare to see one without a beard. Average dwarves tend to be wary of beardless dwarves.Vibe CheckBecause dwarves have completely different biology when it comes to reproducing, their family structure doesn't follow that of creatures that give birth to their own young. Instead, dwarflings stick with whoever mined them during their early years. By the time they are teenagers, they can get a feel for their immediate family and decide whether or not they are a good fit for them. As such, dwarves form families (called Brotherhoods) similar to how most people find friend groups. Dwarves who don’t click with the family they were hatched into will readily leave to go find people that share ideals/lifestyle more closely.Dwarves that are part of a brotherhood share the same name, but are willing to drop it when they change or they think the brotherhood 'aint what it used to be. Dwarves who don't vibe with the local brotherhoods have a tendency to wander around the overworld until they find a nice craftsman or adventuring party to latch onto. Dwarves innately have a strong ability to read people, making this somewhat naïve approach to finding family more viable. Just because a dwarf is traveling doesn't automatically mean they aren't part of a brotherhood. Sometimes it is necessary to do business with surface dwellers.Round Up The LadsBecause dwarves do not have genders, they are a lot less sensitive to the kinds of dynamics having sexual dimorphism causes in humanoids. It can take a bit of getting used to not bathing or taking a leak in the presence of ladies. Dwarves tend to treat women of other races just like the men. This comes with a whole host of problems, but it also comes with a few positives. A woman having a dwarf friend is a bit like having a woman having a gay guy friend, where they can feel at ease knowing that the dwarf isn't looking for every opportunity to get into her pants.Dwarves tend to express masculine ideals much more frequently. They enjoy one upping each other when it comes to tests of strength and especially endurance. A favorite is the drinking contest, which most dwarves will handily win. Unfortunately for suitors, they are also aromantic, making such advances made against them fly right over their head.Secrets of the DwarvesLarger brotherhoods or groups willing to cooperate can sometimes get up to some…Interesting shenanigans when it comes to the experimentation on dwarflings. Nearly everything related to the topic is a closely guarded secret, known only by a handful of elders in the brotherhood. Rumor has it though that the dwarves will use some arcane mining methods in order to increase the chances of dwarflings appearing inside of rare metals like gold. These oddities are usually substantially different from the standard dwarf, taking on some of the properties of the metal they form from. Golden dwarves, a favorite amongst the dwarven elite, tend to be softer, thinner and more magically talented. There are even some rumors of dwarfling eggs being used as part of the forging process in order to create metallic dwarves. If such things do exist and are not just fantasy stories told by bards looking to capture the interest of the common folk, then they have never seen the light of day.

entries.title: elf
entries.content: 🧝‍♂️ Elf The old race with pointy ears. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Art by me! Art by me! {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageElvenSizeMediumTypeHumanoid {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features Ageless PatienceYou can choose to take 10 on skill checks instead of rolling for one skill. Get an additional skill you can use this feature with at level 5 and 10Innate CastingGain a cantrip of your choosing. Cast dream 1/day. @5 Cast dream council 1/day. Minor Features Innate CastingGain the umbrella cantrip. You can cast it as an immediate action.Trance+4 bonus vs sleep effects. Instead of sleeping to rest, you enter a meditative state where you remain aware of your surroundings Replace Features Major Arcane SightYou automatically determine whether an item is magical or nonmagical just by seeing it. You can determine the properties of a magic item that you can see similar to how monster lore checks work (free action once per turn), even if you cannot closely examine it.Elven ArcherIncrease the range of bows by 20.Steeped in MagicGet a +1 bonus to your CL.FlelfYou are constantly under the effect of arcane pocket. Instead of your pocket, it affects your hair.+2 FloofynessFarsight+2 bonus to perception. In ideal conditions you can clearly see things of medium size from up to 1 mile. Double the distance for each size category larger, half for each size category smaller. * Minor Good old Days+2 bonus to historyNice Ears+2 bonus to perceptionL O N G+5 base speed * Lore NumbersElves are usually around 6ft tall and weigh 140 lbsLifespan vary wildly with deaths by "natural causes" being exceptionally rare. As such an elven lifespan is theoretically infinite given ideal conditions.Elves reach adulthood at 20 and have a median age of 300Appearance and BiologyElves are lithe androgynous humanoids with long and pointed ears as their most telling feature. Elves do not age in the traditional sense. Most humanoids start a slow decline once they reach adulthood, eventually becoming withered husks of their former selves. Elves become adults at about the same speed as humans, but when they grow old, they physically change based on things like their environment or their magical affinity. Forest hermits might eventually growing leaves and branches, stag horns or feathers. A wizard that specializes in cryomancy might turn a light shade of blue and grow cold to the touch. Changing in physical properties like these typically happen slowly over decades or even centuries.AgelessElves are unique among humanoids due to their seemingly infinite longevity and youthfulness. As such, they develop a very different perception of time and the world at large. Many details are often lost to the passage of time, but elves persist. While a generation of humans might pass every 20 years or so, a generation of elves often lasts over a century. As such they have a unique perspective on the rise and fall of empires, world level crises and the passage of time in general. Elves possess a unique form of wisdom that can either be used to aid other races, or it can cause them to become jaded as they see the same pattern of self destruction emerge multiple times amongst the humanoid societies they observe.Long life isn't all sunshine and rainbows. Elves can often develop a superiority complex; considering elves are usually the smartest or wisest person in any given room. Yearly celebrations such as birthdays are largely ignored. Elves making friends with non elves is a rarity, since they won't stick around long enough to matter anyway. Elves can often seem apathetic towards the plights of other humanoids, but their reactions have merely been tempered by experience.Because elven society moves much more slowly than other humanoids, many of their practices can seem archaic, time-consuming and inconvenient. They are often purposefully designed to be so in order to make them take more time and be more inconvenient to replicate for other races. "See you again soon" takes on an entirely different meaning as the elf's perception of time is likely wildly different that we, and what most non-elven creatures, think. They tend to be much more conservative than others, adhering to ancient traditions and worshiping less popular or older deities. Everybody is a kid at some point so they understand what it was like to some degree: What it is like to feel wonder in a world filled with the unknown. At some point people grow and the wonder and discovery of childhood is filled with responsibility and routine of adulthood. Elves eventually come to exist on some 3rd plateau of existence where they have eaten every food, vacationed in every country, saved the world, started a family, lost people they loved, turned to the dark side and were eventually redeemed and all the rest. Once you experience so much of what the world has to offer, once you have given so much of yourself to the world only to be forgotten, what is the meaning of your continued existence?ObsessionThe aforementioned appearance changes are merely an outward representation of decades, maybe even centuries of obsession. When traditional methods of acquiring meaning in one's life fail, elves have all the time in the world to dedicate to their projects. Spiteful elves may eventually have their conscious eroded to the point where the short-lived races are viewed as mice in their experiments, and are transformed into monsters. They might develop an entirely selfless desire to protect the natural world and view most any inhabitants that exploit it as a virus to be cured by any means necessary. Maybe at a young age they are exposed to a great evil and tirelessly work to exterminate it, and snuff out any reemergence for as long as they live.Turning people into monsters is abhorrent, and hunting demons is noble. Protecting nature is a lofty ideal, but usually most humanoids are only willing to go as far is needed to maintain their way of life: Appeasing the spirits for safety, enriching the soil for crops etc. So a single-minded dedication to nature could easily cause conflict once one too many trees are cut. These exceptionally long-lived elves that develop obsessions don't necessarily cause conflict, but depending on their obsession, they very easily could. Entire elven societies form around the adaptive obsessions, for better or worse.

entries.title: eternal
entries.content: 🫶 Eternal The legally distinct people-person race {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} toad900 purorange After Skool (youtube channel) {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageSylvanSizeMedium or smallTypeFeyTelepathy (Su)You are unable to speak, lacking the complex biology to produce language. You instead rely on your telepathy in order to communicate. You are still able to create vocalizations. Silencing you disables your telepathy. {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features Detect Desire (Su)With physical contact, you discover information about others through psychic impressions. Brief physical contact gives you insight into the creatures immediate goals (what's for dinner, where am I going). Intimate contact longer than 10 seconds gives you insight into the creatures long-term goals (I will become hokage, I will make cat girls real). During this contact you can also choose to share your own short/long term goals as well. Minor Features Empathic Connection (Su)You have advantage on skill checks against any creature you are in physical contact with (minus things where touching isn't very useful like with stealth).Community [bond] (Su)By touching another creature, you can add them to your community. All bonded creatures are capable of sending a signal of danger to their community (instant action). Every member gets a sense of direction and distance to the creature that sent the signal, and are aware of who sent it. A creature can remove its bond with 1 minute of concentration.If a bonded creature receives another [bond] effect, this one returns when it ends. Replace Features Major Petal Dance (Su)You gain the water bending technique, plant bending, as a water bender of your level, allowing you to manipulate loose vegetation. You're unable to leave the plants in a position that will cause long-term damage.Mind Reader (Su)You can innately cast detect thoughts at-will, but its range changes to touch and it loses the subtle tag. You can choose to substitute the will save for an attack roll. * Minor Cooperation+2 persuasionOral(?) Tradition+2 history * Lore NumbersEternal are around 5' tall and weight around 100 lbsSmall eternals tend to be about half the height and a third of the weight.Despite their name, eternals are not immortal. They reach adulthood at 20 and tend to live to about 80.Appearance and BiologyEternals are androgynous fey with very thin limbs and a similar overall "bipedal humanoid" shape. They have protrusions from the sides of the head or the face that resemble feathers that can flutter to and fro for additional expressiveness. The "default" is usually quite plain with mainly white with secondary green colors, and gem-like structures that help focus their psychic powers. Damaging this removes their ability to communicate telepathically unless they physically touch someone.The appearance of others can vary considerably, with some borrowing features of their appearance from plants or animals. They are fans of the long and flowing fabrics of robes and dresses. Many are capable of manipulating plantlike parts of their body to grow in special shapes.An odd quirk to the eternal is that they are genderless at birth. It isn't until they start developing romantic feelings for someone close to them over a long period of time where they undergo a rapid transformation to accommodate for their partners preferences. They still stay the same general shape, but with more desirable secondary characteristics."For the Greater Good"Most races are capable of empathy, but few hold it in as high a regard as eternals do. In self-contained groups, their collectivist ideals and cooperative nature lead to what some might consider a socialist utopian society. However eternal society is very fragmented, and the groups tend not to interact with each other. Groups rarely have more than 200 people in them.This does not mean that they are an insular people, just that it is very difficult for most to make the kinds of sacrifices that come naturally to eternals. While a human would readily accept no strings attached exorbitant wealth so they can indulge in the finer things of life, an eternal would question how this money was obtained. If people needed to suffer in order to produce this wealth, they would undoubtedly refuse it. Sustainability is of the utmost importance to eternals. Every action they take is an internal calculation where the desirable result is to lift everybody up. Even in personal relationships, squabbles are talked about amongst the community so grudges or trauma are worked through and "cured" before they balloon into major problems.Branching PathsAs part of the advanced calculus that goes on in the head of an eternal, sometimes they deem it necessary to leave their people for the greater good. These individuals are bound to have incredibly stressful lives, as they will constantly be surrounded and people that do not share their ideals. People that hoard wealth, subjugate others and hide their emotions frustrate eternals.Even with these hardships, they press on. They perform mental gymnastics to believe that one day all races can learn to be more like them, and they will be the ones to enact this change. They excel in any profession where their empathy and ideals can be put to good use such as diplomacy or law enforcement. In an adventuring party they lean towards supportive roles like healers.IntimacyEternals often struggle when mingling with other races. Many of the practices that they feel are commonplace between their own people are too intimate or unusual to generally apply to other races. Physical contact, sharing feelings, collaboration, mutual respect: these are the kinds of things that the eternal will find they give too much of, and others give too little of. This can make the transition difficult. This is even worse for eternals raised outside of their own society, who almost universally feel out of place. Eternals in an abusive household will invariably end up menaces.These things can complicate romantic relationships. Eternal require a deep, intimate connection with someone that can only be obtained through years of interactions. As such it is very common for them to be in relationships with childhood friends, even those outside of their race.The Eternal OneThe Eternal One is a collective conscience stored inside of something of significance, like a gem, or a tree. It is of great importance to the eternals since it holds the memories of their people, and is the central focus of rituals disposing of the crystalized memories of the dead. Each settlement has one, and it typically has a guardian that will consult it during times of great distress. Proclamations made by The Eternal One may as well be decrees from a god with how much severity and seriousness they are treated with. It is through these proclamations that eternals most commonly find themselves separating from their kin.

entries.title: exalted-fallen
entries.content: Exalted/Fallen The celestial race. Comes in 2 variants. 1 representing fallen angels, the other of divine bloodlines {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Azazel, Helltaker {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageCelestialSizeMedium or smallTypeHumanoid, CelestialChoose PathThis race of celestial humanoids comes in 2 flavors, Exalted and Fallen. See lore for more details.Exalted:Halo (Su)You emit bright light in a 20 ft radius around you. This can be dimmed or turned back on as a free action 1/turn. While your halo radiates light, you are automatically viewed as a source of authority by NPCs. Guards will have a higher tolerance for your activities, commoners will be more willing to aid you in investigations regarding crime etc.This gives advantage on any skill check when dealing with people concerning law and order.Fallen:Clean Slate (Su)You can [mana burn] 1 to innately cast malleable memory (Larella 4), but only to remove memories. {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features True SpeechYou can speak to any creature that can understand or speak language. You understand all spoken words. This does not give you any insight into written words or non verbal language. Minor Features Innate CastingYou can innately cast cure wounds 1/day.FertilityYou can sense when a creature is pregnant by standing within 10 feet of the creature Replace Features Major Favored Enemy+2 to planes. If you succeed on a monster lore check against a fiend, get +2 attack against itFavored Enemy+2 to religion. If you succeed on a monster lore check against an undead, get +2 attack against itDeathlessThe first time each day you would be drained, negate the drained effect. You recover 1 stack of drained each time you rest. * Minor Radiance1/day when you activate your halo's light, it causes foes within its radius to have blurred vision for 1 round (reflex negates)Mediators+2 diplomacyPassed AwayBy making physical contact, you can tell the name of a corpse, or the name an undead had in life.GlideGlide upon feathered wings. While not movement impaired, take no fall damage. When falling, move horizontally 10 feet per 5 foot fallen at a speed of 60.1/day a swift action, you can increase the size and power of these wings for 1 minute, giving you a fly speed equal to your land speed. You can also take flight as part of the same action. * Lore NumbersExalted stand around 5'6 and weigh around 150 lbsExalted are adults by 15 and live to be around 70 years old. Fallen typically appear as they did in adulthood for 50 years before passing.ExaltedThis race comes in 2 different forms, the more common is the exalted. These are creatures born from a mortal humanoid and a heavenly god. Exalted children usually only know one of their parents personally. Their heavenly parent usually only takes a passing interest in their mortal children, unless they are particularly devoted followers or they accrue a great deal of influence.Exalted that do know of their divine heritage often go to great lengths to impress their deific parent. The silence they experience is painful, but the satisfaction when they are finally acknowledged is immeasurable. Exalted can often feel great pressure to live in ways that reflect an unflinching moral compass. People will often put them on pedestals as the chosen ones of their god: A birthright that does not correspond with the personal thoughts and feelings of the exalted can create a lot of cognitive dissonance. Unhappy exalted tend to break away from their roots in very dramatic and drastic fashions.FallenThe less common form is the fallen. These were creatures that passed away and through their deeds in life were granted access to the heavens in the afterlife. At one point or another though, they broke rules dealing with fiends, sneaking people into the heavens or some other particularly heinous act. As punishment, they are forced to drink from the river styx, forgetting much of their past selves. Then they are banished to the mortal realm, often living hallow lives, but never understanding where that feeling comes from.The touch of divinity never truly leaves them, however. Essentially reborn as adults, Fallen are often drawn to doing the same types of righteous things they did in life to earn their place among the greats. Fragments of memories from their previous lives remain, and what they remember can drastically change their outlook. Sometimes they can create hope that one day they may return, but in others, it only creates spite for the harshest punishment imaginable.Appearance and BiologyThe exalted closely resemble the race of their mortal parent, but with bonus shinyness. They might have a metallic sheen to their hair, eyes that glow a solid gold, cracks along their body filled with gold or other such visually distinct changes. Universally they all have halos of some kind.Fallen resemble the appearance they had in life, but often with the color drained from them, supplemented by black. Their skin tends towards a gray porcelain, their hair, black. If they have wings, they will often have both black and white feathers.Exalted can reproduce freely with mortals, but without any attention from their deific parent, the children are born as their partners race. Fallen follow the same rules, but have no chance of ever created another of their kind.Exalted vs FallenBy their natures, fallen and exalted all tend to be first generation celestials, with the celestial blood diluting with each generation. As such, encounters between exalted and fallen tend to be uncommon. They tend to have mixed feelings about each other.For the exalted, they feel a mixture of pity and envy. Pity that the fallen have no place in the heavens and envy that they are unshackles from their heavenly duties. Oftentimes they will mistreat the fallen, giving them a "holier than thou" attitude. Others that feel they have failed their divine parents will reach out to the fallen and find a kinship that only someone abandoned by the gods can truly understand.For the fallen, exalted represent a possible connection to the divine. This presents an opportunity for redemption, so fallen are typically a lot more excited to find exalted than the other way around. Unfortunately, many will end up disappointed; Either by the lack of enthusiasm, or the lack of connection the exalted has with the divine. Being mistreated by the exalted can make fallen feel even more jaded than they were before about the gods and how they treat mortals.

entries.title: fairy
entries.content: Fairy The smol bullyable race. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Moemon {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageSylvanSizeTiny. Tiny creatures have a reach of 0 ft and must move into the space of an enemy to attack them in melee.TypeFey {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features Tiny WingsYou hover at a speed of 30. During your turn you can use it to fly. Your poise is reduced by 5.Fairy Dust (Sp) [recharge]You can innately cast fairy dust 3/day. Recharge after 1 minute. Minor Features SparklyYou emit light in a 20 ft radius. You can turn this off or on as a free action 1/turn.You create a sparkly substance you can apply to surfaces. You can use this to things like help identify someone or choose to leave an obvious trail of sparkling dust, making it easy to track you. You get advantage on skill checks when you can realistically be helped by such sparklyness (such as using survival to track, or perception to see through a disguise people you've sparkled).Goo Goo Eyes1/day as an immediate action when you are attacked in melee, you give your foe a pleading gaze. They are unable to complete the attack, lose the action and cannot attack you until the start of their next turn (will negates). Replace Features MajorMoth-erYou share more in common with moths than just your wings. You are constantly under the effect of arcane pocket. Instead of your pocket, it affects your hair.+2 FloofynessAntennae: SensoryBlindsense (scent, 10 ft)Antennae: EmotionalWhile in contact with another creature, you experience their emotional state. You can pinpoint the origin of these feelings, giving you greater insight into this creature. Advantage on insight and persuasion against creatures you are in contact with.Lock-On [elusive]As a swift action, you can tether yourself to a creature within reach, matching their movement as long as they do not teleport, you lose line of sight or move more than 100 ft in a turn. * | Minor | | | ------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Greater Fairy (Su) \[recharge] | As a swift action you can increase to large size for 10 minutes. | | Antennae: Expressive | You emit light in a 20 ft radius. You can turn this off or on as a free action 1/turn.You can cause your antennae to light up in specific patterns, allowing you to communicate in a way only other fairies can interpret. These lights can be seen a great distance away. | * Lore NumbersFairies are around 1 ft tall and weigh around 4 lbsFairies reach adulthood by 15 and tend to live to be around 60Appearance and BiologyFairies are thin, sparkly and usually have a pair of gossamer wings. They can grow small plants on their bodies such as flowers and vines. Some even have leafy hair.They have colors that match the natural world around them. If fairies stay in a new location for several months, their colors change to better blend in. This means that fairies that live in cold environments will likely have lighter tones with more blue, while forest-dwelling fairies will likely favor green and brown. Fairies will naturally change with the seasons as well, causing their leafy hair to be a vibrant green in the spring/summer, and brown or red in the fall.Fairies naturally create a powder commonly referred to as "fairy dust" that has a wide variety of applications depending on what the fairy is adapted to. It can help with tracking, decoration and even combat. Used as fuel, it can produce fairy fire, which burns until put out and comes in a wide variety of colors.We do a lil' TrollingFey creatures are well known for being mischievous, and fairies are no exception. Their flight, small size and propensity for pranks make them prototypical as far as the trickster fey archetype is concerned. They will snatch things from windowsills, use their fairy dust to mess up paintings or paint jobs and use their small size and huge eyes to appear innocent and get out of trouble.Most fairies don't stray too far from mischievous. Even their evil plots are usually centered around something minor and silly like ruining someones vegetables with their guerrilla gardening. As such, its usually difficult to take a fairy seriously, even if they are causing serious harm. On the opposite side, their good deeds also tend to not be anything spectacular, like helping a tipped over turtle or battling against a beehive. Fairies tend to be unconcerned with the world at large and its problems, or the long term consequences of their actions. They may end up the saviors of the world joining along some adventuring party, but they were just in it because they like giving the party's beast companion treats and the bard was cute. They may also end up as lackeys in some grandiose plot to take over the world because they were convinced it was gonna be some super awesome prank.Great FairiesIn general, fairies don't live in settlements with other humanoids. They live in the wilderness amongst animals, plants and other fey in little alcoves and clearings protected by a great fairy. Great fairies are massive in size and serve as the guardians to portals to the realm of the fey: the feywilds. These portals are usually decorated pools of shimmering water water decorated with all manner of colorful plants, toadstools and rocks. Great fairies typically reside directly inside this portal, partially submerged so they can interact with creatures in a manner that's at least a little closer to face to face. They can handily deactivate the portal, making interacting with the great fairy a necessary part of using the portal. They usually serve to protect any who wish to travel to and fro between the realms. They also serve as something of a border patrol, keeping the worst from both sides away from the portal. Great fairies are powerful magical creatures that few are willing to attack all on their own. Such plans are made all the more difficult by the entourage of allies they usually gather. Great fairies will naturally accrue a lot of followers and may even be inclined to create organizations around finding and protecting these portals. Because these locations are well protected and serve as a natural gathering spot for travelers, these are where the fairy population is its most dense. Many don't directly serve the great fairy, but are willing to perform menial tasks like sending messages and guiding people through the wilds. Sometimes begrudgingly, sometimes happily, seeing it as an opportunity to mess with humanoids less familiar with the poisonous mushrooms and dangerous sleepy monsters of the natural world.
