entries.content: 🧞‍♂️ Geniekin {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Art by me! Art by me! Art by me! {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} | Language | Primordial | | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Size | Medium or small | | Type | Humanoid, Elemental | | Element | Choose one of the four elements: earth, wind, fire, water. Your racial features are augmented based on what element you choose. | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features Movement[Air] Hover equal to land speed.[Water] Swim equal to land speed and amphibious quality[Earth] Burrow 5[Fire] +10 speedWish1/day you can speak the words "I wish…" followed by a desire you have. Your next related task within an hour that requires a d20 roll you add 4 to it. Minor Features Mixed BloodGain a minor feature of another race (including alternate features). You count as both races for all purposes.Charged[recharge]As a swift action, charge your weapon/unarmed/natural attacks with energy for 1 round. They deal an extra d6 of damage.[Air] Zap[Water] Cold[Earth] Poison[Fire] Fire Replace Features MajorBending BasicsYou get the bending initiate feat. Its damage shares your elemental tagResistance[Air] Zap[Water] Cold[Earth] Poison[Fire] FireDiamond Skin [earth]Ranged attacks cannot graze youKindling [fire]You get +2 attack against creatures set ablaze. When you set a creature ablaze, the DC to get rid of it is 2 higher.Water Blending [water]While mostly submerged in liquid, you can hide in plain sight.Storm Sight [air]You can see the silhouettes of creatures shrouded in clouds of gas.Mist, fog, clouds etc cannot grant creatures total concealment to you, regardless of distance. Ignore partial concealment of adjacent creatures in such environments.Gem Bod [earth]When you are slain, you shatter into pieces. As long as most of these pieces are intact, they can be reattached, restoring them to life. This requires 500g worth of adhesive and 10 minutes of work. This process can also be done to restore a severed limb, requiring only 50g.Your memories are stored all throughout your body. When you sustain major damage, you lose some of your memories. Whenever you are defeated, you forget the minute leading up to when you were KO’d. When you are slain, or if you lose a limb, you forget the previous 24 hours. Losing more significant chunks permanently can give amnesia.Forged in Flame [earth or fire] * MinorMetalhead (Su)[earth] [recharge]As a standard action, you can cause the metal in your body to converge in your hands in a specific shape. You can use this to create weapons, tools, shields and other types of metal equipment. This should generally be something that is lightweight, like a hammer or a dagger.You cannot use this feature until you absorb the metal object, or consume some more, and no more than 1/day.Deep dweller [earth or water]Gain nightvision. You treat dim light as bright light. You treat darkness as dim light.Fired Up [fire]+10 speed on the first round of combat. You can choose to emit bright light in a 20 ft radius. You can turn this off or on as a free action 1/turn.Firefighter [fire or water]By touching a fire, you can put it out and all fire within 10 ft. For magic effects, treat as dispel magic.Close to Home [earth]You do not take a penalty to AC while knocked downGust of Wind (Su) [air]As easily as you can breathe, you can blow on an object within 30 ft to push it 30 ft in any direction. You can exert enough force to move dense objects less than 10 lbs short distances, but objects with large surface area like signs can be affected more easily. * Lore NumbersGeniekin stand around 5'6 and weigh around 150 lbsEarth and water geniekin tend to be slightly heavier, while air and fire tend to be lighterGeniekin are adults by 15 and live to be around 70 years old.Appearance and BiologyGeniekin are humanoids with roughly the same size and build as humans, but they come in 4 distinct variants based on their elemental affinity.Air geniekin tend towards light blue skin tones and white or blonde hair. They love feeling the wind blowing in their hair so they usually will go to great lengths to maintain a large head of hair. Air geniekin are the lightest of the bunch, rarely breaking 120 lbs for even the largest of them.Fire geniekin have red and orange skin tones, and hair that resembles fire blazing atop their heads. Male geniekin will also have facial hair with the same properties. They have a much higher body temperature than most humanoids, making them very popular in the winter.Water geniekin skin tones vary between blue and green, depending on whether they prefer salt or freshwater. Just like with firekin, their hair can also mimic their element. It looks as though it is in a constant state of flow. Most are amphibious, capable of living comfortably in land or sea.Earth geniekin are typically gray, brown, black or somewhere in between. Instead of hair, some grow crystalline structures on their head that they can mold to resemble hair. It lacks the same softness and malleability, but makes up for it with shinyness. Earthkin are the heaviest of the bunch. Their density causes them to be upwards of 200lbs.The "elemental-ness" of a geniekin can vary greatly. With some being closer to humans, and others that are made of stone for example.Like a Genie!Geniekin are all the byproduct of genie wishes. One way or another, all of the humanoids generated through genie magic are geniekin. Wish for an army? Geniekin soldiers. Wish for a son? Geniekin. An entire planet complete with servants? Geniekin servants. Particularly large and grandiose wishes that people have made in the past have made it so the population of geniekin is steady beyond first generation wish creations.Created by magic, geniekin often feel drawn to studying magic in some way, shape or form. It makes them feel as though they are getting closer to finding the origin of their species. Many geniekin are still born with a spark of that genie's magic that created them all those years, perhaps even generations ago. All they need to do is speak "I wish" and their genie powers work to shape the reality to their liking…albeit in less impressive and more subtle ways. It's more like gently steering reality in a desired direction than shaping it.AvatarGeniekin are the creators of the 4 bending styles. They are often drawn to each other by their natural affinity for such magic. There are many settlements that started up as a result of several earth benders or water benders meeting up and starting a school to teach. The ability to bend their respective element is the primary uniting and binding force behind geniekin society. The most highly regarded individuals among geniekin are the bending masters.Benders will sometimes be given a final task by their masters to locate what they call "elemental wells." These are places that house large amounts of energy as a result of natural formations. Places like volcanoes or storms or tornadoes are common locations. These locations establish a much deeper connection between the bender and their element, and usually marks them as a master.Legend has it that when the world falls into chaos, there will be someone who is capable of mastering all 4 elements, drawing power from 4 different elemental wells, and using it to bring balance to the world.

entries.title: goblin
entries.content: 💚 Goblin The green short stacks with big ears. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} By me! By me! By Veroid Crom? It's what google says but twitter account is deleted {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} | Language | Goblin | | -------- | -------- | | Size | Small | | Type | Humanoid | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features UnderfootYou can enter and leave a creature's space without provoking AoOs from it. You flank them as long as another ally threatens.Strength in NumbersWhen you flank, your bonus is +3 instead of +2. This also applies to your [companion] creatures. Minor Features Nice Ears+2 bonus to perceptionNight VisionYou treat dim light as bright light. You treat darkness as dim light. Replace Features Major Roll With It [elusive]When you take damage, you can choose to recoil as an immediate action. You move 10 feet in a direction of your choosing.Boom BotsAgainst any adjacent construct creature, you can attempt to make it go boom. As a standard action roll an engineering check to deal that much force damage to it (fort halves).Ankle BiterYou gain a bite attack that deals d6 base damage.When a creature rolls a combat maneuver check against you and fails to break your poise, you can make a simple bite attack against them as an AoO.Rubber BodyYou only take 1 damage per 10 ft you fall and cannot be drained from falling. You can take the jump action as a free action 1/turn when you take fall damage.You gain compression.RetreatDisengage as a swift action.Gigantic EarsEven for gobbo, your ears are exceptionally large. This allows you to clearly hear distant sounds, and focus your hearing much like you might your eyes. With line of effect you can clearly hear whispers 30 ft away, average conversation up to 100 ft away and shouting 300 ft away. This functions even in the presence of other noise, such as in crowds or noisy bars.Your ears are very bouncy and expressive.Cover Up+2 deception. Increases to +4 if you pin the blame of an event on another immediately present or otherwise reasonably plausible. Larger bonus also applies when creating a diversion to hide. * Minor Just a Little Kick [elusive]When you shoot a gun, you can choose to let the recoil knock you back 10 ft in the opposite direction you shot.Industrious+2 bonus to engineeringFriend not FoodYou can speak to beasts, but only if they are tiny or smaller. You cannot willingly harm such creatures.Mixed BloodGain a minor feature of another race (including alternate features). You count as both races for all purposes. * Lore NumbersGoblins are usually around 3 ft tall and around 30 lbsThey reach adulthood by 10 and live to be around 40Appearance and BiologyGoblins are short green people with oversized heads. They have large mouths, often with sharp teeth that fall out and regrow frequently. Even considering their oversized head, their ears are enormous, sometimes growing to be comically large. Some can even be a little on the fuzzy side, with fluffy ears closer to that of an animal, or a tail with a tuft of fur at the end of it.Goblins are lazy, and tend to present themselves in a candid manner without a lot of attention to their physical appearance. This typically means they wear styles that require the smallest amount of maintenance: bald heads, no makeup, wearing the same things they wore as a kid, never changing out of their armor. Goblin engineers may just wear overalls and nothing else because its all it takes to get the job done. Goblins also tend to be less concerned with cleanliness than other races. If it isn't required, then its pretty low on the priority list.Mine!A goblins short life span and dubious morals combined with their ravenous hunger and general laziness all combine to create a race that rarely has anything to show for their existence. While other races create cities and monuments, goblins prefer to move into wherever is mostly convenient. Goblins will treat the ruins of an ancient city as though they had always lived there, and will make up stories for how they made things. They will invade small towns to kick out their current inhabitants without giving much thought to the consequences when the survivors come to back to take their town backed by the local government. This lack of foresight, or perhaps lack of caring for the consequences of their actions contributes to the shortness of the goblin's lifespan.An actual city with tens of thousands of people or more started up and run by goblins is completely unheard of. Most goblin settlements tend to crumple under their own weight once they reach a certain size. Or they get too big for their britches and anger the wrong adventuring party, local rich person or monster, resulting in a hard reset in a new place.LeechesGoblin tendencies make them terrible at governance, but that doesn't make them completely incompatible with "civilized" society. Small enclaves of goblins will often be a part of any city they aren't outright banned from. Whether their old family died, they were abandoned at a young age, or they fantasize about fancy living, goblins frequently find themselves wandering into towns with nothing but the clothes on their back and a dream of the good life. Alas, the talents they have accrued living out in the wilderness do little to help them live honest lives, and the city is hardly kinder than the outside. City goblins tend towards petty crime or sex work in order to make ends meet. As such, even the upstanding goblin citizens have a mighty uphill battle against the stereotypes of goblin raiders that haunt peoples dreams and the goblin whores that attend to their carnal desires.Their lack of experience with working in general makes them unreliable workers at best. Savvy employers often exploit young goblins, knowing they're going to burn out quick anyway. Might as well get the value while you can. The deception works both ways as the goblins are always finding ways to slip goods they're supposed to sell into their pockets, or take a little bit of money from the register when nobody is looking.Superior GeneticsWhile the picture people paint of goblins is typically negative, they still manage to maintain a steady(ish) population and a consistent place in peoples minds. They bring a certain energy to everything they do that is unlike most other races. Extreme optimism, lack of expertise combined with a general trust of whoever feeds them makes goblins excellent companions for maintaining morale. Due to their short-sightedness, every victory is worth celebrating and every plan with a huge payout is a banger idea. Goblins never settle with success. When they hit the jackpot they keep rolling. When they lose it all, they say double or nothin'. Every defeat they survive is a new opportunity.Goblins make up for their numerous negative traits with their ability to learn things quickly, and with novel approaches. Engineer is basically synonymous with inventor for goblins, as they refuse to use the principles they are educated on for practical purposes, always forging their own path. If it isn't a spell and it explodes, it was probably a goblin that made it.Goblins are also nearly as fond of race mixing as humans. It'd be more accurate to say they are just fond of breeding, but they aren't picky with partners. They have the hardware to accommodate for larger races, and they are happy to take good genes when they find them. Combined with their short lifespans, goblins can quickly morph to physically resemble whatever other race is most dense within a few generations.

entries.title: hellion
entries.content: Hellion The horny race. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Art by me! {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageInfernalSizeMedium or smallTypeHumanoid, Fiend {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features DarkvisionYou can see in the dark as well as you could in light, albeit in grayscale.Innate Casting@1 Cast wave of darkness 1/day@3 Cast darkness 1/day@5 Cast encroaching darkness 1/day Minor Features TailYou have an additional prehensile limb that can manipulate objects and hold them just as your hands would. You cannot wield weapons with your tail.Delicious and NutritiousYou can consume dirt, sand, ash, dust etc. for nourishment Replace Features MajorInfernal EngineYou gain resistance to fire damage. Anything you touch takes 1 fire damage per turn. This does not apply to attacks, but it does apply when you grapple or are grappled.Sacrificial Pact (Su) [healing]By cutting yourself and bleeding on another creature as a standard action, you take (3+lvl) true damage, and heal the creature for double that amount. You can only heal a maximum of your current hp.HornyYou have pointed or ram-like horns and a skull that's harder than most. You gain a natural attack with d10 (crush or pierce) base damage. You can make a simple attack with these horns as a swift action, but its damage decreases to d4 and you become clumsy 1 on hit from how disorienting it is to swing your head into creatures.Natural ArmorYour body is covered in scales, obsidian, or metal plates that protect you, but limit your movement and chafes against traditional armor. You gain +4 ac, but you cannot add dexterity to AC and cannot wear armor. Natural armor also does not give poise. * Minor Maw and ClawEven without a weapon, you are always armed. You have a set of claws and a bite that deal d10 base damage.GlideWhile not movement impaired, take no fall damage. When falling, move horizontally 10 feet per 5 foot fallen at a speed of 60.Polymorph [poly, true]One specific human shape that cannot be altered. Usable 1/day for 10 minutes. Minor fiendish features remain.Thiefling+2 bonus to sleight of hand.Planar Intuition+2 bonus to planes checks. Automatically succeed on identifying portals to the demon realm. * Lore NumbersStand around 5'6 and weigh around 150 lbsSmall variants are about half as tall and 1/5 the weightHellion are adults by 15 and live to be around 70 years old. When created they usually form biologically in early adulthood.Appearance and biologyHellion are roughly human shaped, but can come in many different forms. Many have spaded or forked tails they can use to grab objects. Some have vestigial wings. The most common features are a Hellion's Horns on their head. They come in all different shapes and sizes: Long curved horns like a ram, short pointed horns, multiple pairs of horns, only a single horn.They often superficially resemble the race they were before their fiendish transformation with pointed elf ears or orcish tusks, but that’s where the similarities typically end. Hellion can have wildly different skin colors from crimson red to a grayish blue. Some of them even have furry digitigrade lower halves with cloven hooves.Hellion that try to mesh well into society will dress in whatever the locals wear. As a result of how they are created, many take the opportunity to devote themselves to Brazzeria and wear her ceremonial garb. Though the stereotypical freshly created hellion will likely get piercings, decorate their horns in jewelry and wear indecent clothing just to be contrarian.Open your HeartHellion are created by a Brazzerian purification ritual used on demons that were once mortal. Many fiends are beyond redemption, but those that aren't can be exposed to kindness, care and respect to slowly restore their humanity. Brazerrian priests and priestesses are able to read the hearts to fiends to tell whether they are closed or open, representing their receptiveness to healing the fiendish corruption. Over time they can (usually) be exposed to enough kindness to eventually open their heart and begin the transformation.Freshly transformed hellions have no memories of their previous life before being a fiend, but they do vividly remember what happened during their time as a fiend: All of the suffering they caused, all the lives they’ve taken and all of the kindness they were treated with in order to regain their humanity. After some rehabilitation, they are given a choice to join the cause or return back to society.RacismUnfortunately for hellion, there are scars caused by fiends all over the world. Many people do not understand the intricacies of fiendish creation, or the humanity restoration the hellion undergo. As such, newly created hellion that do not stay under the protective wings of Brazzeria can often be in for a rough time. Small communities of hellion can often be found on the fringes of places where there is a great deal of Brazzerian influence.The racism can go both ways; providing hardship as well as opportunity. Hellion will often find themselves getting approached by unsavory individuals looking for a new hire in their organized crime ring. They will also find it difficult to shake off the "sex demon" stereotype perpetuated by the prolific and every present succubi/twinkubi. It does serve them well when finding dates or getting jobs at brothels at least.

entries.title: human
entries.content: Human The default race. Humans with the mixed blood trait replace the traditional half breed races. Other races with the mixed blood feature are predominantly the original race, only slightly resembling the other parent. Humans are purposefully designed to be pretty generic.  {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Art by me! {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} | Language | Any non secret | | -------- | -------------- | | Size | Medium | | Type | Humanoid | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features SkillGain a bonus skillFeatGain a bonus feat Minor Features IntermingleOnce per day when rolling an opposed skill check against another creature, reroll it.Skill+Get a +2 bonus to any skill Replace Features | Major | | | --------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Big Skill | Gain skill focus as a bonus feat at lvl 1, 5 and 10 | | Race Mixing | Gain a major feature of another race (including alternate features). You count as both races for all purposes. | | Top Percentage | Get a +2 bonus to any skill. | | Versatility | Change the ability score used for a one skill you are proficient in | | Technique | Gain a technique point, only useable within your specialization(s) | | Signature Skill | Gain the signature skill feat in a skill you are proficient in | * MinorMixed BloodGain a minor feature of another race (including alternate features). You count as both races for all purposes.If you have mixed blood more than once, you must choose the features from the same race * Lore NumbersHumans stand around 5'6 and weigh around 150 lbs Humans are adults by 15 and live to be around 70 years old.Humans in FantasyPersonally, I've never given humans much thought in fantasy. I don't think they should be particularly different than they are in real life because they serve as an anchor for people not accustomed to fantasy. Lots of players like to play self-insert characters, and lots of DMs like to have human settlements to provide places where they don't have to think much about culture, history, mannerisms, architecture etc. I think humans are just fine as is, no changes needed. They are a nice glue to keep all the mismatched wild races of fantasy together.

entries.title: orc
entries.content: Orc The big green bully race. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Bayard Wu Jordan Kerbow {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageOrcSizeMediumTypeHumanoid {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features Bully+2 bonus to attack with combat maneuversFerocity [recharge]When you are reduced to zero hit points, you are not defeated until the end of your next turn. On your next turn you are staggered. If while in ferocity you are healed before your next turn, you are not defeated at the end of your next turn, and this ability is not consumed.This ability can only activate once per minute. Minor Features Natural Athlete+2 bonus to athleticsNight VisionYou treat dim light as bright light. You treat darkness as dim light. Replace Features Major Bullying Blow [recharge]As a swift action, enhance your next melee attack this turn to deal poise damage equal to its hp damage. This ability cannot be used in consecutive turns.VengefulWhenever a creature does damage or poise damage to you, you can mark them as an immediate action. You gain +2 attack against them until you mark someone else.Bathe in BloodAny turn you take bleed damage (AKA it isn't negated), your slashing weapons gain the bleed property. As a swift action, you lick your blade to take 3 bleed damage.Blood ScentYour melee attacks gain seeking against wounded creaturesPorcGain blindsense (scent, 10 ft)SavageryGet a technique point in the barbarism treeEyes on the PrizeYour lazy eye allows you to focus on multiple creatures at once. Three creatures need to threaten you in order to flank you. Certain features that augment flanking, like the beast companion's battle buddy, negate this feature.CataractsYour stubbornness against lesser creatures who say "you can't stare at the sun" manifests in your ability to stare directly into the sun and emerge still able to see. You have immunity to the blurred vision and blinded conditions, but suffer -4 perception. * | Minor | | | ----------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | Lift | +100 carry weight | | Gate Crusher | +2 bonus on athletics to break or move things. You can roll athletics to break an object while charging at a foe as a free action 1/round. | | Tenacious | 1/day reroll a fortitude or will save. | | Stoic | You need to be shaken, sickened or clumsy 2 before you suffer any numerical penalties from said conditions. | | Firelord's Chosen | Whenever you deal fire damage, increase the damage by 1. | | Spooky | +2 bonus to intimidation | * Lore NumbersOrcs are usually around 6' and weigh 200 lbs, with a great deal of variance both up and downOrcs are adults by 10 and usually live to be about 50Appearance and BiologyThe most telling feature of the orc is the shape of their skull. They have large jaws with an underbite in order to accommodate for their tusks. They also tend to have short pointed ears and either green or gray skin. Some orcs that live in desert regions can get a reddish hue to their skin. Orcs are much larger than most humanoids, typically being taller and having a much higher muscle density. Even the females share this quality.Orcs are very generous with the beatings they give their body, even when it comes to fashion. They get body and face tattoos, piercings all over and they use scars to trace patterns in their flesh. They commonly dress themselves in furs and leathers, or whatever handy material they can harvest from the creatures they hunt: There's no easier way to show off your greatest kill than to wear in on your sleeve. Literally.BarbarismNo two words fit well together quite like orc barbarian. The prototypical barbarian lives only by killing other creatures. Depending on how annoying their neighbors are, this could even mean other humanoids. Individual orcs tend to keep to themselves. It is only when large groups of orcs gather together where they start becoming a problem for anything around them. It isn't uncommon for a charismatic leader to arise among tribes and unify a few hundred (or more). Then, emboldened by their numbers, they try to take over surrounding towns.More often than not, these types of battles happen between orcs and other orcs. Orcs will have long and drawn out histories of their clan and the surrounding ones, with shaky alliances and even shakier reasons for breaking them. The call for glory in battle is often answered with an almost religious zeal.It isn't all blood in guts within the walls of orc villages. They take great interest in animals; and not just to eat them! They make excellent beast tamers and in general are talented when it comes to the druidic arts. Even the barbarians have animal spirits they use to guide their bestial fighting styles. Orcs are surprisingly mindful when it comes to maintaining a natural equilibrium in their local ecosystem. Unfortunately, they don't share the same degree of respect for places they consider far from home.Friend or Foe?Because of their proclivity for violence, orcs are near universally feared and avoided unless necessary. Orc culture can be very intimidating to outsiders who are accustomed to less violence. So their questions become "can I trust an orc?" or "are orcs dangerous?" This typically depends on the situation. If you hear the war horns, most definitely. But most situations aren’t nearly as cut and dry. Travelling along the road and seeing a half dozen group eyeing your party might make a merchant sweat a little. Much to the dismay of traveling merchants, they will likely end up in many situations with orcs where they are forced to choose between their goods or their life. Orcs are bullies that use the threat of violence as leverage in order to get what they want. Unfortunately for orcs, they are also prone to misdirection. Convince them that there is a much more lucrative option and they might spare you and your goods.OutsidersOrcs that don't align with a particular tribe tend to be drifters, hopping into whatever group their particular talents and morals are well suited for. Common entries are mercenary groups, organized crime and state militaries. Most people tend to view orcs with the same kind of wariness one affords a natural predator; respect, but stay cautious. This serves them well when they want to rise through the ranks of a military, but does little to aid in friendly relations with others. Rarely does a town have a neighborhood filled primarily with orcs, but they tend to pepper any town with more than a few thousands people.Separated from traditional orc culture, orcs can find great success with studies of magic and the arts just like most other people, but they have a bit of an uphill battle getting past stereotypes,

entries.title: pints
entries.content: Pints The genetically engineered small race. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageAny non-secretSizeSmallTypeHumanoidMood SwingYour skin color is prone to frequent changes that you cannot control. In return, you see everyone else's mood as a colorful aura around them.You get a +2 bonus to opposed skill checks and other interpersonal skills like persuasion. Creatures can identify your overall mood by just looking at your colors. Creatures get a +8 bonus on insight checks against you.Mutation: MinorPick one from the list under replace minor features. {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features Mutation: MajorPick one from the list under replace major features. Minor Features Mixed bloodYour ancestors were once another race and inherit a minor trait from it Replace Features Major Mutation: Aquatic You have gills, webbed fingers etc. You are amphibious and have a swim speed equal to land speed. You also have an addition set of transparent eyelids that give you advantage on saves to resist blurred vision and blinded.Mutation: Expanded Intellect [recharge]Your cranium is abnormally large and abnormally good at remembering things. 1/day you can perfectly recall anything you have ever experienced in your entire life. This is usually limited to a single freeze frame for things you have seen, such as a page in a book. Or it is limited to a minute or so of spoken words. For events as part of backstory, consider rolling luck to see if it actually happened to determine of its realistic to recall something about it.Mutation: ChameleonYou can change the color of your skin as a free action whenever you hide. Gain concealment against creatures farther than 5 ft away from you. You cannot use this feature to start hiding while directly observed, but can do so to prowl in areas lacking concealment/cover after using it out of sight.Mutation: Pipsqueak (Su) [poly, true]As a standard action, you can transform into a specific tiny terrestrial animal such as a rat, a lizard or a chicken. You choose what animal you become at character creation and it cannot be changed. You also transform into this creature when defeated. It requires a standard action to transform back to your humanoid form. * Minor Underfoot+2 stealthFind a Cure!+2 alchemyMutation: Prehensile TailYou have a long and powerful tail that can be used to hold and manipulate objects, but not wield equipment like weapons, shields and staves.Mutation: Bio luminescenceYour hair, eyes or skin can emanate light in a 20 ft radius. You can turn this on or off 1/turn as a free action.Mutation: AdhesionYour body has little hairs or suction cups to help you cling to surfaces. You gain a climb speed equal to your land speed, and can use it along any solid surface, even up smooth walls and along ceilings. * Lore NumbersPints tend to be 2'6'' tall and weigh ~20 lbsThey reach adulthood by 15 and live to be about 70ShortstackiumOnce upon a time there existed a large and prosperous city inside of the land of earth called Pint. The natural ebb and flow of the world caused resources like food to grow scarce. Many solutions were tried and failed but one mad scientist saw the solution that nobody else could: Half resource consumption by shrinking everyone down to half size.He spent his entire life being looked down upon, and now it was going to be his turn. He created a chemical compound he called shortstackium that, even in small doses, could cause people to shrink in size significantly. He found clever ways to get this substance into the food and water supply. He put trace amounts into his potions that he sold to adventurers.It was very fast acting, causing people to shrink by the time they awoke the next day. Due to its complexity and strangeness, it took a few weeks to identify the problem and another month to eliminate most of its circulation, getting its creator thrown in jail in the process. His solution was quite effective, but it completely transformed people unwillingly, often with strange side effects. No alchemist has ever managed to figure out how to reverse the effects, and the effects are passed down through children. Appearance and BiologyBecause shorstackium was most effective on humans, the typical pint most closely resembles humans, but pints resembling other races also exist. A great deal of genetic mutation happened as a result of initial incident. This has caused all kinds of changes to the pints.Some common

entries.title: polymerization
entries.content: Polymerization The gooey fusion race. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} | Language | Depends on origin race | | ----------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Size | Depends on origin race | | Type | Ooze | | Gooeyness | +2 | | Origin Race | Polymerizations (shortened to Poly) are fusions between a unique ooze creature and a creature they consumed. As such, they share the size and racial language of a specific race. | | Mixed Blood | Gain a minor feature of another race (including alternate features). You count as both races for all purposes.Must match origin race. | {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features StretchDuring your turn, your natural reach increases by 5 ft.BlindsenseTremor (5 ft). Functions on land and at sea Minor Features CompressionYou are able to move through spaces designed for creatures 1 size smaller than you without treating it as difficult terrain. You are able to move through spaces designed for creatures 2 sizes smaller than you by treating it as difficult terrain Replace Features | Major | | | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Bounce Off | As an immediate action when you are hit with crush damage in melee, you can force the attacking creature 10 ft back | * | Minor | | | --------- | ------------------ | | Amorphous | AC+11 to crit you. | * Lore NumbersHeight and weight are roughly the same as the creature they consumedPoly lead a relatively short life and split at 40.ConsumptionOnce upon a time an alchemist created an ooze capable of forming a special bond with a person it consumes. They tried to kill it after it had consumed someone close to them, but poly only multiply when killed after absorbing a creature. Their death triggers a reaction where they split into two unintelligent amorphous blobs that seek creatures to consume. Since this event, they have slowly spread. Some non-poly use these slime creatures as a method to continue their life after suffering health complications, other people fear their hunger for intelligent life, but most know nothing about the origin of poly.Appearance and BiologyPoly share the general shape of the person they consumed. While poly are somewhat amorphous, this is their "true form" that they do not deviate from too much. As oozes, they are often viscous and jello-like, coming in a variety of colors. Pressing your finger to their skin, it would bend, but it would be difficult to break. They are generally at least semi-transparent.Despite having the ability to remove imperfections, such as scars, missing teeth, slices of ear missing, poly keep these qualities. Instead the alterations they make usually add completely new features, like antennae, horns or tattoos.Poly generally have "barbie bod" smoothing over their intimate parts, and can get away with not wearing any clothing, but many still do. When they do wear clothing, they always choose things that are exceptionally elastic to accommodate for their stretching formsDespite having little in common with humanoids in terms of their biology, they will usually still try to mimic how creatures hold things with fingers and eat with their mouths. It can still be a bit awkward watching their food slowly dissolve in their goo (one reason why they like to wear clothing).Memories of the PastWhile it is clear that a poly loses its soul when it dies and splits, all poly are essentially clones of their "parents" combined with some other creature unfortunate enough to be eaten. Some aspects of their predecessors' consciousness seep into their own. As such, poly often have unusual senses of self. Many of their thoughts are dominated by the memories and feelings of the creature they consumed. While they rest, their dreams are often filled with memories of their previous life. Consuming creatures with particularly strong convictions can lead to the poly working to achieve similar goals. Some poly learn more about their origin and feel guilt towards what must have happened in order for them to exist. Other poly don't understand why they have a head filled with the memories of an outsider, and do everything they can to avoid things that trigger these alien memories.

entries.title: poplin
entries.content: Poplin The toy companion race. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} By Joecanvas {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageRacial language of bonded siblingSizeSmallTypeHumanoid, ConstructMiniaturizeAs a standard action, you can shrink drastically to the size of an action figure, only a few inches tall. This decreases your speed to 15 and causes you to deal half damage with any of your attacks, but gives you hide in plain sight among toys. You can grow back to your usual size as a standard action.Bonded SiblingPoplin are born from the wishes of children as they play with their toys. They never physically grow like their sibling does, but they grow as people in tandem. Poplins die when their bonded sibling die. When their sibling takes damage, they know. They can always tell the direction of their sibling. {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features Amiibo [companion]With 8 hours of work and 100g worth of materials, you can create a toy/plushie etc that mimics the appearance of you or another creature. If you make it out of another creature, that creature must perform a brief ritual requiring one minute of contact to enable its magical effects. This amiibo functions like an old school telephone, capable of sending and receiving calls, but is limited specifically between the amiibo and the creature that it was constructed to resemble. There are modes to the amiibo that make it silent, vibrate or make loud noise in order to indicate contact.Amiibos of bonded siblings do not cost companion slots. It's also no substitute for interacting with them in person. Minor Features Toy SpeechWhile in miniature form, you gain the ability to speak to other inanimate toys. This can include things like plushies, action figures, dolls, rubber duckies and anything similar. They are generally only able to communicate things that they have seen or heard recently.Mix and MatchYour ability to exchange limbs, hair and such gives you +2 disguise. Replace Features Major Magic Wisdom BallYou gain an additional use of prayer. If you had none, gain one. The answer is revealed to you through a physical object inside of your body. Other people can use your prayer to ask questions. This functions similarly to a magic conch or magic 8 ball esque item.TransformerAs part of your build you were designed to also be a tool or a more complex toy. Once you choose what form you can take, it cannot be changed without significant physical augmentation. As a standard action you can transform into or back from this alternate form. You function as a masterwork tool for any creature using you, giving them a +2 bonus, or +4 if you are trained in the skill (treated as assisting). You could also transform into other objects such as a pogo stick (increase jump height to movespeed) or a bike (increase speed to 50).While in this form, you can only perform your intended purpose, move or transform back. * Minor Wind UpYou have a mechanism that allows you to perform very high jumps by storing kinetic energy. "Winding up" requires 3 standard actions. When wound up, you can boost the next jump action that you take to allow you to jump as high and as far as you can move.BobbleheadYour head is built to be much better at absorbing shock. Creatures need to roll 11+AC to crit you.Collector's EditionYour pedigree precedes you, lending you more credence than you deserve. +2 deceptionKung-Fu GripDR10 vs disarm. * Lore NumbersPoplin are around 2'6, and weigh around 30 lbsPolpin do not age. Their life is inherently tied to another, and they live as long as their bonded siblingMagic of LifeAs animated toys, poplin cannot reproduce, nor can they be created consistently. Instead there is a mysterious force that animates the toys of children experiencing hardship. Wizards debate the origin, but the transformation is obviously magical in origin, so its probably another powerful anonymous mage. Either way, these creatures come into being with the same mentality as the young children that create them: that of a curious ignorant creature with a generally positive outlook on the world, especially their bonded sibling, whom they immediately feel kinship towards.AppearancePoplins often have strange appearances that are facsimiles of humanoid creatures. Common ones are plushies and action figures. As such they often have seems and stitches, very visible joints, shiny, smooth or fluffy surfaces. They are often able to move in unnatural ways, such as turning their limbs all the way around or turning inside out to change their appearance; toys are creative. Usually poplin are afforded a bit more mobility than most other toys and plushies, with bending fingers and flapping lips to allow for fine manipulation and speech.Poplin generally stay about the same in appearance as they age from when they are magically willed into existence unless they go out of their way to replace parts of themselves. During old age, they start to literally fall apart as their sibling deteriorates. Their colors fade, seams pop and joints creak.Sibling SquabblesThe way that poplin view their bonded sibling is just that, as though they were siblings. There generally a great degree closeness between a poplin and their sibling. They often play together, help each other out, fight over who gets the last cookie etc.Childhood is usually the easy part, as the poplins dependence on their sibling doesn't matter as much for carefree children with a lot of free time. Poplin often find it difficult to get out of the naïve mindset of a child. So once their sibling becomes an adult, they can often become less important. Suddenly all of those sleepovers and woodland adventures are replaced by the reality and responsibility of adulthood. Poplin can find it difficult coming to terms with living apart from their bonded sibling, often being seen as the toys they resemble. Nothing is more crushing than hearing something like "Oh that's just a toy I used to play with as a kid." From their sibling. Those that adjust well settle for frequent family gatherings, settling as coworkers or adventurers.Poplin separated from their sibling, young or old, are incomplete. They are missing an important part of themselves. Parents who take the poplin away or siblings that distance themselves in adulthood put themselves in danger, for there are few fixations stronger than that of a disgruntled poplin separated from their sibling. Poplin separated from their bonded siblings invariably become menaces to the people or society they see as the cause of their torment.

entries.title: shades
entries.content: Shades The definitely not Midna race. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Maniac Paint Tail Blazer {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageNecrilSizeSmallTypeHumanoid {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features DarkvisionYou can see in the dark as well as you could in light, albeit in grayscale.Hairy [concentration]You have an additional hand that forms from your hair that can be used to hold objects, but not wield or activate them. You can also use this limb to perform combat maneuvers such as grapple.If you concentrate (free action), you can extend the reach of this hand to 10 ft, or 20 ft when in dim light or darkness.This single limb is more than enough to hold your own body weight and lift you to high places.If your hair is ever cut, it grows back within a week. Minor Features Pattern Recognition?Your skin consists of 2 primary colors, and you can shift them around to create varying patterns.+2 DisguiseMagic Tattoos (Su)You can inscribe faintly glowing lines along surfaces by tracing with your fingers in a specific color, chosen at character creation. You can automatically remove the linesDispel magic automatically gets rid of all writing. Some scrubbing also gets the job done.If you draw on your own skin, only you can remove them. Replace Features Major Shadow Realm (Su) [teleportation]After channeling for 1 minute without taking damage, you can open up a 10x10 ft portal to your own pocket dimension for 1 round. The shadow realm is a black mostly featureless void with a tangible floor, but not much else. You can bring in any number of creatures, or any amount of objects so long as it can be brought in within 1 round.This dimension can only exist as long as you are inside of it and alive. If you leave, are banished or die, the contents of the dimension are immediately ejected to the same point you entered from.Shadow Friend (Su)[recharge] [scrying]You can animate your shadow and have it walk around. You can see and hear through your shadow. Your shadow can move anywhere as long as there is a continuous stream of dim light or darkness connecting you and your shadow. As a shadow, you must move along a continuous surface at all times. If 2 surfaces are not connected, you cannot move between them. You can easily move along walls or ceilings however.While animating your shadow, a tether connects you that is significantly darker than even complete darkness, visible to creatures with night vision or darkvision. If the shadow or the tether is attacked, or if the shadow/tether is exposed to bright light, shadow friend immediately ends.Shade Magic (Su)You have a hover speed of 30 ft.Insubstantial (Su)[mana burn]As a FRA, you can [mana burn] 1 in order to pass through a surface no thicker than 1 ft. Once you appear, you are dazed for 1 round.By placing your hand on a wall, you can tell when you can and cannot use this ability. * Minor Underfoot+2 stealth * Lore NumbersShades tend to be 3'6 tall and weigh 40 lbsThey reach adulthood by 12 and live to be about 60Appearance and BiologyShades are short in stature with mostly smooth skin that is a mixture of a dull dark color, usually black, and some other low saturation brighter color, usually blue. These two colors can form unique patterns on the skin, much like how animal fur patterns exist. Their eyes and hair tend to be more vibrant colors, contrasting their dull skin. They grow hair on their heads much faster than other races, forcing them to get frequent haircuts. Thanks to their magical abilities, their hair can appear even longer than it is. They also inscribe tattoos on their skin for added customization.Shades possess the usual sex organs present in most humanoids, but their innate magical abilities gives them the ability to hide most features on their skin to give themselves "barbie bod," making their body smooth and featureless. As such, some opt to not even wear clothing. Most do wear clothing, and they prefer things that show off their skin and are frilly like dresses and veils.Shadow CursedThere exists a land in Nick Nacks considered uninhabitable by most known as the Shadow-Cursed lands. These islands are plagued with eternal darkness as a result of a curse placed upon them by the vampiric overlords that desired more suitable living conditions. As such, all kinds of undead spawn inside of this area. The souls of heroes that tried to cleanse this land serve as ammunition for all of the necromantic research that happens within.Many years ago, an enclave of goblins was forced to flee by sea and was chased to one of these shadow-cursed islands. The goblins thought they had lost their pursuers, but the adventurers were merely unwilling to follow, having heard the rumors of the treacherous environments that often lie within. The adventurers claimed their gold for a job well done, and the goblins were forgotten.Snap back to the present day where the shadow-cursed islands have become a much greater focus of adventuring parties and that same island was explored. Much to their surprise, the adventurers found creatures settling in these lands that weren't interested in stealing their souls. More and more sightings of this magical small race with strange dexterous hair were noted all around the world. As scholars began compiling data about these Shades as they called themselves, they were able to trace their history back to that group of goblins all those years ago. Shades have since become the envoys between the shadow-cursed isles and the rest of the world, working as guides and teachers.Twilight PrincessAside from the physical changes the goblins experienced, they also went through many cultural shifts. They learned a new language that they used to read records etched into the abandoned stony ruins they initially called home and to communicate with the locals. Through this learning, one of their leaders was able to befriend a local witch, and received some magical boons in return. Over time the relationship between the goblins and this witch deepened. The goblins would happily attend to her needs, acquiring rare materials, scouting out new islands to set up bases and dispatching pests. Soon enough she was referred to as the twilight princess and highly revered by all.After many generations of goblins living in the shadow cursed lands and receiving these magical boons, they stopped being goblins after a certain point. Their skin and hair had completely changed colors to more closely resemble their princess. Their relationship with the twilight princess deepened their magical capabilities. The more treacherous environment and dependence on the princess had changed their culture. One day without warning, the twilight princess disappeared, leaving behind only an infant that closely resembled her and a letter to her people, who she referred to as her little shades. The name stuck and since then, the twilight princess has been treated as royalty. She continues to guide the shades through life in the shadow cursed lands.

entries.title: shroomkin
entries.content: Shroomkin Shroomlette's race. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Art!" %} Art by me! {% endtab %} {% tab title="Universal Traits" %} LanguageSylvanSizeMediumTypeHumanoid, PlantMycotoxic Flesh[poison]You excrete a subtle poison from your pores. Prolonged contact (basically anything that isn't an attack) from something as innocuous as a handshake or hug is enough to proc the poison. When the poison takes hold, the creature stands there in a stupor, waiting for a command (fort negates). This allows you to make a simple request that can be performed quickly and easily (kiss me, do a flip, open that door). Repeated exposure eventually makes creatures immune to your poison. {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Major Features Palliative Caps5/day shrooms on your body can be plucked and eaten as a standard action that heal 5 hp. These mushrooms deliver the shroomkin's mycotoxic flesh poison. Eating yourself isn't cannibalism, its normal. Minor Features Natural Remedies+2 AlchemyMixed BloodChoose the minor feature of another race (including alternate features). You count as both races for all purposes. Replace Features | Major | | | ----------------- | ------------------------- | | Poison Resistance | Gain resistance to poison | * Minor Rent Free [bond]With a 1 minute ritual, you can infect a creature with spores to establish a mental connection with them. You can speak telepathically with this creature over any distance.You automatically established this connection with your parents and children. It does not have the [bond] tag for them.Goomshroom BlessedYou can innately cast bubble (shroomlette 1) 1/day.One of UsYou can speak with plants/plant creatures. Unintelligent inanimate plants are limited to simple single word responses. You get a +2 bonus on skill checks related to plant creatures and when interacting with them. * Lore NumbersShroomkin are generally around 5' tall and weigh about 120 lbsThey are adults by 10 and live to be about 50AppearanceShroomkin are humanoids whose most telling feature is their ability to grow mushrooms on their body. They feel a certain kinship towards the fungus and form a symbiotic relationship with it. The mushrooms are most common on their head, but they can grow all over: Its only a matter of where they groom that decides where they grow. In order to not be seen as monsters, most shroomkin tend to keep most of their body clean. Another telling feature is that shroomkin never have white scaleras, always favoring darker and duller colors.Because shroomkin easily blend together with other races, they come in a wide variety of colors. The type of mushrooms they grow on their skin can also change very quickly due over a few generations. Certain mixes with shroomkin can create wildly different mushroom flavors from a hellion's spicy shroom to a watery geniekin's minty shroom.BiologyJust like the mushroom itself, there's a lot more happening under the hood with shroomkin and their relationship to fungus. They constantly maintain a thin layer of mucous, making their skin always well-moisturized and slick to the touch. Shroomkin typically use this poisonous excretion as a method to mess with people, but can be used to remedy a great deal of situations, provided they can make contact to deliver it.An interesting quirk to shroomkin biology is that when they conceive, instead of gestating over a long period of time, they grow a special mushroom (cluster?) on the exterior of their body that their child(ren) will eventually sprout from over the short period of a few weeks. Shroomkin babies are very small when compared to races of similar sizes, but they are a lot more mobile, capable of crawling, clinging and even climbing after only a few hours. This accelerated physical development continues until they reach adulthood, but their mental lags behind a few years by comparison, leading most "adult" shroomkin to more closely resemble teenagers in how they act. Shroomkin males paired with other races produce offspring of the mother's race.GoomshroomThere is a specific type of fungus that only grows in areas blessed by the persistent drizzle of a goo dragon. With the shape and patterns of a mushroom and the colors and antennae of the goo dragon, the goomshroom is a treasured item that is always treated with great care. These sentient fungi live several times longer than the shroomkin and usually serve the role of a "village elder" who will pass down stories from generation to generation and be their voice of wisdom.Shroomkin will sometimes call upon the goo dragon during times of great crises. There is no guarantee they will come, but the good nature of the goo dragon means it will usually answer the call and come to their aid. Other groups of shroomkin have a very close relationships with the goo dragons and they serve as the settlement's protector.Blessing of the ShroomletteThe Shroomlette is the shroomkin god of happiness, rest and fertility. One of the few gods that exists in the realm of mortals. She resides in a garden filled with all kinds of oddities that rests on the clouds above a mushroom forest. There she resides, forever resting in a shiny cradle, waiting to be tucked in by a visitor. The Garden is commonly used as a place of mediation since all forms of violence are forbidden within the domain of the Shroomlette.Occasionally when couples are unable to conceive or sometimes for more mysterious reasons, people will receive a blessing from The Shroomlette. A stork will deliver a baby shroomkin girl directly to their abode with mysterious origins. Many see this as a blessing, but others who aren't happy about their newfound responsibility see it as a burden, and do everything they can to get rid of it. Those that don't treat the child with love and care incur the wrath of the Shroomlette. With poor enough treatment, she may even curse them to be an adult trapped inside of a babies body for a time to experience the some of the anguish they put the child through.

entries.title: README
entries.content: General Thoughts Races don't give ability scores. Now you can choose your race based on what features you want. Bring out the jacked fairies and the clumsy elves! Most races have a racial language, but also know common.\ All creatures are assumed to have a base speed of 30ft. Keep in mind a lot of the lore I use to describe races is used to differentiate a given race from the others. I personally don’t appreciate when elves are just long pretty people. I also make it to give people a starting point if they don't know how to roleplay or world build with a specific race. The descriptions you find here (or in any source really) are specifically tailored to a setting, or are the brain child of some other fantasy obsessed weirdo. They do not need to match how a specific race exists in your world if you have something else in mind. For example...\ In the world I built my Lore around, Nack, elves primarily live in a continent known as "The Land of Storms" which has an absurdly high level of rainfall. As such, they developed a spell to combat it called Umbrella, which Elves often inherently learn, separate from any additional magic training. Doesn't make much sense for a subterranean elf now does it? {% hint style="danger" %} Races very often offer skill bonuses. Skill bonuses from race do not stack unless the two features are a pair of minor and major features. So you couldn't pick goblin and get perception from mixed blood elf's "nice ears" for instance. The only exception to this is if the skill bonuses only apply to specific circumstances, such as a cyborgs sentinel build. {% endhint %} Format TraitsThese usually cover some of the race basics, such as creature type, starting language etc. Some races come with a specific feature baked in that can't be exchanged. You will know if a race has this when they only have 1 major or minor feature.Major FeaturesAll races have 2. These are the heavy hitting features that generally aren't shared between races and have a major impact on game play.Minor FeaturesAll races have 2. Supplementary features such as skill bonuses that are less impactfulAlternate FeaturesAny features that pop up in major/minor features are features that you can exchange with anything listed in their respective feature type (major replaces major, minor replaces minor).LoreMy take on the shapes, sizes, ages, cultures, behavior, biology and origin of various races. Take what you like, scrap what you don't.

entries.title: other-skill-rules
entries.content: Other Skill Rules Taking 10 When not under duress, you can take 10 on skill checks. You normally cannot take 10 on opposed skill checks. Good for profession and general crafting. Taking 20 When not under duress, and with a lot of time on your hands, you can automatically achieve the result of rolling a 20. It takes 20 times as long as the task would normally take. It is also assumed that during this time, you fail several times, making it ill-suited for a situations where there are consequences on a fail (such as smashing a wall or deactivating an explosive). Group Skill Checks In certain circumstances, creatures may want to work together perform the same task. If it is something that can tangibly benefit from group effort (pushing over a large boulder, creating a spell etc.), use the bonus of the creature with the highest modifier, then get +1 for each assisting creature and +2 for each assistant creature that is proficient in the task at hand. In other circumstances, you may want to use skills as a group when you need to, even if it less than optimal, such as group stealth with a clumsy heavy armor user. In such scenarios, you use the bonus of the weakest link as though everybody were assisting them. Gambits Using a rule system inherently poses limitations on the actions that a player can take. The idea of gambits is to let players take their cool ideas and let them play out despite the games mechanics. If your player wants to do something that isn't necessarily covered by the rules (or only vaguely), then it counts as a gambit. The intention behind gambits is to create situations that have incredibly high risk and high reward. Before performing a gambit, the player tosses out a few ideas on how they plan to perform the action and the GM makes suggestions and/or adjustments based on circumstance. The GM should make it clear to the player what their roundabout odds are for completing a given gambit. Benefits for performing a gambit can include things like not taking fall damage with a plunging attack, gaining extra movement by swinging on things through danger or surviving otherwise deadly circumstances. Drawbacks for failing when attempting a gambit can include things like being CC'd, losing poise, losing hp or having their actions interrupted and made impossible. In extreme cases if players do something very silly, like jumping up cliffs or battling forces of nature, they may accumulate afflictions, or other long lasting debuffs.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Acrobatics Used for making risky jumps, traversing difficult terrain, and avoiding AoOs. Most actions are made as part of movement. Uses dex. Balance Acrobatics can be used to cross slippery surfaces coated in things like ice or oil. The DC is 10. Failing the check give you the knocked down condition until the start of your next turn. It can also be used to traverse or stand on incredibly small and unstable space such as a cliff side or a fallen tree branch. Jump You can also roll acrobatics to determine your jump distance/height to see if you can jump farther than your default jump distance. The distance you jump is equal to your acrobatics roll in feet, or half that in height. This still requires a swift action to perform. IF you are proficient in acrobatics, your default jump distance is increased by points in dex or str. Jumping does not increase your speed, and is thus limited by your movement speed. Wall Kick (P) As long as there are 2 walls within 5 feet of each other, you can continually hop between them to ascend. Only the upward distance you cover counts against your movement. Avoid AoO (P) Acrobatics is rolled against all threatening creatures’ reflex saves. The DC of their reflex save is equal to your acrobatics roll. If they succeed, you provoke as normal. Signature Skill Soften Fall When you take the jump action, you reduce falling damage by your acrobatics roll. Excuse me You can move through creature spaces without provoking from said creature, but you cannot end your turn inside of a creature's space. Strafing no longer provokes AoOs. Hopping You can jump as a free action once each turn.

entries.title: breaking-objects
entries.content: Breaking Objects Should we push over the tree or just cut it down? Players may find themselves in situations where it is unclear whether it would be more effective to just hack at their problem with their swords or try to break it open with brute strength. A lot of that depends on what it is you're trying to break and what it is you're using to break it. As a general rule, if the substance that you're using is more tough, and could reasonably damage the object you'd like to destroy (hammers aren't good at cutting ropes for instance) then you can damage/break the object just by swinging at it. Some consideration should still be taken about the size and scale of the object. Adamantine might cut through stone like butter, but a 3-ft thick stick of butter would still take quite a bit of effort to cut through. Use the following chart to determine roundabout how "tough" something is. FragilePaper, glass. clothAverageWood, plastic, leatherSolidStone, common metals, force effectsAdamantineRare metals, dragon scalesTransmundaneLightsaber, DM magic

If you want to tear a brick out of a wall, that would make breaking the stone easier. If you want to break down the entire wall, that is much more difficult.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Athletics Used for climbing and swimming, as well as moving heavy objects and breaking things. Uses str. Climb Assuming ideal climbing conditions, no check is required, such as when climbing an average tree. Spaces you climb through are considered difficult terrain. \ With athletics proficiency, you climb at full speed. Swim Assuming ideal climbing conditions, no check is required, such as when swimming in still water. Spaces you swim through are considered difficult terrain. \ With athletics proficiency, you swim at full speed. Brute Force For when there are no lockpicks or beasts of burden, you have elbow grease. The DC to break open a door is based on its material and reinforcements. You can also use athletics to represent bursts of adrenaline that allow you to surpass your normal carry weight to push over statues and punch boulders into lava. Catch Fall (P) As an immediate action, you can attempt to grab onto something to halt your falling, or to prevent an ally within reach from falling. The default DC to do this is 20. Creatures falling farther than 30 feet increase this DC even higher. Aquatic Combatant (P) With athletics proficiency, you take no penalty to fighting underwater with melee weapons. Signature Skill Triathlete You gain an additional 20 speed each turn you can use to climb and swim. Power Lifter Increase carry weight by 100.

entries.title: README
entries.content: History Tell Story You can use your vast knowledge pool to weave together important threads in history, making for a story that is both entertaining and informative. Identify Artifact Certain items may be tied to creatures or entities from the past. By identifying the craftsmanship and symbols on items, you can determine their origin/purpose. Interpret Hieroglyphs Ancient people often like to communicate without using the written word. You can interpret the meaning or significance in paintings, carvings, murals, statues and the like. Recall Past Events Major battles, great tragedies and turning points in civilization are all of interest to a historian. With some kind of prompting, you can recall information related to these events dating back tens, hundreds or even thousands of years. Recall Prominent Figures There are some names that withstand the test of time due to their accomplishments, inventions and atrocities. With some kind of prompting, you can recall details about specific people, creatures or cultures. This can include things such as their names, species, class, nicknames, organizations etc.
