entries.title: README
entries.content: Nature Identify Natural Phenomenon You know about natural processes like photosynthesis, the reproduction of creatures, and tectonic activity. You can do things like figuring out if a volcano is about to erupt, what could be causing plants to die or how long until an egg hatches. Identify Elements of Nature If it doesn't have a stat block and it isn't man-made or magic, then it probably falls under natural element. Nature allows you to identify animal behavior. It also lets you identify types of plants and minerals and their uses/dangers. It also allows you to tell if something is unnatural. Identify Weather Predict the weather, usually only for the day, but with higher checks, even farther into the future. You can also tell if these effects are naturally occurring or created by something unusual like magic.

entries.title: alchemy
entries.content: Alchemy Identify Potion/Poison (creation DC) With a quick wiff or taste, you can determine the effects of an alchemical substance. Reverse Engineer (creation DC+5) You can take an unfamiliar substance and learn what it's made out of with the intention of creating it again in the future. A success indicates that you managed to write down the necessary ingredients and processes to create the item in the future. Create Alchemical Item (DC varies) Alchemy can make all kinds of different things: common things include healing wounds, inflicting wounds, preventing sickness, adhesives, solvents, starting fires, temporary adaptations. Uncommon things include cloning and permanent transformations. All found under the equipment tab.

entries.title: arcana
entries.content: Arcana Identify Spell Being Cast (DC 15+spell lvl, no action) You must be able to clearly see or hear the creature in order to identify a spell that they are casting. Useful for determining whether or not you want to dispel something, or figuring out what spell a creature cast that has no immediate visible effect. Identify Active Spell (DC 10+spell lvl, free action 1/turn) You examine the magical effect to determine what spell it is, and what the spell does. Identify Magic Properties of Item (DC=Craft DC, +10 if cursed, standard action) You learn all of the qualities of a magic item that you are adjacent to.

entries.title: cryptozoology
entries.content: Cryptozoology Legendary Creatures Using a name or a basic description as a prompt, you can recall legends of ancient, powerful or noteworthy creatures. Such creatures usually have tales that have been written about them, or have stories that have been passed down that you can recount. Uses the "relevancy to the world" DC of (22-lvl). Identify Hoax You can use cryptozoology in place of insight to glean if a creature is deceiving you or exaggerating details about the description of a creature they have encountered or heard about through word of mouth. What do they want? Creatures from the stars often have very strange interests in the mortal world. If you succeed on a monster lore check against such a creature, you also learn about its interests in the world, such as requiring humanoids to reproduce or a keen interest in bovines. You can also glean this information from witnessing the phenomenon itself. Using the same DC as monster lore, you can witness cattle kidnapping or host infections and glean what type of creature is doing it Astronomy Generally, cryptozoology can be used as a substitute for any kind of scientific research with regards to space, such as astronomy and astrophysics.

entries.title: engineering
entries.content: Engineering Identify Function Identify the purpose of particularly complex machinery. Depending on the size and scope of what you're looking at, this could only be a glance, or it could require a few minutes, and usually requires a hands-on approach. Hacking Where there exists technology, there exists a method to disable or gain control of it, even if only temporarily. Hacking always requires a hands-on approach. Structural Quirk Large scale buildings such as castles, watchtowers, walls, factories, prisons etc. Are all built with specific purposes, facilities and defenses in mind. You can use engineering to figure out aspects of these buildings like where exhaust/waste pipes lead, how far underground you might need to take to go underneath the structure, structural weaknesses etc.

entries.title: local
entries.content: Local Recall Customs When dealing with foreign cultures, you can recall information about how to conduct yourself. This can be particularly useful when trying to gain someone's favor, such as royalty. You can also recall information about holidays, festivals and ceremonies. Recognize Name/Face You can attach a name to a face, or vice versa. You generally understand aspects of this creatures reputation, their affiliations, their general capabilities etc. Exceptionally high rolls might even land you some secrets or gossip related to this creature. Recall Useful Locations You can recall the answer to a specific simple question such as "where can I buy potions?" Or "where does the royalty live?" Or "where can I hire someone to build something?" Something along those lines. These questions can be applied to the town you're in or with a higher DC, something much bigger like a country or continent.

entries.title: planes
entries.content: Planes Identify Portal (DC 10) In the presence of a portal, you can tell where its destination plane is. Rolling higher can give more specific locations, more details about the portals creation and how often it gets used. Find Portal Location (DC 30) Portals are strange phenomenon that tend to come and go, but there are signs that they exist miles away from where the portal is actually located. Disable/Destroy Portal (DC 30) A task that is very difficult by one's self. Failure could mean getting stuck on the wrong side of the portal or hyper charging the portal to attract extraplanar creatures.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Knowledge All knowledge uses int.\ What you know. Knowledge is broken up into many different skills based on subject and each one has a subsection dedicated to monster lore of specific types of creatures. Monster lore isn’t its own skill, but it has its own functions separate from the rest of individual knowledge skills. If a subject or creature falls into multiple categories, then players can choose whichever they like more, but an individual character can't roll multiple checks with different skills. ALL knowledge requires proficiency to roll. {% hint style="warning" %} If you want to know who an individual creature is and their relevance to the world, rather than their stats and abilities, the DC is usually dependent on how popular they are. Typically (22-lvl) with additional reductions to the DC if they are famous, or in a position of power. This could also include increases to the DC if they work to keep their identity and exploits hidden, or live remotely. {% endhint %} Monster Lore Adventurers are assumed to know basic things about monsters, like how constructs lack of anatomy grant them resistance to many effects or the properties of incorporeal creatures. Monster lore checks are for figuring out more information about specific monsters.   Monster stat blocks are broken up into sections. Basic stats (saves, HP and AC), offense traits (breath weapons, dangerous auras, prominent spells), defense traits (healing abilities, elemental resistances), other traits (extra senses, extra movement options, out of combat abilities) and weaknesses/deep lore (lich's phylactery, vampires not appearing in mirrors).   Rolling a monster lore check is something you can do as a free action once per turn. It is assumed that you also vocalize what you learn to your team. The base DC of a monster lore check is (10+creature's lvl). By succeeding on a monster lore check, you can figure out a creature's basic stats and one other category. Every 5 over the DC you roll, you figure out another category. If a creature has nothing in a category, you choose another. Creatures with the \[unique] tag in their entry increase monster lore DC by 5. Humanoids with class levels by default are assumed to have the \[unique] tag. {% tabs %} {% tab title="Arcana" %} The default skill whenever magic is involved. Common uses include figuring out what spell someone is casting, determining the magical properties of items and identifying the effects of persistent spells.\ Identifies dragons with monster lore. {% endtab %} {% tab title="Alchemy" %} The blanket skill for most of DnD (mad) science. Used for the creation of potions, poisons and other strange but useful concoctions.\ Identifies oozes with monster lore. {% endtab %} {% tab title="Cryptozoology" %} Used in the knowledge of creatures that should not be. Cryptozoologists are particularly astute at remembering legends that pertain to creatures, and gleaning hoaxes.\ Identifies aberrations and cryptids with monster lore. {% endtab %} {% tab title="Engineering" %} Used to determine things related to structures, such as building them, finding weaknesses or the ability to make basic assumptions about its design (ex. a factory this large needs an exhaust vent somewhere). It can also be used to identify technology such as elevators, vehicles and other mechanical objects.\ Identifies constructs using monster lore. {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} {% tabs %} {% tab title="History" %} Used to recall events that happened in the past and prominent historical figures. Historians are good at identifying the flags of fallen nations, reading in dead languages and recognizing relics from the past.\ Does not have a specific creature type you can use monster lore with. Can be a suitable substitute for famous or infamous creatures hundreds or thousands of years old. {% endtab %} {% tab title="Local" %} Used to know about cities, countries, individuals. Specifically their culture, traditions, legends, government, laws, customs, politics and prominent organizations Identifies humanoids and giants with monster lore. Special: When using monster lore against humanoids that have class levels, you learn information about the class the creature possesses. {% endtab %} {% tab title="Nature" %} Used to detect oddities in the natural order and how to restore it. Can also be used to determine the weather, identify naturally occurring things like ores and flowers and elements unique to the feywilds. Identifies plants, fey and beasts using monster lore.  {% endtab %} {% tab title="Planes" %} Used to determine the nature of other planes. Can also be used to determine the destination of portals and where they might be located. Identifies fiends, celestials and elementals. {% endtab %} {% tab title="Religion" %} Used in understanding/identifying gods and their followers. Church hierarchies, religious practices, symbols and scripture are all covered by this skill. Identifies undead with monster lore. {% endtab %} {% endtabs %} Signature Skill Nerd When you succeed on a monster lore check, gain knowledge about an additional category. Lore Dump You can rapidly assess the battlefield and communicate your knowledge. You can roll an unlimited number of monster lore checks each turn.

entries.title: religion
entries.content: Religion It is assumed that if you are of a specific religion, you can do many of these things without rolling for your own faith. Identify Religious Symbol (DC 10) Followers of gods often wear regalia, use specific types of seals and put their gods symbol on their stuff. Sometimes just by looking at a building or a person you can tell where their religious affiliations lie. Recall Tenets (DC 15) When prompted by specific actions, you can tell whether or not these actions align with the deity in question. Good for finding fakers or guiding the faithful with poor memory. Accrue GBP (DC 15) You can figure out what kinds of things would appease a specific deity and earn you GBP. Identify Chosen (DC 20) Gods will often play favorites when it comes to specific people, peoples or items/places when deciding who will receive their blessing.

entries.title: languages
entries.content: Languages Common Languages CommonPretty much every intelligent creature speaks this.InfernalThe language of fiendsCelestialThe language of celestialsSylvanThe language of feyPrimordialThe language of elementals and ancient beings  Racial languages  Goblin GiantDwarven OrcElvenWeebanese/Anime  Uncommon languages Morse CodeA binary code of two sounds mixed to create letters in an alphabet. Communication in Morse code is very slow and impractical, but still serves a useful function for subtle communication.Sign LanguageAn entirely visual language that consists of hand gestures that translates directly to common.NecrilLanguage of undead  Secret languages DruidicTypically only passed down from teacher to student with specialized training in nature magic.Thieves CantThe language of thieves and criminals. It's more like speaking in code than another language entirely.SemaphoreA code that uses the position of flags to create letters in an alphabet. Communication and semaphore is very slow and impractical, but still serves a useful function for subtle communication.BronzeA unique language that is only understood by creatures with negative intelligence. Typically only spoken by barbarians.Fairy FlareA language that is only used by a specific type of fairies that cause their bio luminescent antennae to flash in specific patterns. Even if you know the language, it cannot be spoken without the proper biology/equipment, only understood.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Linguistics The lawyer skill that gets languages as a bonus. Uses int. Interpret Text You peruse a book, contract or other written work to quickly summarize what it says in one minute. The DC for most works is 10, but it changes based on the size and complexity of the work at hand. Failure indicates more time is necessary to understand what the text contains. Finding oddities in a contract requires an opposed linguistics check. Polyglot (P) With proficiency in linguistics you gain a new language for every level you have, and every new level you gain. Write/Forge Official Documents (P) Make contracts, forge signatures and make (fake?) documents look official. Noticing oddities in such documents requires an opposed linguistics check. Encode/Decode (P) You can write things in ways that are difficult to interpret without a cipher, such as disguising your forbidden ritual as a cookbook. The DC to your code is 11+(linguistics bonus). Creatures that know the code can read encoded text, but creatures that don't interpret the text as something else. To read encoded text, you must first crack the code, usually requiring at least a week of research. At the end of the week, roll a linguistics check versus the writer’s DC to crack the code. Signature Skill Cliff's Notes You can summarize 10 pages of written text per one minute of reading. Secret? You can select secret languages as bonus languages. Immediately gain 1 when you acquire signature skill. Read Lips With a clear view of a creature's face, you can understand what the creature is saying as long as you understand the language they are speaking in.

entries.title: dice-vs-roleplay
entries.content: Dice vs Roleplay Persuasion is one of those skills where you can reasonably skip past lots of dialogue in order to get the desired result more quickly and efficiently. However, this is a role-playing game. So regardless of how big someones persuasion bonus is, no matter the suggestion, you must persuade something someone could conceivably be willing to do on their own, in the right circumstances. On the opposite end, even if you do not possess the persuasion skill, you might still be able to convince an NPC of something if you present the right information in the right circumstances. A gruff pirate might not be interested in a -1 cha fighter, but if he says he knows where treasure is the pirate has been hunting for decades, that can change his mind. Tl;dr \ Role-play and dice are 2 different tools to acquire the same result, each with their own benefits and drawbacks. Neither should be dismissed as nonviable and one should not be required in order to succeed at the other.

entries.title: example-dcs
entries.content: Example DCs DifficultyDCExamplesMundane0Assistance with a simple task, like cutting veggiesGathering information on a topic people are concerned withRequires Focus5Assistance with a time consuming task,Trained10Gathering less relevant information: did x person wander into town lately?Difficult15Gathering dangerous information, the kind of thing that makes people say "you didn't hear it from me, but…"Very Difficult20Convince people to do something dangerous and potentially life threatening, like escorting you through wilderness, standing up against a bully or breaking the lawMasterful25Gathering secretive information, such as hideouts, passwords or scandalsNearly Impossible30Convince people to do something against their ethos, but could be conceivable, such as killing baby monsters, putting someone out of their misery or ditching the religion of a corrupt priestAscended40Convincing people inconceivable things, like killing family members, nobles donating their wealth to charity or rallying commoners against an ancient dragon (given adequate circumstances)  Common modifiers to make the task more difficult can include…\ \>Racism\ \>Your questions/requests are offensive or closely guarded secrets\ \>You are not well liked by the person/people you are persuading  Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include\ \>You are well liked by the person/people you are persuading\ \>You hold a position of authority over the person/people you are persuading\ \>The information you are looking for is well known or noteworthy

entries.title: README
entries.content: Persuasion Convincing others to do things with your words. Uses cha. Persuade When you ask something of someone, such as information or aid, they may be on the fence about whether or not they should answer and persuasion gets them to your side. The difficulty of the check is based on how well you know the person, how difficult the request is and what the consequences of telling you might be. Even if you do persuade someone to do something, it may come with caveats such as favors or payment. Gather information (P) When in a settlement, you can roll persuasion to find the answer to a simple question by speaking to people in town. The time it takes and the difficulty scales with the size of the settlement, people's general attitude toward you and how knowledgeable they are on the subject. Asking about where someone lives in a village could take minutes, but asking in a large city could take hours. Signature Skill Mercy Breeds Cooperation When you defeat a foe, you can instead choose to give it the time out condition for 1 hour. Contact You always know at least a few places in town drifters are welcome. The time to gather information is always less than 10 minutes.

entries.title: example-dcs
entries.content: Example DCs | Difficulty | DC | Examples | | ----------------- | -- | ------------------------------------------------------ | | Mundane | 0 | Navigating a road | | Requires Focus | 5 | Navigating a beaten path | | Trained | 10 | Navigating a location with landmarks, like a forest or | | Difficult | 15 | | | Very Difficult | 20 | | | Masterful | 25 | | | Nearly Impossible | 30 | | | Ascended | 40 | |

entries.title: README
entries.content: Survival The day to day things that need to be done when out and about adventuring far from home in the wilderness. Uses wis. Navigation You can attempt to not travel in circles when moving through unfamiliar territory. Failure indicates that a lesser amount of progress is made towards reaching your destination, or arriving at an unintended destination. Extract Resources You can skin creatures, extract organs/fluids and other resources from recently killed creatures. This usually takes 1 minute. You get an amount of value equal to (10+the creature's lvl). \ Particularly dangerous or delicate operations require proficiency and a survival check (usually 10+creature's level), with higher value multipliers. A failed attempt represents the resources being destroyed. Live off the Land (P) Characters proficient in survival can sustain themselves and 4 other creatures in environments with suitable sources of food and water. Tracking (P) You can attempt to follow footprints, broken branches, scent trails and other disturbed natural elements to figure out where a creature has been and where it’s going. With ideal conditions you can follow trails made days or even weeks ago (if you don't believe me, look at dino footprint fossils :^). The longer it's been since the creature has been there and the less ideal the conditions, the higher the DC. Signature Skill Sniff Them Out You gain blindsense (scent 5 ft).\ If you already have scent, increase its range by 5 ft. Advanced Tracking You can use survival to track creatures that fly and swim using scent, even if you aren't aquatic. It's harder to determine "ideal conditions" in these types of environments, so the DC is mostly based off of how long ago the creature was present.

entries.title: deception
entries.content: Deception Simply put, lying. This skill is almost always opposed to insight. Uses cha. Convince Truth Speak falsehoods to cover your ass or to soften the truth. Common modifiers to make the task more difficult can include…\ \>The person you are deceiving witnessed events you are lying about firsthand\ \>The claims you are making are incredibly outlandish or outright impossible (angels and demons are the same, the sky is green)\ \>The person you are deceiving is knowledgeable on the subject matter. Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include\ \>The person you are deceiving is inattentive. They are sleepy, drunk or in a hurry\ \>The person you are deceiving is a friend or close ally Feint In place of an attack, roll deception against a creature within reach. DC (10+lvl) or (10+creatures insight bonus) whichever is higher. If successful, your opponent is DD. They are unable to make AoOs against you or take immediate or instant actions in response to your actions. These benefits last until the end of your turn. Create Diversion As a standard action, you can shout something at your enemies to briefly get them to look the other way so you can give them the slip. Out of all creatures currently attending you, roll deception against the creature with the highest insight. If you succeed, you are able to roll stealth and people don't know where you went. This does not prevent people from being unable to find you again using perception. Convey Secret Message (P) By speaking in roundabout terms and making subtle gestures, you can communicate a simple idea (we need to leave, time to strike) while in company that might scrutinize. The DC to convey this message is 15. The intended recipient automatically understands the message. For anybody else listening, its insight DC to read between the lines is (10+your deception bonus). Sucker Punch (P) If you are in some kind of standoff where you aren't quite fighting your enemy yet, you can use this skill as a replacement for stealth to surprise your enemy with a melee attack. The enemy must be aware of you in order sucker punch, otherwise it is stealth. If you don't use an unarmed strike then you have disadvantage on this check. Certain situations where you are not able to get close to your aggressors, such as having bows pointed at you on from a garrison above you, make sucker punching impossible. Signature Skill Enigma You have advantage on saving throws against effects that would read your thoughts or otherwise pry into your mind.  Inception Convince a creature that one of your ideas is their own idea. By speaking with a creature over the course of a few minutes you can plant an idea in their mind that they then act on as if it was their own. You take a -10 penalty to your deception check vs their insight.

entries.title: disguise
entries.content: Disguise Pretend to be someone you’re not. Rolled against perception. Uses cha. Craft Disguise Spend 10 minutes perfecting your makeup, outfit and wig to appear as a playable race you're not. Disguise checks are usually unnecessary unless you fall under scrutiny, the person knows you/what you're pretending to be or you're trying to enter an exclusive club. Creatures get bonuses to their perception if they know you or what you're disguised as particularly well. You take a -2 penalty to disguise checks when you try to change your race and when you change your apparent gender. When you initiate a disguise, you tell your DM your bonus, they apply any appropriate modifiers and roll it in secret. Crafting a disguise without a disguise kit or magic imposes a -5 penalty. Impressionist (P) Creatures proficient in the disguise skill have the ability to alter their voice significantly. If a creature can’t see you (or while you are disguised), you can pretend to sound like someone else whose voice you have heard, or something more exotic like an animal. If a creature sees you and the voice is a mismatch, then they will quickly see through obvious facades, but can potentially be used to misdirect. Signature Skill Zero to Hero You can change your disguise into something completely different as a FRA. If someone was looking for you, they automatically get a check to see through your disguise if they see you again. Costume Expert You no longer take a penalty to disguise when changing your race or gender. You can now use disguise to pretend to be a monstrous creature (skeleton, phoenix, giant). These disguises tend to be very bulky and impractical. You cannot do anything physically intensive while in such a disguise, such as acrobatics, athletics or combat without the disguise falling apart.

entries.title: insight
entries.content: Insight When interacting with creatures, pick up on nonverbal cues and tone of voice to glean more information. Uses wis. Detect Truth Whenever a creature makes a statement, you can roll insight (opposed by deception) to see if what they say aligns with what they think. If you succeed, you determine that something is fishy. Prying further about the deception may cause the creature to reveal the truth or become hostile depending on context. If you roll this too often, your DM can silence you. No using insight multiple times on the same thing. Don’t be silly. Detect Intrusive Presence (P) You can use insight to determine when a creature is under duress from a spell or some other kind of effect that has a lasting impact on their mind, such as domination or possession. You must actively search for this by speaking with a creature for 1 minute. Roll insight vs the DC of the effect. If the effect has no DC, assume basic DC with cha as the modifier. Signature Skill Intrusive Thoughts By having a conversation with a creature for one minute, you can glean into their surface thoughts as you continue this conversation. Make an insight check with a -10 penalty, if you succeed you can read their surface thoughts for the remainder of the conversation. 5 Steps Ahead When a creature fails to feint you, they are feinted by you.

entries.title: intimidation
entries.content: Intimidation Be spooky and coerce creatures. Uses the higher value of either your str, or your cha. Demoralize As a standard action, inflict shaken 1 on an enemy that can see or hear you within 30 feet. Must have line of sight. They roll a will save vs (10+your intimidation bonus). They are shaken as long as you are nearby, and for 1 minute after. You can demoralize a creature repeatedly to increase the penalty. If they pass their save, their shaken value decreases by 1. Coercion (P) By having a conversation with a creature that lasts at least one minute, or by defeating a creature in combat, you can shape how they respond to you or anybody asking about you in the future. The strength of this creature's conviction is dependent on your intimidation roll against it.  You can make the creature keep their mouth shut about something you did to them. Any checks to gather information from this creature about you or your party change to this roll if it would be higher than the usual DC. You can greatly exaggerate what you did to further spread fear and grand tales of your strength. Any knowledge checks that creatures make on you when hearing about information that spreads from this creature changes to your intimidation roll if it would be higher than the usual DC, or else they learn false info. PTSD (P) You can permanently scar a creature so that your mere presence is enough to fill it with dread. Creatures you defeat in combat are automatically shaken 1 in your presence permanently. If you successfully demoralize a creature afflicted with PTSD, you can choose to increase their shaken penalty or make them frightened. Signature Skill Big Shot Any minion creature (a creature that is 1/3 your level or lower) is automatically shaken 1 while in combat with you. Boo You can demoralize a creature as a swift action.

entries.title: medicine
entries.content: Medicine Be a doctor in a world filled with people whose touch brings people back to life. Uses wis. Assess the Wounded A creature that is wounded can be examined to determine how they were injured, how long ago it happened and whether they are in grave danger of dying. This also functions on corpses. The more complex the ailment and the longer the duration since it happened, the higher the DC. Duration may reverse in scaling in the case of diseases, where more time passing makes the symptoms more obvious. Provide First Aid (P) As a standard action you can cure creatures of status ailments to a creature within reach. You can remove sickened stacks, bleed and blurred vision. The DC of removing any of these conditions is the DC of the ability that inflicted them. If they have no DC, then assume the class/offense trait DC. When you succeed in providing first aid to heal a condition, the creature heals 1 HP. Performing first aid without a first aid kit imposes a -5 penalty. Long Term Care (P) Resting under the care of a creature that is proficient in medicine lets you recover 1 drain every 3 days instead of every week. You also qualify for removing many types of afflictions, both physical and mental. Prevent Recovery (P) If you have defeated creatures in your custody that you don't want to be waking up at inconvenient times, you can choose to treat them so that way they do not naturally recover hp (including regen and FH). This requires a few minutes to perform, and lasts 24 hours. Identify Affliction or Curse (P) By spending a minute examining someone who suffers from an affliction or curse, you can determine its exact effects. You also know the exact method on how to cure the affliction or remove the curse. T1 afflictions have a DC of 5. +5 to DC for each tier. Curses have a DC of 10+spell lvl. If the effect was not a spell, then DC 10+(1/2 lvl of entity who inflicted curse). Signature Skill Improvised Implements You take no penalty to medicine checks when you do not have a first aid kit.\ When you provide first aid, you heal 3 hp. Frankenstein's Secrets Permanent devastating effects to a creature's body, such as having a limb severed or an eye gouged out can now be healed with a DC 30 check. Provided the wound is fresh and the body part is intact. Failure inflicts drained 2 and destroys the body part. Band-Aid Fix You can provide first aid as a swift action.

entries.title: perception
entries.content: Perception {% hint style="info" %} All creatures are considered proficient in perception, unless they are mindless. Uses wis. {% endhint %} Perception is the mechanism through which players can notice the unnoticed in the imagination game. Traps, hidden loot, secret entrances, unusual stimuli are a handful of the many things this skill is used for. Conditions such as bad weather and listening through walls can make perception difficult, or even impossible. Sleeping gives a -5 penalty. Detect Hidden Presence Once a round, by spending 15ft of movement, or a swift action, you can make a perception check to find hidden creatures/objects, or their general direction if they have total cover. Signature Skill One Eye Open * You take no penalty to perception from sleeping. * You perceive and remember things that happened around you while sleeping when you wake.  * You can choose to automatically wake up for any reason.  * You are not DD by default when asleep. Quick Scan You can Detect Hidden Presence as a free action, but still only once per turn.

entries.title: profession
entries.content: Profession The skill for the working class fellas. Defaults to wisdom, but see the experienced feature. Recall If you are ever quizzed on particular aspects of a profession and you are not proficient, you must roll an intelligence check to answer correctly (DC 10 for most professions). Proficient creatures automatically know most aspects of their profession. Hard Work Every day you work, you earn money. See economics for more details.\ Your talent could be anything from music, to craftsmanship to working as an innkeeper. Experienced (P) You can select what ability score to use to determine your profession bonus for all your professions. Your given ability score colors the approach you have to your professions. Signature Skill ? ?

entries.title: sleight-of-hand
entries.content: Sleight of Hand Pocket things while staying undetected. Quietly open locks and turn off dangerous devices. Uses dex. Thievery If a target is unaware of you or otherwise distracted, you can attempt to steal items loosely attached to their person or in their pockets. Rolled versus the perception of the individual. Anybody else vigilantly standing guard also gets a check with a penalty based on circumstance. You can also pilfer unattended objects, with anybody nearby or standing watch getting a check to notice your misdeeds.\ Objects that are in some way affixed to a creature, such as a sword in its hilt, take a -5 penalty to SoH when you try to steal them. Conceal Weapon (P) You can store light weapons in all kinds of places. As a swift action you can draw a concealed weapon to attack a creature with. If they fail a perception check vs your sleight of hand, they are DD this turn. If you're in a crowded area, or in some kind of standoff where you aren't quite fighting your enemy yet, you can even use this skill as a replacement for stealth to surprise your enemy. The enemy must be aware of you in order use a concealed weapon, otherwise it is stealth. Pick Lock (P) Open locked objects with a DC dependent on the complexity of the lock. Mages and very skilled locksmiths might have nearly impossible locks while common doors are child's play. The more difficult the DC, the longer it takes to open a lock, with an upper limit of 30 seconds. Failing a check has no consequences unless time is short or there are other security measures in place. Picking locks without thieves' tools imposes a -5 penalty. Disable Device Pressure plates and dangerous magic crystals are at your mercy if you’re able to get your hands on them if you notice them before you get roasted. You can temporarily or permanently disabled the dangerous dungeon decorations with a DC based on the complexity of the device. Simple tripwires are easy enough but a soul gem firing arcane bolts could be tricky. If you pass the DC by 5 or more, you can repurpose the trap to suit your needs. The more difficult the DC, the longer it takes to disable, with an upper limit of 30 seconds. Disabling devices without thieves' tools imposes a -5 penalty. Signature Skill Fast Hands You can pick any lock and disable any devices as a FRA. Is....this your sword? You can steal sheathed and stored weapons at no penalty, and replace them with other items of similar size/shape.

entries.title: stealth
entries.content: Stealth Moving around while remaining unseen. If someone is looking for you in your immediate vicinity and you don't want to be seen, you roll stealth. Uses dex. Special: Stealth and size Size provides no numerical benefit or penalty. The only thing that size effects relative to stealth is your ability to gain cover: Larger creatures have a harder time figuring out places to hide, while smaller creatures find it very easy.  Hide (immediate) As long as you have total cover, partial concealment or total concealment, you can attempt to hide from your enemies as an immediate action. You remain hidden until no longer have total cover/concealment, you cast a spell, use a special ability, attack or someone spots you with perception. When you attack a creature after successfully hiding from them, they are DD until the end of your turn. Pass Without Trace (P) Characters with stealth proficiency can travel without leaving an obvious trail behind. Attempts to track them suffer a -5 penalty. Signature Skill Dampen Presence Blind sense does not function against you. Stalker Use stealth to trail someone without them noticing you. It is assumed that you keep your distance, only observing broad strokes what they do, but not things they say, write down etc. If you want to get a closer look to find such details, you take a -5 penalty to stealth. Using stealth to stalk people can potentially become impossible without first circumventing protections against spying. How often you roll stealth checks is determined by the situation, opposed by the creature you stalk. * Some general examples… | Every 10 minutes | Target is wary, is in a place you are unwelcome or has bodyguards on watch | | ---------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Every few hours | Target is in a public place with limited spaces to hide | | Every few days | Target is isolated in an environment with ample hiding spots |

entries.title: README
entries.content: General Thoughts {% hint style="info" %} All creatures are proficient in perception, unless they are mindless {% endhint %} Skill rolls are how players interact with the world without hitting it with their sword. Even if certain actions have a skill associated with them, you don't necessarily need to roll a skill check (no need to roll deception if they already believe you, no need to roll athletics in still water, etc). When one is required, it is prompted by the DM.  D20 can be very swingy, creating dramatically unexpected results. That is its strong suite. As such using a skill roll as a barrier for entry can create all or nothing scenarios. There's nothing wrong with saying "the lock is too complex for you to pick," but you can't be upset when immediately after the martials of the party start smashing into the door. Just like with attack rolls and saving throws, there should be lesser versions of success. If you barely fail the DC to scale a wall, it lowers your speed instead of falling. If you barely fail a stealth check while trailing someone, they can tell someone is in the bushes, but not who.  Skill bonuses by default only use the relevant ability modifier.   Proficiency in a skill grants you a 2+(lvl) bonus to the skill. Certain aspects of a skill might only be available to characters that are proficient in the skill and are denoted with a (P)\ When you have multiple spells and/or items that give bonuses to skills, only take the highest bonus. Standard skill DCs are what should be used in the absence of a set or opposed DC. They are as follows… | Difficulty | DC | | ----------------- | -- | | Mundane | 0 | | Requires Focus | 5 | | Trained | 10 | | Difficult | 15 | | Very Difficult | 20 | | Masterful | 25 | | Nearly Impossible | 30 | | Ascended | 40 |  Some skills are opposed to other skills, while other skills will include examples comparable this chart.

entries.title: emissaries
entries.content: 🥇 Emissaries Each god has a single mortal that they choose as their most dedicated, trusted and powerful follower. This follower is known as the emissary of X god. Emissaries gain extra boons, and usually a direct line of communication to their deity.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Power of God Gods are beings that have purposefully not been given stat blocks, because fighting a god via conventional means, that being swords and magic, is impossible. An ancient and powerful pact is in place that prevents the gods from seizing mortals as puppets to enact their will, and forces them to figure out more subtle and indirect means of acquiring what they want. This same pact makes them immune to conventional weapons. Gods have so much mana flowing through them that no singular person is close to powerful enough to even scratch them. This same mana allows them to perform incredible feats, often referred to as miracles.  Gods are free to walk amongst mortals only sparingly, as doing so requires a great deal of mana. As such they usually prefer only to appear in their Deific Aspects, which only allow them to exert a fraction of their power, and appear as a translucent spectral version of themselves. They can also appear as a mortal, unable to exert any of their usual deific powers, and usually having a hard time gathering the attention of mortals. They also use other indirect means, such as using their followers as vessels, projecting only their voice or having their messages appear in writing via ink or blood. Gods are not all-knowing, nor are they all-powerful. They have the ability to focus their attention on many places at once, with much greater detail in places where their followers exist. They hear and answer prayers while doing other things. Their ability to multi-task and process information is beyond comprehension. Certain types of things may draw their focus, such as hearing a prayer related to a matter that interests them, or a ritual in their honor conducted by one of their favorite disciples, or an enemy defacing their places of worship. Gods must carefully consider what they focus their attention on, and what they do. Their existence may seem immutable, but the countless gods lost to time suggest otherwise. They must satisfy the desires of mortals, lest they lose their source of power. As such, gods tend to only give boons to the dedicated, and only make appearances amongst mortals if it can be flashy and garner a lot of attention. A constant form of pageantry they must perform in order to maintain their power and increase their influence.

entries.title: anime-jesus
entries.content: 🎌 Anime Jesus Anime Jesus is the anime god of order. He primarily concerns himself with the purging of corruption and evil in the realms beyond his own.  The followers of AJ call themselves The Golden Order. Many that follow him mimic his powerful offensive magic in order to destroy aberrations, demons, undead and the mortals that serve/create them. Anime Jesus is not just concerned with the evil that exists on Nack, but also that which lies beyond the stars. A radioactive and corrupting force permeates the galaxy known as ligmanium. It twists and transforms all it comes into contact with, eventually spreading between planets. Destroying this substance at its source is the prime directive of AJ and his followers. Boons T1: \ T T2: \ t T3: \ You

entries.title: README
entries.content: Demigods There exist a great many lesser or local deities that are much less popular, and therefore do not follow the same kind of rules as the other gods. They are still more mortal than divine, and are free to exert their lesser influence directly in the mortal realm. There are even rules on how a player character can become one. These demon dukes, demigods and other lesser deities can be killed like any man. They do still have abilities similar to gods, such as the ability to grant boons, and project their deific aspect, however their ability to perform miracles is limited. Demigods must often fight tooth and nail to not fade into irrelevance once the next generation of mortals forgets them for their deeds.

entries.title: daughters-of-the-cataclysm
entries.content: Daughters of the Cataclysm The Cataclysm is absolutely obsessed with raw physical strength, and constantly throws herself and her followers into situations where they can test their might. This manifests in a particularly strange way, where she sees herself as the perfect being, and so therefore her offspring are the only ones that really have a chance of every topping her feats of strength. The exact circumstances of their creation are unknown, but they typically end up as large muscular demons, and are always women. Unfortunately for these ladies, mom's standards couldn't be higher: They must become stronger than their mother. Since all of them fall short of this goal, she abandons them, giving them some kind of leadership role in her demonic armies and only ever interacting with them sparingly. The only training she ever gives them is physical, so they are usually unprepared for this role.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 🌋 Caldera the Cataclysm The Cataclysm is the most outwardly terrifying, hostile and destructive force known to mankind. She is concerned with little more than raw physical strength, twisting this ideology to its absolute extremes and eliminating any and all unable to survive the hostility and violence so common among her and her minions. As such, she is very often held in high regard by eugenicists, anarchists and the unhinged that just want to watch the world burn. One of the few things that the followers of the Cataclysm will always hold in high regard is contests of raw physical strength. Their method of testing your might is typically an arm wrestling contest. This is often used as a last ditch effort by people to save their own skins when faced with overwhelming odds of death. On rare occasions, her followers will kidnap specimens they deem worthy enough. They will be dragged into the demon realm to have all manner of alchemical, magical and genetic experiments run on them to create a creature that is perfectly huge. Caldera herself is a massive muscular woman clad in metal armor who typically stands over 20 feet tall. Her body is covered in all manner of bony spikes, horns and scales. Along her back are dorsal plates that run down her massive tail, giving her stance a forward lean, allowing her to loom over and gaze upon lesser beings with her many eyes. Boons T1: Huge\ Any thing that gives you additional carryweight in increments of 100, such as strength and racial features, gives you 1000 lbs of carryweight instead. You can throw heavy objects, dealing 2d6 base damage.\ You get a +2 bonus to athletics to destroy and displace objects, and to arm wrestling. T2: Huge XXL\ Your mastery over gravity lets you benefit from the 5G technique constantly. You can toggle this ability off or on as a free action 1/rnd. Share your training regiment as a special attack you can use at will. Special Attack: Gravity Training: Apply grounded for 1 round on hit. The grounded creature takes a -15 penalty to speed if it is not proficient in athletics, or doesn't have at least +3 strength. T3: Perfectly Huge\ You

entries.title: fiendish-pacts
entries.content: Fiendish Pacts A fiendish pact requires an agreement between two parties, typically via writing, but also can be done via verbal agreements. Such pacts bind the 2 creatures to these agreements, with immediate consequences if one does not abide by the agreement. Pact Basics Pacts, like written contracts in real life, are methods of binding 2 parties together to persuade some time of cooperation or exchange. It usually involves exchanging goods, services, information or boons. Typically pacts are formed when someone desires something, but the other doesn't want to grant this desire for free. Both parties mediate until a satisfactory transaction is agreed upon. Then the 2 parties must decide on a punishment for the other should they not fulfill their end of the bargain. Again, the 2 parties come to an agreement on what the other desires. Finally, some type of gesture is taken to finalize the deal, such as shaking hands, returning a bow or signing a contract. Some creatures may take issue with the order in which the parties perform their end of the bargain, but it is inevitably up to the creature with the power to make the pact what order things happen in. Legally Binding  Pacts, unlike written contracts in real life, cannot be broken without evading consequence. Pacts are made with magic that does not ask for mediation or a jury. Disobeying the contract immediately afflicts the creature with whatever the punishment is. Any kind of agreement must be within the means of the creature to perform.  In the event where someone is unable to hold up their end of the bargain, or does so in a way that is not in accordance with the deal, they are afflicted with punishment immediately. You cannot also say "I will grant you anything you wish" without the ability to grant wishes.  Punishments must also be within the means of both parties. You cannot just say "if you don't pet this dog 10 times then you burst into flames and die" without being able to use some type of fire magic. If you agree on a punishment that you cannot inflict, then there is no consequence for not fulfilling their end of the bargain. It us up to you to decide if the other really CAN devour your eternal soul or not. Shira's Boons  Shira, and her most dedicated, are capable of providing additional boons to those they make pacts with. Contracts without meaning, such as those made between allies to acquire more boons, will draw Shira's ire and are not recommended. Twist of Fate - The creature gains a luck dice. Lexicon - Give creature information about a subject as though asking Shira herself. The amount of information she gives typically depends on what was done in the contract. Good deeds get the bare minimum to satisfy the contract while deeds that align with Shira's interest are paid in dividends.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 👄 Shira the She-Devil Shira is the demon lord most known for making deals with mortals, and with subterfuge. A master of disguise, Shira always finds a way to hide amongst the crowd in parties held by those in the highest echelons of society. She will somehow simultaneously be the most beautiful and second most beautiful lady attending the party at once.  She delights in the act of giving mortals exactly what they want, but then taking so much more in return. Her deals will always be carefully worded, often with a written contract. She may misrepresent things and lie to get people to sign, and if they believed her, its their fault for not reading the fine print. These devilish tendencies work to break down society by eroding trust, generating discontent and playing off of the selfish desires of mankind. You didn't honestly expect her help to be free, right dearest? Shira prefers a much more appealing and innocuous form to represent herself. She takes on the form of a voluptuous fox-like beastfolk, appearing mostly human, save for the ears and tail. The only thing that would even indicate she is a demon is vertical pupils of her eyes. When in private company, she has a casual attire she likes involving loose purple clothes, and she lets all nine of her tails out. When working, such as attending parties, she tends to dress exceptionally well and hides all but one of her tails. Boons T1: Party Animal (Su)\ While at a social gathering, such as a party, festival, ball etc, you can exist in two places at once. This otherwise functions as a ninja's shadow clone, but the clone disappears once the event ends or you begin combat. So long as both clones aren't in someones line of sight at once, people do not question how you pop up so frequently. T2: Mistrust\ You gain a new use to deception.  Sow Doubt - Roll a deception check after a few minutes of conversation (DC 10+creature's level). You can convince this creature that another creature has it out for them and seeks their downfall. They will always view what this creature does in the worst light possible, which can eventually cause great strife in the future. This will stay the case until someone can use the Detect Intrusive Presence feature of insight (DC 10+your deception bonus). Usually someone only gets a check who is familiar that notices this unusual behavior. For creatures who are close to one another, such as family, friends or allies, the DC increases. Usually only +2 for people they see in a positive light, +5 for allies and +10 for those closest to them. T3: Devil's in the Details (Su)\ You gain the ability to write magically binding Fiendish Pacts.

entries.title: moogen
entries.content: 👁️ Moogen Moogen is the demon lord most often associated with death, darkness and murder. The forces of the Cataclysm will come busting down your door. Moogen's forces will watch you for days, waiting for when your death will have the most impact in inspiring fear and chaos in your family, town or society as a whole. The more impact the death has, the flashier it is and the longer it stains the memory of mortals, the better. Moogen's unique obsession with death has created a unique set of circumstances. Moogen is not a singular entity, but rather a position that can be taken by someone capable of outwitting, outmaneuvering and killing the current Moogen. Moogen delights in the constant dance of death that happens all around her as a result of the tasty allure of this lucrative opportunity. Because Moogen is more of a title, rather than a singular creature, the appearance can vary greatly, but a handful of features are passed down. Moogen always has the same type of white eyes with many circles within that seem to spiral and hypnotize. They always have enormous mouths capable of snapping open and devouring a creature of equal size whole. When undercover, the mouth in excess is covered in skin, but usually it is only partly covered in skin, making it appear as though Moogen has multiple mouths. Boons T1: Shadow in the Night (Su)\ You are constantly under the effects of Night Crawler. It grants darkvision and does not consume the buff tag. T2: Born in Darkness (Su)\ Absorb light around you, lowering the light level of spaces you occupy by 1 level (bright to dim, dim to dark). You can toggle this ability on or off 1/turn as a free action. T3: Shadow Blending (Su)\ You do not need cover or concealment to hide in any dim light or darkness, even against creatures with night vision and dark vision, though not while being directly observed.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 👿 Demon Lords The entities that have the largest degree of influence over the Demon Realm. To say they rule over it would be giving them too much credit. The demon realm is a disgusting and dangerous twisted realm that is beyond control. The demon lords tend to spend a lot more time focused on the mortal realm, always looking to spread their influence among mortals willing to eat the forbidden fruit. In particular many spend a lot of time in their mortal forms to blend in and mingle with mortals, delivering their sales pitch directly to the ears of their would-be followers. Demon lords are themselves demons, but they break the mold, bending the rules of what the typical demon can and can't do. They can transform other creatures into demons against their will, reproduce on their own, teleport long distances and create portals to other realms, among other things atypical of lesser fiends.

entries.title: life-after-death
entries.content: Life After Death When a person dies in the world of Nack, their soul separates from their body and is quickly pulled down into the Underworld. Most people plunge into the Styx immediately, losing all sense of self and becoming an amorphous unrecognizable spirit before washing up on a line in front of Hades' desk. Depending on the type of life they lived, they are sent to different areas of the Underworld. Many are given tasks to perform, the most popular of which are record keeping and patrolling the halls for those who would steal Hades' treasure or try to escape the Underworld. Particularly strong-willed people are able to resist the pull towards the Styx for a bit longer, and are able to maintain most of their appearance, albeit a bit more ghostly. Creatures that curry favor with Hades are given access to the bodies they had in life and are still privy to many of their core memories. Any and all attempts at resurrection show up on Hades' desk after the fact, and he decides how he wants to approach them on a case by case basis. Acts performed by other gods are out of his control, but noted for future dealings. Every instance of resurrection is considered a debt that must eventually be repayed. Sometimes when creatures cheat death, Hades will instruct his followers to hunt them down.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Hades Hades is the god of the dead, and the dutiful arbiter of the underworld. Hades and those who work under him attend to the souls of the dead, carefully cataloguing and maintaining records of any souls that pass through the underworld and river Styx. Hades is an entity that his job very seriously, and has strict rules that apply to any inhabitants.  He is often worshiped by initiate necromancers, much to his dismay. Hades despises necromancy, as it only causes problems for him. More adept necromancers understand the ire their activities bring to him, and tread lightly when around those his worshipers. Hades is a massive humanoid with long dark hair and an exceptionally long mustache. Clad in the bones of the fallen, he wears a crimson toga and covers himself in other forms of regalia such as gold and jewels. Boons T1: \ Y T2: \ Y T3: \ You

entries.title: the-underworld
entries.content: The Underworld The Underworld is a physical location in the mortal realm, though its entrance is never something that stays in the same place for very long. Usually when too many people catch wind of its location, Hades will change it to another location. The entirety of the Underworld is Hades' domain, and he takes great care to make sure that he does not get unwanted guests, and that people do not escape. The underworld is split up into several parts. The Styx The River Styx in omnipresent throughout the Underworld. Wherever you stand, you can always see it snaking through the terrain. The entire Underworld is shaped around this mystical river. The liquid that flows through it changes based on the region of the Underworld. Pure in Elysium, lava in Asphodel and a crimson blood-like liquid in most other places. Exposure to the waters of the Styx has a variety of effects that depend on circumstances. Creatures who have lived exceptionally long lives are particularly resistant to the effects of the Styx while younger creatures are wiped clean very quickly. Taking a sip from the waters will not get rid of much but taking a plunge for just a minute can wipe away years of life. Typically more important memories are more resistant to the power of the Styx: Childhood memories, cherished loved ones, sense of self and important deeds. The Precipice Starting from the entrance/exit is the precipice. Guarding the exit is the mighty three-headed beast Cerberus, standing as the Underworlds eternal guardian. He freely allows creatures to enter, but never allows them to leave. The precipice largely consists of twisted caves where the River Styx snakes around. Spirits of the dead often linger in the precipice as long as their will allows before inevitably passing through the Styx and washing up in front of Hades' desk. Creatures from the mortal realm wander into the Precipice quite frequently, filling its halls with beasts or mischievous creatures who like to desecrate Hades' altars and commune with lost spirits to lead them astray.  Elysium This region. Asphodel This region. Tartarus This regio

entries.title: frogg-saran
entries.content: 🐸 Frogg Saran Frogg Saran is chaos incarnate. He is known to give blessings and curses in equal measure. Frogg Saran is a very active force in the world of Nack, worming his way into many people's lives whether they like it or not. All this god seeks is to increase the amount of entropy in the universe. His followers start riots and revolutions merely to change the status quo. They reincarnate people for the lulz, just to see the reaction to their new body. Frogg Saran's odd fixation on the rubbery amphibious creature causes frogs to be revered by his followers. Special care should be taken when interacting with any frog or frog-adjacent creature, or risk unwittingly getting dragged into the machinations of this mad god. You never know when what looks like an ordinary frog could be a lunatic, or worse yet, Frogg himself in disguise. The true form of Frogg Saran is unknown, though many suspect his true form is that of a smug frog, save for its eyes are replaced with gnashing maws. It is a common way he appears before mortals, but with other common occurrences being cheese and tentacles, some depict him as an otherworldly aberration, or a rodent.. {% hint style="info" %} Because it is possible to have faith in Frogg with negative wisdom, he never reliably answers prayers. But when he does answer prayers, they are typically in unexpected ways, and tend to be useful in ways other than providing advice. This could mean the place you are looking for suddenly explodes, the handsome fellow you were interested in talking to reveals they are a homosexual, or a frog will lead the way. In any such case, the advice/assistance comes in a much more dramatic and roundabout way. {% endhint %} Boons T1: Frog Shape (Su) \[poly, true]\ As a standard action you can assume the form of a tiny frog. You can transform back as a free action. Gain the following qualities… * | Mad Hops | Increase the distance the jump action brings you by 10 ft. | | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | | Tongue | Make combat maneuvers to drag at 30 ft range without penalty. | | Smol | Decrease size to tiny. Decrease reach to 0. | | Speed | Gain a swim speed. | T2: Born Again Believer (Su)\ You can innately cast reincarnate 1/day. When you cast reincarnate, you gain access to a random innate technique that you can use once. While you have this technique, you lose access to reincarnation. After you expend the technique, you regain access to reincarnation. See chart below for determining what technique you gain. Using this technique as it is intended, AKA, not using it just to cycle to a new one, gives you 100 GBP. You cannot use this to farm GBP passively during down time. Up to DM interpretation what qualifies as "intended use." Usually it involves using the technique in combat, or if a utility effect, in an apt scenario, such as using sending to communicate with a random person you met today with a cryptic message. T3: Forbidden Knowledge\ You can expend a use of prayer in order to find out forbidden lore concerning a creature you can see. Choose a random creature within 30 ft of you and then roll serendipity. The higher the roll, the more pertinent the information. This knowledge is always presented in a numerical format such as "2 kings killed" for important/secret high roll info or "0 dogs pet" for low impact knowledge. Believer Chart When you truly believe, you are rewarded. Roll on this chart to see what technique tree, then roll d6 until you get a technique level you have access to. Then roll another dice in a similar method to determine what technique in that tier (something like a d10 should usually suffice). Ex. I roll 12 and get Cataclysm. Then I roll d6 and get 6, but I'm only level 5 and don't have access to tier 6 techniques. I roll d6 again and get a 1. I roll d8 and get a 1, giving me access to the 5G technique. RollTrees1Warfare2Wild Card3Unarmed4Arcane5Earth Mother6Scoundrel7Barbarism8Brazzeria9Pyromancy10Lunar11Necromancy12Cataclysm13Moogen14Pupper15Larella16Shira17Beastmode18Anime Jesus19Protector20Frogg

entries.title: mother-earth
entries.content: 🍃 Mother Earth Mother Earth is the god of all things untamed and natural. She is the oldest of all deities. It is said that she was the entity that created the realm of mortals. A piece of her exists inside of all living things. As such, she has no true domain. But there are locations where life is at its most dense that are considered sacred, like lush rain forests, coral reefs and the valleys between forested mountains.  Many see Mother Earth as a benevolent force, but she is primarily an entity that seeks balance between sentient creatures and the rest of the world. Many great tragedies have happened to people in the past when mankind overstepped its boundaries: Floods, earthquakes and storms the likes of which the world is better off never seeing again. These stories and their lessons are passed down through those studying under the druidic arts so that way such tragedies can be prevented from happening again. She is often depicted as a resting land mass, the bends of her shoulders, knees and hips creating mountains. While out and about, she is humanoid in shape, thought she appears to be entirely composed of lush green vegetation. Pano Boons T1: Friend of the Forest (Su)\ You can expend a use of prayer to pacify a beast or plant creature. If used out of combat, you can usually cause it to run off or generally be okay with your presence.\ If used in combat, it is a standard action, and inflicts the pacified condition for 1 round automatically. Alt T1 Boon: Spirit Animal (Su) \[poly, true]\ You can expend a use of prayer to transform into a specific terrestrial or aquatic beast that must be chosen when you gain this boon. You can only transform into this beast. The transformation lasts until you end it. You can exit this form as a swift action. T2: The Forest has Ears (Su) \[scrying]\ You can touch a living tree as a standard action, and project your sense of hearing into another tree within 100 ft of it, even one you cannot see. T3: Nature's Vigilance (Sp)\ You can innately cast Voice of the Forest once a week. As part of speaking, you can choose to manifest your spirit as visible aspect of the earth mother, allowing her to speak through you instead of the usual effects.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 🌍 Earthly Deities Those that reside directly in the realms of mortals. Their domains tend to be much smaller and can often be physically visited, with the potential to even meet the deity in person.

entries.title: shroomlette
entries.content: 🍄 Shroomlette The Shroomlette is the shroomkin god of happiness, rest and fertility. One of the few gods that exists in the realm of mortals. Her domain is a garden filled with all kinds of oddities that rests on the clouds above a mushroom forest. There she resides, forever resting in a shiny cradle, waiting to be tucked in by a visitor. The Garden is commonly used as a place of mediation since all forms of violence are forbidden within the domain of the Shroomlette. The Shroomlette is an entity that represents the bond between gooms, a breed of squishy draconic creatures, and shroomkin, a race of people with close ties to fey creatures and mushrooms. These two entities live in tandem with each other with one main goal: increase the quantity of happiness in the world. The tactics they use to do so is to subdue creatures that decrease happiness and physically change the world around them to make it a better place to live. Boons T1: Form of Baby (Su) \[poly, true]\ You can transform into a tiny baby version of yourself. You are unable to attack, cast spells, speak etc. Your movement is reduced to a crawl of 10ft. You can transform into a baby or revert to your original form as a standard action. T2: Bubble Blowing Double Baby (Su)\ You can innately cast Bubble at will. It does not have the concentration tag. You can make the bubbles into any shape you desire. Whenever you blow any type of bubble, you can carefully shape it to make bubble art. T3: (Su)\ You

entries.title: brazzerian-purification
entries.content: Brazzerian Purification Brazzerian Purification The art of purification involves turning a fiend into mortal form, purging them of their inherently sinful natures. To do this requires a lot of time and effort to be successful. The bare minimum required in order to conduct the ritual is... Mana. 100\(creature's lvl)^2. (1=100, 2=400, 3=900...12=14,400) * Proficiency in planes. * The creature's name before it transformed. With all of the above ingredients, you can draw the magic circles required, power it, and initiate the ritual. The person in charge of performing the ritual rolls a DC 17 luck check to guess the creature's true name: A word in an ancient tongue meant to represent who a person is at the core of their soul. If successful, then it transforms into a hellion. If it fails, it is evaporated, leaving only a silhouette and any of its gear/clothing behind. Because this is such a slim chance of success, and creatures only get one shot, Brazzerian priests have done a great deal of research on how to improve the likelihood of a rituals success. Each of the below things can improve odds, adding additional bonuses to the luck check. * (+1) Double the mana cost. This can stack, but it must be doubled each time. * (+2) Convince the creature to be willing to transform, usually requiring appealing the the creatures ethos. * (Up to +3) Have detailed information on who the creature was in life. Major things, like events they regret, cherished family/friends, major accomplishments contribute more. * (Up to +3) Have items significant to what the creature was in life. Items like childhood treasures, wedding rings and signature weapons/armor contribute more. * (+2) Perform ritual in sanctified area. Such areas are rare instances where Brazzeria has visited the realm of mortals to perform miracles, and are closely guarded treasures. Other things can add to the bonus that aren't listed here as appropriate. Born Fiendish In very rare instances, creatures can be born fiends, such as when they are the child of a demon lord. Such fiends ignore most of the aforementioned rules: They can automatically succeed on the ritual if they are willing, and it always fails if they are not. Their changes tend to be less dramatic, allowing them to maintain most aspects of their fiendish form and powers, making them very rare catches for Brazzerians.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 🌘 Brazzeria Her Smoliness the Goddess Brazzeria is the goddess of redemption, often revered by the Hellion her followers create. Brazzeria is unique in that she and her followers can see the good in all but the most depraved of souls. More importantly, they also believe such creatures can be saved. They often form close intimate and personal relationships with people and creatures that many find unsavory. Combine that with their tendency towards acceptance of sexual deviancy and Brazzeria has a mixed reputation. Regardless of what mortals think, the immortal fiends of the world fear Brazzerian priests and priestesses more than anything. Brazzerian missionaries will travel to the fiendish infestations in the world to capture as many as possible for conversion, even traveling into the demon realm itself to keep a steady flow of purification rituals. Brazzeria is depicted as a light-skinned, small catgirl with feathered wings. Her skin typically covered in tattoos of gold and milky yellow. She wears minimal clothing, preferring to wear the coif portion of a nun's habit, and an ill fitting one that allows her golden hair to spill out of it. Outside of that she wears stockings and sleeve warmers, leaving censorship fairies to cover up the rest. Boons T1: Fiends are Friends (Su)\ You get advantage on persuasion checks made against fiends. You can expend a use of prayer to get a general sense of distance and direction of the highest concentration of fiends within 100 miles. This prayer takes 1 minute. By succeeding on a planes check, or touching a fiend, you can tell if its soul/psyche is too shattered to be redeemed. This is most common in monstrous fiends, or amalgamations of souls. T2: Introductions (Su)\ With physical contact, you can automatically tell what a creatures real name is, if it has one.  Intimate touch, such as kissing or...wrestling...gives you a nugget of info, as though you used the Psychic Reading spell. T3: Beyond Corruption\ You cannot be dominated by fiends. Any types of corrupting effects, such as curses, afflictions or other DM magic have no effect on you if they originate from a fiend.  Below are some methods to gaining GBP specific to Brazzeria MethodDetails/GainsCaptureFiends who are dead cannot be purified, and so therefore capturing them is an integral part of Brazzerian practices. Capturing creatures nets a similar type of bonus as "slay enemies of" on the default favor page, but the values are doubled if you manage to capture fiends.Secure SpecimenSome fiends are very rare, such as those who were born fiends. Capturing one such creature nets 500*(creatures lvl) GBP.Dethrone LordDemon Lords are the highest tier of creature that can be claimed. If killed, grants value as defeating a mortal enemy. If captured, grants 100k GBP.Dethrone DukeDemonic Dukes and Duchesses are a loose way of referring to other powerful and influential fiends, but that aren't as well known and feared by all mortals who hear their name.Half the kill and capture values of a demon lord.Next LevelIntroduce a romantic partner you have been together with for at least 3 months to the idea of polyamory. It is commonplace (though not compulsory) among dedicated to Brazzerians to mingle with one another, the demons they capture and the hellion they create.By opening a relationship to such opportunities, you gain 300 GBP.EnemiesDemonic cultists, monstrous fiendsMortal EnemiesProselytes of the Golden Order during a crusade against fiends.Leaders of demon hunting organizations.

entries.title: README
entries.content: ⛅ Heavenly Deities Those that typically reside in realms deemed higher than the realms of mortals. These realms have a greater degree of order and prosperity than most others, with some variety in appearance and structure depending which god calls it their domain.

entries.title: invoking-deities
entries.content: 🙏 Invoking Deities Deities can give their favor in specific ways, but invoking their name can give you a more general boon. Whenever you would perform a task that falls in line with the god's ethos, goals or tenets, you can choose to invoke their name as a free action.  This could mean a contest of strength for The Cataclysm, a persuasion check made against a fiend for Brazzeria, or a survival check to track down a hunter exterminating wildlife for Mother Earth. The DM is the final arbiter to decide if your request is answered. When you invoke a deity, you expend a use of prayer and gain a d8 to any single d20 roll (minus something like a random chart). If you invoke and your deity disapproves, you lose that use of prayer, and you get an impression of why your request for aid failed.  You can only invoke a deity that you have curried favor for in most circumstances. When you invoke, you cannot do so again for 1 minute.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Favor of Gods The gods of have a vested interest in the goings on in the world of mortals, and what better way to get mortals to do your bidding then to give them your favor when they act in your interest? This system is designed to provide active incentives for characters to enact the will of the deities in the world: the more that you please a god with your actions, follow their tenets and donate to their causes, the more favor they grant to you. The amount of favor that the gods provide to you is broken up into tiers. The first tier only grants minor boons. Trying to gain the favor of multiple gods only makes all of them hate you more: pick one and stick to it. In general, you cannot earn the favor of a god by accident. In all but the most extreme cases, such as defeating the mortal enemy of a god, you must first learn about a deity to start gaining their favor. As such you cannot start accruing GBP until speaking with priests, cultists or froggs to learn more about what the gods desire. TierDescriptionTier 0(negative GBP)Enemies of the god. You either worship in opposing god, or you act in direct opposition to what the god wants. Followers of this god won't need much reason to deny you services or even attack you.Tier 1(1k+ GBP)You believe in a god. You pray to them, you follow their basic tenets and you might even donate here and there. Most wisdom based classes start off here.Tier 2(10k+ GBP)You are very active member of activities related to the god. You regularly fight and lay down your life to enact their will. You inspire others to join you in your mission to grow your god's following.Tier 3(100k GBP)You are a champion of the god. The deeds that you have performed in their name are legendary. You have statues in your honor, your word is law and you have likely personally met and spoken to your god. * The tier a favor that you're at is determined by the amount of God Benediction Points (GBP) you earn through various tasks. Gods typically have more specific things they like, but common things to increase your GBP include: MethodDetails/GainsDonationsGold/gem donations placed inside of a god's donation vessel (commonly found in churches dedicated to said god) disappear instantly to be used where it is most needed. You gain 1 GBP per 100 gold spent up to a cap of 1k. Once you have 1k, you need 500 gold for 1 GBP.Once you have 10k, you cannot gain more GBP from donations.OfferingsCertain gods may accept specific items other than gold depending on their personalities, with points varying based on the items rarity or desirability. Poor or unwanted offerings can make creatures lose GBP.ManaYou can donate mana to receive 5 GBP per point you burn. See link for more stipulations.Church RegularYou regularly attend services, work directly in the church or otherwise. For each week you can earn 20 GBP.ConversionConvince another to your side. Once a creature you had a significant influence on becomes a church regular, you gain 100 GBP.Destroy Minor Enemy(s)100 GBP. A group of minor enemies typically consists of level 3 or lower creatures in direct opposition of your god.Destroy Intermdiate Enemy(s)500 GBP. An intermediate enemy is typically level 4-6Destroy Major Enemy(s)1k GBP. A group of major enemies typically consists of level 7 or higher creatures that are in direct opposition of your god.Destroy Mortal Enemy(s)30k GBP. And mortal enemy is a specific known creature of great significance. Often creatures other gods have given tier 3 favor to, or someone (or a group of people) the god particularly doesn't like.
