entries.title: README
entries.content: Afflictions Certain monster abilities, as well as the defeated condition, give permanent debuffs to characters. These debuffs represent physical/mental wear and tear beyond the catch-all of hp. The longer you are away from home, the more debuffs you are likely going to accrue. Debuffs universally MUST have some finite method of curing them. Many of them can be cured just by taking a day off: Spend a night at the local bar or brothel, spend time with family, visit a theme park etc. Others require something more specific. Debuffs come in tiers, the higher the tier, the greater the debuff. In the heat of combat, you do not gain the afflictions. Afflictions are accumulated after combat. Roll separately for each time you were defeated in combat. How do you decide what tier you get? Roll a luck check.  If you roll below 1, you get a Tier 3 affliction.\ If you roll below 6, you get a Tier 2 affliction.\ Anything 6 or above and you get a T1 affliction The luck check gets a penalty to the roll equal to afflictions all added up.\ Tier 1 give a -1 penalty, Tier 2 gives -2 and T3 gives a -3 penalty.

entries.title: abnormalities
entries.content: Abnormalities Another feature that can help you decide if your character is a weirdo or not. If you want a relatively average character, don’t roll this. Roll a d20, then roll a d3. The d20 represents what feature is in question and the d3 represents whether the abnormality tends towards being positive (1) unusual (2) or negative (3). You can roll a few times to decide a few unusual features, decide you want a specific number of each feature, then roll a few d20s, or not roll at all. Depending on the race, some of the features described as weird or negative may actually be positive or completely normal. Some features may be completely absent from your race. An easy way to create a new negative feature is to completely remove or damage certain features (one eye). Feel free to go down the whole list if you're a mad lad (though the ladies might not appreciate some of the hair options) D20 RollBody PartEffect1EyesPositive: Your eyes have a very vibrant and entries.title: age
entries.content: Age Roll a d100. The result you get is the percentage of the way through your life essentially. Multiply this value by the average lifespan of your chosen race. Example - Human with a roll of 75 70\*.75=52 years old Most races tend to be children for the first 20% or so of their life, so you can opt to be older if you don’t feel like being a kid.

entries.title: height-weight
entries.content: Height/Weight Roll a d20 and then flip a coin. The d20 represents the variance as a percentage and the coin flip decides up (heads) or down (tails). Example - Human are average 5'6 and weigh 150. I roll a 10 and get heads. 66\1.1=72 in or 6 ft, 150\1.1=165 lbs If you roll a 1 or a 20, you can choose to be ludicrously tall or smol.

entries.title: resurrection-chart
entries.content: Resurrection Chart When a character is resurrected, roll a d4. | 1 | Bad | | --- | ------- | | 2-3 | Neutral | | 4 | Good |   After that roll your respective chart. Characters with positive luck can decide to reroll their result. Characters with negative luck roll twice and have the DM decide what effect happens.   Bad stuff Dice RollResult1Mini Me: A childlike mini version of yourself is resurrected alongside you. Mini Me is a simple creature that is happy with life as long as it gets to travel with you. If Mini Me is separated from you for 3 days, your max hp decreases by 5 until you reunite. If separated for 3 months, it dies and this max hp decrease becomes permanent.2All you felt in death was drowning. Now you are deathly afraid of water. If forced to swim, automatically start drowning in water, fail all swim checks.3Extreme Fear (DC 10 luck check or be frightened, roll until succeed per combat) of creature/creature type that killed you.4You are comatose for 1 week. Your body cannot move but you can still sense everything happening around you.5Res Functions as reincarnate6An enemy that you killed at some point is resurrected at the same time as you. They want revenge, their new purpose is to destroy you at all cost.7Fear of Mortality: You start combat shaken 1 until you or your allies defeat a foe.8Soul Lag: Your body is slower than you remember. -2 to initiative9You physically age 3d12 years.10Celestials sense great evil within you. Take a –4 penalty to charisma checks with celestials.11You cannot lie. Only through omission can you not speak the truth.12Curse of Frogg Saran: The first round of every combat you are a frog (see gods: frogg saran).13Eternal Rest: You take a -4 penalty to saving throws against sleep effects.14During your short eternity you were very "close" with a creature from the beyond.If male, a child will find you claiming to be your spawn. If female, a surprise is growing within you.15Big Hands: Your hands increase in size by 50%.16Biggest Fan: A particularly sneaky and intelligent undead creature will follow you around constantly and try to hang out with you. If killed, it reforms in the nearest graveyard and continues its quest to hang out.     Neutral Dice RollResult1A single horn grows from the center of your forehead. If you already had one, you grow another of to the side.2You suddenly speak a random language. You also lose one of your old languages (other than common).3Whenever you attack, you attack nonlethally. Cannot kill another creature.4You awaken with a brand on your ass. Asking the right people will reveal who did it (a strange imp). Speaking with them may reveal a way to remove it.5Another soul latched onto you. You can communicate with it if you concentrate. Sometimes pops into your thoughts. (luck check to see how good/helpful this soul is, higher is better)6Grow a(n additional) tail.7You look like a rotting corpse in your reflection.8You now constantly know the time of day no matter the condition. Your sense of time is impeccable.9You grow antennae with a keen sense of touch.10Your senses have become a bit jumbled. You now smell with your ears, hear with your eyes, see with your tongue, and can taste and touch with your entire body.11Swap Genders12The Fates had determined you were to be reincarnated, but the ritual has cheated them. You are haunted by dreams of a young couple mourning the loss of the newborn you were to be. Every month or so, you will have dreams and nightmares as the childless couple, your parents, try and fail to grow their family. Over the years they grow bitter, bicker with one another, and live miserable lives.Only finding them and apologizing will make the dreams stop.13 14Whatever killed you leaves a horrific scar that can never be removed (savage burns, large gashes etc).15Your eyes turn a solid color (ROYGBIV+black+white+gray)16Mood Eyes: (Red=mad, blue=sad, pink=affection, orange=happy, yellow=surprise, Violet=disgust, black=afraid).17You can read written text via touch.18A tattoo of a celestial marks the entirety of your back. (A DC 20 planes check reveals its effect). The next time one of your close allies or friends dies near you, you immediately die and their life is restored.19Share Memory: You gain a significant memory of the creature that killed you or a significant creature that contributed to your death.20Green Thumb: All plants you tend to manage to pull through somehow. Plants like you.21Blessing(?) of Frogg Saran: 1/hour you can fire sliced cheese from your hand as a ranged attack. It harmlessly slaps against your opponent, but it might confuse them, make them paranoid, make them laugh or make them realize the power you hold.22You come back slightly resembling another creature type. (1-Aberration, 2-Fiend, 3-Celestial, 4-Fey, 5-Construct, 6-Animal, 7-Plant, 8-Dragon). There is no particular mechanical change with this, but people might treat you differently due to your appearance change.23The sound of a truly epic (fiendish/celestial) performance accompanies the resurrection.24You are haunted by the ghost of Big Smoke. He doesn’t actually exist for anyone other than you. He exclusively calls you CJ, asks you about food and keeps talking about a train.25 26Stone Faced: Almost all facial gestures you make are very subtle compared to what they used to be. You get a +4 bonus to deception checks but suffer a –4 penalty to all other charisma checks.27Stone Face: Your face is made out of stone, almost as though your face is just a mask that is impossible to take off.28Can I Keep it?: A small undead animal is bound to your soul and relies on you to exist. it stays within 5 feet of you and acts as you wish. If it moves beyond this range it teleports back to you.29There is always a frog somewhere in your field of vision. When you look at it, it changes position to be at the edge again. Everybody else can interact with this frog normally.30Love at First Sight: You now have a crush on someone present during the resurrection (decide randomly).31Anchor Arms: The muscles in your arms appear to grow incredibly large, but it does not affect your strength. If you already had high strength, they get even bigger. If you had low strength, you look ridiculous.32Floofy: Your hair grows incredibly long and other parts of your body get exceptionally fluffy. Floofyness +233Censorship: When naked, natural elements of the terrain move to maintain modesty.   Good Stuff Dice RollResult1You understand, write and speak all (non-secret) languages2There is an incomplete map tattooed to your back. It's enough to get the rough idea of where it may be leading, but just barely.3A friend or some other helpful person gets resurrected at the same time as you. They appear lying next to you. They are eternally bound to you, immortal as long as you live.4Second Sight: You grow a perpendicular third eye on your forehead. Consuming corpse parts lets you see how they died. Biting people gives you insight into their feelings of you.7Your spirit is forever bound to a small item near the location of your resurrection. Should you ever get 30ft away from this item, you are defeated until it Is returned to you. You cannot die while this item is within 30 feet of you.8Dragon Sight: The area around your eyes is coated in scales and your eye color changes to match. You gain night vision.9You lived as an animal during your time of death. You now feel a kinship towards animals and can speak with them.10Hellion say "you smell like home." +4 to charisma checks with hellion and fiends.11You can grow and shed your hair into any shape/length you please at will.12You mysteriously gain a piece of knowledge. You can call upon this knowledge whenever you make an intelligence-based check. You automatically succeed. When you use this, the knowledge fades and you can't use feature again.13You gain the ability to play instruments out of thin air. Like an air guitar, but with all instruments. You get a +4 bonus to all instrument-based perform checks.14You no longer need to sleep and can enter the dreams of adjacent sleeping creatures. Though they are the masters of their own world and can force you to leave.15You are now incredibly knowledgeable on the creature that killed you, as though you succeeded on a monster lore check to identify all its features.16Blood Sight: By sacrificing 15 ft of movement, you can focus on a visible creature. This allows you see the rough percentage of hp they are missing. 17You awaken from the resurrection with a non magical silver ring clasped in your hands. It feels wrong to put it on anybody's hand who you don’t truly love. Once put on, DM decides if the love is true. If it isn't, the ring fades away. If it is, you gain a succ bond with them where both of you gain its benefits.18You can speak telepathically to creatures you are in direct contact with.19Whenever you bleed, you bleed water. Creatures like vampires will be very disappointed. Effects that require blood don’t function properly. You can still take bleed damage, however.20Read the Room: You can tell the attitudes of NPCs towards you just by looking at them (good, bad, neutral).21Blessing of Frogg Saran: You gain the ability to transform heathens into sweet rolls. This functions like the besmolder's candy ray. This ability can only turn creatures into sweet rolls. 1/day.22You more closely resemble a (1-Hellion, 2-Exalted, 3-Fallen, 4-Geniekin). You don't gain their racial features, but you can take their racial feats.23You no longer age and will essentially live until you are killed.24Be Right Back: As an immediate action you can choose to disappear from existence until the end of your next turn. 1/day.25Blessing of NJU: Gain a +8 bonus to an athletics check 1/day. Become fatigued for 1 minute after.26You no longer dream when you sleep. Only by taking damage or a creature spending a standard action to shake you can you wake up.27Cool hat: You acquired an exceptionally fancy hat worth 1k gold. It gives you an air of nobility when wearing it.28Mega Cookie: You are blessed by the bakers from the great beyond. This cookie can resurrect a creature that has been dead for less than 1 minute.

entries.title: catapult
entries.content: Catapult Catapult Alchemy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureSaveReflex The end of your staff manifests into a sling or catapult like device. You can load it with any handheld item weighing up to 10 lbs and launch it at a creature. The creature takes d8+CL (4+CL) damage and is also affected by the item catapulted (reflex halves and negates effect of item). The type of damage varies depending on the object thrown. The creature must also make any appropriate save against catapulted items. Even if a creature passes its save, the item is assumed to land in the creatures space, so if the item activates on impact, the creature may still have to deal with an explosion, grease or whatever other fun stuff gets tossed.

entries.title: endothermic-touch
entries.content: Endothermic Touch Endothermic Touch \[buff] \[fire] Alchemy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil Rest You are temporarily much better at conducting heat in a controlled manner. In general you can exist in hot environments comfortably. One of your limbs glows like heated metal and can be used to touch solid objects that are sources of large heat. Up to a 1 ft cube can be affected at a time. By maintaining contact with an object (one FRA) you can store its heat. Later you can choose to diffuse this heat into the air around you, or transfer it to another object. The effects of which depend on the object. Many things simply burn, but others like stone and metals can be softened. If used as a melee attack, it deals 2d6+CL (7+CL) fire damage. If you desire, you can immediately diffuse the heat as you touch the hot object continuously. You can affect a 1ft cube per round of contact. Prolonged exposure to heat bothers you less during this spell, but in enclosed spaces, your allies, and eventually even you, can be overwhelmed by heat.

This changes nothing about the metals physical properties, only its appearance. You can affect a 1ft cube of metal. A DC 10 nature check reveals the gold is fake. entries.content: Nauseating Trail Nauseating Trail \[poison] \[persistent] \[concentration] Alchemy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoEIt's complicatedDuration3 roundsSaveFort Immediately dash and disengage, leaving behind a toxic trail in your wake. For the rest of your turn, spaces you move through are filled with a toxic gas that lingers. The gas spreads slightly up into the air, causing the spaces 5 feet above you to also be affected.  Any creature that moves through one of these spaces experiences its stench and caustic properties. They take 3d8+CL (13+CL) poison damage and are sickened 1 (fort halves damage and negates sicken).

entries.title: alchemize
entries.content: Alchemize Alchemize Alchemy 3 Cast Time - 1 minute EffectRangeReachTarget1 Metal Object You instantly turn a hunk of metal into gold. The object can be no larger than a 3x3x3ft cube, and it must be something you are able to hold (in its entirety) in one hand. As long as the item you hold is mostly made out of metal, you convert it to gold equal to 60% of its total value. This spell can also be used to convert gold into base metals. {% hint style="success" %} I'm currently thinking about the implications this spell has on world building. It's a complex web that makes you consider the value of metal, how the crafting system works and how the world replenishes resources consumed by magic. {% endhint %}

They gain the following special attack\ Special Attack: Poop Toss - Make a thrown weapon attack. On hit the creature takes 2d6 (7) poison damage and becomes sickened 2. Curse can be removed by eating a banana or using poop toss.

entries.title: disc-of-light
entries.content: Disc of Light Disc of Light \[holy] \[light] \[persistent] \[upcast] Anime Jesus 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE30 ft lineRange30 ftDuration1 round You throw a disc of light that boomerangs back to you at the start of your next turn. Make a ranged attack and compare the result to every creature within a 30 foot line. Each creature takes (6+CL) holy damage. The disc persists at the end of its range, automatically dealing its damage to creatures that move through that space. At the start of your next turn, the disc returns very quickly in a line directly back to you dealing half the damage again automatically, requiring no roll. If you spend an immediate action, you can catch the disc, allowing you to throw it again at no cost. If you do not throw it again on your next turn, it disappears. If the disc impacts solid terrain (such as a wall) on either the way out or the way back, it halts in place. The discs give off light in a 20 ft radius. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by 4.

You must spend a standard action each round to continue concentrating. Round 1 - 5d6+CL (17+CL) holy damage (reflex halves). Round 2 - 5d8+CL (22+CL) and increases the DC by 4. entries.title: threnody-of-vengeance
entries.content: Threnody of Vengeance Threnody of Vengeance \[buff] \[concentration] Anime Jesus 5 Cast Time - 1 immediate action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 allyDurationUp to 3 rounds {% hint style="info" %} Maintaining concentration on this spell consumes your swift actions. {% endhint %} You cast this spell in response to an ally being dominated, frightened, defeated, or slain. The ally is stunned for as long as this spell persists, but a golden flaming duplicate of themselves emerges from their space, able to act in their stead. The ally controls the copy, and still consumes its resources if the clone uses any. The copy has half of their maximum hit points, has no negative conditions copied over, and is taunted by whatever charmed, feared, defeated, or slew them. If the stunned condition is removed, the ally is no longer dominated/frightened/defeated/slain, the copy is slain, or the ally wills it to end at any point, the spell ends.

entries.title: elden-memes
entries.content: Elden Memes Elden Memes \[holy] \[concentration] Anime Jesus 6 Cast Time - 1 FRA EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration5 roundsSaveReflex You create a condensed ball of divine energy and release it into the world. Every round on your turn, the ball of light gently floats towards a target you designate at the time of casting at a speed of 30 feet. If the ball gets within 30 feet of the original target, it starts to gently circle around them clockwise instead of moving towards them. All enemies within 30 feet of the ball at the end of its movement each turn automatically take (CL) holy damage from projectiles that rapidly fire in all directions around it. If the original target is ever defeated, then a new target can be selected as an instant action. On the 5th round, the ball advances rapidly towards the original target and explodes in their space. If the original target is dead, unconscious or has managed to get more than 300 feet away, it instead explodes immediately. The explosion deals 7d8+CL (31+CL) holy damage (reflex halves) in a 20 ft radius to all enemies.

entries.title: black-light
entries.content: Black Light Black Light \[light] Brazzeria 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE5 ft radius aura, centered on casterDuration10 minutes Your staff emits light, but it is a dim violet color. The radius of the spell turns darkness into dim light. More importantly, certain substances are highlighted while within this light. Bodily fluids and chemical spills are the most common substances, but savvy alchemists can create ink that also shows up under black light.

entries.title: bookake
entries.content: Bookake Bookake \[curse] Brazzeria 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 inanimate book, or book-like object You apply the mark of Brazzeria and close the book. Between its pages ooze an incredibly effective gooey adhesive that keeps it closed. No matter how strong the individual, the book's adhesive may stretch slightly, but it cannot be broken open. You can also choose to seal off only a specific section of a book, such as a chapter or a singular page. The caster must apply a password to the book that dispels the goo when spoken.  A caster may roll arcana to determine the password (15+CL). An application of universal solvent automatically dispels this effect.

entries.title: cure-wounds
entries.content: Cure Wounds Cure Wounds \[healing] \[upcast] Brazzeria 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Magically close wounds and replace lost blood. The creature gains 5+CL hp and is cured of fatigue. By adding \[mana burn] equal to spell level you give it the \[overheal] tag. Upcast - For every additional mana you spend, increase healing by 3 and you can target an additional creature. You can move in between delivering the spell to reach more than one creature.

entries.title: fasting
entries.content: Fasting Fasting \[curse] Brazzeria 1 Cast Time - 1 minute EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature You lock the creature out from all kinds of physical intimacy. The target is physically unable to engage in intimate touch as a divine force repels all attempts to initiate such acts, as well as all attempts made against the target to initiate such acts. No other bodily functions are impaired by this spell. Any effects that have a saving throw and can be obviously considered lewd are rolled with advantage. When the spell is cast, a magical key is generated. Inserting this key into the chest of the corresponding creature is the only reliable way to end this spell (don’t lose it!). If the key is destroyed, they spell ends.

This functions both ways. This spell creates a visible spectral golden hand that wraps around the bonded creature's hand.

entries.title: unnatural-lust
entries.content: Unnatural Lust Unnatural Lust Brazzeria 1 Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange30 ftTarget2 creatures within 30 ft of each otherDuration1 roundSaveWill When you cast the spell, you choose two targets. The initial target you inflict the horny upon. The second target doesn't get affected by anything, but rather determines where this horniness is directed towards. The initial target must spend the entirety of its next turn moving towards the secondary target and then caressing, hugging, or kissing them (will negates). A creature gets a +4 to its save if it would not normally be sexually attracted to the secondary target. By succeeding on a monster lore check against a creature, you can determine what an appropriate secondary target for this spell would be. After failing its save and satisfying it's carnal desires, a creature becomes more resistant to the spell and always receives the +4 bonus on subsequent casts against it for one minute. A creature can only be targeted by a spell that makes them horny once every few minutes.

entries.title: circle-of-sealing
entries.content: Circle of Sealing Circle of Sealing \[mana burn] Brazzeria 2 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectRangeReachTarget1 defeated or willing fiendDuration Until Rest You move around to inscribe a circle on the ground, then infuse it with mana to cause a tangible but transparent barrier to appear, sealing the fiend inside of it. The fiend is unable to pass through this barrier, or go under/over it. It is anchored and siphoned while inside. Otherwise the fiend may act as they wish.  If the barrier is ever damaged from the outside, it automatically breaks, and so care must be taken to protect trapped demons. Brazzerians usually use this spell to interact with the fiend to get to know them better to prepare for purification. This spell functions only on level 4 or lower fiends. Upcast - Each additional mana spent increases the level of the fiend you can trap by 2 (max 12).

entries.title: detect-thots
entries.content: Detect Thots Detect Thots \[concentration] \[subtle] Brazzeria 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 CreatureDuration10 minutesSaveWill (see text) You detect thots. For the purposes of this spell, a thot is someone who (breathes) has had more than one sexual partner. Every turn as a standard action you can scan a creature you can see, automatically telling you their propensity for horniness on a scale of 1 to 5. You can also pry further to find out a rough approximation of the number of sexual partners the target has had (will negates). Rough estimation: Zero, one, several, dozens, countless

entries.title: exhibition
entries.content: Exhibition Exhibition \[glamer] Brazzeria 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 CreatureDuration3 roundsSaveWill This spell functions differently if you target an ally or an enemy. Enemy\ You cause all of the creatures equipment to visually disappear, making them appear naked (will negates). For the duration of the spell the creature treats it as though they have no equipment, and cannot use anything dependent on equipment, such as shield actions, spell casting and weapon special attacks. At the end of each turn, the creature gets a new save to end the effect. They still get any passive bonuses to their equipment, such as armor or poise from shields. Ally\ You can cast this spell on yourself or an ally as a swift action, and its duration increases to 1 hour. It instead only makes your ally appear as though they are naked or scantily clad, but still armed. They can still use any activated equipment.

The DC is (10+CL of the effect). For non-spell effects its (10+creature's lvl). If the status is removed, the creature heals 5 hp. This spell cannot be used in order to remove permanent status effects, like curses or afflictions.

entries.title: simp
entries.content: Simp Simp \[curse] \[charm] Brazzeria 2 Cast Time - 1 standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 defeated or willing creature You inflict the curse of the simp on a defeated or willing creature. The creature is permanently charmed. All interactions between you and the creature are inherently positive to the creature. Stepping on them is a massage, insulting them is advice etc. When the creature is asked about you, they have nothing but positive things to say and you can do no wrong. While they are not compelled to do anything that you ask necessarily, they do go out of their way to help in ways that don’t require much effort on their part, and they are very easy to convince. You get advantage on any skill check versus this creature. If you affect the creature with an effect that deals damage or otherwise harms them, then they get a will save against the curse (also applies if they see/find out you told someone else to do so). Doing an advanced ritual that involves going outside and touching grass, the curse ends.

entries.title: true-form
entries.content: True Form True Form Brazzeria 2 Cast Time - 1 standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature You roll a caster level check to immediately end a polymorph effect. The DC is (11+CL of the effect) or for non-spell effects (11+creature's lvl). If you are successful, the creature is staggered for one round and cannot use polymorph effects for 24 hours. If you cast this on a creature that is not currently hiding its true form, the spell rebounds and you stagger yourself for 1 round. If you cast this on a helpless or willing creature, it automatically succeeds. When used against a fiendish creature, increase your effective caster level by 5.

entries.title: bondage
entries.content: Bondage Bondage \[concentration] Brazzeria 3 Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minuteSaveReflex A golden chain is launched from your staff and wraps around a creature (reflex negates). While chained the creature cannot easily move beyond the spell's range and is clumsy 2. As a swift action, the creature can attempt an opposed athletics check to drag you along with them. If you are untrained in athletics, use your CL as your bonus. If they succeed, you are pulled towards them the distance they move beyond the spells range (max 30 ft) and take 10 poise damage. If this poise breaks you, you are knocked down. You can also attempt this athletics check to yank the creature back.

entries.title: ecstasy
entries.content: Ecstasy Ecstasy \[mind-affecting] Brazzeria 3 Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration2 roundsSaveWill You fill a creatures mind with horny thoughts, causing them to shiver and writhe with pleasure. The creature is dazed for 1 round and staggered the round after (will reduces to stagger 1 round). If the target creature could reasonably be sexually attracted to the caster (aka, not gay) then the DC is increased by 1. If the caster is naked, or basically naked, the DC is increased by 1. These DC increases stack. A creature can only be targeted by a spell that makes them horny once every few minutes.

entries.title: hell-and-back
entries.content: Hell and Back Hell and Back \[teleportation] Brazzeria 3 Cast Time - 1 minute EffectRangeReachDurationSee text You generate a portal that leads to the demon realm for 1 minute. A maximum of a dozen creatures can go through the portal. At any point within the next 24 hours, you can spend another minute to recreate this portal to bring you back to your original position. The portal’s destination is always on stable ground in an area without any immediate natural hazards (you don’t spawn in lava pits). You must have an idea of where you would like to go in order to use this spell. Roll a planes check and subtract your result from 40. That is how many miles you appear off course from your desired location. The minimum distance is 1 mile off course. If you are interrupted during the cast time when attempting to recreate the portal or you stay for longer than 24 hours, you cannot use this spell to return back to the material plane and must find other means. This spell does not require line of sight.

entries.content: Golden Shower Golden Shower \[healing] \[persistent] \[concentration] \[holy] Brazzeria 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE20 ft radius, centered on casterDuration5 minutes A fluffy yellow cloud appears 30 ft overhead and soothing droplets of gold rain wash over nearby allies, and burn nearby enemies. All allied creatures recover 4 hp each turn and all enemies take 4 holy damage each turn for 1 minute (totaling 40 healing or damage over the full duration). This healing/dmg occurs at the end of each of your turns. If an enemy is defeated, they cannot die from this damage, and they no longer take holy damage from the rain.

entries.title: grace-of-champions
entries.content: Grace of Champions Grace of Champions \[healing] \[buff] \[holy] Brazzeria 4 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute You conjure a golden spectral champion of Brazzeria that mirrors your movements and enhances your actions. Whenever you target allies with a beneficial effect, you can choose to also heal them (or one of them for AoE effects) for d4+CL (2+CL), or 2d6+CL (7+CL) if they are within your natural reach.  Whenever you target an enemy with a harmful effect, you can choose to also strike them with holy energy (or one of them for AoE effects), dealing d4+CL (2+CL) holy dmg, or 2d6+CL (7+CL) holy damage if they are within your natural reach. Either effect requires a swift action, and can be performed as part of casting this spell. The spirit will also protect you in your hour of need. If you fail a will save, you can choose to instead pass. If you are defeated, you can instead choose to drop to 1 hp. Either effect requires an immediate action and ends the spell.

entries.title: holy-nova
entries.content: Holy Nova Holy Nova \[holy] \[healing] Brazzeria 4 Cast Time - 1 swift action EffectAoE30 ft radius burst, centered caster Unleash a quick burst of radiance to heal your allies and damage your foes. Allies heal (CL) hp and enemies take (CL) holy damage.

entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 5

entries.title: waves-of-ecstasy
entries.content: Waves of Ecstasy Waves of Ecstasy \[mind-affecting] Brazzeria 5 Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectAoE30 ft coneDuration2 roundsSaveWill Functions as Ecstasy, but in a 30 ft cone. A creature can only be targeted by a spell that makes them horny once every few minutes.

entries.title: power-word-cum
entries.content: Power Word Cum Power Word Cum \[mind-affecting] Brazzeria 6 Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration2 roundsSaveNone You fill a creatures mind with horny thoughts, causing them to shiver and writhe with pleasure. The extent of which this affects them is determined by whether or not the creature is attracted to you. If the target creature could reasonably be sexually attracted to the caster (aka, different gender and not gay) then the creature is stunned for 1 round, then staggered the round after. If the creature isn't compatible (same gender and not gay etc) or doesn't experience horny (like mindless creatures and constructs) then it is staggered for 1 round. A creature can only be targeted by a spell that makes them horny once every few minutes.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: README
entries.content: Brazzeria Brazzeria embodies the struggle people face when their beliefs clash with reality and their desires clash with their duties. She has a reputation for normalizing what would otherwise be considered taboo in most other types of relationships. In the eyes of her followers, almost no evil is too great to be beyond redemption. As such, it isn’t uncommon to find her followers frequenting the same place as fiends on the material plane. It is a constant battle of wills; satisfying your deepest desires while avoiding the descent into deepest depths of profanity. Brazzeria spells are a mix between useful spells for battling fiends, healing and horny spells.

entries.title: acid-splash
entries.content: Acid Splash Acid Splash \[poison] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 round Your hand, or your staff/seal turn a sickly green color and start bubbling. You flick it towards a creature, making a ranged attack roll, and a sticky glob of caustic goo flies at them. Deals d4+CL (2+CL) poison damage. This damage happens again at the end of the creatures turn unless they are wet, or otherwise remove the acid through some kind of washing.

entries.title: arcane-mark
entries.content: Arcane Mark Arcane Mark Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature or objectDurationPermanent You touch a surface and inscribe a symbol or a single word. The mark can be no larger than 4x4 inches. In order to use the spell on a creature, it must be willing, you must land an attack roll or you must make a successful sleight of hand check. Dispel magic automatically succeeds on an arcane mark.

entries.title: audio-book
entries.content: Audio Book Audio Book \[concentration] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 piece of written text You touch a book, scroll or other form of writing and give the text a faint glow. As long as you could read the text normally and you concentrate, the text is automatically read out loud. It is in your voice in a language that you can speak. After casting the spell, you can leave and go about your business and the spell continues to work its magic. You can dictate a starting point, and the pages flip all on their own, highlighting the text as it is read.

entries.title: catch-flame
entries.content: Catch Flame Catch Flame \[fire] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDuration1 minute A mote of flame manifests in an empty hand, or attached to a staff/seal. As part of casting the spell, you can blow this flame onto a creature within reach by making an attack roll. Does d10+CL (5+CL) fire damage. You can continue making more attacks by blowing on it again as a standard action each turn as long as the flame persists. You can also use this mote of flame to gently warm things, start fires and provide light (10 ft bright light).

entries.title: dancing-light
entries.content: Dancing Light Dancing Light \[light] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 willing creature or objectDuration1 hour You conjure a tiny being of light. It gently floats around the target and gives off bright light and a 20-foot radius, and dim light in a 20 foot radius after that. Casting this spell again causes any other instances of it to end.

entries.title: death-ward
entries.content: Death Ward Death Ward Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE20 ft radius burst, centered on casterDuration10 minutes A rune appears on each willing creature inside of the area. All creatures that posses a death ward cannot kill creatures that were subject to the same casting of death ward by defeating them. This spell is used for organized duels and tournaments to prevent contestants from dying.

entries.title: detect-pregnancy
entries.content: Detect Pregnancy Detect Pregnancy Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature By holding your hand close to the creature, you can tell whether or not it's pregnant and how far along in it's pregnancy it is.

entries.title: ghost-sound
entries.content: Ghost Sound Ghost Sound \[figment] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftDuration Up to 1 minuteSaveWill You create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place. You choose what type of sound is created when casting it and cannot change the sound. The sound mimics whatever you want. It can sound like a cafeteria, crowd, waterfall, lion roaring etc, but cannot produce intelligible speech, or sound like a specific person. It can be very loud, but cannot be loud enough to cause harm or otherwise affect anything physically. When exposed to this sound, a creature can roll a will save to realize it is fake.

entries.title: grasp-of-the-undying
entries.content: Grasp of the Undying Grasp of the Undying Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 round Make a ranged attack against a creature with a bony spectral hand. Deals d6+CL (3+CL) necrotic damage and applies bone chill for 1 round. Special: If the target creature is within your natural reach, you can make this attack as a melee attack.

entries.title: icicle
entries.content: Icicle Icicle \[frost] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange30 ftTargetOne creatureDuration1 round You fire an icy projectile that deals d6+CL (3+CL) frost damage and decreases the creatures speed by 15 for 1 round on hit.

entries.title: innervate
entries.content: Innervate Innervate \[recharge] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 immediate action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature You call upon the energy of all living things to empower you or an ally. You cast this spell in response to a spell being cast and it increases the spells CL by 1.  A creature cannot be the target of this spell more than 1/day.

entries.title: living-roots
entries.content: Living Roots Living Roots \[earth] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveReflex Choose a creature that is standing on some form of dirt/earth/sand. Roots burst up from the ground and entangle the creature (reflex negates). They can remove this condition automatically as a standard action, or a swift action with an athletics check (spell DC).

entries.title: mage-hand
entries.content: Mage Hand Mage Hand Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange30 ft You create a ghostly ethereal hand that can pick up items and perform a simple task such as opening doors, pulling up pants or tipping over buckets. It can carry up to 10 lbs and has a +0 bonus to athletics. The hand cannot do anything that takes longer than one turn to perform unless you add the \[concentration] tag and focus on its actions with yours each turn. You can use the hand to perform a bully or shove combat maneuver with a bonus of +1.

entries.title: magic-missile
entries.content: Magic Missile Magic Missile \[force] \[outplay] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creature Launch a dart of magic that unerringly strikes an enemy to deal (CL) force damage.

entries.title: mana-ramping
entries.content: Mana Ramping Mana Ramping Cantrip Cast Time - 1 minute EffectRangeReachTarget1 willing creature or multiple mana crystals {% hint style="info" %} The target of this spell must be willing. This means it cannot be used against creatures that have no will of their own, that lack intelligence or enemies that have been defeated. {% endhint %} You touch your staff to the target creature and drain the mana from them. They mana burn equal to their maximum mana-1. A mana crystal appears in the creature's possession with mana equal to the amount they mana burned -1. This makes it useless on most commoners. Mages typically use this to collect from themselves for the convenience of not needing to go through other adventuring guilds, craftsmen or churches to get the mana they need for their own projects. You can also use this spell to combine all mana crystals in your possession together. The smaller crystals are absorbed by the larger crystal and you add the mana values together.

entries.title: metronome
entries.content: Metronome Metronome Cantrip Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectEffects Vary Wiggle your staff and cause a random effect from the following list. Roll a D6. 1 - Bury yourself underground until the start of your next turn, effectively putting you in stasis against anything that isn't an earth-based attack. If you attack a foe on follow up turn, they are DD.\ 2 - Confuse yourself. Immediately roll on confusion chart, then end the confusion.\ 3 - Cause a banana peel to appear under a creature within 30 ft of you. They are knocked down, (reflex negates).\ 4 - Your tongue becomes long, powerful and elastic, allowing you to make a free drag attempt with a range of 30 ft.\ 5 - Move 60 ft in a straight line of your choosing \[elusive], stopping when you hit a solid surface. Creatures along the way take d6 (3) crush damage\ 6 - You and an enemy within 30 ft of you are set ablaze (reflex negates for you both).

entries.title: prestidigitation
entries.content: Prestidigitation Prestidigitation Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRangeReachTargetVaries With a flick of your wrist and some magic sparkles, you can create a variety of effects. HeatIncrease the temperature of small areas/objects to be warm to the touchChillDecrease the temperature of small areas/objects to be cold to the touchCreateGenerate crude creations out of small objects, like origami or board game piecesColorChange the color of small areas/objects like pieces of paper or pencils

entries.title: README
entries.content: Cantrips The magic basics. Cantrips don't cost mana and essentially count as level 0 spells.

entries.title: scribe
entries.content: Scribe Scribe Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action Focus - A writing utensil and something to write on EffectRange30 ftTarget1 piece of written text You touch a book, scroll or other form of writing and give the text a faint glow. The utensil moves on its own to copy down the content you targeted onto the paper, parchment etc. you provided as a focus. It copies down the text at a rate of about 1 page of an average book per minute in your handwriting. If you are trained in the linguistics skill, you can duplicate the handwriting.

entries.title: shocking-grasp
entries.content: Shocking Grasp Shocking Grasp \[zap] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRangeReachTargetOne creature Your staff transforms into electricity and coats your hand. Make a melee attack against a creature that deals d8+CL (4+CL) damage. The creature cannot make AoOs for 1 round on hit. If the creature is wearing metal armor or is sufficiently metallic, get a +4 bonus to attack.

entries.title: spirit-animal
entries.content: Spirit Animal Spirit Animal \[companion] \[concentration] \[upcast] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRangeReachDuration1 hour You create a small spectral animal of significance to you. This animal follows basic commands and can roll survival ONLY to guide people through wilderness using your bonus. It cannot interact with the physical world and disappears if it takes damage. Casting this spell again causes any other instances of it to end. Upcast - Increase duration by 8 hours per mana spent

entries.title: stubbed-toe
entries.content: Stubbed Toe Stubbed Toe \[earth] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 CreatureSaveReflex You cause the ground underneath a creature to react unfavorably to their movement. If the targeted creature moves at all on their next turn, they must roll a reflex save or a piece of the ground intercepts their movement. They take d6 (3) bludgeoning damage and they have their speed reduced by 15 ft until they spend a standard action bitching and moaning about it.

entries.title: umbrella
entries.content: Umbrella Umbrella \[dismissable] Cantrip Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectTargetSelf You create a visible barrier above your head that shields you from the elements. You are protected from things such as rain and sunlight. Gain cover from attacks that originate above you. Creatures that huddle next to you can also share this benefit. Certain effects that mimic weather can potentially be mitigated by this spell such as call cheese storm and solar eclipse. Average doorways are considered difficult terrain while this spell is active.

entries.title: fog-cloud
entries.content: Fog Cloud Fog Cloud \[air] \[water] Clairvoyance 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftAoE20 ft radius, centered on a point on the groundDuration1 minute Cause a fog cloud to roll into the area and linger for a bit. Creatures outside of the fog cloud can only see 5 ft into it. Creatures inside of the fog cloud can only see 5 ft in front of them. Even still, such creatures have partial concealment. Creatures beyond 5 ft of fog have total concealment. Upcast 4 - The fog becomes much thicker. Creatures treat it as difficult terrain. It can also soften falls.

entries.title: lightning-rod
entries.content: Lightning Rod Lightning Rod \[buff] \[zap] Clairvoyance 1 Cast Time - 1 Free Action EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil Rest As an immediate action, you can choose to direct any effects with the \[zap] tag to yourself, provided you are within range 30 ft the effect's origin or destination. You can use yourself as a target for any effects that require multiple creatures to chain \[zap] effects and are immune to allied \[zap] effects without reducing the number of creatures it effects.

entries.title: lightning-strike
entries.content: Lightning Strike Lightning Strike \[zap] \[martial] \[concentration] \[upcast] Clairvoyance 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTarget1 melee weaponSaveReflex Electrify a melee weapon, natural attack or unarmed strike. Concentrate until you land an attack with it. On hit the electricity arcs to another target within 15 ft. All secondary targets take the entirety of the attacks damage as lightning damage (reflex halves). They do not suffer any of its on-hit or additional effects. You choose the targets. If you are disarmed of the weapon you cast this spell on, you cease concentration and the spell ends. Upcast - Every additional mana spent allows you to increase the number of additional targets.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: storm-stomp
entries.content: Storm Stomp Storm Stomp \[air] Clairvoyance 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectAoE5 ft radius, centered on casterSaveFort You take a step forward and whip up winds around you knocking any creatures within range back 5 feet (fort negates).

entries.title: achoo
entries.content: Achoo! Achoo \[air] \[elusive] \[upcast] Clairvoyance 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureSaveFort Your nose twitches before you unleash a mighty sneeze. You knock yourself and a creature back 10 feet in opposite directions. They are staggered for one round and take 2d8+CL (9+CL) crush damage, or two rounds with 3d8+CL (13+CL) crush damage if they impact a solid surface (fort halves dmg and negates stagger). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: finger-gun
entries.content: Finger Gun Finger Gun \[air] \[upcast] Clairvoyance 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveFort You point your finger at someone and then snap your fingers with your thumb pointing towards the sky. You unleash a powerful concentrated stream of air at a creature, requiring a ranged attack. The attack deals 3d8+CL (13+CL) crush damage. The creature is staggered for 1 round (fort negates). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: heavens-vengeance
entries.content: Heavens' Vengeance Heavens' Vengeance \[buff] \[zap] \[upcast] Clairvoyance 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange30 ftTargetSelfDuration1 minute A dark cloud spawns above your head that crackles with electricity. It is angered whenever you take damage, and deals 3 zap damage to the creature that inflicted the damage if it is within 30 ft. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by 1.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: static-field
entries.content: Static Field Static Field \[buff] \[zap] Clairvoyance 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute While this spell is active, you crackle with electricity. Your melee attacks deal an additional 2 zap damage and apply a mark to enemies on hit. As a standard action while this persists, you can end the spell with one big stream of electric current. Marked creatures you have line of effect to automatically take 3d8+CL (13+CL) zap damage, even if you can't see them. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage of the standard action blast by d8 (4).

entries.title: wind-wall
entries.content: Wind Wall Wind Wall \[air] \[concentration] Clairvoyance 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ft AoEVariesDuration1 minute All ranged attacks passing through the wall take a -4 penalty to attack unless they originate from a siege weapon. Exceptionally small creatures such as insects cannot pass through the wall. The wall can also reasonably protect against things like harmful gases. Moving through the wall costs 15 ft of movement. Creatures that opt to stand inside of a wind wall are clumsy 2 until they exit. You can choose to make the wall in 2 shapes.\ Wall - 20x40 rectangle\ Castle - 10ft cube

entries.title: call-lightning-storm
entries.content: Call Lightning Storm Call Lightning Storm \[upcast] \[concentration] \[zap] Clairvoyance 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minuteSaveFort As part of casting the spell, and as a standard action every turn after, you call down a lightning bolt to strike a specific creature. The creature takes 2d8+CL (9+CL) zap damage (fort halves). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, target an additional creature with each lightning strike.

entries.title: eye-of-the-storm
entries.content: Eye of the Storm Eye of the Storm \[buff] \[air] Clairvoyance 3 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute You surround yourself with a tempest that you can command. You get advantage on saves against \[air] effects +2 ac against ranged attacks and spaces within your natural reach are considered difficult terrain. Harmful gasses, smoke, fog etc is blown directly away from you, clearing areas you move into. As a standard action while the spell persists, you can spend a standard action to make an attack against a creature within 30 ft with a gust of wind. This attack can be melee if made against a creature within reach. It deals 2d6+CL (7+CL) crush damage and an equal amount of poise damage. If this breaks the creatures poise, you can choose to shove it or knock it down. {% hint style="success" %} Special If you have the elemental blast \[air] feature. You can use that attack's damage instead of this spells damage. {% endhint %}

entries.title: lightning-bolt
entries.content: Lightning Bolt Lightning Bolt \[upcast] \[zap] Clairvoyance 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTargetSee TextSaveFort Lightning erupts from your fingertips and bounces around the battlefield from enemy to enemy. You initially target a single creature, then the lightning bounces from that target to another target of your choosing (that you can see) within 30 ft. You affect a total of three creatures. Each creature affected takes 4d8+CL (18+CL) zap damage and is staggered for one round (fort halves damage and negates stagger). Upcast - For each additional mana spent the lightning bolt bounces to an additional target and deals and additional d8 (4) damage.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: storm-step
entries.content: Storm Step Storm Step \[elusive] \[air] Clairvoyance 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoEReachSaveFort The direction of the wind changes to briefly haste you. As part of casting the spell, dash.  Creatures within reach of you at the end of your turn take 3d8+CL (13+CL) crush dmg (fort halves). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: succ
entries.content: SUCC SUCC \[air] \[concentration] Clairvoyance 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoEVariesSaveVaries You take a breath so deep that you can use it to inhale enormous quantities of air in a 40 ft radius around you. This is best used against clouds of smoke, fog or poison. As long as you concentrate, you can hold this air in your massive cheeks without any harm to yourself. When you cease concentration, you can exhale these gases as a 30 ft cone attack if they were harmful, inflicting whatever negative effect they had using your save DC. Regardless of what you exhale, the gas dissipates immediately after the attack.

entries.title: temperamental-tempest
entries.content: Temperamental Tempest Temperamental Tempest \[air] \[concentration] Clairvoyance 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE30 ft lineDuration3 roundsSaveFort You create a tornado about the height of a man that rapidly moves around the battlefield tossing around foes. Immediately after casting and for an additional 2 rounds at the start of your turns, it barrels in a line of your choosing 30 feet. Enemies within its path are tossed in a random direction 10 ft, take 2d6+CL (7+CL) crush damage and are knocked down (fort negates dmg, knockback and knocked down).

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 5

entries.title: rushing-winds
entries.content: Rushing Winds Rushing Winds \[air] \[elusive] Clairvoyance 5 Cast Time - 1 FRA EffectAoE60 ft line, see textSaveFort Fly rapidly in a direction 60 feet. Any creatures within 10 feet of you during this journey are blown in the direction of your movement 20 ft, take 6d8+CL (27+CL) crush damage and are knocked down (fort halves damage and negates push back/knockdown).

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: tempest
entries.content: Tempest Tempest \[air] \[recharge] Clairvoyance 6 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectRange60 ftTargetAll EnemiesSaveFort You bend the wind to your will, and you will it to destroy. Over the course of the cast time, the weather worsens, giving creatures the opportunity to run and hide. Wind speeds increase to the extent where even heavy objects get picked up and tossed around. All but the most sound structures are damaged and weak structures are outright destroyed within minutes. You gain a fly speed (60) while within the area of the spell. Other flying creatures are automatically clumsy 4 and all ranged attacks have a -4 penalty to attack. Creatures without proper protection, that don't take shelter and lack proficiency in the athletics skill are whipped up by the winds and tossed 30 feet in a random direction every turn, taking 2d6+CL (7+CL) crush damage. Creatures that take shelter are generally safe, while those that have protection and/or have athletics can roll checks (spell DC) each turn they move through an open area affected by this spell or they are tossed. In areas where numerous loose objects are plentiful, you can use a standard action to command the winds to blow them at your enemies. The objects deal 4d6 (14+CL) physical damage (reflex halves), with the AoE being determined by the size of the object (max huge). You are immune to the effects of the wind and any objects that might get tossed your way. All weather inducing spells do not function underground.

entries.title: thunderlords-decree
entries.content: Thunderlord's Decree Thunderlord's Decree \[zap] \[recharge] Clairvoyance 6 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTargetAll EnemiesSaveFort Your shout echoes like thunder across the battlefield as you call down lightning bolts to strike all enemies you can see within range. Creatures takes 6d8+CL (27+CL) zap damage and are staggered for 1 minute (fort halves and negates stagger). Creatures get a new save to end the stagger at the end of their turn.

entries.title: level-4
entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: README
entries.content: Clairvoyance Clairvoyance is leader and mother to all cloud giants. She and her children dominate the mountainous northern region of the world plagued by all manner of windstorms and blizzards. She covets wealth in all of its forms and regularly uses her power and influence to steal from those that think they can live in her cold and desolate corner of the world. Clairvoyance’s spells are centered around the manipulation of wind, storms and lightning.

entries.title: embiggen
entries.content: Embiggen Embiggen \[buff] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDurationUntil Rest The touched creature increases to large size. If the creature is already large or larger, the spell has no effect.
