entries.title: README
entries.content: Copy of Template 2 The magic-y magic that has no real life analogue. Primarily focused around dealing force damage using projectiles and conjured weapons.

entries.title: crimson-confession
entries.content: Crimson Confession Crimson Confession \[Curse] Corruption 1 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectRangeReachDurationPermanentTarget1 object with a size of up to 5x5x5ft SaveWill You touch an object and infuse it with a curse to help you keep track of creatures who mess with it. When you lay this curse you can name creatures that circumvent the curse out loud. Afterwords, if any creature touches or directly moves the object, including through gloves, telekinesis or a long stick, their skin turns a bright crimson color (will negates). If their skin was already crimson, they turn blue. Once a creature has passed their save against this effect, they are immune to further touches against the same cast. If you cast this spell on an object while you already have a crimson confession active, the previous one disappears. The creature must either admit to touching the object to the caster , or they must manually cover their body in paint of their previous skin color to remove the curse.

entries.title: feast-and-famine
entries.content: Feast and Famine Feast and Famine \[healing] \[overheal] \[upcast] Corruption 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTargetInanimate plants {% hint style="danger" %} This spell only functions if you are not in a form of desolate terrain. This could include places like, arctic terrain, dessert the surface of deep ocean or many urban areas. If it's iffy, you can always roll luck! (with a DC dependent on terrain) {% endhint %} You wave your staff in a circle to absorb the life from any plants in the area. You heal yourself for 6+CL hp and automatically end all bleed effects. This kills the plants. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, heal 4 more hp.

entries.title: fish-out-of-water
entries.content: Fish out of Water Fish out of Water \[curse] Corruption 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill Curse a creature so they can no longer breath air, and must inhale water in order to breath. Unless there is a sizable water source nearby to submerge themselves in, cursed creatures must spend a swift action each turn to breathe, dunking their heads in puddles, or guzzling water. They must have some form of liquid on their person or nearby in order to do this otherwise they begin to suffocate. While suffocating, the creature is silenced. If they end their turn suffocating, they are drained 1. This spell has no effect on creatures that are aquatic, amphibious, or that do not need to breathe (such as a skeleton). In order to end this curse, a creature must drink a glass of iced tea. {% hint style="info" %} If its iffy as to whether or not there's water sufficient enough to stave, roll a luck check for the victims, with a DC dependent on terrain. {% endhint %}

entries.title: life-drinker
entries.content: Life Drinker Life Drinker \[buff] Corruption 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectAoE15 ft radius, centered on caster.Duration1 minute You emanate an aura that absorbs energy from creatures attempting to heal. This aura follows you as you move. Creatures other than you are bone chilled while within this aura, and for 1 round after they leave it. Upcast - By spending 4 mana, you also gain any healing you negate from the bone chill you inflict with this aura.

entries.title: never-lucky
entries.content: Never Lucky Never Lucky Corruption 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature Cause a creature to be unlucky. They next time they roll an attack or saving throw, they roll it at disadvantage. Outside of combat, this has the \[subtle] tag, but only affects skill checks, ability checks and luck checks. Upcast - By spending 3 mana, the creatures next 2 rolls are at disadvantage.\ By spending 5, the creatures next 3 rolls are at disadvantage.

entries.title: poison-the-well
entries.content: Poison the Well Poison the Well \[curse] \[upcast] Corruption 1 Cast Time - 1 Minute Focus - One gold piece EffectRangeReachTarget1 water source You stand at the edge of a well and fill a coin with malefic energy. By dropping the coin into the well, it subtly causes it to become poisonous. Creatures that drink from it become drained 1 (fort negates). This curse can be removed by removing the coin from the well. Upcast - You can affect larger water sources by spending more mana.\ At 2 mana you can effect larger bodies of water, such as lakes and creeks.\ At 3 mana you can effect large lakes and 1 mile of river.\ At 6 mana you can effect an entire river, regardless of its length.

entries.title: prisoners-brand
entries.content: Prisoner's Brand Prisoner's Brand \[curse] Corruption 1 Cast Time - 1 Minute Focus - A drawing of the brand EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature You touch the creature and apply the brand used as the focus component. It is slightly uncomfortable when applied, but does not cause damage. You are constantly aware of the direction of this creature. You can brand multiple creatures, but you cannot tell which creature is which. Petting an eagle removes this curse and its associated brand. Other types of freedom-related creatures can potentially suffice.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: enfeeble
entries.content: Enfeeble Enfeeble \[curse] Corruption 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill With heavy arms, the creature struggles to bring the full force of their attacks and spells. Whenever the creature deals damage, that damage is decreased by 2 (unless it is true damage). While a non-minion creature within 60 ft is afflicted with this curse (and you are its caster), you get advantage on fortitude saves. In order to remove this curse, a creature must sheathe and unsheathe a sword 3 times without doing anything else. In combat this requires a FRA.

entries.title: harvester
entries.content: Harvester Harvester \[curse] Corruption 2 Cast Time - 1 Minute Focus - 1 Inert Mana Crystal EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature The curse of the harvester is a tool used by creatures to remotely collect mana. Because of the cast time, the creature must either be willing or defeated to be the target of this spell. You link a creature to the inert mana crystal used as a focus. You also specify a time of day.  Every day at the specified time, the target is mana burned until they only have 1 mana left, as though they had donated mana. The harvester receives (this mana value-1), which they can use as they see fit. This curse can only be removed by destroying the inert mana crystal used as the focus for the initial casting. The harvestee can innately tell if a crystal is bound to them by looking at it, feeling it etc.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: retributive-reparations
entries.content: Retributive Reparations Retributive Reparations \[curse] Corruption 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 handheld objectSaveWill Curse an object to reject its owner, unless that owner is you. The first time a creature picks up this item it is inflicted with a curse (will negates).  The curse causes them to be unable to separate from the item, unless it gives it back to you, and fatigues them until it does. If the creature tries to use the item, like unlocking a door with a cursed key or swinging a cursed weapon, they become drained 1. The creature doesn't need to hold the item per se, but it does need to be on their person. If they try something clever like putting the key in a backpack, then taking the backpack off, the backpack defies logic and stays put, just like the key would.  The creature can return the cursed item to you as a swift action, removing the curse. Alternatively, if you spend 1 week more than 1 mile away from this creature, the curse naturally fades.

entries.title: violent-accident
entries.content: Violent Accident Violent Accident \[curse] \[subtle] Corruption 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveReflex {% hint style="info" %} Special: You must speak directly to a creature to inflict this curse, or otherwise have its attention. {% endhint %} You inflict an omen upon the creature. At some point within the next 24 hours, they will encounter a dangerous scenario that will deal 20 damage to them (reflex negates). The damage type could be something falling on them for crush damage, getting struck by lightning for zap damage etc. A creature trained in arcana that is the target of this spell can identify it (DC 17). If successful, it can diffuse the omen by treating you with kindness. If a creature trained in arcana witnesses the deadly effect of violent accident, they can make an arcana check to identify the origin of the effect. If they happened to be present when it was inflicted, they also are able to identify who cast it.

entries.title: wither
entries.content: Wither Wither \[concentration] Corruption 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveFort Cause a creature to atrophy over 3 rounds. This has no immediate effect, but at the start of the creatures turn it withers (fort negates). The first failure fatigues the creature and reduces their speed by 15. The second and third failure reduce their speed by an additional 15. This effect continues for three turns, regardless if the creature passes its save (unless it has stalwart).

entries.title: caught-red-handed
entries.content: Caught Red-Handed Caught Red-Handed \[curse] Corruption 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeUnlimitedTarget1 corpseDuration2 weeks Drawing upon the spiritual link between a corpse and its killer, you reach out across space to brand the killer of the corpse you used as a focus for this spell, creating a physical manifestation of the killer’s guilt. The killer’s right hand is stained a crimson red, and this stain can’t be removed (though it can be hidden by mundane means such as by wearing gloves). If the killer doesn’t have a right hand for some reason, the spell instead causes a red stain in the shape of a hand to appear elsewhere on the creature’s body (typically on the arm). This spell affects only the creature that directly killed the targeted corpse. Other individuals that contributed to the target’s death are unaffected. If the victim did not die from violence or died indirectly (for instance, if the creature died from suffocating after someone trapped it in a room filling with water), then the spell fizzles. Once a corpse has acted as the focus for red hand of the killer, it can never act as the focus for another casting of red hand of the killer.

entries.title: corrupting-mist
entries.content: Corrupting Mist Corrupting Mist \[poison] \[persistent] \[concentration] \[upcast] Corruption 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftAoE20 ft radius, centered on a point on the groundDuration1 minute You cause a purple or green mist to spread over and area. Creatures inside cough and wheeze, becoming sickened 1 (fort negates). If the creature is already sickened, then they instead take 3d8+CL (13+CL) poison damage (fort halves). You are immune to your own cast of corrupting mist. Upcast 5 - You can increase the duration of the spell to 1 hour. Every round it persists, it spreads an additional 10 ft. It only spreads in one direction 180 degrees.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: vulnerability
entries.content: Vulnerability Vulnerability \[curse] Corruption 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftAoE20 ft radius, centered on a point on the groundDuration1 minute The curse softens hide, weakens bones and lowers the creatures pain threshold. While afflicted with this curse, a creature has weakness 2 to all damage. To remove this curse, a creature has to give themselves a paper cut or break a glass window.

entries.title: curse-of-blindness
entries.content: Curse of Blindness Curse of Blindness \[curse] Necromancy 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveFort The target's vision wanes permanently as the world disappears around it. It is blinded (fort reduces effect to blurred vision for one round). Removed by consuming the raw eyes of a freshly killed creature.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: rotting-alliance
entries.content: Rotting Alliance Rotting Alliance \[curse] \[upcast] Corruption 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget4 creaturesSaveWill You curse up to 4 creatures with a rot that accelerates their demise when they exist near one another. When a creature with this curse exists within 15 feet of an ally that is also cursed during its turn, it takes 4d6 (14) necrotic damage and is drained 1. This is a \[persistent] effect. Each cast of this spell is not mutually exclusive. Multiple castings of this spell have the potential to include more creatures in this effect.  This curse is removed by the cursed creatures all signing their name on something like paper or parchment without damaging each other in the process, and then burning it. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, affect an additional creature.

entries.title: level-5
entries.content: Level 5

entries.title: level-6
entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: README
entries.content: Corruption Demons, fey, undead and all manners of evil mages manufacture malefic methods of harming their enemies and the world around them. The corruption tree focuses on making everybody else miserable. Curses are their favorite method of delivering this suffering. {% hint style="info" %} Curses are permanent debilitating status effects that sometimes have a degree of freedom over the types of curses are inflicted. All but the most powerful of curses have some finite, actionable and often unusual way to lift them (which can be found out by using the "identify affliction" function of medicine). {% endhint %}

entries.title: blanket-of-snow
entries.content: Blanket of Snow Blanket of Snow Cryomancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureSaveReflex A shadow appears beneath the target, and a blanket of snow falls upon them immediately after. The creature takes 2d8+CL (9+CL) crush damage and has to spend 30 ft of movement to dig themselves out of the snow (reflex halves dmg and getting buried). While buried, the creature cannot move, has resistance to fire damage and has cover.

entries.title: frost-armor
entries.content: Frost Armor Frost Armor \[upcast] Cryomancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 round You cover yourself in a thin protective ice barrier. You gain resistance to the next instance of HP damage that is not crush, slash or pierce. Once you take damage from any source, minus damage over time effects like bleed or self inflicted damage, the ice barrier shatters and frost armor ends. If you are ablaze when you cast this spell, instead of the usual benefits, put out the flames. Upcast 4 - This spell becomes an immediate action.

entries.title: frost-breath
entries.content: Frost Breath Frost Breath \[frost] Cryomancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE15 ft coneSaveFort You exhale and fill the area with ice cold air. Creatures inside take 2d8+CL (9+CL) frost dmg and are made frosty (fort halves dmg and negates frosty).

entries.title: ice-skating
entries.content: Ice Skating Ice Skating \[buff] Cryomancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 CreatureDurationUntil rest You coat the bottoms of your feet/footwear etc with ice, allowing you to slide along cold terrain with ease. While in an arctic environment, or while moving across ice or snow, your gain a "skating speed" of 50.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: snow-fort
entries.content: Snow Fort Snow Fort \[concentration] \[upcast] Cryomancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 medium or smaller creature You cause a snowy barrier to appear to protect a creature. The barrier appears all around the creature, protecting them from all sides, but not from attacks from above. They gain cover as long as they do not move from their space. If you stop concentrating or if the fort is hit with fire damage, it crumbles. Upcast 2 - You can target large creatures, or 2 medium or smaller creatures. The barrier improves to shield from airborne attacks. Upcast 3 - You can target huge creatures, 2 large creatures, or 3 medium or smaller creatures. The barrier now grants improved cover. Upcast 4 - You can target up to 4 creatures of any size.

entries.title: snow-man
entries.content: Snow Man Snow Man \[companion] \[mana burn] Cryomancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachDurationUntil Rest You sculpt snow into a more friendly shape, and your new friend does his best to aid you. A snow man is an elemental that shares all of your ability scores, poise, AC and saves. He has half of your max hp. He shares your level, but is always treated as a minion. He cannot wield weapons, and his only form of attack is a single snowball every turn that deals d8+dex/str crush dmg. If there is no snow present, he must take 3 true damage to throw this snowball. He has a 30 land speed. When not moving along snowy or icey surfaces, his speed is 15. When the snow man is destroyed, or when the spell ends, the mana burn is removed.

entries.title: snowball
entries.content: Snowball Snowball \[frost] Cryomancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveFort You toss a snowball at a creature, aiming for their weak points. Make a ranged attack that does 2d8+CL (9+CL) frost damage. They also suffer one of the following effects (fort negates). Eyes - Creature has blurred vision for 1 round. Mouth - Creature is staggered for 1 round.

entries.title: chill-metal
entries.content: Chill Metal Chill Metal \[frost] \[concentration] Cryomancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 metallic object of up to one 5x5x5 ft cube, or one attended metal item Rapidly chill a metallic object. If it is not currently attended, it automatically happens. Creatures that touch this item for whatever reason are entangled by rapidly spreading frost. If the object is attended, then the creature can choose to drop the object as an instant action to negate the effects of the spell and it functions as written above. If they do not drop the object or cannot, such as with metal armor, the creature takes (CL) cold damage at the start of each of their turns and the item cannot be separated from them until heat is applied or you cease concentration. You can also use this spell to target a creature that is made of metal, functioning as though they cannot drop the object. Sometimes creatures have features that rely on heated metal. Such features are disabled while they are affected by this spell.

entries.title: creeping-ice
entries.content: Creeping Ice Creeping Ice \[frost] \[concentration] \[persistent] Cryomancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftAoE5 ft radius, centered on a point in the airDuration3 roundsSaveFort You drain the heat from the air, coating an area in frost. The radius of the AoE increases by 10 feet each round on your turn. Creatures in the AoE at the time of casting or that enter/end their turn in the AoE take 2d8+CL (9+CL) cold damage and are staggered for 1 round (fort negates stagger).

entries.title: frostbite
entries.content: Frostbite Frostbite \[frost] Cryomancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDuration1 minute You subject to creature to a cold winter's night over the course of a few seconds. On a successful attack roll, the creature takes 3d8+CL (13+CL) frost dmg. It gains weakness 5 frost for the spells duration.

entries.title: ice-lance
entries.content: Ice Lance Ice Lance \[upcast] Cryomancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Turn your staff into a deadly ice spike, and stab a creature with it for 3d8+CL (13+CL) pierce damage. If the target is entangled by a \[frost] effect, you make the attack with advantage and it does 3d10+CL (16+CL) pierce damage. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, the spell deals an additional d8 (or d10 if entangled) damage.

entries.title: powder-snow
entries.content: Powder Snow Powder Snow \[concentration] \[upcast] Cryomancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE20 ft radius, centered on casterDuration1 minute Snowflakes permeate the air, chilling creatures to the bone. The spell leaves behind a cloud that persistently inflicts weakness 5 to frost damage to all creatures without frost resistance in the cloud. Your allies gain frost resistance while within the area of powder snow. Upcast - Per each additional mana spent, increase the weakness the spell inflicts by 2, and increase its radius by 5 ft.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: glacial-advance
entries.content: Glacial Advance Glacial Advance \[frost] \[elusive] Cryomancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE30 ft lineSaveReflex Rapidly advance forward in a straight line riding along a tiny glacier, dealing 4d8+CL (18+CL) frost damage and an equal amount of poise damage (reflex halves). If a creature drops to 0 poise from this, they are shoved 15 ft away from the line in a direction of your choosing. The area of the spell becomes icy, causing creatures that move through it to fall prone unless they treat it as difficult terrain or roll acrobatics (vs class DC).

entries.title: ice-beam
entries.content: Ice Beam Ice Beam \[frost] Cryomancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creature Fire a ray of ice at a foe. Make a ranged attack. It deals 4d8+CL (18+CL) cold damage and makes them frosty and entangled on hit. If they are already frosty or entangled, they are instead entombed. Athletics as a swift action to escape entangle (vs DC), or standard if entombed.

entries.title: icy-spears
entries.content: Icy Spears Icy Spears \[frost] Cryomancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget3 creaturesDuration1 minuteSaveReflex You jam your staff into the ground and thin streams of ice advance towards your foes. Choose three creatures within 15 ft of each other. A series of pointed ice spears erupt from the ground directly beneath them, dealing 4d8+CL (18+CL) frost damage, as well as entangling them (reflex halves damage and negates entangle). Athletics as a swift action to escape. Pass or fail, the spaces occupied by the spears are considered impassible terrain until they are destroyed or melted. A successful reflex save also means the creature can choose any space within 5 ft of the spell effect to move to \[elusive]. Larger creatures create more impassible terrain and dodge farther. If there are multiple creatures in the same space, you can target the larger creature and hit all creatures in the space, but you cannot target both the creatures to double up on damage.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: snowscape
entries.content: Snowscape Snowscape \[recharge] Cryomancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectAoE1 mile radius, centered on casterDuration1 hour A bunch of clouds roll in and start to deposit large amounts of snow. Temperatures decrease and the area of the spell becomes difficult terrain after 1 minute. Certain gear can allow you to traverse snow unimpeded. Creatures cannot see beyond 100 ft. If you cast this spell in an area where snow normally is impossible, incredibly unlikely or out of season, the spells duration decreases to 1 minute. All weather inducing spells do not function underground.

entries.title: blizzard
entries.content: Blizzard Blizzard \[frost] \[air] Cryomancy 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE60 ft coneSaveFort Pelt your foes with a wave a frigid air in a wide area. Creatures take 5d8+CL (22+CL) cold damage and makes them frosty and entangled (fort halves dmg and negates entangle). If they are already frosty or entangled, they are instead entombed. Athletics as a swift action to escape entangle (vs DC), or standard if entombed.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: cold-feet
entries.content: Cold Feet Cold Feet \[frost] Cryomancy 5 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE60 ft coneSaveFort Call forth icicles underneath all of your foes. Each one is entangled and takes 6d6+CL (21+CL) cold damage (reflex removes entangle and halves dmg). Athletics as a standard action to escape.

entries.content: Level 5

entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: README
entries.content: Cryomancy Ice magic! Frequently slows and restricts movement.

entries.title: fraudgg
entries.content: Fraudgg Fraudgg \[mind-affecting] Frogg Saran 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 frogDuration8 hoursSaveWill You enchant a friendly frog to give off an aura of excellence, as though it were rich, famous or well renowned. People treat this frog as though it were a person of high importance, accommodating for its small stature whenever they can. You can give this frog a set of simplistic orders such as "enter that restaurant and buy a steak" or "pretend to be a lifeguard at the beach." It will dutifully perform these tasks to the best of its ability. Only creatures that directly interact with the frog get a save against the enchantment (ie the waiter or someone the lifeguard saves). Creatures who are level 0, or who are minions to you do not get a save. If you cast the spell again, the frog harms anyone or someone kisses the frog, the spell ends.

entries.title: lucky-star
entries.content: Lucky Star Lucky Star \[force] \[upcast] Frogg Saran 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature You point at your foe and a star-shaped projectile unerringly falls upon them, dealing d20 force damage. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, the star bounces, affecting an additional creature within 10 ft of the previous.

entries.title: oh-my-frogg
entries.content: Oh my Frogg Oh my Frogg \[contingent] Frogg Saran 1 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectRangeSelfDurationUntil RestSaveWill Before you would normally be affected by a hostile (non cantrip) spell, you change the nature of the magic into something completely different (will negates). The spell changes to another spell of the same level with you as the primary target or origin point of the spell, regardless of its typical range/targeting. Make saves as appropriate. Some spells may have other restrictions like material components. Ignore them. Upcast spells count as spells of a higher level. Level 1 (d4)\ 1 - Time Shudder (Frogg 1)\ 2 - Charming Gaze (Shira 1)\ 3 - Bloodbath (Necromancy 1) \[caster immediately takes bleed damage]\ 4 - Cure Wounds (Brazzeria 1) Level 2 (d4)\ 1 - Hysteria (Frogg 2)\ 2 - Silence (Moogen 2)\ 3 - Detect Thoughts (Larella 2)\ 4 - Mirror Images (Wildcard 2) Level 3 (d4)\ 1 - Enfroggen (Frogg 3)\ 2 - Ice Beam (Cryomancy 3)\ 3 - Cosmic Cage (Lunar 3)\ 4 - Afterimage (Moogen 3) \[afterimage always cosplays a frogg] Level 4 (d4)\ 1 - Call Cheese Storm (Frogg 4)\ 2 - Curse of Blindness (Necromancy 4)\ 3 - That's All Folks (Shroomlette 4)\ 4 - Sacrificial Heal (Lunar 4) \[transfers CL hp] Level 5 (d4)\ 1 - Doom (Frogg 5)\ 2 - Rainbow Beam (Pyromancy 5)\ 3 - Telekinetic Thrust (Larella 5)\ 4 - Inferno Sphere (Pyromancy 5) Level 6 (d4)\ 1 - Rod of Roasting (Frogg 6)\ 2 - Elden Memes (Anime Jesus 6)\ 3 - Possession (Necromancy 6)\ 4 - Invisibility (Moogen 6)

entries.title: plague-of-frogs
entries.content: Plague of Frogs Plague of Frogs \[upcast] \[poison] Frogg Saran 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 rounds You conjure a spectral frog that slowly jumps towards an enemy. Each round it moves 20 feet closer to the target. Once it moves into the targets space, it explodes in a cloud of toxic gas, dealing 2d8+CL (9+CL) poison damage (fort halves). If it survives its first turn without hitting its target, it deals an additional 10 damage when it explodes. The frog does not take into consideration difficult terrain, and will hop directly into the air towards a foe. It cannot pass through walls and will move around them if the target moves out of sight. If a creature enters the space of a frog, willingly or unwillingly, then it immediately explodes. Upcast - For each additional mana spent (max 2 additional mana) increase the damage d8 (4) and add another frog that targets a different creature.

entries.title: power-overwhelming
entries.content: Power Overwhelming Power Overwhelming \[Buff] Frogg Saran 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 round Cause the creature to surge with unbelievable power as their body rapidly deteriorates. They get a +4 bonus to all d20 rolls, damage rolls and CL. After the buff ends, they take 50% of their max hp in true damage.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: spontaneous-combustion
entries.content: Spontaneous Combustion Spontaneous Combustion \[fire] Frogg Saran 1 Cast Time - 1 swift action EffectRange30 ft radius burst, centered on caster Randomly set a creature ablaze. All enemies within 30 and yourself are suitable targets. You are always lit ablaze on a 1. {% hint style="info" %} Consider using a dice larger than the number of creatures for uneven numbers and then re rolling unsuitable results. {% endhint %}

entries.title: tentacles-for-arms
entries.content: Tentacles for Arms Tentacles for Arms \[polymorph, chimeric] Frogg Saran 1 Cast Time - 1 Free Action EffectDuration3 rounds One of your arms transforms into several muscular writhing tentacles, reaching for nearby creatures autonomously. At the end of each turn, they roll a grapple attack with a +4 bonus against a random creature within your natural reach, even if you are unable to act. If you do not threaten a creature, then they grapple you. You cannot willingly end a grapple made by the tentacles.

entries.title: time-shudder
entries.content: Time Shudder Time Shudder \[concentration] Frogg Saran 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange30 ft radius burst, centered on casterDuration1 minute You emit waves of entropy, hindering or helping ALL creatures nearby (including you). Immediately upon casting and at the start of your turn unleash a pulse to determine the effects of the spell for one round. There is a 50% chance to Hinder and there is a 50% chance to help. Hinder - Creatures are staggered Help - Creatures gain an additional 30 speed and their movement is \[elusive]

entries.title: hysteria
entries.content: Hysteria Hysteria \[mind-affecting] Frogg Saran 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ft radius burst, centered on caster You laugh maniacally and revel in the chaos. All creatures in the radius of the spell MUST make a simple attack with a melee weapon against the nearest creature. If they do not have a means to attack, then the spell does not affect them. \ The order that creatures make the attacks is as follows: The caster, his allies, neutral parties, his enemies. The caster is allowed to use a special attack instead of a simple attack.

entries.title: laser-pointer
entries.content: Laser Pointer Laser Pointer \[light] \[concentration] Frogg Saran 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange100 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minuteSaveWill You use your finger to point at something and a little red light appears on the surface in the space of a creature. The creature is entranced by this tiny red light (will negates, mindless creatures and animal intelligence get a -2 penalty to this save). If the creature is not in combat then it follows the light with a playful curiosity, trying to catch it. The creature will not go anywhere it is incapable or that is inherently dangerous. You must spend a standard action each turn to maintain the light. When you do, you can move the light up to 30 feet a round to guide the creature's movement. If the creature is currently engaged in combat, they spend their move action following the light, but still have any other actions.

entries.title: mind-maze
entries.content: Mind Maze Mind Maze \[mind-affecting] Frogg Saran 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveWill You alter a target's perception to make it think it needs to move in specific directions around invisible walls in order to reach it's intended location. At the start of the creatures turn, it moves 15 ft in a random direction, even if that brings them to a very dangerous position, such as off a cliff. Aside from this movement, the creature is unable to move further. If something prevents the creature from moving, such as being snared, then it does not move.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: reincarnate
entries.content: Reincarnate Reincarnate Frogg Saran 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTargetOne willing or defeated playable race You transform a humanoid into a random race. They are (usually) reborn as a completely different race. They replace all of their previous racial traits with the racial traits of the new race, making the same choices they had during character creation for things such as alternate racial features. Use the following chart determine what race the spell transforms the creature into. Campaigns where more races are present, feel free to add more options to the chart. If the race is incompatible with your campaign, then reroll until you find an appropriate race. Special: A lunatic that casts reincarnate gains a luck dice 1/day. | | | | --------- | ----------------------------------------- | | Dice Roll | Race | | 1 | Amazon | | 2 | Anime | | 3 | Boner | | 4 | Cyborg | | 5 | Dwarf | | 6 | Eternal | | 7 | Elf | | 8 | Exalted | | 9 | Fairy | | 10 | Geniekin | | 11 | Goblin | | 12 | Human | | 13 | Hellion | | 14 | Orc | | 15 | Poplin | | 16 | Polymerization | | 17 | Shroomkin | | 18 | Shade | | 19 | Fallen | | 20 | Human, with mixed blood of your next roll |

entries.title: wonkas
entries.content: WonkaS Wonkas \[teleportation] Frogg Saran 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange120 ftTargetSelf You open up a portal underneath yourself and a random enemy within range you can see. The portal violently sucks the creature into it forcing it to swap places with you.

entries.title: confuse-ray
entries.content: Confuse Ray Confuse Ray \[pattern] \[light] \[persistent] \[concentration] Frogg Saran 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTargetA single space, see textSaveWill A ray of light shines down on a point, and mysterious motes of light fly around and distort creatures' perception of the world around them. Any creature that starts its turn inside of, or moves into the ray of light becomes confused (will adds 4 to confusion rolls). You can direct this light as a standard action on subsequent turns, moving it 20 feet in a straight line. All creatures along its path are subject to its effect.

entries.title: enfroggen
entries.content: Enfroggen Enfroggen \[poly, baleful] Frogg Saran 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill You transform a creature into a frog. Permanently. The caster is unable to attack, cast any spells that affect this frog or otherwise harm it in any way, even when magically compelled to do so. The creature gains the following qualities. | Mad Hops | Increase the distance the jump action brings you by 10 ft. | | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------ | | Tongue | Make combat maneuvers to drag at 30 ft range without penalty | | Smol | Decrease size tiny. Decrease reach to 0. | | Speed | Gain a swim speed | Another creature must spend their standard action to kiss the frog to transform it back. The un-frogged creature is dazed on its next turn and charmed by the creature who kissed it for 8 hours. This secondary effect is a \[charm] effect.

entries.title: eye-of-sneko
entries.content: Eye of Sneko Eye of Sneko \[curse] Frogg Saran 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelf You change the pupils of your eyes to match that of the mysterious serpent Sneko, afflicting you with its curse. Whenever you spend mana, roll a d4. 1 - The mana cost is decreased by 2\ 2 - The mana cost is decreased by 1\ 3 - The mana cost is increased by 1\ 4 - The mana cost is increased by 2 You can choose to spend mana in excess to your current mana as long as you could potentially reduce the mana cost to your remaining mana or less. If the mana cost exceeds your remaining mana, you mana burn the excess. If the mana reduction exceeds the mana cost, you regain mana. To remove the curse, you must T-pose and perform no actions for 1 full round.

entries.title: hot-potato
entries.content: Hot Potato Hot Potato \[fire] Frogg Saran 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 rounds You cause a smoldering potato to appear in a creatures free hands, in their pocket, or otherwise lodged on their person. It is uncomfortable to the touch, but does not deal damage. It vibrates and pulses with greater intensity as time passes, culminating into a powerful condensed explosion on the 3rd round, dealing 6d12+CL (33+CL) fire damage to whoever is holding it. The potato must be possessed by someone, and can only be removed by the creature who currently has it giving it to someone else as a standard action, requiring a successful attack roll or poise break. For clarity... Turn 1 - Cast Spell\ Turn 2 - nothin'\ Turn 3 - Explodes violently at the end of your turn

entries.title: call-cheese-storm
entries.content: Call Cheese Storm Call Cheese Storm \[concentration] Frogg Saran 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action Material Component - 1,000g cheese, weighing at least 100 lbs EffectAoE300 ft radius burst, centered on casterDuration1 minute You make a cheesy sacrifice to the god of madness. He blesses you by generating a storm of cheesy goodness. Cheese wheels fall from the sky, damaging friend, foe and terrain alike. Any creature without some kind of cover from the harsh weather takes (CL) crush damage at the start of each of their turns. The effect on the surrounding terrain varies based on how durable it is. Many settlements will experience broken windows and plenty of casualties. But with great sacrifice comes great reward: This spell generates a mountain of edible cheese.

entries.title: chimpanzee-bolt
entries.content: Chimpanzee Bolt Chimpanzee Bolt \[companion] Frogg Saran 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minute You summon a chimpanzee, functioning as a medium sized harambe, and it immediately flies at high speeds towards the target of this spell. Make a ranged attack that deals 5d8+CL (22+CL) crush damage.  Hit or miss, the chimp lands adjacent to the target. During the first turn you summon it, you can command it to better strategize. Every turn after it attacks creatures randomly until it is defeated, focusing on whatever creature is closest.

entries.title: doom
entries.content: DOOM DOOM \[necrotic] Frogg Saran 5 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE60 ft radius, centered on casterSaveFortitude Drain the life from the world around you in a massive burst that has a rebound effect proportional to the number of creatures you hit with it. Deal 7d8+CL (31+CL) necrotic damage to creatures other than you in the spells radius. For every creature you hit, you take d6 (3) true damage and gain 1 mana reserve.

entries.title: rain-of-frogs
entries.content: Rain of Frogs Rain of Frogs \[concentration] Frogg Saran 5 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE60 ft radius, centered on casterDuration3 rounds A bunch of storm clouds roll in, even while indoors, and rain hundreds of frogs upon the area. The situation grows more dire with each passing round at the start of your turn. Round 1 - A mere frog drizzle. The area is considered difficult terrain to any non frog creatures. Round 2 - A frog downpour. The area is considered impassable terrain for any non frog creatures. Any non frog creatures still in the area are entangled, unable to effectively move through the lake of frogs. Round 3 - A frognado. The frogs, and any creature in the area of the spell is lifted into the air and thrown 60 feet in a random direction. The frogs quickly dissipate afterwords. Any other creatures and objects are staggered for 3 rounds and take 6d10+CL (33+CL) crush damage.

entries.title: madness-consumes-you
entries.content: Madness Consumes You Madness Consumes You \[mind-affecting] Frogg Saran 6 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE30 ft radius, centered on casterDuration3 rounds All creatures in the radius of the spell become confused.

entries.title: mystery-box
entries.content: Mystery Box Mystery Box Frogg Saran 6 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE???Range???Duration???Save??? You form a direct conduit with Frogg himself, allowing his magic to flow through you. Roll to select a random spell list, then cast a random spell of each spell level on that spell list (up to fifth level). Targets of these spells are chosen randomly from all legal targets. If a spell generates an area of effect then it chooses a creature randomly to center this effect on. If a spell does not have a suitable target then it fizzles, producing no effect. You are always considered a willing and available target for all effects that can affect your creature type. Frogs and frog-like creatures are fair game for this spell. A target is considered "legal" if its targeting is allowed. For example, if you roll the Frogg spell list and get lucky star, you count the number of creatures in range, then roll randomly to see who gets targeted. However, if you roll necromancy and get corpse explosion, but you don’t control any undead, there are no corpses within range and you aren't undead yourself, then that particular spell fizzles.

entries.title: rod-of-roasting
entries.content: Rod of Roasting Rod of Roasting \[fire] \[healing] Frogg Saran 6 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action Material - 1 Staff EffectRangeReachDuration3 roundsSaveReflex You plant your staff into the ground and it ignites in flames. The flames take the shape of a frog and start laughing maniacally, telling a joke or saying proverbs unfit for the current situation. At the end of each of your turns, the frog launches an intense fireblast at a creature within 60 ft, chosen randomly between all creatures. Creatures takes 10d8+CL (45+CL) fire damage (reflex halves). Touching or trying to physically move the stick also triggers this effect.  If you are the last one standing within a 60 ft radius of the rod when the spell ends, you refund the the mana cost of this spell, you gain a luck dice, your staff returns to you and you gain 40 temp hp.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Frogg Saran Ever since his rebranding from the god of death back in the old days, Frogg has grown a lot more popular. Frogg Saran is chaos incarnate. He is known to give blessings and curses in equal measure. Frogg Saron is a very active force in the world of Nack, worming his way into many peoples lives whether they like it or not. All this god seeks is to increase the amount of entropy in the universe. His followers start riots and revolutions merely to change the status quo. They reincarnate people for funsies just to see the reaction to their new body. Frogg spells are categorized by their randomness and propensity to inflict madness or strange behavior, generally favoring the caster.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: snap-back
entries.content: Snap Back Snap Back \[elusive] Time 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill Reverse time ever so slightly, only doing so for 1 particular creature. They move back to the position they were in at the start of their last turn. If used on an enemy (will negates). Has no effect on a creature that has not acted in combat.

entries.title: steal-years
entries.content: Steal Years Steal Years Time 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveWill You cause a creature to age rapidly and then you use that energy to bolster yourself. The target looks superficially old and you appear superficially in your prime. The target is fatigued (will negates). As long as they are fatigued from this spell, you can spend an immediate action to reroll a d20 roll.

entries.title: tardiness
entries.content: Tardiness Tardiness God Mode 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill Delay a creature so that way their spot in initiative is moved to be dead last (will negates). If the creature has already acted in this round, it does not get an additional turn.

entries.title: time-bomb
entries.content: Time Bomb Time Bomb \[force] God Mode 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftAoE10 ft radius, centered on creatureTarget1 creature; see textSaveReflex You cause a rapidly ticking down unstable looking clock to appear above a creatures head. At the end of that creature's turn, it explodes, dealing 2d8+CL (9+CL) force damage to all enemies within 10 ft (reflex halves dmg). You can place this time bomb on an ally or an enemy. The time bomb never damages allies.

entries.title: blink
entries.content: Blink Blink \[buff] \[teleportation] God Mode 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute You sporadically blink out of the mortal plane into a private demiplane. At the end of your turn, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, you blink out of existence, putting you in stasis until the start of your turn.

entries.title: on-the-clock
entries.content: On the Clock On the Clock \[concentration] God Mode 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftAoE20 ft radius, centered on a point on the ground Cause magic circle that resembles the face of a clock to appear on a surface. As long as you concentrate, enemies treat this area as difficult terrain, even if they attempt to jump/fly over it. Allied movement through this area is elusive.

entries.title: portal-jump
entries.content: Portal Jump Portal Jump \[teleportation] God Mode 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange30 ft at a point on the ground A portal opens up beneath you, bringing you to the target location. You cannot move, but you may take your turn from your new position. At the end of your turn, you fall back into the portal and return to the initial position. Other creatures cannot pass through your portal, even with prepared actions.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: spacial-rend
entries.content: Spacial Rend Spacial Rend \[concentration] God Mode 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveWill Tear apart time in space surrounding a creature, causing the creature to temporarily split into two different versions of itself. One is clearly insubstantial, almost like a ghost, and gets yanked into a space of your choosing within range. Targeting this severed spirit, in all ways, is treated as though you were affecting the original creature, using all of its statistics. \[Persistent] effects can still only effect once per turn, and AoE effects that target both still only do one instance of damage, but it gives the creature disadvantage on its save. The spirit cannot be moved. It cannot be affected by anything other than HP damage, which is redirected to the original target of this spell. It cannot use any abilities and the original creature cannot activate its own abilities through its spirit. The target of the spell is tethered, and cannot ever be more than 120 ft from its spirit.

entries.title: borrowed-time
entries.content: Borrowed Time Borrowed Time \[recharge] God Mode 3 Cast Time - 1 Free Action EffectTargetSelf Borrow some time from your future self. Gain an additional swift action, but you lose your swift action next turn. You can choose to \[mana burn] 3 to not consume your swift action next turn. Can only be used once a turn.

entries.title: fast-forward
entries.content: Fast Forward Fast Forward \[recharge] God Mode 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creature The creature you target moves at incredible speed, allowing them to immediately take an additional turn. This does not affect their position in initiative. On the creatures next turn they are dazed. A creature cannot be the target of this spell for 1 minute after being affected by it. The magic of this spell is a bit unstable and can sometimes go overboard. After the daze ends, an affected creature must make a DC 8 luck check or age 1 year.

entries.title: multiverse-theory
entries.content: Multiverse Theory Multiverse Theory \[companion] \[recharge] God Mode 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachDurationUntil Rest You call out into the multiverse your own name, and you answer the call. A version of yourself from an alternate timeline appears before you to speak to you or aid you with tasks. This alternate version of you does not have access to its mana pool, cannot attack and has 5 hp.  The primary use of this spell is to give you a different perspective on things. It can give you a +2 bonus to skill checks, as though using the aid action, and it can do simple item interactions, such as pulling levers or lifting things. Because of how different your dimension is from theirs, they cannot perform tasks on their own.  If this alternate version of yourself ever takes damage, you also take that damage, ignoring any temp hp you have. If the alternate you is out of your sight for longer than a minute, it disappears. If you cast this spell again, the previous alternate you disappears.

You target allies and objects freely. If you target an enemy (will negates).

entries.title: dimension-door
entries.content: Dimension Door Dimension Door \[concentration] \[teleportation] God Mode 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReach Touch a mostly flat solid surface and cause a incomplete portal to appear on it. At any point after as a standard action, you can touch another solid surface within 120 feet of the original and turn the portal on. For as long as you concentrate, creatures can walk into one portal and appear out of the other. You can see through the portal as though it were a window leading to its destination.

entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: retro-visions
entries.content: Retro Visions Retro Visions \[concentration] \[recharge] God Mode 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE30 ft AoE, centered on casterDurationUp to 1 hour You gaze into the past of the location you stand. You can make weeks, months, or even years pass by within minutes, but you always intuitively have a sense of how far back into the past are. You can see and hear events as they occurred. Things that are visually striking or loud are blips on your radar that give pause and allow you to watch in real time. Otherwise you need to have a roundabout idea of when the event happened. The radius of the spell represents how far you can move around while observing. You can freely travel (CL\*5) years back into the past looking for anomalies. If you have the exact date of an event, you can go twice as far back.

entries.title: slow-time
entries.content: Slow Time Slow Time \[recharge] God Mode 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 round Cause time to stop almost completely for all creatures other than you. Everything else in the universe is essentially in stasis until this effect ends. You can spend a standard action to move an unattended object you would normally be able to manipulate (with great difficulty), but other than that, your options are limited for what to do with your extra turn.

entries.title: hostile-teleportation
entries.content: Hostile Teleportation Hostile Teleportation \[teleportation] God Mode 5 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 enemySaveWill Choose an creature and teleport it anywhere within the spells range. If the creature is an enemy (will reduces effect to stagger).

entries.title: inner-sanctum
entries.content: Inner Sanctum Inner Sanctum \[teleportation] \[concentration] God Mode 5 Cast Time - 1 Minute Focus - Tuning Fork EffectRangeReach Create a portal that brings you to your own private dimension (aka demiplane). The first time you go to this dimension, it is empty, and the tuning fork used as the focus attunes to this plane. Every time you cast this spell after the first, you come back to this dimension. The range, concentration and teleportation aspects of this spell refer to the portal you create to get to your inner sanctum. The portal acts as a window between the 2 dimensions, and stays open as long as you concentrate. Whenever you exit your inner sanctum, you always appear from where you entered it. The sanctum itself is a large empty void filled with a dark clay-like substance. Using your mind alone, you can form this clay into the shape of anything you like, such as furniture, statues, trees etc. This substance always has a texture of sturdy but malleable clay. It cannot create living things or complex objects like clocks, only facsimiles of such things. The substance always has a dark, almost space-like color to it. You cannot bring this substance out of your sanctum, but you can freely bring real objects in and out of it. The sanctum's dimensions are 100x100x100 ft.

entries.title: chronobreak
entries.content: Chronobreak Chronobreak \[teleportation] \[force] \[recharge] \[healing] God Mode 6 Cast Time - 1 instant action EffectAoE10 ft radius burst, centered on afterimage...see spellSaveReflex While this technique is prepared a ghostly afterimage of yourself mimics your actions and movement, but at a delay of several seconds. At any point while you can take standard actions, you can choose to revert back to the time your afterimage represents. You return back to the position you were in at the beginning of your last turn. When you do, you burst in magical force, dealing 7d8+CL (31+CL) force damage to all enemies (reflex halves). You also restore 3d8+CL (13+CL) hp and cleanse all non-permanent status effects. {% hint style="success" %} I recommend using a token to refer to the position you were in, updating it at the start of each of your turns. {% endhint %}

entries.title: README
entries.content: God Mode God mode magic involves manipulating things people generally perceive as constants, such as time and distance.

entries.title: blessing-of-goom
entries.content: Blessing of Goom Blessing of Goom Goomshroom 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil Rest You exude an aura that allows creatures to exist in worlds they are no used to. Every creature that can see you (or sense you) gains the amphibious quality, allowing them to comfortably adapt to either land or sea, no matter which they normally prefer. Sea creatures gain a 30 ft land speed and land creatures gain a 30 ft swim speed. This quality persists for as long as they stay near you, but it does not immediately disappear. The boon persists for (CL\*10) minutes after the creature cannot see you. Most churches dedicated to The Shroomlette are persistently affected by this aura.

entries.title: bubble-break
entries.content: Bubble Break Bubble Break \[concentration] \[water] Goomshroom 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveReflex You blow a big bubbles. Affected creature is trapped inside of a bubble for 3 rounds (reflex negates). The bubble is completely indestructible and cannot be popped, moved or altered in any way from the inside. Trapped creatures are free to take any actions they please, the only restriction being that they cannot affect creatures outside of the bubble. They can use teleportation to escape or use the reprieve to heal and buff.  The reverse is also true: Creatures outside of the bubble cannot affect creatures inside of the bubble without first popping it. Bubbles can only be popped by taking 1 pierce damage. Because of the defensive properties of the bubble, hitting allies with it to protect them is a viable strategy. Allies do not need to roll a reflex save. They can choose to be affected by the spell or not, even while defeated.

entries.title: bubble
entries.content: Bubble Bubble \[concentration] \[water] Goomshroom 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTargetCreatures or objects that can fit in a 5x5x5ft space Blow a bubble large enough to carry the target(s) of the spell. The bubble can carry any amount of weight, and can even hold sharp objects without popping. The bubble trails behind you, matching your speed, automatically avoiding obstacles and bouncing against surfaces. You can toggle whether the bubble follows you on and off as a free action. The only way the bubble can be popped is ceasing concentration, dispel magic or a creature spending a standard action to poke the bubble. Upcast 3 - The bubble carries up to 10x10x10 of space Upcast 5 - The bubble carries up to 15x15x15 of space

entries.title: copy-of-bubble-buddy
entries.content: Copy of Bubble Buddy Bubble Buddy \[concentration] \[water] Goomshroom 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachDuration10 minutes You blow a bubble in the shape of a friend. It floats gently in the air or water behind you at a static distance of 10 ft. It cannot be popped unless it takes piercing damage from a direct attack. Gives all nearby allies +2 happiness. Bubble buddy has nothing but the best intentions but often somehow finds a way to sour the mood. At any point while bubble buddy exists, you can send it into a social situation. People will generally treat bubble buddy as a real person, but it does not speak much back, only communicating vaguely through subtle item interactions. Over the course of a minute, bubble buddy will quickly inconvenience people to show what a bad possible outcome is for interacting with this specific person or type of person. Such as spilling a dwarf's drink, or poking someone very sensitive to touch. If you allow it, bubbly buddy will continue interacting with people all around a social setting, such as a party, a tavern etc and ruin the mood. After which, people will turn on the buddy (and the caster if they saw you cast it, see you concentrating etc).

entries.title: gang-up
entries.content: Gang Up Gang Up \[figment] Goomshroom 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minute You create 3 slimy copies of yourself that relentlessly follow a creature of your choosing (even into areas you couldn’t go, such as into the air). While they persist, they each take up a single space adjacent to the creature most optimal to provide flanking. If they are targeted with a hostile attack, spell or take any damage, they disappear. Their movement is \[elusive]. These duplicates are treated as though they have all teamwork feats.

entries.title: gooball
entries.content: Gooball Gooball \[concentration] Goomshroom 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minute Your throat swells as your mouth fills with bile. You spit a glob of goo at a creature as a ranged attack roll. Their speed is reduced by 15 for 1 minute. A creature can remove this goo automatically as a standard action, or a swift action with athletics.

entries.title: message-in-a-bottle
entries.content: Message in a Bottle Message in a Bottle \[teleportation] \[water] Goomshroom 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeinfiniteTarget1 creature You take a bottle and you think of somebody that you know at least by name and have met as you place it into a source of water: A bucket, a lake, a toilet, as long as the bottle can be submerged, it counts. This bottle disappears and then appears near the creature you thought of and floats towards them in a bubble. If the creature is near no suitable water sources then it only appears when the creature gets nearby one. After (presumably) reading the message, the creature can write their own message and send the bottle back to you. Anything that can reasonably fit into a tiny bottle can also be included. This spell does not function across planes. This spell does not require line of sight.

entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: splatter
entries.content: Splatter Splatter \[concentration] Goomshroom 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftAoE10 ft radius, centered on a point on the groundDuration1 minute Spit a slimy ball at the ground that splatters on impact. Creatures in the spells area at the time of casting, or that walk into the spells area are affected by it.\ \ Choose one:\ Greasy - Creatures are knocked down (reflex/acrobatics negates). Treating the grease as difficult terrain while moving through it prevents the creature from being knocked down. Gooey - Creatures are entangled (fort negates). Athletics as a swift action to remove snare.

entries.title: stick-together
entries.content: Stick Together Stick Together \[buff] Goomshroom 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil Rest Your skin oozes a gooey substance. Whenever you touch a willing creature (free action), your initiative now matches theirs. This does not give you an additional turn, but you can use any movement you have left to ride into battle with the touched creature. Simply by touching them, you can allow a creature of any size to mount you as though you were appropriately sized. You ignore their weight as though it were your own. Any effects that create forced movement automatically moves all attached creatures if you are affected, and have no effect on mounted creatures if you aren't affected. If you attach to multiple creatures, you all must choose one creature's initiative to attach to. You can also use the carry action without making allies clumsy. By applying a solvent or making an athletics check (spell dc) as a standard action you can be forcefully separated. The caster can choose to release stuck creatures at any time as a free action.

entries.title: mud-buddy
entries.content: Mud Buddy Mud Buddy \[companion] \[earth] \[water] Goomshroom 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetWet EarthRangeReachDurationUntil rest You sculpt mud into a more friendly shape, and your new buddy does his best to aid you. Mud buddy is an elemental that shares all of your ability scores, poise, AC and saves. He has half of your max hp. He shares your level, but is always treated as a minion. Mud buddy cannot wield weapons, and his only form of attack is a single topple every turn. He has a 20 land speed and a 60 swim speed. He can burrow through moist earth using his land speed. Outside of combat he can do simple tasks, such as physical labor. He is intelligent, but he lacks the ability to speak and has no skills. He can carry 300 lbs.

entries.title: mushroom-dance
entries.content: Mushroom Dance Mushroom Dance Goomshroom 2 Cast Time - 3 rounds EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Choose an adjacent creature to start dancing around. If you remain adjacent to the creature for the entire cast time, you learn about their lifestyle by gleaning one of three general categories. Sin - They kill, lie, cheat, steal or deal with demons/undead Neutral - They have no strong tendencies towards sin or virtue, or roughly equal measures of both Virtuous - They are honest. They save the lives of innocents and lend aid to the weak and downtrodden "Mushroom dance. Mushroom dance. What could it mean?"

entries.title: nap-time
entries.content: Nap Time Nap Time \[healing] Goomshroom 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveWill You inflict a wave of drowsiness on a creature, causing it to fall asleep (will reduces to clumsy 1). If the creature stays asleep until the end up the spells duration, it gains 20 temp hp.

entries.title: osmosis
entries.content: Osmosis Osmosis \[concentration] Goomshroom 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 written text As long as you maintain concentration and contact with a body of written text, you can continue to absorb information from it. You can effectively summarize a book without even opening it at a rate of 10 standard pages a minute, even if you don't understand it's language. If the text is encoded, you only interpret its literal meaning. This spell allows you to get the gist of anything written in a secret language.

entries.title: overflow
entries.content: Overflow Overflow \[water] \[concentration] Goomshroom 2 Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRange60 ftAoEOne 15 ft diameter hemisphere, centered on a point on the groundDuration1 minute You cause a hemisphere of water to suddenly form in an area. This water has no inherently negative effects, but aquatic terrain can be a problem for some and a boon for others. Upcast - By spending 4 mana, the diameter of the sphere increases to 25ft.

entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: to-the-rescue
entries.content: To the Rescue! To the Rescue! \[healing] \[elusive] Goomshroom 2 Cast Time - 1 FRA EffectTargetSelfDuration1 rounds Your hands ooze with a soothing and sticky goo. Take the carry action and increase your speed by 20 this turn. You ignore their weight as though it were your own. Any creature touched recovers (5+CL) hp. You can rescue up to 2 allies. At the end of your turn, they detach in an adjacent space of your choosing, or in your possession. If a creature is directly preventing an ally from moving, such as when being grappled, then you cannot rescue them. For situations like being stuck in a web, a suitable check (like athletics) can be rolled to rescue.

entries.title: aqueous-orb
entries.content: Aqueous Orb Aqueous Orb \[water] \[concentration] \[persistent] Goomshroom 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftDuration3 roundsSaveReflex You open a portal to the elemental planes to generate a large size (10x10 ft) orb of water. Immediately upon casting the spell, and as a swift action each turn, you can move the orb up to 30 ft in a straight line. If the orb moves through a creature's space, then it is carried along for the ride and made wet (reflex negates). When picked up or at the end of each turn it is carried, creatures take 2d8+CL (9+CL) poise damage and are made clumsy 2. Spell DC athletics as a swift action to escape.

entries.title: bubble-breath
entries.content: Bubble Breath Bubble Breath \[concentration] \[water] Goomshroom 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 rounds You blow a bunch of bubbles. Affected creatures are trapped inside of a bubble for 3 rounds (reflex negates). The bubble is completely indestructible and cannot be popped, moved or altered in any way from the inside. Trapped creatures are free to take any actions they please, the only restriction being that they cannot affect creatures outside of the bubble. They can use teleportation to escape or use the reprieve to heal and buff.  The reverse is also true: Creatures outside of the bubble cannot affect creatures inside of the bubble without first popping it. Bubbles can only be popped by taking 1 pierce damage. Because of the defensive properties of the bubble, hitting allies with it to protect them is a viable strategy. Allies do not need to roll a reflex save. They can choose to be affected by the spell or not, even while defeated.

entries.title: dog-pile
entries.content: Dog Pile Dog Pile \[elusive] Goomshroom 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 roundSaveReflex Cover the ground underneath your foe in sticky goo, entangling them for 1 round (reflex reduces to -15 speed). Your allies are magnetized to this enemy. Any allies can move 30 ft closer to a creature entangled by this spell as a free action once.

entries.title: rain-dance
entries.content: Rain Dance Rain Dance \[recharge] Goomshroom 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE1 mile radius, centered on casterDuration1 hour You dance a jig. After you complete your dance, clouds roll in and it starts to lightly rain. After the spell ends, the weather returns back to what it was before casting. All weather inducing spells do not function underground.
