entries.title: power-word-fun
entries.content: Power Word Fun Power Word Fun Nack 5 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE30 ft radius burst, centered on casterDuration1 round {% hint style="info" %} Special: This spell can only be cast while the caster is deprived of a standard action or otherwise unable to cast spells. {% endhint %} You temporarily and partially negate CC on yourself and nearby creatures. For creatures who are stunned, dazed, in stasis, in time out etc. This spell does not end the cc, but it allows creatures who are affected by them to do anything that could reasonably be considered "not mechanically beneficial" such as singing, dancing, juggling (unless these actions could somehow be mechanically beneficial) or casting a Nack spell. This does not allow movement, attacks, defensive features etc that you would normally be deprived of. This is a meme. If you try to anyway, you are put in time out until combat ends. Any creature in range, regardless if they are CC'd, adds extra flair in all their actions, or emotes like they're in a video game. Even if they try not to, they can't help but bob their head and tap their feet. The caster can immediately use any other Nack spell as a free action.

entries.title: awaken
entries.content: Awaken Awaken \[recharge] Nack 6 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE30 ft radius burst, centered on casterDuration1 round You give a plant or animal sentience. Its intelligence increases to +0. If it is a plant, it gains a 30ft speed and the ability to uproot without killing itself. If it is a beast, their type changes to magical beast. Creatures gain big goofy eyes and a mouth to speak with. They learn common. What happens after that is largely based up to it. Certain types of creatures may have certain mannerisms. Predators tend to be more aggressive, for instance. Beavers are more industrious. They can look upon their past and present with great clarity, recognizing mistreatment and caring. This spell has a 1 week cooldown.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Nack {% hint style="info" %} Special: Nack spells cannot be learned via technique points. They can only be learned by finding books containing their knowledge. When these books are read, you gain the spell as an at-will innate technique, and the book vanishes. Since the spell level is mostly irrelevant, it mostly just refers to the rarity. {% endhint %} Nack is a mysterious mage who uses his mastery in order to create mostly useless and niche magic. He also has enough free time to hide these books all over the world in secluded places. Very few of the spells are as powerful as one might expect of a mage, but they are usually interesting, quirky and fun. A mage with mastery over Nack spells is not more powerful because of it, but they're probably more fun to have at parties.

entries.title: blight
entries.content: Blight Blight \[necrotic] \[upcast] Necromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTargetvariesSaveFort You briefly allow a creature to experience the joy of decomposition. They take 2d8+CL (9+CL) necrotic damage and are sickened 2 for one minute (fort halves dmg and negates sickened). Upcast - For each additional mana you spend, deal an additional d6 damage. If you cast at 3rd lvl or higher, increases the sickened duration to 1 hour.

entries.title: bloodbath
entries.content: Bloodbath Bloodbath Necromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget3 creaturesSaveFort As part of casting the spell, you cut yourself with a held object taking d6 (3) bleed damage immediately and every turn after at the start of your turn. Creatures you target bleed for the same damage you took (fort negates). As long as you continue to bleed, the targets also continue to bleed for the same damage you take each turn. You can choose to stop bleeding as an instant action, ending the spell.

entries.title: bone-shaker
entries.content: Bone Shaker Bone Shaker \[necrotic] Necromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTargetvariesSaveFort {% hint style="info" %} The spell cannot target creatures that are BONELESS. A successful monster lore check against a creature reveals if it has bones.  {% endhint %} The spell's effect varies depending on what you target. Living Creature - The creature takes 2d6+CL (7+CL) necrotic damage and is staggered for one round (fort haves damage and negates stagger). Willing Undead - The creature spends an immediate action to make an attack against a creature within reach or move 30 feet Unwilling Undead - Functions as willing undead (fort negates)

entries.title: call-of-the-grave
entries.content: Call of the Grave Call of the Grave \[upcast] \[earth] Necromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureSaveReflex Cause several arms to erupt from the ground and grab onto a creature. The creature is entangled (reflex negates). The hands share your AC, and have poise equal to their AC. On hit, when the hands are poise broken, or with a successful athletics check (DC=their AC) they retreat back into the ground. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, target an additional creature in range.

entries.title: decomposition
entries.content: Decomposition Decomposition Necromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget12 corpses, or 1 undead You cause a group of corpses to rapidly experience decomposition, turning in them into skeletons almost instantly. Perfect for cleanly storing in your closet. If cast on an undead creature, they instead take 2d6+CL (7+CL) true dmg. This can happen accidentally if you happen to target an undead buried amongst corpses.

entries.title: grave-robber
entries.content: Grave Robber Grave Robber Necromancy 1 Cast Time - N/A Effect While this technique is prepared, you gain an innate sense for when corpses are nearby. You can sense them buried up to 30 feet underground. You can read the text written on tombstones and similar things, even if the text has long since faded. If you can see a corpse, you know what its name was in life. As a standard action, you can reach into the ground and pull out an entire corpse if it is not inside of a container of some sort. Undead creatures have a visible aura around them unless they are your level or higher.

entries.title: halt-undead
entries.content: Halt Undead Halt Undead  Necromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 undeadDuration1 minuteSaveWill You command an undead creature to bend to your will, and you will it to stand still. It is entangled (will negates). An intelligent undead creature gets a new save at the end of each of its turns.

entries.title: life-transfer
entries.content: Life Transfer Life Transfer \[healing] \[upcast] Necromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature You transfer fundamental life energy between yourself and the target. Choose one. Heal\ You can inflict drained upon yourself in order to heal the target. You become drained 1 and you heal 10 hp, or remove 1 drain stack from the target. Harm\ Alternatively, you can \[mana burn] to inflict drained stacks you possess onto another creature. This requires an attack roll and removes 1 drained stack from yourself to inflict it on your target on hit. If you miss, you do not mana burn. You must be drained to use this variant of the spell. Upcast - When you heal, you can increase the number of drained stacks you accumulate by 1 for each additional mana spent. For each stack of additional drain you accumulate, you can remove an additional stack of drain from the target or heal an additional 7 hp. When you harm, each additional mana spent allows you to increase the stacks of drain you pass on to your enemy by 1. You must possess drained stacks equal to the amount you are inflicting.

entries.title: mr-skeltal
entries.content: Mr Skeltal Mr Skeltal \[companion] Necromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action Focus - 1 Instrument EffectRangeReachTarget1 corpse Raise a skeleton from a corpse whose only calling is to jam. Give it the instrument used as the focus of this spell and it will play it with a bonus of (CL+2) whenever you ask. When not playing, it follows you around. If you give the skeleton a trumpet, its bonus increases to (CL+4). Doot.

entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: animate-dead
entries.content: Animate Dead Animate Dead Necromancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 corpse You lay your hand on a corpse, reanimating it with profane power into a zombie, or tearing the skeleton from its body. The creature is mindless, but it does understand your orders. It will protect you when you are in danger or carry out simple manual labor. Animated dead act on your turn in initiative, meaning they are automatically surprised if you are. If given no orders, they mindlessly follow you. Defeated undead, construct, ooze, plant and elemental creatures cannot be targeted by animate dead. If a creature has multiple types and includes one of these types, it cannot be targeted by animate dead. First, choose one of the following\ Boner - Weakness (crush 2)\ Zombo - Weakness (slash 2) The spell has complex rules on how this changes the creatures stats.\ LevelThe creatures level is set to 1/3 your level upon creation (minimum 0).Ability ScoresThe creature loses its intelligence score. It's str and dex remain the same. It's remaining stats are set to +0.SkillsThe creature loses all of its skills. It shares your perception bonus.FeatsThe creature loses all of its feats.Defensive traitsThe creature loses all of its defensive traits other than resistance, immunity and DR. It gains resistance to necrotic damage and +4 bonus to saves against effects to control it. The first time it is defeated, it is instead reduced to 1 hp unless it is defeated by holy damage.AttacksThe creature maintains all of its natural attacks, including any multi-attack options. It can wield weapons if it wielded them in life.Offense traitsLose all offense traits unless it is marked with the [special attack] tag.Other traitsKeep swim/climb/land speeds. Gain night vision. Lose everything else. {% hint style="info" %} Special: The spell is going to be cast on a wide variety of creatures, some of which don't exactly fit the mold. Certain features you may want to get rid of and keep something from the creature. Some features might be too powerful on certain creatures and should be removed. DM discretion. Ex. The creature is blind and senses only using tremorsense. Keep the tremorsense, don't give night vision. Special: If you die, your undead act instinctively, usually attacking whatever is close at hand at random (including your allies). {% endhint %}

entries.title: bone-cage
entries.content: Bone Cage Bone Cage \[buff] Necromancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange10 ftTarget1 corpseDuration1 minute {% hint style="info" %} The spell cannot target creatures that are BONELESS. A successful monster lore check against a creature reveals if it has bones.  {% endhint %} You tear the bones out of a corpse and use them to shield yourself. You get +2 AC. This bone armor can be destroyed with a successful sunder.

entries.title: gloom-bolt
entries.content: Gloom Bolt Gloom Bolt \[necrotic] Necromancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature You shoot a ray of necrotic energy that interferes with the creature's vision. Make a ranged attack that deals 3d8+CL (13+CL) necrotic damage and blinds on hit for 1 round. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, fire an additional ray at a different creature.

entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: spectral-hand
entries.content: Spectral Hand Spectral Hand \[buff] Necromancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil Rest You summon an ghostly bloodied hand that you can used to deliver reach spells from a range. Spells with a range of reach gain a range of 30 ft. You can make these attacks as melee attacks or ranged attacks. Defaults to melee. The hand ambiently floats around you when not in use, but you can choose to pocket it if you don't want creatures to see it.

entries.title: vampiric-blood
entries.content: Vampiric Blood Vampiric Blood \[healing] \[upcast] Necromancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 bloody corpse You drain the blood from a recently deceased creature and use its life force to bolster yourself and a chosen ally within range. You restore 2d6+CL (7+CL) hp and grant the same amount to the chosen ally. The same corpse cannot be targeted multiple times with this spell.  Upcast - For every additional mana spent, increase healing by d6.

entries.title: asphyxiate
entries.content: Asphyxiate Asphyxiate \[concentration] Necromancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveFort {% hint style="info" %} Because this is a concentration spell, it requires you hold your staff. Because it also detaches a hand, it requires you also have a free hand. {% endhint %} One of your hands detaches and flies over to a creature to choke it and lift it into the air (fort negates). They take 2d6+CL (7+CL) crush damage. The creature is silenced, entangled, cannot ingest consumables and takes the same damage again at the end of each of its turns as long as you stay within 30 ft of them. If the target passes its save, you move more than 30 ft away from the target, or the spells duration expires your hand flies back and reattaches automatically. Your hand can be targeted using all of your statistics, but it has cover (+2 AC/reflex).

entries.title: corpse-explosion
entries.content: Corpse Explosion Corpse Explosion \[necrotic] \[upcast] Necromancy 3 Cast Time - Varies EffectRange30 ft/60 ftAoE5 ft radius/10 ft radiusTargetOne allied undead/one corpseSaveReflex The effect and cast time of this varies depending on what you target. Allied Undead (Immediate) - You can cast this freely on any undead you control, even in response to one being destroyed. Upcast - By spending 5 mana, you can cause the the initial explosion to deal 5d8+CL (22+CL) necrotic damage. In addition, you set off a chain reaction, causing all corpses in the spell's area to also explode, and the corpses they effect and so on. A creature can still only be damaged by a single explosion.

If you targeted an allied undead, this kills the undead.

entries.title: drain-soul

They are drained 2 (fort reduces effect to 10 necrotic damage). You regain 10 hp. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase drain by 1 and healing by 5 (with passed saves dealing the would be drained value\*5 necrotic damage).

entries.title: unholy-frenzy
entries.content: Unholy Frenzy Unholy Frenzy Necromancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ft radius, centered on caster Give undead you control within the spells area a +4 bonus to attack this turn. Choose one specific creature within range of the spell. All undead under your control rush this target down, moving up to it and making a simple attack. entries.title: corpse-possession
entries.content: Corpse Possession Corpse Possession \[scrying] Necromancy 4 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectRangeReachTarget1 corpse This spell spell functions as animate dead, but changes as follows.  It raises the creature as a zombie version of itself. Upon completion, your spirit leaves your body and inhabits the zombified corpse. You can inhabit this corpse indefinitely, and speak through it in the creatures voice, your own, or a raspy mixture of the two. You can choose to no longer inhabit the corpse at any time, returning back to your body and causing the magic animating it to leave. This kills the zombie. While you animate this corpse, any other undead you have animated enter a coma, and reanimate once you return. Upcast 5 - You can choose to animate the corpses of 3 similar creatures at once, such as members of a town guard.

entries.title: haunted
entries.content: Haunted Haunted \[scrying] \[subtle] Necromancy 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature or objectDuration1 hourSaveWill Take a creature or an object for a ride. Detach your spirit from your body, causing it to look like you are napping or have your head in the clouds. Attach your freed spirit to a creature or object within range (will negates against creatures). If the object is possessed by a creature (ha), then you are effectively targeting the creature and it still gets a save. If you are successful, you can swap between using your own senses and the senses of what you are attached to. The creature remains unaware of your presence unless you make it known. You can telekinetically move objects within 30 ft around while haunting. Objects weighing less than 5 pounds can be tossed and objects under 100 lbs can be slowly dragged. You can also telepathically speak to the creature, making your voice sound vague and ghost-like or your own voice. A creature with arcana or religion recognizes the moving objects or voices as a possession with a DC 14 check. By uttering a prayer or drinking holy water, the spell immediately ends. You can also choose to end it willingly at any time.

entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: vile-vigor
entries.content: Vile Vigor Vile Vigor \[healing] \[mana burn] Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature You can remove practically any status ailment at the cost of your own magic. Mana burn to remove it, increasing in amount based on the status ailment. 1 - Minor Status - Asleep, bleed, blurred vision, charmed, entangled, fatigued, fascinated, grounded, knocked down, shaken/sicken/clumsy stacks, frosty, wet. 2 - Major Status - Bone chilled, ablaze, blinded, confused, envenomed, frightened, staggered, silenced, taunt. 3 - Extreme Status - Dazed, pacified, stun, stasis. You can change the mana burn into drain to cast this spell as a swift action.

entries.title: final-hour
entries.content: Final Hour Final Hour \[buff] \[curse] Necromancy 5 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 willing undeadDuration2 rounds A surge of necrotic energy imbues an undead creature, giving it a very noticeable aura. It takes a -5 penalty to stealth and becomes immune to hp damage. It is afflicted with a curse that destroys it at the end of its second turn.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 5

entries.title: shackles-of-pain
entries.content: Shackles of Pain Shackles of Pain \[concentration] Necromancy 5 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange10 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minuteSaveWill You share your pain with another creature, represented by an ethereal shackle that connects you two (will negates). While within 60 ft of this creature, you take half damage, and the other half of the damage is transferred to it as true damage. If the creature leaves this range, the shackle breaks.

entries.title: beyond-death
entries.content: Beyond Death Death Defied Necromancy 6 Cast Time - N/A EffectTargetSelfDuration1 round When you are defeated or killed, you can choose to spend 6 mana to enter a ghost state. While in this state, you can freely speak, use supernatural abilities and cast spells, but your speed is 0 and you cannot make weapon, natural or unarmed attacks. At the end of your next turn, your spirit reunites with your body and this effect ends. Your ghost remains tethered to your body. You cannot move on your own without the aid of magic, but other creatures can physically move your body to adjust the position of your ghost.

entries.title: possession
entries.content: Possession Possession \[concentration] \[recharge] Necromancy 6 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill You turn incorporeal and siphon into a creatures mouth to take control of their body (will reduces effect to stagger for 1 round). On each of your subsequent turns, you can play as that creature using all of its abilities and statistics except hp. In order to use activated the abilities, you must have seen the creature use them, or succeed on a local check (DC 15+lvl of creature). If you do not, then you must spend 1 week to accommodate yourself to the new body. Creatures under your control like summons or undead still recognize you as their master. When you are defeated, dispelled etc, you appear in a space adjacent to the possessed creature and are staggered for 1 round and the creature is drained 3. If cast on a defeated creature, there is no save. Because the spell uses your vitality to sustain the creature, you can immediately stand up and start fighting. You get a plus +5 bonus to disguise checks to pretend to be this creature. You can swap between your voice and the creatures voice at will. The spell cannot be cast again until you rest. When you rest while possessing a creature, you regain your hp, but no other benefits from resting.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: skelepathy
entries.content: Skelepathy Possession \[concentration] \[recharge] Necromancy 6 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minute Speak directly to a creature's skeleton, setting it free from the tyranny of its fleshy host. The spell cannot target creatures that are BONELESS. A successful monster lore check against a creature reveals if it has bones. This spell functions as animate dead, but with a few bonuses… * You can target creatures that aren't dead (including undead, but not undead that are only bones) * Its level is set to the level of the creature the spell is cast on * Its max HP is the current HP of the creature at time of casting * It has the perform (dance, trumpet) skill (bonus=CL+4)

entries.title: README
entries.content: Necromancy Necromancy spells are about manipulating the dead and inflicting dead, often via necrotic damage.

entries.title: blazing-palm
entries.content: Blazing Palm Blazing Palm \[fire] Prismancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creature You fire a ray of immolation that sets targets ablaze. Roll a ranged attack that deals 2d8+CL (9+CL) fire damage. On a hit applies glowing.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: sacred-flames
entries.content: Sacred Flames Sacred Flames Prismancy 1 Cast Time - N/A Effect While this technique is prepared, your heat is infused with holy light. Whenever you cast a spell that does fire damage, its damage counts as fire and holy. The spell's tags change as appropriate.

entries.title: flame-of-destiny
entries.content: Flame of Destiny Flame of Destiny \[fire] \[light] Prismancy 2 Cast Time - 10 minutes EffectRangereachDurationUntil rest You create a stationary bonfire whose flames move in slow motion, and illuminate an area of 100ft. It can be put out like any other fire. By resting next to the fire and gazing into its flames for at least 10 minutes, your deity shows you visions of a prominent creature that it wants you to defeat or apprehend. This creature is always a similar level to you, and is a leader of some sort at the forefront of operations in opposition to your deity: a necromancer, bandit chief, cult leader etc. This creature is also somewhat close by in terms of proximity, only targeting creatures you can realistically find within a week of travel using your current means of transportation.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: solar-flare
entries.content: Solar Flare Solar Flare \[light] \[fire] \[recharge] Prismancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE60 ft radius burst, centered on casterSaveReflex Close your eyes and unleash a blast of solar energy that deals (CL) fire damage to all creatures and blinds them for 1 round (reflex negates).

entries.title: blazing-beam
entries.content: Blazing Beam Blazing Beam \[fire] \[upcast] Prismancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature Fire a beam that magnetizes to burning creatures and feeds the flames. The target takes 4d8+CL (18+CL) fire damage. If they are ablaze, the DC to save against the condition is increased by 4, and the penalty to AC is increased to -4. Only standard actions grant a new save against being ablaze. If an effect would normally automatically remove ablaze, it instead only grants a save without the -4 penalty. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, the spell deals an additional d8 dmg.

entries.title: radiance
entries.content: Radiance Radiance \[light] Prismancy 3 Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature or objectDurationUntil Rest You cause the target of the spell to emanate an exceptionally bright light. The area within 60 ft of the target is bathed in bright light. You can use the spell effectively as dispel magic against a spell with the \[darkness] tag. If you succeed, the light spell consumes the dark. This happens automatically when the area of the spell overlaps with a \[darkness] effect and radiance is disabled for 1 minute.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: plasma-blade
entries.content: Plasma Blade Plasma Blade \[buff] \[fire] \[light] \[martial] Pyromancy 4 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetHeld melee slash weaponDuration1 minute Imbue a melee slashing weapon in hand with searing light, changing its base damage to d8+CL (4+CL) Fire damage. It becomes weightless. It gives off bright light within 20 feet. As part of casting this spell, and as a swift action every turn for its duration, you may make a simple attack with this weapon. If it leaves your possession, this spell ends after one round.

entries.title: prismatic-body
entries.content: Prismatic Body Prismatic Body \[buff] \[light] \[fire] Prismancy 4 Cast Time - 1 swift action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute You become a being of pure light, allowing you to move through glass and obstacles that do not block light (such as wire fences) freely. You shed light in a 20-foot area. This form can be suppressed while in areas of magical darkness, but you automatically attempt to dispel any such area at the start of your turns. Sighted creatures that attack you are considered to have blurred vision against you, and creatures that successfully attack you in melee or are grappling with you are set ablaze (reflex negates). No matter how many attacks a creature makes, they cannot be forced to make multiple saves a turn.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: rainbow-beam
entries.content: Rainbow Beam Rainbow Beam \[light] \[fire] Prismancy 5 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ft lineTargetAllies and enemiesSaveReflex Line attack deals 6d8+CL (27+CL) fire damage to enemies, but instead of harming allies, it grants them a Lucky Rainbow - visible as an aura around them. They may consume this rainbow to reroll any one attack, save, or skill check within a minute, after which it disappears. A creature may only have one Lucky Rainbow on them at a time. It lasts one minute. Also creates bright light in its area for a round.

entries.content: Level 5

entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: README
entries.content: 🌈 Prismancy The luminosity tree is all about inflicting a unique status effect called "glowing." This status effect can be consumed by spells in this tree to trigger bonus effects. Prismancy spells deal fire damage and light up the battlefield.

entries.title: blazing-bulwark
entries.content: Blazing Bulwark Blazing Bulwark \[fire] Pyromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Immediate Action EffectTarget1 creatureSaveReflex {% hint style="info" %} Special: Must be wielding a shield to cast\ If you have shield focus, you can cast this spell as an instant action. {% endhint %} As part of casting the spell, take the block action. If the foe attacked with a melee weapon, they are set ablaze (reflex negates).

entries.title: bouncing-blast
entries.content: Bouncing Blast Bouncing Blast \[fire] \[upcast] Pyromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creature (see text) You toss a mote of flame that hungers for more if it successfully consumes its target. Roll an attack against a creature that deals 2d8+CL (9+CL) fire damage. If it defeats the creature, you can target a new one within 30 ft with an additional attack. This can continue indefinitely. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8.

entries.title: forbidden-flame
entries.content: Forbidden Flame Forbidden Flame \[fire] Pyromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creature Convert all of your mana into heat with a spark. Cause the air to explode in a creatures face, dealing 2d8+CL (9+CL) fire damage. You automatically spend all of your mana, including any reserves, when you use this technique. For each mana spent beyond the first, increase the spells CL by 1.

entries.title: pillar-of-flame
entries.content: Pillar of Flame Pillar of Flame \[fire] \[concentration] \[persistent] \[upcast] Pyromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftAoEOne space, 30 ft highSaveReflexDuration1 minute Ignite a circle on the ground and cause a pillar of flame to erupt from it. Creatures in the area of the pillar take 2d8+CL (9+CL) fire damage. Upcast - Increase damage by d8 (4) and create an additional pillar.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: self-immolation
entries.content: Self Immolation Self Immolation \[fire] \[buff] \[persistent] \[upcast] Pyromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfAoE5 ftDuration1 minute You light yourself on fire and the fire hungers for things to burn. At the end of your turn, you take 4 fire damage. Whenever a creature is within 5ft of you, they take 4 fire damage.\ Your speed increases by 5 ft. Upcast - The damage increases by 2 and your speed increases by 5 per additional mana spent. If you spend at least 3 mana, your movement is \[elusive].

entries.title: soulfire
entries.content: Soulfire Soulfire \[fire] \[upcast] Pyromancy 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureSaveReflex Your mana reserves ignite and you release this uncontainable energy at an enemy. They take 2d10+CL (11+CL) fire damage (reflex halves). You also temporarily stop memorizing a spell of your choosing until you rest. If that spell was currently active as a buff or concentration effect, it immediately ends. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d10. {% hint style="info" %} For creatures with innate techniques, consider rendering one of their at will abilities inaccessible. {% endhint %}

entries.title: boiling-blood
entries.content: Boiling Blood Boiling Blood \[concentration] \[fire] Pyromancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveFort Ignite a creatures insides, making them convulse in pain. They are staggered and take (CL) fire damage each round at the start of its turn (fort negates). At the end of each turn, save again. Creatures that are already ablaze take a -4 penalty to their save.

entries.title: flame-cleanse-me
entries.content: Flame Cleanse Me Flame Cleanse Me \[healing] \[fire] Pyromancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTarget1 creature You hold a flame to your chest that burns away your ailments. Poisons, bleed, and magical damage-over-time or status conditions are removed at the cost of 5 hp.

entries.title: hot-streak
entries.content: Hot Streak Hot Streak \[buff] Pyromancy 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 Minute Supercharge your staves, decreasing the mana cost of all abilities with the \[fire] tag by 1, but increasing the mana cost of all other mana expenditure by 2.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: backfire
entries.content: Backfire Backfire \[fire] Pyromancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creature This spell functions exactly like dispel magic, except when you successfully counterspell or dispel a \[buff], the creature you target takes 4d8+CL (18+CL) fire damage.

entries.title: fire-and-brimstone
entries.content: Fire and Brimstone Fire and Brimstone \[fire] \[persistent] \[concentration] Pyromancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoEInfinite line (see text)SaveReflex The flames of hell are unleashed through a portal you open up. A line of hellfire that continues until it hits a solid object deals 3d8+CL (13+CL) fire damage to creatures within. The portal remains open for 3 rounds, continuing to damage creatures that move through it. Fire created by this spell ignores fire resistance. This spell has great potential for destruction considering its immense AoE and the fact it persists for several rounds, potentially burning holes through creatures and structures alike.

entries.title: fire-blast
entries.content: Fire Blast Fire Blast \[fire] Pyromancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftAoE10 ft radius, centered on a point on a surfaceSaveReflex You throw an enormous ball of fire that attaches to something, then explodes forcefully, dealing 4d8+CL (18+CL) fire damage and knocking down creatures struck (reflex halves dmg and negates knock down). You can target one specific creature with an attack roll. If you land it, the creature's space is the center of the explosion, and it takes a -2 penalty to its save. If you miss, the fire falls directly down and then explodes when it first impacts a surface. This also destroys flammable undergrowth, sends small objects flying, starts fires, disperses atmospheric conditions, and otherwise causes the effects one would expect from a fiery explosion. Upcast - Every additional mana spent adds d8 damage, 10 range, and 5 radius.

entries.title: hellfire
entries.content: Hellfire Hellfire \[fire] \[upcast] Pyromancy 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE20 ft radius, centered on casterSaveReflexDuration1 minute (see text) Temporarily borrow some fire from the demon realm, burning yourself in the process. You explode violently dealing 4d8+CL (18+CL) fire damage and setting creatures ablaze (reflex halves dmg and negates ablaze). This spell and the fires it causes ignore fire resistance. The area of the spell is scorched for 1 minute, causing the movement of any fiends inside of it to increase by 20 for 1 round. You yourself take (CL) fire damage from the burst, and ignore being set ablaze. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, the spell deals an additional d8 (4) dmg.

entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: fire-snake
entries.content: Fire Snake Fire Snake \[fire] \[persistent] \[concentration] Pyromancy 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE30 ft line 10 ft tall (see text)Duration3 roundsSaveReflex Cause a flaming serpent to erupt from your staff. It moves along the ground 30 feet, capable of bending around obstacles and terrain. It continues to occupy that 30 feet of space, burning any that it passes through, or that pass through it. Creatures engulfed by the fiery serpent take 5d8+CL (23+CL) fire damage (reflex negates). As a swift action on subsequent turns, you can move the snake another 30 feet.

entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: inferno-sphere
entries.content: Inferno Sphere Inferno Sphere \[buff] \[fire] \[persistent] Pyromancy 5 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE15 ft radius aura, centered on casterDuration1 minute The area around you is pelted with a whirling storm of flame. All creatures (except you) within 15 feet are instantly and persistently set ablaze. Creatures that start their turns in range or move into range take (CL) fire damage. Your speed is reduced to 10 while buffed by this spell.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 5

entries.title: purge
entries.content: Purge Purge \[light] \[fire] \[concentration] \[persistent] Pyromancy 6 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ft line, 15 ft highDuration3 roundsSaveReflex You fire a beam of purifying light, dealing 7d8+CL (31+CL) fire damage and blinding everything it hits for one round (reflex halves dmg and negates blind). This automatically destroys objects of solid or lesser toughness, and if it's enough to break them, it continues past them. This damage area is persistent, and creatures that enter it must save against the damage. Fiends and undead creatures that fail their saves are set ablaze. You may not move while concentrating on this spell. At the start of your next two turns, the damage occurs again, and you may sweep the beam up to 45 degrees to target a new line and everything between the two lines that gets caught in the sweep. The sweep area is not persistent, but the new line is. Turn 1: line\ Turn 2: sweep, new line\ Turn 3: sweep, new line\ Turn 4: spell ends at the start of your turn

entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: README
entries.content: Pyromancy The magic-y magic that has no real life analogue. Primarily focused around dealing force damage using projectiles and conjured weapons.

entries.title: charming-gaze
entries.content: Charming Gaze Charming Gaze \[charm] \[subtle] Shira 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDurationVariesSaveWill You lock your eyes onto a target and charm them (will negates). If you're currently engaged in combat with the creature, the spells duration is 1 minute. If you are not, the spell's duration is 8 hours. Entering combat against them shortens the remaining duration to 1 minute.

entries.title: dance-with-me
entries.content: Dance With Me! Dance With Me! \[charm] \[elusive] Shira 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDuration1 roundSaveWill You extend your hand to a creature and offer to dance. You immediately move 15 ft in a direction of your choosing and charm the creature during its next turn. It cannot move while entangled in your routine, but it can otherwise act normally (will reduces effect to 15 speed penalty). {% hint style="info" %} Unique: If you have the perform (dance) skill, then you can move 30 ft in a direction of your choosing on a failed save. {% endhint %}

entries.title: darting-duplicate
entries.content: Darting Duplicate Darting Duplicate \[figment] \[subtle] Shira 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftDuration3 roundsSaveWill An illusory duplicate of yourself leaves your square, which moves at up to your speed per round and takes a path of your choosing. It can go around corners if you know where to turn to not hit terrain or creatures. It cannot replicate any actions besides moving and smiling. Creatures that are threatening you when you cast this spell must make an AoO on the duplicate (will negates). If the duplicate enters a creature's space or impassable terrain, any creature that witnesses it instantly disbelieves it. A creature that identifies your spell when you cast it instantly disbelieves it.

entries.title: lip-service
entries.content: Lip Service Lip Service \[mind-affecting] \[subtle] Shira 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature You can make a creature think you said something you didn’t. You can implant simple ideas that require no more than two sentences to convey (I think your hat looks lovely. Where did you get it?) into their head that they think that you said in the middle of a conversation, while masking what you actually said during the few seconds it would take to speak. In essence you can speak to two different people at the same time and tell them two different things.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: role-playing
entries.content: Role-Playing Role-Playing \[glamer] Shira 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDuration1 hour You instantly apply a disguise to the target creature. Disguises typically include things like makeup, clothing, accessories and occasionally something more odd like stilts.

entries.title: tongues
entries.content: Tongues Tongues \[buff] Shira 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDurationUntil Rest Creature can speak and understand all spoken non-secret languages. Has no effect on written text.

entries.title: unspoken-name
entries.content: Unspoken Name Unspoken Name \[recharge] Shira 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelfAoE1 mileDurationUntil Rest When you cast this spell, designate a word, phrase, or name. If a creature within 1 mile of you uses that word, phrase, or name to refer to you, you immediately learn that creature’s name, appearance, and location. This discharges the spell.

entries.title: command
entries.content: Command Command \[mind-affecting] \[language] Shira 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 roundSaveWill You give the subject a single command, which it obeys to the best of its ability at its earliest opportunity (will negates). You may select from the following options. The spell specifies whether the creature can take other actions, or if their actions provoke AoOs. Approach - On its turn, the subject moves directly towards you 30 ft, provoking AoOs Drop It - On its turn, the subject drops whatever it is holding. It can’t pick up any dropped item on the same turn it drops it. Kneel - The subject is knocked down. It may act normally but takes any appropriate penalties. Begone - On its turn, the subject moves 30 ft directly away from you, provoking AoOs. Praise Me - The subject babbles on about your greatness, effectively silencing them for 1 round.  If the subject can’t carry out your command on its next turn, it defaults to kneel.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: sense-motives
entries.content: Sense Motives Sense Motives Shira 2 Cast Time - N/A Effect While this technique is prepared, you gain a +4 bonus to insight checks. Whenever you glean something using insight, you can transfer the knowledge you gain to any creature you can see as vague impressions, effectively treating it as though they had succeeded in using insight to detect falsehoods.

entries.title: stage-fright
entries.content: Stage Fright Stage Fright \[mind-affecting] \[fear] \[psychic] Shira 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minuteSaveWill The fear of failure looms over the target creature (will negates). They take a -2 penalty to attack and opposed skill checks. Whenever they graze, miss or fail an opposed skill check they initiated, they take d6+CL (3+CL) psychic damage.  Outside of combat this gains the \[subtle] tag and gives creatures disadvantage on their next skill check made in front of a crowd. Its duration changes to 24 hours. Once they roll the check, the spell ends.

entries.title: stunt-double
entries.content: Stunt Double Stunt Double \[glamer] \[buff] Shira 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature of your sizeDuration1 hourSaveWill You instantly apply a disguise to the target creature that causes them to appear identical to you. While standing adjacent to a creature that looks identical to you, attacks and targeted spells roll to randomly target among everyone (will save per attempt negates, passing this save causes an attacker to be immune to the same cast of the spell).

entries.title: tongue-twister
entries.content: Tongue Twister Tongue Twister \[mind-affecting] Shira 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveWill You add an extra load to all mental actions related to a creature’s speaking, causing their speech to be slowed and slurred (will negates). In order to speak at all, the creature must spend a swift action instead of a free action (ex sharing information with monster lore). In order to cast a spell that normally requires a swift action, the creature must spend a standard action. In order to cast a spell that normally requires a standard action, the creature must spend a FRA. This increase in action cost can reasonably apply to any other actions based on speech as well.

entries.title: overstimulate
entries.content: Overstimulate Overstimulate \[mind-affecting] Shira 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration3 roundsSaveWill You flood the creatures senses with stimuli, overloading them (will negates). They have -15 speed, blurred vision and any blindsense they have is disabled. They have weakness 2 to all damage. This weakness can only be applied once per effect (ie multiple damage types on something like a fire sword don’t deal +4 dmg per strike). An affected creature can make an additional save at the end of each of their turns. If wet, this additional save has advantage.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: the-hand-that-feeds
entries.content: The Hand that Feeds The Hand that Feeds \[mind-affecting] \[upcast] Shira 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 companion creatureDuration1 roundSaveWill You bring forth all of the negative memories and feelings a companion has for its leader. The target companion is taunted by its leader for 1 round (will negates). It does not use any recharge abilities while taunted in this way. This ability cleanses all other taunt effects currently affecting the companion creature if the spell is successful. Upcast 5 - You can target 2 companion creatures.

entries.title: venomous-promise
entries.content: Venomous Promise Venomous Promise \[poison] \[subtle] \[scrying] Shira 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Your words are poison, but they don't know that. Whenever you share information and get a creature to promise not to tell anybody (or something to that effect), you can infect the creature with a venomous promise. From that point after, if they share any information related to what they promised about, they succumb to the effects of the spell. They are immediately envenomed. You are aware of when this happens, who triggered it and what they said and can immediately begin scrying, sensing through the creature that broke the agreement. You can do this for up to 10 minutes. At any point during the scrying, including when it ends, you can deal 40 poison damage to the creature. This damage is nonlethal and does not immediately kill them (though the venom might).

entries.title: domination
entries.content: Domination Domination \[charm] \[concentration] \[recharge] Shira 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minuteSaveWill You link your mind with a creature and enforce your will upon it. For the duration of the spell the creature is charmed and you can telepathically give orders to the dominated creature. They must follow these orders unless they are very obviously self-harming (ex. KYS NOW). For all intents and purposes, this creature is considered your ally as long as they are dominated. If you know of the creature's abilities, you can command it to use them, otherwise they use their normal tactics, but to aid you. At the end of each turn, the creature gets a new save against the effect. The spell ends if any of your allies harm the target (including you).  This spell can only be cast 1/minute.

entries.title: order-66
entries.content: Order 66 Order 66 \[charm] \[contingent] \[language] Shira 4 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectRangeReachTarget1 willing or helpless creatureDuration1 month; 1 minute You plant subconscious cues into a helpless or willing target. After completing the cast time, you cause the target to forget you casting this spell. At any point thereafter, you can trigger the true effects of this spell by speaking a passphrase in a manner where the target can clearly hear you as a standard action. For 1 minute the creature aids you in combat, attacking your enemies as you direct them. Once this effect is triggered, the contingency ends. The contingent aspect of this spell applies to the caster, not the target creature. The spell leaves behind subtle cues, allowing those trained in insight to realize the creature is affected by this spell (caster's DC+4). Creatures only ever get 1 check to realize this enchantment is in place. Upcast 6 - The duration of the subconscious order is permanent.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: authority
entries.content: Authority Authority \[charm] \[language] \[concentration] Shira 5 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectAoESee textTargetAll creatures, other than those you designateSaveWill You link the minds of all creatures with intelligence higher than -2 that can hear the sound of your voice and see you. For the duration of the cast time, you must speak and stand relatively still. What you talk about during the minute cast time is of little importance, all that matters is that you speak. You automatically catch the attention of every creature if nobody is under duress for the duration of the cast time. At the end of the cast time, all minion creatures are automatically charmed by you. For non minions (will negates). A creature of your level or higher needs not make a save at all. After the minute, you can move around, ensnaring more people in your speech as long as you continue speaking. While charmed, creatures will follow you around and agree with basically everything you have to say. You can parade them around, have them protest, have them clap at your performances etc. They will avoid actively engaging in obviously dangerous activities, like jumping off cliffs, attacking people or walking into a war zone.  Stopping the spell or playing beautiful music can break this spell's effect. The profession DC to do so is the spell's DC+5.

entries.title: thrall
entries.content: Thrall Thrall \[charm] \[companion] Shira 6 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectRangeReachTarget1 willing or helpless creature Worm your way deep into a creature's psyche and take control of their body. Functions as Domination, but must be cast on a willing or helpless creature. The domination lasts indefinitely. The creature does not receive new saves and must be freed through other means, magical or otherwise.  If a friend, ally, respected superior, family member etc spends a standard action to sway the creature, it gets a will save against the effect with disadvantage. If at least three creatures spend their turn doing this at once, the save is not at disadvantage. Certain types of people, such as people related to the controlled creature's destiny or true love can give a creature advantage on their save.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Shira When you try and figure out who the most attractive lady is at a party, it's often a question of who is second best, for whenever you get a closer look at #1, it's Shira. People submit to the Cataclysm for strength, and Moogen for stealth, but this demon lord prefers subterfuge. She often exists among mortals, playing along with the politics and wars for fun. Being the least abrasive and the most approachable, Shira is the demon lord the most mortals find intertwined in their life, often not knowing that they deal with a demon. Shira spells focus on deceit as well as mental domination of both overt and subtle varieties.

entries.title: embiggen
entries.content: Embiggen Embiggen \[buff] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDurationUntil Rest The touched creature increases to large size. If the creature is already large or larger, the spell has no effect.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Template 2 The magic-y magic that has no real life analogue. Primarily focused around dealing force damage using projectiles and conjured weapons.

entries.title: alarming-sigil
entries.content: Alarming Sigil Alarming Sigil \[sigil] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget20 ft radius, emanating from a pointDurationUntil Rest You inscribe a magic rune on the surface of an object. Whenever a creature of at least tiny or larger size enters this area, the sigil triggers, creating one of 2 effects you decided on casting. In either case, you are mentally alerted and awakened if sleeping. Silent Alarm - Only you are mentally alerted\ Loud Alarm - A loud sound starts to play and repeat, like beeping. Creatures within 300ft can hear it in ideal conditions.

entries.title: amplify
entries.content: Amplify Amplify \[upcast] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDuration1 hour The touched creature gains the ability to increase their volume much higher than what is normal. Good for getting the attention of crowds, shouting for lost friends and announcing for sports. Upcast 5 - The spell doesn't increase your volume further, but rather allows your voice to carry extreme distances. You are capable of speaking to entire towns, large battlefields and small islands miles wide.

entries.title: arcane-lock
entries.content: Arcane Lock Arcane Lock \[dismissable] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 object that can be opened or closedDurationPermanent The spell can only be cast on medium (or smaller) sized objects, like a chest, an average door or a dresser. A visible padlock appears on the object decorated with magic sigils, usually near the point where it needs to be opened. While the lock persists, the object cannot be opened. As a standard action, a character can get rid of the lock and pop open the object with an athletics or sleight of hand check (DC 23). Any previous instance of this spell disappears if cast again.

entries.title: arcane-pocket
entries.content: Arcane Pocket Arcane Pocket Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 pocket or pouchDurationUntil Rest You create an extradimensional space that can store numerous small items. When you gaze inside you see nothing but a starry sky. It creates a 5x5x5 ft space that can hold 100 lbs of items. The item need not fit into the entrance of the pocket/pouch, only the extra dimensional space. Any excess you attempt to put in spills back out immediately. As long as you know what you're looking for, you can effortlessly pull it out of the space without looking inside. If you turn the pouch/pocket inside out or this spell ends, all of the items spill out. This spell can be made permanent by sewing phase spider web into the fabric (3k gold). You no longer need to prepare a permanent arcane pocket. Any previous instance of this spell disappears if cast again.

entries.title: embiggen
entries.content: Embiggen Embiggen \[buff] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelfDuration10 minutes The touched creature increases to large size. If the creature is already large or larger, the spell has no effect. Upcast - By spending 2 mana, this effect can target allies with a range of reach.

entries.title: feather-fall
entries.content: Feather Fall Feather Fall \[air] \[upcast] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Immediate Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minute Used to save people from deadly falls. The target gently falls 60 ft per round and safely lands on the ground. The spell ends early if the target lands. Upcast 2 - Target up to 4 creatures within 30 ft of each other with the spell.

entries.title: free-swim
entries.content: Free Swim Free Swim \[buff] \[water] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDurationUntil Rest You gain a swim speed equal to your land speed and the amphibious quality, allowing you to fight underwater without a penalty.

entries.title: gear-up
entries.content: Gear Up Gear Up \[concentration] \[upcast] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachDurationUntil Rest You create a magical copy of a non-magical shield or weapon that you think of that doesn't require ammunition, such as a dagger or greatsword. It deals force damage instead of its usual damage. If you have an open hand, you can cause the weapon to appear in your hand and you can make a simple attack with it as part of casting the spell. If you cast this spell while you have already conjured gear, the previous gear disappears. Upcast - For each additional spell level, create an additional piece of gear

entries.title: hidden-power
entries.content: Hidden Power Hidden Power \[elemental] \[upcast] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveReflex Unleash a wave of elemental energy that homes in on a creature, dealing 2d8+CL (9+CL) damage (reflex halves). The damage type can be any elemental damage type and is chosen when cast.  Upcast - For each additional mana spent, deal an additional d8 (4) damage.

entries.title: jump
entries.content: Jump Jump \[upcast] Wildcard 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRangeSelfDuration1 round Casting this spell allows the caster to jump as high and far as their movement speed. When you jump, you ignore fall damage from a fall of 30 ft or less. If you attack an enemy that is in midair during this time, your movement is \[elusive] when landing after jumping up to them. As part of casting the spell, you can take the jump action. Upcast 2 - You can increase the duration of the spell to 10 minutes, and it gains the \[buff] tag.

entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: dimensional-anchor
entries.content: Dimensional Anchor Dimensional Anchor Wildcard 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration10 minutes You fire an anchor-shaped projectile a creature. Make a ranged attack; if it hits, the target is dimensionally anchored, preventing them from using \[teleportation] effects, either on themselves or others. The DC to dispel this effect is 13+CL.

entries.title: dispel-magic
entries.content: Dispel Magic Dispel Magic Wildcard 2  Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creature, or 1 magical effect The spell can be used in two different ways. Dispel - You roll a caster level check to immediately end a magical effect. The DC is (11+CL of the effect). Counter Spell - You roll a caster level check to prevent a spell from being cast. This must be done as a prepared action in response to a spell being cast. The DC is (11+CL of the spell). If the spell the creature is casting has a higher caster level than your to dispel magic, you have disadvantage on your caster level check. You can use dispel magic on supernatural features, labeled (Su). The creature's CL is treated as (lvl+2).\ Passive supernatural effects or constant innate spells can be reactivated as a standard action.

entries.title: mirror-images
entries.content: Mirror Images Mirror Images \[buff] \[figment] \[recharge] Wildcard 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration3 rounds 4 illusory copies appear within your space and mirror your actions. Increase your AC by 1 for every clone you still have. If a creature grazes you, they destroy a clone. You can only cast this spell once every minute.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: shrink-ray
entries.content: Shrink Ray Shrink Ray Wildcard 2 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTargetVariesDurationUntil Rest This spell has a different effect depending on what you target. Ally - Creature shrinks down to the size of an action figure, only a few inches tall. It is unable to effectively damage creatures of small or larger size due to its diminutive nature. Their speed is reduced by 15. They can say "big mode" to increase back to their normal size as a standard action. Enemy - The creature shrinks to small size on-hit. If already small or smaller, no effect. Object - Targeting an unattended object shrinks it down to 1/10th of its original size. Divide its weight by 100.

entries.title: backstab
entries.content: Backstab Backstab Scoundrel 3 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Move to the direct opposite side of a creature you threaten and make an attack.

entries.title: elemental-shield
entries.content: Elemental Shield Elemental Shield \[buff] \[dmg type] Wildcard 4 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute While this spell is active, you are wreathed in an elemental damage type of your choosing. You gain resistance to this damage type. 1/turn when you take damage, the spell rebounds and deals (CL) of your chosen damage type to the creature that did the damage (instant action).

entries.title: plane-shift
entries.content: Plane Shift Plane Shift \[teleportation] Wildcard 4 Cast Time - 1 Minute Focus - A tuning fork EffectTargetSelf+8 creatures You concentrate for a minute on your destination, then appear in a location on another plane. The recipients of this spell must be in physical contact with each other. You must have an idea of where you would like to go in order to use this spell. Roll a planes check and subtract your result from 40. That is how many miles you appear off course from your desired location. The minimum distance is 1 mile off course. Tuning forks are made out of material native to the plane. They are difficult to obtain without first visiting that plane or purchasing them from specialized vendors.  This spell does not require line of sight.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Wildcard The generic magic techniques available to all mages.

entries.title: amnesia
entries.content: Amnesia Amnesia Arc 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectTarget1 creatureDuration1 minute You hit a creature in the head hard enough to cause it to forget its own training. On hit the creature forgets a technique of your choosing. In order to remove a specific technique, you must have seen the technique get used, hear about a specific creature's technique from someone who has seen it or succeed on a monster lore check against the creature to reveal its offense traits. For creatures with class levels that prepare techniques this can be a bit awkward since they can swap techniques so you're gonna have to play it by ear. If you don't have a specific technique in mind, the creature forgets one of its highest tier techniques known if it prepares them, or a 1/day innate technique (that it hasn't used yet) if it doesn't. Move down the list until you get something that fits, with the idea being remove most important and powerful tech first. A creature with Amnesia can spend a standard action to try and remember the technique. Martial techniques require a DC 5 intelligence check while magical techniques require a DC 20 intelligence check.

entries.title: dismantle-su
entries.content: Dismantle (Su) Dismantle \[upcast] Arc 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRangeReachAoEA 10x10 ft wall You create a transparent but clearly visible wall that partially unweaves magic that passes through it. Any spell or supernatural (Su) effect that passes through the wall has its attack bonus and DC decreased by 2. You can also choose to form the barrier into a hemisphere centered on you with a radius equal to half the walls dimensions. Upcast - Per each additional mana spent, increase the dimensions of the wall by 10 ft (20x20, 30x30 etc)

entries.title: down-to-earth-su
entries.content: Down to Earth (Su) Down to Earth \[upcast] Arc 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectTarget1 creature You infuse your weapon with the ability to tangle a creatures wings or the magic that holds it afloat in the air. Make a weapon attack that applies grounded for 1 round. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4). At 3 mana, the grounded duration increases to 3 rounds. At 5 mana, this debuff gains the \[curse] effect.  The curse only ends when the creature consumes a creature known to fly, even if only sparingly, such as a chicken, or its egg.

entries.title: mana-drain
entries.content: Mana Drain Mana Drain \[buff] \[upcast] Arc 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute You radiate a 10 ft aura that drains the mana from living things. Every time a creature spends mana within this aura, it spends an additional mana. If the ability costs no mana, such as an innate spell, its CL is reduced by 2. Upcast 4 - Double the penalties of the aura (+2 mana expenditure, -4 CL for innate spells).

entries.title: pressure
entries.content: Pressure Pressure \[elusive] Arc 1 Cast Time - 1 Instant action Move 10 ft in response to an enemy casting a spell. You must end this movement in a space adjacent to said enemy. Because this action happens before the casting completes, you can benefit from effects like Mana Drain or Fighter's Lament.

entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: silencing-strike
entries.content: Silencing Strike Down to Earth \[upcast] Arc 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectTarget1 creatureDuration1 roundSaveFort Strike at a creatures throat in order to silence them for 1 round (fort negates). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: crumble-magic-minion-su
entries.content: Crumble Magic Minion (Su) Crumble Magic Minion \[upcast] Arc 2  Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectTarget1 creature If you land this attack against a magically created minion, such as an undead or a summoned creature, you automatically deal the attack's damage to the creature that created the effect too if they are within 100 ft of you. In the case of summoning contracts, it still damages whoever summoned them, not the real body of the creature being summoned. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4). If you spend at least 3 mana, the attack damages all the companion creatures, in addition to their creator/summoner.

entries.title: dispelling-strike-su
entries.content: Dispelling Strike (Su) Dispelling Strike \[upcast] Arc 2  Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectTarget1 creature or magical effect Roll an attack roll in place of a dispel check against a magical effect you can attack. If it is attached to a creature, the attack only effects the spell, not the creature.  If you successfully dispel the effect, the caster takes 2d8+lvl (9+lvl) force damage. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: mana-burn-su
entries.content: Mana Burn (Su) Mana Burn \[curse] \[upcast] Arc 2  Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill You weaken the creatures connection to the source of their magic power. They mana burn 2 (will negates) decreasing their current and max mana by the burn value. Mana burn curses can stack. By not casting a spell for a full day, the curse ends. Upcast - Increase mana burn by 1 per mana spent.

entries.title: psionic-backlash
entries.content: Psionic Backlash Psionic Backlash \[psychic] Arc 2  Cast Time - 1 Immediate Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 spell caster When you hear magic words or see magic at play, you can respond by making the creature's mana manipulation unstable. They take d6 (3) psychic damage for each point of mana they spend (or would spend with innate casting).

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: superstitious-su
entries.content: Superstitious (Su) Superstitious \[buff] Arc 2  Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil RestSaveWill (see text) You see magical auras around mages constantly. You learn the highest level spell a creature can cast by focusing on them as a standard action. You automatically get a check to see a creature’s true form (will save vs their class/offense trait DC). If you strike a creature disguising their true form, they revert back to it (will negates).

entries.title: arcana-theft-su
entries.content: Arcana Theft (Su) Arcana Theft Arc 3 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectTarget1 creature Make an attack against a creature and steal their magic away from them. If they are currently affected by a buff spell, you take it away from them on hit. You remove the buff from them and grant it to yourself or an ally within 30 ft.

entries.title: blood-price-su
entries.content: Blood Price (Su) Blood Price \[curse] Arc 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill Inflict a curse that is particularly annoying to mages (will negates). Whenever the cursed creature casts a spell, it starts bleeding. The creature immediately takes the bleed damage after the spell is cast. The bleed damage is equal to (the spells level+2). The bleed effect happens after the effects of the spell (so using a healing spell has no effect on the subsequent bleed). By not casting a spell for a full day, the curse ends.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: teleblock-su
entries.content: Teleblock (Su) Teleblock Arc 3 Cast Time - 1 Immediate Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureDuration1 minuteSaveWill When a creature attempts to teleport and you successfully identify the effect (via monster lore or arcana to identify the spell), you can block it automatically. The creature is also anchored (will negates).

entries.title: teleportation-trap-su
entries.content: Teleportation Trap (Su) Teleportation Trap \[sigil] \[upcast] Arc 3 Cast Time - 3 rounds EffectRangeReachAoE120 ftTargetA spot on a flat continuous surfaceDuration24 hours When you place this sigil, you must designate a location within its AoE on a surface visible from where it is placed. Unlike most other sigils, a teleportation trap is not triggered by moving within a certain radius of it. A creature that teleports within 120 feet of the sigil, even without direct line of effect, is immediately affected by the trap and teleported to this predesignated location instead of their intended destination (will reduces effect to clumsy 1). If you place a Teleportation Trap while you already have one active, the previous one disappears. Upcast 6 - The sigil becomes permanent and its AoE increases to 300 ft.

entries.title: trace-teleportation
entries.content: Trace Teleportation Trace Teleportation Arc 3 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectTargetSelfDuration10 minutes You gain a 6th sense allowing you to detect when a teleportation effect has happened in the area recently. Such spots appear as silhouettes of portals. While adjacent to such a space, you can inspect it more closely to glean further details. You can automatically tell the distance and direction of the teleportation effect. If the effect teleported the creature to another plane, you know what plane instead of the distance. You can roll an arcana check (DC 10+CL of the effect, or 10+the creatures level for non spell effects) to gaze into this pseudo portal to see exactly where the creature teleported to, as though looking through a window to their destination. You see it as it currently is, not as it looked when they went, using all of your senses. If you are capable of getting to this destination while the same use of this ability persists, you need not make further checks to see any chain of teleportation that may have occurred from the same caster.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: siphoning-sigil-su
entries.content: Siphoning Sigil (Su) Siphoning Sigil \[sigil] Arc 4 Cast Time - 3 rounds EffectRangeReachAoE20 ft radius, centered around a pointDurationUntil RestSaveWill You inscribe a anti-magic rune on the surface of an object. Whenever a creature of at least small or larger size enters this area, the sigil triggers. All creatures within 20 ft of the sigil are siphoned (will negates). At the end of each round, creatures get a new save against this effect.

entries.title: trigger-word
entries.content: Trigger Word Trigger Word Arc 4 Cast Time - 1 immediate action EffectRangeReachSaveFort You have trained your body to react to magic words with violence. When an enemy you threaten casts a spell, attack them. On hit the spell fizzles (fort negates).

entries.title: covetous-aura
entries.content: Covetous Aura Covetous Aura \[buff] Arc 5 Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectTargetSelfAoE20 ft radius, anchored on youDurationUntil Rest Whenever a creature uses a supernatural ability (Su) or spell on one of its allies within the aura, you can decide to become the target of the effect as an immediate action. For AoE effects (like channel energy), you can only steal the effect from one target. Unless you identify it with monster lore or arcana, you're gambling. Any effect that requires a saving throw that you steal (like a Blight) you automatically fail.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 5

entries.title: highway-patrol
entries.content: Highway Patrol Highway Patrol \[buff] Arc 6 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfRange60 ft (see text)Duration1 minuteSaveWill (see text) You are a master at negating teleportation, but why not play along a little? Every time a creature within 60 ft of you teleports, you can redirect them to another position within 60 ft of you as an instant action and cause them to become clumsy 2 (will negates redirection).
