entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: README
entries.content: Arc The techniques designed to combat and negate magic.

entries.title: blood-for-blood
entries.content: Blood for Blood Blood for Blood Barbarism 1 Cast Time - 1 immediate action EffectTarget1 creatureDurationReach When you provoke an AoO, you can retaliate after the attack is resolved with a simple attack.

entries.title: bloodletting
entries.content: Bloodletting Bloodletting \[recharge] Barbarism 1  Cast Time - 1 Free Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Shed your own blood, taking 5 true damage and offering it to the gods. They repay you by granting you 1 mana, You can only use bloodletting once a turn.

entries.title: carnage
entries.content: Carnage Carnage \[buff] Barbarism 1 Cast Time - 1 swift action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute The more blood that flows from your battle, the more flows through your veins, pushing you forward with reckless abandon. When you defeat an enemy, you take a -1 penalty to ac and get a +1 bonus to attack. This can stack up to 5 times. {% hint style="danger" %} You cannot receive another buff effect while under the effects of carnage. {% endhint %}

entries.title: fore
entries.content: Fore! Fore! \[upcast] Barbarism 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature {% hint style="info" %} This special attack can only be initiated against a knocked down target. {% endhint %} Make a melee attack against a creature that deals an additional d8 (4) dmg. On hit launch it 20 ft in any direction with a slight parabola to knock them over obstacles. The creature remains knocked down in it's new position. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: put-me-in
entries.content: Put Me In! Put Me In! \[upcast] Barbarism 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 willing or helpless creature Deal 20 poise damage to an ally and throw them into combat. You can throw them up to 20 ft, including into the air. Upcast - For each additional mana you spend, you can throw your ally an additional 10 ft.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: war-paint
entries.content: War Paint War Paint \[buff] Barbarism 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRangeReachTargetSelfDuration1 minute Wipe the blood, sludge or ectoplasm off of a creature and apply it to yourself to get yourself in the mood for battle. You must initially target a defeated creature or yourself if you are below 10 hp. After you apply the blood to yourself, gain +15 speed, a +4 bonus to intimidation checks. When you critically strike, you deal an additional 50% damage. Most weapons now do 2x damage on a crit, and 2h weapons deal 2.5x damage on a crit.

entries.title: wide-open
entries.content: Wide Open Wide Open  Barbarism 1  Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectAoEReachSaveWill Call out to your foes to hit you where it hurts. Provoke an attack of opportunity from all creatures currently threatening you. Wary creatures who do not want to make an AoO must make a will save. Failure means they do it anyway. You may make an additional simple melee attack against any creature that AoO's you as a result of this technique.

entries.title: foe-toss
entries.content: Foe Toss Foe Toss \[upcast] Barbarism 2  Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Make a grapple attack. Instead of grappling them, you make a bonus thrown weapon attack using the poise broken creature as ammunition. The attack always deals full damage to the poise broken creature. If you graze the secondary target, it does not change the damage against the initial target. If you crit, they are both crit. All creatures affected take an additional d8 (4) damage.  If you are already grappling the creature when you initiate the attack, you don't need to grapple them again. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: spartan-kick
entries.content: Spartan Kick Spartan Kick \[upcast] Barbarism 2  Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature A swift kick in the abdomen sends your opponent reeling backwards. The attack automatically pushes them back 10 ft on hit and deals an additional d8 (4) damage. If the opponent was clumsy, they take double fall damage (6 damage per 10 ft). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: technology
entries.content: Technology Technology Barbarism 2  Cast Time - N/A Effect While this technique is prepared, you can activate things using the athletics skill that normally require another skill. This could mean twisting the doorknob off of a door to open it, forcing open a book that requires a password gleaned through arcana or activating a portal that normally required planes. This usually involves damaging or breaking the object. "We aren't cavemen. We have technology!"

entries.title: ups-and-downs
entries.content: Ups and Downs Ups and Downs \[upcast] Barbarism 2  Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureSaveFort On hit deal an additional d8 (4) damage and smash a creature into the ground, or throw them directly up into a low roof within 10 ft. In either case, the creature is entangled until they use athletics to escape as a swift action. If you throw the creature into a roof, they are also unable to see and interact with the floor below until they escape. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: blood-armor
entries.content: Blood Armor Blood Armor \[buff] Barbarism 3 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute {% hint style="info" %} Special: Can only be used while below 50% hp or bleeding. {% endhint %} Bathe in your own blood. While below 50% hp or if you took bleed damage this turn, gain +2 AC. If you stop bleeding, or heal above 50% hp, the buff remains, but you lose the AC bonus until you meet the techniques requirements. If you are below 10 hp, gain +4 AC.

entries.title: cart-su
entries.content: Cart (Su) Cart Barbarism 3 Cast Time - 1 FRA EffectRangeReachDurationSee text You manifest a cart of your own design. Every time you manifest this cart, it is the same cart. The cart is capable of holding a dozen or so people and has an extra dimensional cargo space (5-ft cube). You can cause this cart to vanish back to the cart realm as a FRA. While attached to and dragging your cart, your land speed doubles. To you, the contents within the cart are completely weightless. To anybody else, it weighs 10k lbs. The cart lasts indefinitely, but disappears while you don’t have this technique memorized.

entries.title: exist
entries.content: Exist Exist Barbarism 3 Cast Time - 1 Instant Action EffectRange60 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill As part of the initiative roll you can choose a creature within range. That creature is taunted (will negates). To that creature, your very existence infuriates them and you must be stopped at all cost. At the end of each of their turns, they get a new save to end the effect. If you are at or below 50% hp when this ability triggers, increase the DC by 2. If on subsequent turns, you take no actions on your turn other than movement, the DC increases by 2. If this creature is defeated, then you may choose a new creature to affect with this ability (no action required, happens immediately).

entries.title: flash-attack-su
entries.content: Flash Attack (Su) Flash Attack \[teleportation] \[force] \[upcast] Barbarism 3 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectRange30 ftTargetA threatened space You can teleport 30 ft, as long as you appear in a threatened space. Any creatures you threaten take 2d8 (9) force damage and an equal amount of poise damage. After you activate this ability, your turn immediately ends. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: forget-me-stick
entries.content: Forget Me Stick Forget Me Stick \[upcast] Barbarism 3 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature You need to defeat the creature on the same turn that you land this attack for it to have its effect. The creature is never killed by your attacks this turn. You deal an additional 2d8 (9) damage. The target forgets anything that happened while defeated, and anything that happened a minute before being defeated. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: revenge
entries.content: Revenge Revenge Barbarism 3 Cast Time - 1 Immediate Action EffectRangeReachTargetThe creature that last damaged you Make a simple melee attack against a creature that did hp damage to you. If they are not within reach, you can move your speed to get within reach of them.

entries.title: firmly-grasp-it
entries.content: Firmly Grasp It Firmly Grasp It \[upcast] Barbarism 4 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDuration1 round Make a disarm attack with a +4 bonus. Instead of knocking the weapon out of the creatures hand, you violently stab it into the creature's hand, dealing 3d8 (13) additional damage. The creature cannot use that hand or weapon until the weapon is removed as a standard action with athletics (class DC). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: most-annoying-sound
entries.content: Most Annoying Sound The Most Annoying Sound in the World \[sonic] Barbarism 4 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReach or 30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill (see text) Make a grapple attack. Gain constrict 3d8 (13) sonic while it persists. While grappled, the creature is confused.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: walk-around
entries.content: Walk Around Walk Around \[mind-affecting] \[concentration] Barbarism 4 Cast Time - 1 FRA EffectRangeReach or 30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill (see text) You can walk around. You spend all of your actions moving and doing nothing else, ending your movement at some point within 30 feet of where you started walking around. Naturally this behavior befuddles the creatures around you. All enemies within 60 feet of this initial starting point are confused (will adds 2 to d10 roll). The effect ends when creature gets the result "act normally." Creatures that make an AoO against you when you move take a -2 penalty to their save. You may continue spending your turns walking around to maintain this confusion effect as long as you want, the same creature cannot be confused more than once. This has no effect on creatures not engaged in combat with you.

entries.title: armed-robbery
entries.content: Armed Robbery Armed Robbery Barbarism 5 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureSaveFort Make a grapple or disarm attack. If successful, instead of grappling or disarming, tear off your opponents arm causing them to be drained 1 (fort removes drain and reduces to broken arm, which renders it useless until medicine check to provide first aid, DC=class/offense trait DC). Make an attack against them with their own arm that deals an additional 4d8 (18) dmg.

entries.title: man-drop
entries.content: Man Drop Man Drop \[recharge] \[earth] Barbarism 5 Cast Time - 1 FRA EffectRange100 ftAoE30 ft radius, centered on a point on the groundSaveFort Leap with incredible strength 300 ft into the air and crash down onto an area. Creatures within 30 ft of your landing position take 6d8+lvl (27+lvl) crush damage and are staggered for 1 minute (fort halves damage and reduces stagger to 1 round). Creatures get a new save against the stagger effect at the end of each of their turns. Usable 1/combat.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 5

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: undying-rage
entries.content: Undying Rage Undying Rage \[contingent] \[recharge] Barbarism 6 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectTargetSelfDuration1 round, see text While you have this technique applied to you, your eyes glow a dark red and your resting emotional state is angry. The first time you are defeated and the effect is not negated by another feature, such as ferocity or the Diehard feat, this contingency activates. You become completely immune to death. Every time you take damage that would defeat you, you can instead decide to become drained 1. This drain does not cause you to fall unconscious. When you become drained 20, you instantly die.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 💢 Barbarism Techniques that use raw strength to perform ridiculous and unorthodox feats. Barbarism also rewards you for putting yourself in danger and hurting yourself.

entries.title: bear-arms
entries.content: Bear Arms Bear Arms Beastmode 1 Cast Time - N/A Effect While this technique is prepared, your arms get coated in a thick fur and your fingers get claws at their ends. The claw attacks deal d8 slash damage, or d10 if your hands are empty. They have the CM (disarm) and CM (grapple) properties. If you already had claws, these qualities are only in addition to what you already had. Cannot decrease your claw dmg. While wielding a gun, you get DR 20 vs disarm attacks. You can make grapples and disarms as AoOs with your bear arms. You gain a multi-attack option:\ Bear Rights - Make 2 attacks with your bear claws.

entries.title: bestial-claw
entries.content: Bestial Claw Bestial Claw \[upcast] Beastmode 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE15 ft radius, centered on user or 20 ft coneSaveReflex Dig your claws into the ground and unleash a cone of sharp claw shaped shockwaves dealing 2d8+lvl (9+lvl) slashing damage (reflex halves). Creatures take an equal amount of poise damage. Upcast - Every point of additional mana spent on this ability increases the damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: frenzied-leap
entries.content: Frenzied Leap Frenzied Leap \[upcast] \[earth] Beastmode 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectAoE10 ft radius, centered on landing point Take the jump action and crash upon your foes with a shockwave. Creatures within 10 ft of your landing position (or your natural reach) are clumsy 1. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase your jump distance by 5.

entries.title: lick
entries.content: Lick Lick \[upcast] Beastmode 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeSee textTarget1 creature Your tongue grows in size and strength to attack a creature. You can use it to make melee attacks with an additional 15 ft of reach for the remainder of your turn. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase the reach by an additional 15 ft.

entries.title: pack-attack
entries.content: Pack Attack Pack Attack \[upcast] Beastmode 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Keep up the pressure on an opponent by making it appear like many copies of you are attacking it at once. If the attack lands, an ally (other than yourself) has advantage on their next attack against the target in the next round. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: pouch
entries.content: Pouch Pouch Beastmode 1 Cast Time - N/A Effect While you have this technique prepared you have a single large pouch in your skin, or other methods of storage on the exterior of your body. You gain an extra 100 carry weight and natural pockets to place things in. You can use the patches to hide objects using sleight of hand.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: shells-up
entries.content: Shells Up Shells Up \[poly, chimeric] Beastmode 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature While this technique is prepared, you have a large shell on your back. You cannot be flanked. By spending 1 mana when you take the total defense action, you can slip into your shell completely. This prevents you from taking any instant or immediate actions, but increases the the defense granted by the action to DRA 4.

entries.title: venomous-sting
entries.content: Venomous Sting Venemous Sting \[poison] \[upcast] Beastmode 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureSaveFort Grow a large stinger, or long fangs to sink into an enemy. On hit they are envenomed (fort negates). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, deal an additional d8 (4) poison damage.

entries.title: jaws-of-the-beast
entries.content: Jaws of the Beast Jaws of the Beast \[upcast] Beastmode 2  Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Grow massive powerful jaws and take a chomp your opponent. dealing an additional d8 (4) damage and latching onto them on hit. Until the start of your next turn, you stay adjacent to this target as it now needs to drag you along for the ride. You can decide which space you end adjacent to them after the creature moves. Anything that prevents you from moving prevents the other creature from moving as well (such as being entangled). If you are poise broken you detach. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: kindred
entries.content: Kindred Kindred \[poly, true] \[mana burn] Beastmode 2  Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute Transform into a beast creature you can see. You do not copy their appearance exactly, only their species. You gain the creature's senses, movement types and natural attacks, but nothing else. A pattern appears in your fur/scales etc that matches the symbol of Mother Earth. How others of the species react to you depends on the species. Some creatures are territorial, others are social and others don't care. If you \[mana burn] you can increase the duration to 10 minutes.

entries.title: make-or-break
entries.content: Make or Break Make or Break \[healing] Beastmode 2 Cast Time - 1 Instant Action EffectTargetSelf You can cause pieces of your body to detach, such as your hands or legs. Basically anything that isn't your head or your torso. When you do so, you are drained 1. These pieces of your body grow back slowly over time, making a full recovery when you recover from the drain. If you are able to retrieve your detached limbs, this recovery time decreases to 1 hour, during which constant contact is required between the detached limb and where it was detached from. This technique does not allow you to recover limbs you didn't have before using the technique.

entries.title: predatory-instincts
entries.content: Predatory Instincts Predatory Instincts \[buff] Beastmode 2  Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 Minute You can instinctively tell when a creature is a lower level than you just by looking at them. You get a +2 bonus to melee damage rolls against said creatures. If the creature is a minion, you can tell, and this damage bonus increases to +4.

entries.title: rapid-recovery
entries.content: Rapid Recovery Rapid Recovery \[healing] Beastmode 2 Cast Time - None EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil Rest While this technique is memorized, you regenerate lost limbs and organs, and in general recover much faster. You recover 1 stack of drained every 3 days instead of every week, as though receiving medical attention (doesn't stack). A lost limb/organ regrows within 3 days. When you are defeated, you automatically regain 1 hit point after 10 minutes. As a swift action, you can heal 10 hp, regrow a limb instantly and make yourself drained 1.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: rend-vision
entries.content: Rend Vision Rend Vision \[upcast] Beastmode 2  Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureSaveReflex Grow a beak and poke at a creature's eyes. On hit the creature takes an additional d8 (4) dmg and is blinded for 1 round (reflex reduces to blurred vision). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: sniffer
entries.content: Sniffer Sniffer \[buff] Beastmode 2 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil Rest You enhance your sense of smell, giving you blindsense (scent, 10 ft).

entries.title: blood-spurt
entries.content: Blood Spurt Blood Spurt Beastmode 3  Cast Time - 1 Immediate Action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureSaveReflex While you are bleeding, or whenever a creature within your natural reach deals slashing or piercing damage, you can respond by squirting some of your blood at them. You take 2 true damage and the target is blinded for 1 round (reflex reduces to blurred vision).

entries.title: chameleon
entries.content: Chameleon Chameleon Beastmode 3  Cast Time - N/A Effect While this technique is prepared, you gain the camouflage monster quality. You can turn this quality on or off as a free action 1/turn.

entries.title: feast
entries.content: Feast Feast \[healing] \[upcast] Beastmode 3 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature, living, defeated or dead Grow rows of jagged teeth, unhinge your jaw and take a meaty bite out of a creature, dealing an additional 2d8 (9) dmg. If after the attack is resolved, the creature is defeated or dead, gain (2\*lvl) temp hp. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: octolock
entries.content: Octolock Octolock \[upcast] Beastmode 3 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Grow several tentacles and make a grapple attack with a +4 bonus. While grappled in this way, the target has -4 AC, you have resistance to poise damage and you constrict them for 3d6 (10) damage each turn, including the turn you initiate it. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase attack bonus by 2.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: return-to-monke
entries.content: Return to Monke Return to Monke \[poly, true] Beastmode 3 Cast Time - 1 standard action EffectTargetselfDuration10 minutes Assume the form of a tiny monkey indefinitely with the following qualities (see shapeshifter). You can exit this transformation as a standard action. SpeedClimbSmolTinyPrehensileTailBotherMake noise to taunt an enemy within 30 feet into attacking you (will negates). Lasts 1 minute, but the taunted creature gets a new save after each turn.AttackBite While in this form, you gain 2 abilities. Both usable as a standard action. One of Us \[poly, true] - While in monkey form, you reach over and touch a creature with your tiny monkey hands. The creature also turns into a tiny monkey (fort reduces to stagger 1 round). Ohhh Banana \[mind-affecting] - You procure a shiny golden banana that hovers in the air for 1 minute. All creatures you turned into a monkey are automatically fascinated. Other monkey/ape-like creatures are fascinated (will negates).

entries.title: unseen-predator
entries.content: Unseen Predator Unseen Predator Beastmode 3 Cast Time - 1 special attack EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature While hiding, leap 30 ft, requiring a jump action. You appear suddenly next to the creature and make a melee attack against them that deals an additional 2d8 (9) dmg. If the target fails its perception against your stealth, instead deal 4d8 (18) additional dmg.

entries.title: death-roll
entries.content: Death Roll Death Roll Beastmode 4 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectTarget1 creatureRangeReach {% hint style="info" %} Can only be used against a grappled or knocked down creature. {% endhint %} You chomp down onto a creature with excessive force and spin them around. If the creature is grappled, they are knocked down and take an additional 3d8 (13) damage and are made clumsy 2. If they are knocked down, you initiate a grapple and take an additional 3d8 (13) damage and are made clumsy 2. If the target is neither grappled nor knocked down, you can attempt one such maneuver as a free action on hit. When you maintain a grapple against a creature after using this technique against them without the grapple ever being broken, they are made clumsy 2.

entries.title: peacocking
entries.content: Peacocking Peacocking Beastmode 4 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTarget1 creatureRange15 feet You grow an elaborate and colorful set of feathers, patterned wings or a wide hood like that of a snake to temporarily entrance your enemy. The creature you direct this display towards becomes fascinated for 1 round (will negates). You cannot use this technique against a creature you have attacked this round.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: devour
entries.content: Devour Devour Beastmode 5 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectTarget1 creatureRangeReach This move functions differently based on whether you target an ally or an enemy. Enemy\ Against a creature you are grappling, this attack automatically works. If not already grappling, roll a grapple attack with a +4 bonus. If successful, you swallow the creature whole. While devoured, the creature inside is in stasis. You gain access to the following special attack.\ Spit Up - Spit out a devoured creature, hurling them up to 30 feet. The creature takes 6d8+lvl (27+lvl) crush damage and is knocked down. Creatures within 5 ft of the impact location are also knocked down (reflex negates). If you do not use spit up on the following turn, the target is disgorged with no negative effects at the end of that turn. Ally\ Devour a willing ally, they can hang out inside your stomach indefinitely, hearing muffled versions of things happening outside. As a free action, they can exit your stomach. While inside, your ally cannot be targeted as though they had total cover. If you take damage or become sickened, you automatically vomit them out.

entries.title: hive-mind
entries.content: Hive Mind Hive Mind Beastmode 5 Cast Time - 1 Minute EffectTarget1 willing creatureRangeReach You establish a connection to your allies with 1 minute of intimate contact, adding them to your hive mind. While part of the hive mind, you are able to speak telepathically with them. You can choose to telepathically communicate with one, some or all members. All members of the hive also get an intuitive sense of each member's direction and distance. You can form a hive mind with a number of creatures equal to your level. If you ever stop preparing this technique, your hive mind disappears.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 5

entries.title: blood-hunt
entries.content: Blood Hunt Blood Hunt Beastmode 6 Cast Time - N/A Effect While this technique is prepared, you can smell everything as long as it bleeds. You gain the Shirshu's Elite Tracker and Sightless Blindsense. These only function against wounded creatures, or against creatures whose blood you have smelled before. You see a faint misty red trail leading directly to whatever you track, automatically succeeding on survival checks to track creatures whose blood you have smelled before.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 6

entries.title: wallop
entries.content: Wallop Wallop \[recharge] Beastmode 6 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectAoE10 ft radius, centered on casterSaveFort Grow long bestial arms to scoop up your foes and toss them in a specific direction. Choose a direction, then make a shove attempt with a +8 bonus and apply it to against all creatures within. Creatures successfully shoved are moved 20 ft in the direction you chose. If they impact solid terrain, they take 7d8+lvl (31+lvl) damage and are stunned for one round (fort reduces stun to daze).

entries.title: README
entries.content: Beastmode The techniques surrounding using natural attacks, and briefly transforming into animals. All beastmode features are supernatural. As a reminder, ALL special attacks have the \[martial] tag, even if it is not listed. Martial effects allow the user to deliver the effect using the attack and damage and on-hit effects of a wielded weapon, even if it mentions using another form of attack.

entries.title: 5g
entries.content: 5G 5G \[buff] Cataclysm 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift action EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDuration10 minutes Increase the effects of gravity on your body, causing you to stay firmly planted on the ground, sometimes to your detriment. You cannot hover or fly. You gain advantage on any save that would physically move you from your position or knock you down. Creatures have disadvantage on attacks made against you that would move you from your position or knock you down. If used underwater, you sink to the bottom 60 ft per round.

entries.title: quake
entries.content: Quake Quake Cataclysm 1 Cast Time - N/A Effect While this technique is prepared, you drastically increase the weight of your footsteps, causing each one to echo and the ground to shake. You gain a +2 bonus to intimidation and -10 penalty to stealth. The bonus to intimidation increases to +4 if you wear heavy armor.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 1

entries.title: roar
entries.content: Roar Roar \[fear] \[sonic] \[upcast] Cataclysm 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard action EffectAoE10 ft radius, centered on casterSaveWill {% hint style="info" %} Special: If your natural reach is greater than the AoE of the spell, then use that instead. {% endhint %} You roar loudly, sounding more monster than man. Creatures within the ability's area take d6+lvl (3+lvl) sonic damage. They are frightened for one round (will negates). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d6 (3).

entries.title: sonic-boom
entries.content: Sonic Boom Sonic Boom \[sonic] \[upcast] Cataclysm 1 Cast Time - 1 Standard action EffectAoE15 ft coneSaveFort You clap your hands together with violent force. Creatures in the area take 2d8+lvl (9+lvl) sonic damage and are pushed back 10 ft (fort halves damage negates pushback). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: thunder-stomp
entries.content: Thunder Stomp Thunder Stomp \[earth] Cataclysm 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creature {% hint style="info" %} You and your target must be touching the ground to use this technique. {% endhint %} You smash the ground violently, causing a shockwave under the target. Roll a topple attack. If successful, the creature takes 2d6 (7) crush dmg in addition to any other effects. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d6 (3).

entries.title: training-arc-su
entries.content: Training Arc (Su) Training Arc \[upcast] Cataclysm 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureDuration1 minute Charge your attack so it leaves behind a lingering effect, causing the target to experience the gravity of a larger planet. On hit the target is grounded. As a swift action, you can end the grounded debuff and pull the creature 30 ft closer to you. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: crater
entries.content: Crater Crater \[upcast] \[earth]  Cataclysm 2  Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature {% hint style="info" %} You must have high ground on your opponent to use this technique. A jump is sufficient to meet this criteria. {% endhint %} Slam your opponent into the ground with such force that the ground underneath you cracks and splinters upwards, dealing an additional d8 (4) dmg. A 10 ft radius circular wall of earth forms with you and your opponent at the center inside. The wall is 20 ft tall on the inside and 10 on the outside. A creature can break through the wall with an athletics check as a standard action. You can break through it as a free action (1/turn) with a successful athletics check. If you or your opponent is larger than medium, than the walls radius increases by 5ft per size category above medium. Upcast - For each additional point of mana spent, deal an additional d8 (4) dmg and increase the DC of destroying the wall by 2.

entries.title: ferocious-howl
entries.content: Ferocious Howl Ferocious Howl \[sonic] \[fear] \[upcast] Cataclysm 2  Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange20/40 ftTarget1 creatureSaveWill Shout at your enemy to create a sonic projectile and scare them off. Make a thrown attack that deals 3d8+lvl (13+lvl) sonic damage. The target is frightened for one round (will reduces to shaken 1). Upcast - Every point of additional mana spent on this ability increases the damage by d8 (4). If you spend at least 3 mana, its range increases to 40/80. If you spend at least 5, 60/120.

entries.title: fist-of-the-cataclysm
entries.content: Fist of the Cataclysm Fist of the Cataclysm \[upcast] Cataclysm 2  Cast Time - See text EffectRange30 ftTarget1 creatureSaveReflex (see text) Call upon your fiendish patron and punch the ground. An enormous fiendish fist appears above your target and slams down upon them. \ This can have 2 different effects... Make a melee attack, with a "cast time" of a special attack. This functions as though you were making a melee attack, but it has greatly increased range, deals an additional d8 (4) dmg and an equal amount of poise damage. If this poise breaks, it knocks the creature down. If the creature was flying, they are sent down to the ground in addition any other effects on hit.  or Let the patron do all the work as a standard action. The targeted creature takes 3d8+lvl (13+lvl) crush damage and is sent down to the ground if flying (reflex halves dmg and negates grounding). The target also takes poise damage equal to damage dealt. If this poise breaks, it knocks the creature down. Upcast - Deals an additional d8 (4) damage per mana spent. If you spend at least 4 mana, the technique's range increases to 60 ft.

entries.title: gift-of-the-cataclysm
entries.content: Gift of the Cataclysm Gift of the Cataclysm \[buff] Cataclysm 2  Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minute Your devotion manifests into gifts from your fiendish patron. Get a +2 bonus to athletics checks and damage made with unarmed strikes and natural attacks. As part of using this technique, you must make a DC 15 athletics check to break a handheld object, like an apple, a hammer or a trumpet. If you fail, the buff immediately ends.

entries.title: gut-check
entries.content: Gut Check Gut Check \[upcast] Cataclysm 2  Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTargetSelf You make an unarmed strike or natural attack against a creature, aiming straight for the abdomen while shouting "GUT CHECK." The attack does an additional d8 (4) dmg and on hit if the creature has just swallowed something recently, they vomit it out, negating its benefits or drawbacks. Also ends pregnancies (fort negates). Upcast - For each additional point of mana spent, deal an additional d8 (4) dmg. If you spend at least 4 mana, the creature is also sickened 1, and cannot consume anything without getting rid of the sickened first.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 2

entries.title: earth-shatter
entries.content: Earth Shatter Earth Shatter \[earth] \[upcast] Cataclysm 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard action EffectAoE60 ft line, 30 ft cone or 15 ft radius burst, centered on userSaveReflex {% hint style="info" %} You must be touching the ground to cast this spell. {% endhint %} You smash the ground violently, causing it to crack and crumble under your strength. The area becomes difficult terrain. Creatures on the ground in the area take 4d8+lvl (18+lvl) crush damage and are knocked down (reflex halves damage and negates knock down). Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: fracture
entries.content: Fracture Fracture \[upcast] Cataclysm 3 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creatureSaveFort On-hit or after grappling a foe, crack a creature's bones in one of their limbs in order to impede them and cause great pain. The creature takes 2d8 (9) true damage and has one of their limbs rendered useless (fort halves damage and turns damaged limb into stagger for 1 round). Arm - Creature is unable to use arm Leg - Creatures speed is reduced by 15. Clumsy 1 permanently. Wing - Creature is unable to fly. {% hint style="info" %} Other limbs can be selected, disabling natural attacks like tentacles and such. These are just the most common examples. {% endhint %} The damaged limb can be healed with a DC 25 medicine check, taking 1 minute. It can also be healed by restoring to full hp. Upcast - For each additional mana spent, increase damage by d8 (4).

entries.title: gravity-well-su
entries.content: Gravity Well (Su) Gravity Well Cataclysm 3 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE60 ft radius aura, centered on casterDuration1 minuteSaveFort (see text) Flex so hard you exert a weak gravitational force around you. All creatures within 60 ft are grounded. This debuff persists for the rest of the affected creature's turn after leaving the area. As a swift action, you can end the effect and pull all creatures within range 30 ft closer to you (fort negates).

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 3

entries.title: shockwave
entries.content: Shockwave Shockwave \[buff] \[earth] Cataclysm 3 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDuration1 minuteSaveFort You empower yourself with thunder thighs. You can take the jump action as part of using this technique. Whenever you take the jump action, creatures on the ground within reach of your destination are staggered for 1 round (fort negates). Creatures that were already staggered are knocked down (fort negates).

entries.title: wasteland-su
entries.content: Wasteland (Su) Wasteland \[sigil] \[curse] \[upcast] Cataclysm 3 Cast Time - 1 minute EffectRangeReachAoE1,000ft burst, centered on sigil You use the ink to inscribe the mark of the Cataclysm on a flat surface. Over the course of a week, the curse will spread over the area of the spell. Plants will wither, soil will turn to sand or dust, water sources will dry up and wildlife will perish. In general, the natural terrain suffers until it is converted into uninhabitable wasteland over the course of a year, and a toxic volcanic wasteland over a decade. To remove the curse, a creature must spend 200g of summoner's ink or normal ink made with holy water to write a brief poem or prayer in druidic in a circle around the mark of the Cataclysm. Depending on how long the mark was present, it may take years for the land to recover without assistance. Upcast 5 - AoE increases to 1 mile Upcast 6 - AoE increases to 5 miles

entries.title: clapped-su
entries.content: Clapped (Su) Clapped Cataclysm 4 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectRange15 ftTarget1 creatureSaveFort You call forth a portion of your fiendish patron to crush your enemies. Two muscular arms overlap your own as you clap a foe within range. Make two unarmed melee attack rolls against a creature with a +2 bonus. Each attack deals 4d8 (18) crush damage. Creatures hit by at least one attack are dazed for 1 round (fort negates). Creatures hit by both strikes are stunned for 1 round (fort negates).

entries.title: power-lift-su
entries.content: Power Lift (Su) Power Lift \[buff] Cataclysm 4 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil Rest You infuse yourself with the power of LIFT, drastically increasing your carrying capacity. You can lift objects weighing up to 10 tons. The following special attack can be used at will. Heavy Artillery - You can throw an object weighing at least 1 ton to deal 3d12+Str (16+str) dmg, defaulting to crush dmg.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 4

entries.title: disintegration
entries.content: Disintegration Disintegration Cataclysm 5 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTargetOne creature or objectDuration3 roundsSaveFort Attack with such violent force that the target is evaporated. Roll a melee attack and on-hit the target starts to disintegrate (fort reduced duration to 1 round). Disintegrating creatures take 5d6 (17) true damage at the start of each turn and are staggered. Creatures defeated by this damage are turned to dust. If you target an object, you can evaporate a 5x5x5 ft cube matter of solid or lesser toughness, turning it to dust. Tougher objects sustain heavy damage in the same area.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Level 5

entries.title: roar-of-the-cataclysm-su
entries.content: Roar of the Cataclysm (Su) Roar of the Cataclysm Cataclysm 5 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE30 ft radius burst, centered on casterSaveWill (see text) You call forth a portion of your fiendish patron to strike fear into the hearts of your enemies. The visage of your fiendish patron overlaps your own as you let out a monstrous roar.  Creatures within 30 feet of you take 6d6 (21) sonic damage. They are also frightened for 1 minute (will reduces frightened to shaken 1). Each round at the end of their turn, creatures can roll another save to reduce the frightened condition to shaken 1.

entries.title: cataclysm
entries.content: Cataclysm Cataclysm \[recharge] \[elusive] Cataclysm 6 Cast Time - 2 rounds Material Component - 1 scale of The Cataclysm EffectRange120 ftDurationSee textSaveFort You call forth the infinite reserves of strength possessed by your fiendish patron to lay waste to the area around you. It requires a standard action to initiate this technique and you immediately leap 5,000 feet into the air. You are still targetable through normal means, but the distance makes most forms of attack impossible. Until the start of your next turn you charge energy and gain momentum as you plummet towards the ground. To onlookers you look like a meteor rapidly approaching. As a standard action on your next turn, you decide the area you want to unleash this gathered momentum and energy. Choose a 60 ft line in the technique's range. All but the sturdiest objects (adamantine toughness+) within 30 feet of this line are immediately evaporated by your impact, turning to dust. Creatures within 30 feet of this line take 50 bludgeoning damage, are knocked out of the area and are staggered for 1 minute (fort halves the damage and lowers the staggered duration to 1 round). New save every round to end stagger. You end the movement granted by this technique at the end of this line. The area within 30 feet on either side of this line becomes a 30 ft deep pit of roiling liquid magma that persists for weeks, or even longer depending on environmental conditions. This technique is anything but subtle and leaves a lot to be desired when using it as a surprise attack. The impact creates an incredibly powerful shockwave that people might mistake for an earthquake. Objects such as buildings, trees and roads close by to the where this technique is cast are damaged by being in the vicinity of this impact, even if they aren't in the lava crater.

entries.title: gravity-storm-su
entries.content: Gravity Storm (Su) Gravity Storm \[recharge] Cataclysm 6 Cast Time - 1 Standard Action EffectAoE60 ft aura, centered on userDuration1 minute You channel your power such that it forces everything nearby to bend to your might. You passively exert a tangible gravitational pull to everything within 60 ft, causing loose objects weighing less than 100 lbs to immediately be pulled into the storm, throwing them into an orbit around you. Loose objects weighing between 100 and 1000 lbs are slowly dragged towards you. As part of using this technique, and at the start of every turn as a free action, you can choose to exert this force, pulling all creatures in range 10 ft closer to you. Any movement within 60 ft of you that isn’t moving directly towards you is considered difficult terrain. Creatures within range can hover or fly and immediately take appropriate fall damage if they enter your gravity aura. At the end of each of your turns, if a creature is within your natural reach, it must roll a DC 20 athletics check or buckled under its own weight and brought to its knees, causing it to take 4d6 (14) crush dmg and gain clumsy 1.

entries.title: README
entries.content: 🌋 Cataclysm Caldera the Cataclysm is a demon lord that respects raw physical strength over all else. Her followers regularly engage in contests to prove who has the most. People fear to speak her name or draw her ire and have the cataclysm fall upon them. She has reached the pinnacle of physical strength, giving her the ability to control gravity itself and literally bend physics to her will. Cataclysm spells are centered around increasing and utilizing raw physical strength, manipulating gravity, causing immense destruction and being incredibly loud.

entries.title: arrow-splitter

You can spend 1 minute to diffuse the power of this ammunition, removing the effects of named bullet from it and removing the mana burn. You can do this regardless of distance from it. entries.title: README
entries.content: Pupper Cinder Tourneau is an influential adventurer that lived through not one, but two different world crises while fighting to stop it. Once upon a time she had the blood of fiends run through her veins but has since been transformed by a mad scientist and retired. Even when she was a child she would charge at foes many times her size without fear by the side of her parents. The memory of this cute pupper still inspires people to this day to fight greater evils. Pupper techniques are focused on providing useful combat buffs, aggression, speed and putting you straight into the action to slap people in melee.

entries.title: backstab
entries.content: Backstab Backstab \[Elusive] \[upcast] Scoundrel 1 Cast Time - 1 Special Attack EffectRangeReachTarget1 creature Move to the direct opposite side of a creature you threaten and make an attack. entries.content: Fan of Knives (Su) Fan of Knives Scoundrel 1 Cast Time - 1 Swift Action EffectTargetSelfDurationUntil Rest While under the effects of this buff, you always have 2 non magical light weapons on your person with the thrown property. They are in your voluminous hair, fat folds or keistered in less comfortable places...You can draw these weapons as a free action any number of times each turn if your hands are empty. Gain access to the following special attack, usable any number of times per combat. Fan of Knives - Throw up to 3 knives at up to 3 creatures within 10 feet of each other. Ignore attack penalties from attacking creatures in the second range increment. You also always have thieves tools in your back pocket, in the form of a single lockpick.

entries.title: feign-defeat

While the weapon is in hand, you lose access to the hand. You and your opponent cannot move away from each other without letting go of the weapon. If you are poise broken, or otherwise moved out of reach, you let go of the weapon. While you hold a weapon, you get a +4 bonus to sunder attempts against it.

entries.content: Casting Components All spells have some kind of visual effect associated with their casting before the effect occurs. Magic circles shining fingers and eyes, words manifesting into physical objects and circling the caster are all means to easily identify when a creature is casting a spell. The only exception to this being spells with the \[Subtle] tag.\ All spells have a verbal component. Verbal components cannot be whispered, and you must speak them clearly. Anything that prevents the mage from speaking prevents them from casting, such as being silenced.  This rule applies to innate casting.  \--- All spells have a staff/seal component. Disarming a mage of their staff/seal prevents them from casting using it.\ Any spell with a material component has an item with a price associated with that is consumed on use.\ Anything with a focus component has an item with a price associated that is NOT consumed on use.  These rules do not apply to innate casting.

entries.title: staff-component
entries.content: Staff Component Staves, Seals, Wands etc\ In general the staff component serves much the same function no matter its shape, but there are some small differences. Staves - Staves are usually long and sturdy pieces of wood. Most of the magical components of the staff are attached to the end of it. Staves can universally be used as weapons. Seals - Seals have an enormous amount of variety to them. But they are typically compact: Some small handheld object, often of spiritual significance. Seals are ineffective unless they are the only thing occupying the hand. Wands - Wands are usually small pieces of wood about in the rough shape of a pencil, but usually a bit larger. Wands usually come pre-built in with a cantrip. Other sufficiently magical things can potentially be used as magical foci with their own unique benefits such as books giving access to more spells. Dual wielding these items gives +1 CL. Some seal examples...

entries.title: other-magic-rules
entries.content: Other Magic Rules Caster Level (CL) Caster level (CL) is typically equal to the creature's level, though certain effects can change it. CL determines the effectiveness of many spells. This stat is also relevant in resolving what happens when casting goes head to head with each other (such as with dispel magic), when using healing to staunch bleeding or when light and darkness magic meet.  If dual wielding staff components, get +1 CL. Spell Failure By default, spells have a 100% chance of being cast, but certain things can cause spell failure. When spell failure causes your spell to fail, the resource used to cast it is consumed. A spell failing is usually shortened to "fizzles." Combining Magic Effects Many spells give you some kind of buff, or generate some kind of persistent effect. You can only have one type of each of the following effects active at once. \[Concentration]\ An effect with the concentration tag requires some degree of upkeep from the user and typically has a duration. Things like wall spells and summons have the concentration tag. \[Buff]\ An ability with the buff tag grants a boon to the creature it is applied to (and not necessarily the user). A creature can only have one effect with the buff tag active at once. Buffs can only be cast on willing creatures. Weather Certain high level spells manipulate the weather in drastic ways. If multiple casters attempt to cast different spells that affect the weather, the creature with the higher CL always wins. In the event where the caster tries to interfere with weather that is supernaturally powerful (created by a complex ritual, associated with cursed terrain etc), the DM should assign the effect an effective CL. All weather inducing spells do not function underground.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Spell Mechanics Spellcasting is a general title that applies to a specific type of magical effect, with specific rules. Spells do not encompass all magic, but it is the most common type. Spells are specifically anything that falls under the magical techniques section.

entries.title: README
entries.content: Technique Rules Progression in this game is broken up into 3 main distinct categories: Class features, feats and techniques. This section is dedicated to techniques. Techniques use a point system to represent how invested you are in a specific technique, from 1 to 6. Techniques are often things that you use in combat, such as special attacks and spells. Memory When you have technique points invested in a specific style, you can prepare any of the techniques of the tier you have unlocked. Memory determines how many techniques you can have prepared or "memorized" at any given time and thus what you can use on a dime. All techniques are assumed to take 1 memory unless stated otherwise. Special attacks from items/class/etc and cantrips to not require memory. Using Multiple Techniques a Turn Techniques can be any kind of action, leading them to be able to be used twice, maybe even more times a turn. Techniques are not balanced in such a way to be allowed to freely use some of your most powerful abilities multiple times a turn. Therefore there is an inherent limit tied to techniques. You can only use up to 2 levels of techniques at level 1, 3 at level 3, 4 at level 5 etc, increasing by 1 every 2 levels and capping at 7 by level 11. This essentially limits you to using level 1 techniques in tandem with your most powerful available techniques.  This limit even applies to innate techniques, however there is a small exception. Sometimes you may receive some incredible boon, or a monster might have a technique a bit higher than their level might suggest. In such cases, no additional techniques can be used in the same turn as this high level technique. Innate Casting/Techniques Some techniques can be granted outside of the standard progression, such as things gained from race, class, magic item, specialized training, or some kind of boon granted by another creature. Usually quite limited in scope and much more common on monsters. Innate techniques do not take up memory slots and are always memorized. Innate techniques grant creatures the ability to use a specific set of techniques. Spells do not require the staff/seal component that other casting typically requires. If a spell has a material or focus component, that is also ignored with innate casting. By default, creatures with innate techniques can use their techniques an unlimited number of times. Number values are included next to techniques that have limited uses per day. Mana burn still applies to innately casted spells. But otherwise they cost no mana. If a spell is constant, the spell is persistently active on the creature and takes up its buff slot. A new buff can be cast on it, rendering the constant spell inactive. If its constant spell is deactivated, it can reactivate it as a swift action. Technique Progression In general, classes get access to a few technique trees. Techniques are separated into six levels, requiring 6 points of investment in order to reach the highest tier. At every even level, you get a technique point you can invest in any form of technique. For every point you invest, you get access to a new level of technique. * There are some limitations. You cannot invest all of your technique points into the techniques your class specializes in to get access to high level abilities extremely early. Technique levels have a hard character level requirement, as shown below… * | Technique Level (and points required) | Character Level | | ------------------------------------- | --------------- | | 1 | 1 | | 2 | 3 | | 3 | 5 | | 4 | 7 | | 5 | 9 | | 6 | 11 | Techniques are also separated into two different general categories: martial and magic. Each class typically has a specialization in either one of these categories. Martial/Magical Specialization With martial specialization, you automatically gain points in warfare equal to the highest level of investment you have in martial techniques (ex. Have barbarism 3? You also have warfare 3). Magical specialization as a baseline gives you access to cantrips. You know 6 cantrips. You do not need to spend memory in order to prepare cantrips.\ You automatically gain points in wild card equal to the highest level of investment you have in magical techniques (ex. Have pyromancy 3? You also have wild card 3). Upcast My spending additional mana, you can increase the effectiveness of the technique. Some techniques scale per additional mana spent and others require thresholds to get completely new effects.\ You can only ever spend 6 mana on a technique.
